However, it is believed that at the moment, these household names should not become role models to current generations because money and glamor are foundation of this fame instead of achievements. From my perspective, this opinion is true to certain extent and I will explain my preference in the following paragraph.<NL><NL>Perhaps for many, this option is quite convincing because of several reasons. First, a significant number of celebrities are famous because of their talent and attainments. To be specific, civilians, who have an unfortunate background, attempt to work hard and make efforts to acquire achievements. Particularly, household names, who have actual talent, should become a good example for youngsters to follow. For instance, in Vietnam, Ha Anh Tuan is famous because of not only his excellent voice but also his integrity. Second, products or items, which famous individuals utilize, are bought by their fans. To elaborate, thereby, famous figures assist in promoting brands’ benefits. <NL><NL>However, these arguments are insufficient to overshadow the drawback of the  topic in question. First and foremost, at the moment, the current generations’ standard to define the success of a citizen is inadequate. In particular, an individual, who just need the beauty and wealth, could prevail easily. Worst still, some civilians are popular because of their notorious actions. In addition, scandals are often more visual among junior citizens and this encourages them to follow. In fact, in Vietnam, an inordinate number of tiktok users posted ludicrous videos and encouraged children emulate them. <NL><NL>In short, celebrities who reach specific attainments in their career should become role models for youngsters to emulate and KOLs also help brands to increase their benefits. Nonetheless, because standard of junior citizens to determine the success of a household name weak, so notorious civilians also gain grounds and this is a bad example for children.

task: Nowadays celebrities are more famous for their glamour and wealth than for their achievements, and this sets a bad example for young people. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: In the contemporary era, media persons are well-known for their fashion style and property rather than their accomplishments. It may create a negative impact on the young generation. I do not fully support the above statement. In the forthcoming paragraph, I will discuss my thoughts.<NL><NL>Firstly, the general people follow  celebrities in their daily life, and also consider them as their icons. So, it is normal that they have a huge effect on the common folk. At present, celebrities are more concerned about their lifestyle. They try to be in limelight, hence they are keeping themselves fit. For that reason, they are going to the gym for exercise, and maintain healthy food habits. Even though they get aged, they look so young. the community can gain inspiration from their idols as well as can lead a healthy and glamorous life. Secondly, in the ,world everyone works hard for earning money. If someone is recognized by his or her wealth, it will not create a bad impression on the young. Consequently, others will try to earn money by following them. For instance, if someone's favourite actor or actress wears a dress, it will influence others to earn money and buy the dress.<NL><NL>Alternatively, I am not denying, being famous only for their luxurious life and wealth will not influence<NL><NL>the Z-gen fully positive away. the nation also should focus on its achievements, so that it can work hard and achieve success like its icon.<NL><NL>To conclude, as a common we may get to know the media persons for their lifestyle or property, but<NL><NL>society will only remember them for their work. The young generation is getting up-to-date by<NL><NL>following the lifestyle of  celebrities.

task: Nowadays celebrities are more famous for their glamour and wealth than for their achievements, and this sets a bad example to young people. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Mankind has wanted to have expensive life since its creation. There is a new phenomenon that being rich and having luxury life draws people's attention more than their success ,unfortunately it dramatically affects youngsters badly. I opine, that sort of tendency will kill  creativity and push people to earn easy money instead of working hard to gain an appropriate salary.<NL><NL>    To begin with, people do not prefer to work in order to have luxury life instead of an intense schedule they are looking for the easy way. Even if they are successful when they have reached the high standard of living, they stop working on it. By doing so, it would kill their creativity and their quality performance. For instance, Hakan Kurt, who had been playing in the Goztepe football club from 2002 to 2005, was the most popular athlete in Turkey. Much big football teams had desired to transfer him. However, after he had gotten good fortune, he  finished his football life.<NL><NL>    On the other hand, today’s world has constituted many lazy individuals with that case. Nobody desire to be a labour. Since they are thinking that they would be able to earn a fortune effortlessly. That fact has  increased among  young people, nowadays. Therefore big amount of employers have difficulties finding an employee. This results in a decrease in companies production capacity. because young people take a pattern the celebrity's life standard. for example my cousine Ahmet his biggest dream is to be a singer, but he does not want to work a regular job.<NL><NL>    to sum up, famous people's possessions and lifestyles have the wrong effect on youngsters. They are trying to have an easy fortune rather than gaining it while they are working. It has a massive effect on either famous people or teenagers. hence, they lose their creativity and also companies have problem lack of a professional workforce.

task: Nowadays celebrities are more famous for their glamour and wealth rather than for their achievements, and this sets a bad example to young people.<NL>To What extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: The current generation of famous personalities are known more for their attractive lifestyle and less for hardwork which I believe is misleading the youngsters. I will explain in this essay how the focus on extravagant lifestyle of a celebrity instead of focusing on their work can leave a wrong impression on the youth.<NL><NL> Firstly, the living style adapted by the well known people sets unrealistic goals and standards for an average person. Moreover, the importance is given to the looks and style of clothes rather than the succesful art which also results in people spending unnecessary money on expensive beauty and health products. The youngsters try to look like these stars by using overpriced materialistic things and hence, loose their focus on studies and their career. There are multiple online websites that sells the exact clothes used by the celebrities with an astonishing price range. With such standards a young person gets influenced easily and lead a misguided life.<NL><NL> Secondly, the overshow of the luxurious way of life of a famous personality leads the people to beleive that the hardwork is the least imprortant part of their success. Their talent and artistic work is overshadowed by their media presence. As we all know, the social media has been an intimate medium to get an access to a celebrities life which is mostly deceiving. Although, the purpose of these stars is to motivate people but they end up leaving a bad example of putting the glam above the job.<NL><NL>In conclusion, I fully agree that by putting the excess expenditure of money and a luxurious lifestyle as the centre of attention, the famous people are misguiding our present youth.

task: Nowadays celebrities are more famous for their glamour and wealth rather than for their achievements, and this sets a bad example to young people.<NL><NL>To What extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: These day’s youngsters are influenced by renowned personalities’ fame and fortune rather than their accomplishments. I completely agree younger generation is influenced by the charisma and prosperity of superstars rather than their attainment. The essay is going to elaborate on how these celebrities influence juveniles badly.<NL><NL>The youth follows these famed personalities blindly and try to spend lavishly on their looks and lifestyle. Moreover, the possession of luxurious cars and expensive clothing’s boasts of their financial strength leading to provoke the youth for spending excessively. This results in an excessive financial burden on parents as these youngsters are not financially self-dependent.  For example, in my ,locality there is a group of growing kids who imitates Justin Bieber and buy costly Justin Bieber merchandise without checking their financial strength.<NL><NL>Secondly, these youngsters being obsessed with the fame of these luminary being unaware of hard work and hardship, blindly adopt a lifestyle at times and risk their health and sometimes life as well. It is observed that in many colleges a number of students imitate the stunts, big shots of smoking a cigar, intake of drugs and alcohol etc. as they see them in movies and end up with accidents and spoiling of their lungs.<NL><NL>Considering the above examples it is clear that youth follow fame remaining unaware of the hard work and accomplishments of these trendsetters. For these ,immature it is important to be in trend rather than analysing rationally what is right or wrong for themselves. So according to ,me I agree to a large extent that these 21st-century generations focus on  fame and prosperity rather than accomplishments achieved by these showmen’s.

task: Nowadays celebrities are more famous for their glamour and wealth rather than for their achievements, and this sets a bad example to young people.<NL>To What extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: In this modern era, high profile people are becoming popular with the masses just because of their alluring and charismatic personality. This is the high time we should wake up and give importance to our valued culture and traditions of which I am an inseparable part.

task: Some think that governments should support retired people financially while others believe they should take care of themselves.<NL><NL><NL>Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay: Retired people have been increasing in numbers, nowadays. This stage of life is believed to be given support financially by the government, however, there are others who think that they need to finance their needs and should not expect any government assistance. Both of these views need to be discussed further as I believed that these retired individuals are important members of the society and should be given support from authorities for as long as they need them. <NL><NL><NL>Many of the retired people are receiving pensiones from their previous work in different sectors that offered insurance policy. This financial support sometimes comes from the government’s insurance system if they had worked for the government sector such as public teachers, soldiers, and other government office employees. In this regard, it is axiomatic that the government should support retired people because they had rendered service for a period of time.<NL><NL><NL>Meanwhile, there are retired people who were not able to establish financial security at their old age. These are the ones who worked menial jobs, or unfit to work at all. In this case, there are government authorities who make sure that these individuals are taken care of under a social service unit. Rendering care to these people is a government responsibility in order to build a humane society. <NL><NL><NL>However, a part of the society is not keen on the idea of government helping the retired ones. This is due to the fact that some of them are still physically and mentally able to work. Others also claim that their families, especially children should take responsibility for financing their needs. For instance, in Filipino culture, the elderly are well supported by their family members and some children even include them in their paid insurances, such as medical care. <NL><NL><NL>All these being said, the government needs to allocate budget for social services to retired persons who do not have any support from private sectors or their own families. These retired members of the society have rendered in their own way a service to their nation and thus should be respected and supported in their needs.

task: A lot of old people are suffering from loneliness these days. They also lack physical fitness.<NL><NL>What do you think are the reasons for this problem?<NL><NL>Can you think of possible solutions?
essay: Nowadays, a significant number of old people are becoming looner, they do not have physical activities as well. In this essay, I will describe the ongoing reasons for this issue and address the possible solutions. <NL><NL>First, we cannot ignore the consequences of social media, the human being as a result of progress in technology  becoming depressed and  other mental health problems. Therefore, old generations do not want have any physical activities as they compare themselves to influencers on Instagram, They also suffer from loneliness as most children leave their parents and have their own life  . For instance, sadly,  old society in Iran has been suffering from being alone more than ever as most of the occasions their children went  abroad. One solution for this matter is to participate in the majority of classes. Thus, they have less time for spending on social media and thinking of their children. <NL><NL>Second,  one of the vital stuff which makes us who we are is our habits, things we are used to doing.  Accordingly, many things we do when we are old are stuff we have done in  the past in our youth time. As an illustration, young people rather than playing outdoor games prefer to play online and this seriously harms their bodies and minds. So, old generations should make physical exercise and socialise with other people their habits when they are young.  This can be done by warning teenagers at schools to have these activities a part of their lives to not suffer in the future. <NL><NL>In conclusion, these days, a lot of old communities are becoming alone and they do not have physical activities as well. In this essay, I described the ongoing reasons for this issue and mentioned the possible solutions.

task: A lot of old people suffering from loneliness these days. They also lack physical fitness. What are the reasons for these? Can you think of possible solutions?
essay: Nowadays, it is irrefutable that the life expectancy of old generations is getting shorter ,However they are not physically fit and prefer to live alone. Although there are some researches that have been carried out, resulting some solutions and its causes. that will be articulated in upcoming paragraphs.<NL><NL>initiating with the causes. The predominant reason is an environment to elaborate, in this modern era. Although there are some technologies that have been introduced to us, by which health problems can be cured, it causes a massive amount of damage to the environment, which makes older people hard to survive it cause some critical illnesses to them. Moreover, their physical strength also becomes weak and resulting some people may suffer from serious problems like paralyse. Secondly, Families are getting more attentive towards their work, whereas Children are busy in their schooling, by that, they do not get enough time, which they can use to talk with their older parents. Resulting in them suffering from loneliness and they become introverts. For example, 40% of individuals live separate from older people, as they feel hard to take care of them and the remaining 60% of Individuals are favoring their work more rather than their elders. Thus, they feel alone and also become physically and mentally weak.<NL><NL>Despite the aforementioned causes, there are some solutions to tackle them. Firstly, the government has constructed some parks away from polluted areas. by planting trees ,especially for old generations in which they can do some physical exercise in the arms of nature, resulting to enhance their immune system as well as increase their life expectancy. Another solution is those old people can find the same masses with whom they can talk or play. Moreover, working people and youngsters should give them time to talk about their past activities and supervise them. For instance, Recently, authorities have announced a law. Elders can register the file against people who try to torture them, resulting 10,000 dollars fine with 3 years of jail.<NL><NL>To sum ,up everything that has been stated so far, Although there are several reasons like poor environment and shortage of time. but there are some measures that can be followed to overcome the problem.

task: Directors of large organizations earn much higher salaries than ordinary employees do. Some people think it is necessary, but others are of the opinion that it is unfair. Discuss both views and give your own opinions.
essay: Big co-operates and multinational companies are led by leaders who are paid with high wages which they deserve.This is due to the fact that they are highly educated ,hardworking and showed remarkable skillsets in their fields.But the ordinary employees are provided less amount of money due to a number of factors such as years of experience and level of studies.In my opinion, directors of big enterprises have to receive the best payment compared to the common workers.<NL><NL>First and foremost,individuals at the leadership level usually possess high level of education from great universities .In addition to that, they own more number of experience in their areas and they are expertised in their domain.They might have tried so hard and faced numerous challenge to attain that role.Consequently the organizations are liable to pay them immensely.For instance,the director of the brand Pepsico has reached that role by her immense amount of effort throughout her career.<NL><NL>On the contrary, the regular staffs might not have done several years of work .Also,they do not have proper degrees or masters to fit in a bigger role.For achieving such a level, they have to do lots of hard work.These all factors constitute to the reason for the lower payment of usual workforce.<NL><NL>To sum up,the main head of an establishment has to be salaried exceptionally as they are worthy enough for it.Also,other workers have to be paid according to their efforts and experience level.

task: The shortage of housing in big cities can cause severe consequences. Only government action can solve this problem.<NL><NL><NL><NL><NL>To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Metropolitan cities face a severe shortage of accommodation  leading to declining health and rising crimes.,Apparently the issue can be tackled  only by a government intervention either by putting a limit on on the entry of new people into cities or by expanding the urban region.The public contribution is limited in solving the issue as  the root cause of the shortage of land remains unresolved. <NL><NL> <NL><NL>Since the basic issue lies in the lack of space for building houses,the community has a limited role in executing a long-term solution.Temporarily,they may resolve shortage by sharing homes or residing in the countryside and travelling daily for jobs.The former solution can result in poor  health due to overcrowding and lack of adequate basic facilities while the latter would cause mental stress to those commuting long distances daily.Both these would affect the productivity of these people in their jobs.<NL><NL>The government can make a marked change in this situation by restricting the entry for new residents as that can give more time to solve the current housing issues.Then the administration should ensure that the population is proportionate to the land available and take measures to sustainably build adequate housing apartments.An alternative solution wud be by subsuming nearby farmland or expanding the outskirts of cities so as to provide the required amount of land for building suburbs.<NL><NL> <NL><NL>In conclusion,I believe that the housing shortage in metropolia can be effectively solved by the government either by having a practical ratio of citizens with land or by expanding the land to build new residences.City folks have a limited role as they can only adapt to the available accommodation though it is with great difficulty.

task: The shortage of housing in big cities can cause severe consequences .Only government action can solve this problem .To what extent do you agree or disagree
essay: Accommodation is an essential need in our lives. The scarcity of shelter can cause serious problems. Some people believe that it is the state's responsibility to solve the shelter shortage. The government can act by creating affordable housing trusts , introducing new home zones and giving incentives to small builders. I completely agree that it is solely the authority's responsibility to solve shelter deficits in cities.<NL><NL>The creation of affordable housing trusts aids by giving people mortgages to buy apartments that can be paid over a certain timeline. Building more apartments and giving loans help to mitigate the problems of housing in towns. For example, an apartment can accommodate a tremendously higher number of individuals than a house which occupies and wastes land. Furthermore, the government can introduce new home zones in virgin lands which are nearby the metropolitan. This is done to empower individuals who want to build houses and are unable to purchase land or apartments in the city. As a result, it helps to decongest the number of people in towns and provides solutions to housing problems.<NL><NL>Also, the government should give incentives to small contractors to enter the market of constructing houses as independent builders. Likewise, this helps people who are unable to afford professional builders to build their homes. In doing so the authority will be increasing the number of houses for its citizens.<NL><NL>In conclusion ,I believe that it is the state's main responsibility to curb the lack of homes in the metropolitan area by providing several measures to accommodate its citizens.

task: Only government action can solve housing shortages in big cities. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Housing scarcity is thorny a social issue every government needs to resolve.  After all, over-high <NL><NL>housing price exerts a detrimental influence on people’s happiness index. Some people argue that only the government can relieve the pressure of housing because the most supreme governmental administration. Personally speaking, governments do have a vital role to play in stabilizing the housing price, but there are still other means to tackle this severe problem.  <NL><NL>Indeed, I have to concede that governments can， in more ways than one，  restrain the ever-accelerated cost of new houses . One of the most effective ways to control over the expenditure of the house is to deter the greedy speculators or property developers from flipping homes, more precisely， the vacancy rate could be greatly reduced when governmental interruption works. <NL><NL>Moreover, governments are supposed to strengthen the supervision over real estate developers so that it helps to stop those illicit merchants from disrupting the regular economic orders. However, the effort made by home buyers and builders is indispensable. <NL><NL>As far as wealthy house purchaser who desires to earn high interests in housing investment concerned, they should learn to eliminate their avarice for an enormous house. The rich had better assume the responsibility to set a fine example for society.  In this way,  the public will learn that housing investment is not the only worthwhile way to allocate wealth. In the meanwhile, ordinary buyers not only ought to work diligently to raise money for future house investment, but also make full use of the government policies and bank loans to promote the standard of living. <NL><NL>Furthermore, the builders’ efforts cannot be ignored. Firstly, they ought to transfer their housing strategy from building luxurious villas to popularizing economically affordable houses. Only when cheaper houses are built by property developer can they meet the demands of common house consumers. Similarly, mass media have the duty to alter people’s mode of thinking in house via <NL><NL>encouraging people to rent houses if they cannot own their property in short time.  <NL><NL> <NL><NL>In closing, I reaffirm my conviction that it is rather superficial to simply say that only government can address the housing shortage problem. Concerted efforts should be made by house buyers and builders.

task: The housing shortage in big cities can cause severe social consequences. Some people think only government action can solve this problem. <NL><NL>To what extent do you agree or disagree with the above statement?
essay: These days as the population is increasing at an unprecedented pace, the housing shortage has become one of the main consequences. It is concerned whether it is an obligation of the government to alleviate this issue or whether the nation is responsible for the lack of accommodation. I firmly believe that both parties should integrate and contribute to the solutions. <NL><NL>To begin with, there is ample evidence that sustainable housing is strongly due to government regulations. That is to say, political houses should establish certain restrictions on the numbers of people and land that is distributed to each citizen. For instance, a recent survey has revealed that 25 countries had a scarcity of land to construct new houses because of the fact that government didn't allocate the land properly and residents were prone to build large houses in order to outperform one another, which later caused housing shortages in multifold metropolitan cities. <NL><NL>Secondly, it is explicit that because of the nation's unprofitable purchase of lands and housing facilities, it has become prevalent to some citizens to inevitably live in flats and accommodations. It can be solved by public organisations that can share and divide some houses, which indicates that the government is not fully liable for such an issue. For example, several cities concluded that this problem is partly due to people's actions, 45 per cent of which could solve this problem by uniting both the government and the nation. <NL><NL>To conclude, it can be clearly seen that I strongly advocate that it is not only feasible for the government to come up with a solution, but also citizens of the city are able to resolve the scarcity of housing.

task: Only government action can solve housing shortages in big cities. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Some people believe that only legislation isable to encounter the problem of housing management in major cities. In my view, both public and authorities can find out solutions collaboratively. <NL><NL>To begin with, the government has tthe authorityity to enact  large-scale change; they can be made a decision by designi  an urban organisation. For example, Singapore, they have been encountered the housing crisis and solved it by vertically building such as high-rise buildings with the proper layout. Moreover, me civil work such as hihighwaysor mmotorways might be eliminated by using underground construction where passengers can easily accessible through the subway as well as reduce traffic congestion.These abovementioned could h the residence shortage by building vertical construction.<NL><NL>Furthermore, the government can help in this situation by expanding cities and creating more area residential estates in rural area. For instance,  a fast-growing city has provided accommodation  supplying population growth by building up amenity facilities such as houses, factories, and villages in the outskirt area. Additionally,  some countries are enacting a policy for their citizen to tackle this problem by reducing building prices in the outer zone while increasing the tax on shack ownership in the city centre.<NL><NL>To conclude, it is clear that the government has played a significant role in supreme to take  appropriate measurementsmeasurementsse to create planned development with the city and well-designed infrastructure to meet the population needs of its citizen.

task: Housing shortages in big cities can cause severe social consequences. Some people think only  government action can solve this problem. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: In recent years, the increasing population has caused trouble in purchasing lands. On the one hand,  the society argues the fact that authorities should make remedy actions to fix an issue of inadequate  residences. However, on other hand, people themselves should solve this issue. I partially agree  with the given statement, and I will provide the substantiate argument in upcoming  paragraphs.  To commence, the government should restrict the allocation of land. To put it another way, government should apply more taxes to real estate so that they limit the making of houses.  Moreover, a focus on vertical housing would help to resolve the issue of even distribution of  homes. As an illustration, the apartments, and townhouses in developed cities like Singapore,  are made in a vertical manner in limited areas. Furthermore, authorities should apply more taxes  to bungalows and large houses. Therefore, people would purchase less of them. As an example,  the Canadian government restrict the purchase of houses for two years to resolve the issue of housing shortage.  On a contrary, people could also solve this issue by themselves. To simplify, they should prefer  living in villages and outskirts of towns instead of living in bigger cities. People can find more job  opportunities like farming in villages to earn a livelihood. This would help in bringing more  employment in the country and in this manner, society could also develop the villages. The fresh air  of villages would also make people more healthy and less stressed. Therefore, it would reduce  crimes in society.  To conclude, although people move to metropolitan cities in search of better opportunities,  they still face residential issues. Therefore, it is the responsibility of both government and people to resolve the issue by encouraging people to live in vertical housing and villages.
