essay: some indviduals thinks that optaning a college dgree would improve your chances for better employee states , which i do believe as well because its rais your oppertionties to get a desant income in future mean while othere group thinks starting a job after finishing secondary school is more benifishal this essay will explor both prespective<NL>Firstly i strongly agree with is notion , as been graduated form a  good coollege is essnisal to compate with othere candidates when applying to a high qulification types of jobs that mean more  chances to progress in life  ones you got them they helps you achive a a good qulity life style standers like geeting married or been able to rent a house or flat , paying you`r bills , have a saving account to use for holidays or  miltiple ocations , and that won`t come unless the person is highly qulified , with a high income, for example , doctors and bussenissemens who have finish there higher education had a high wages than low skills workers .<NL><NL>On the othere hand,  people who is aganist this thinks that working from a young age like 16 -18 would  teach the young people  responsplity and independancy form such a yong agee by  take cantrol of there own life that helps there personality to gow and become more aware  with the desigions they make , in instance in german teens  there was studes show that teens who have start there solo online  bussenise since secondary school years  where more seccseccfull later in life .<NL><NL>in cancluion althogh some gueas may brefire satrting work after high school ,this essay agree that having an acadmic dgree is great way to have more stable life and and dending up with a good career,

task: Some people believe that studying at university or college is the best route to a successful career, while others believe that it is better to get a job straight after school.<NL><NL>Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: Many people think that the getting a knowledge at college or university is greatest way to take a position in every wanted sphere.However, others reckoning that this is better to find employment.Although,there are benefits from working after school,I would argue that it is better to go to university or college .In the following paragraphs,let me elaborate both viewpoints and share my position on this drawback.<NL><NL>The point of start work straight after school is so stunningly solution .Lots of people want to earn money as soon as available.And this is crucial reason to start working after high-school.Because of job,many teenagers are able to get experience to future humanity career.This means that,on account of less responsibility on your head,when you make a significant mistake in your teenager ages,you would have to more chances to correct it than in adult years.But the accomplish,which you can get at the your job time,will be able to help you in your future position in each sphere.<NL><NL>On the other hand,we have to think about new technology on science or on our lifestyle,which is speedly improving by years.Humanity must develop his all sides respectively to new technology.In my opinion,we have to be ready for new generation of technology.Because active evolution of technology poses a threat to humanity that the robots and machines can replace position of people in future.But do not forget that the robots and machines are absolutely without emotions and morality.And because of them Humanity also must be developed,and people should go to university to improve his knowledge about a world and humanity.And this is noticed that consequence from study at university is better than working straight after school for us.<NL><NL>In conclusion,I believe that find employment after school have many benefits for our life,but consequence of ending university would be better.

task: Some people believe that studying at university or college is the best route to a<NL>successful career, while others believe that it is better to get a job straight after<NL>school.<NL>Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: It is often said that if people desire to have a successful life, they need to face challenges and should not recoil from failure. From my perspective, even though facing risk means one might suffer from setbacks and the apprehension of making the wrong step, I believe the conducive effects which derive from it can outweigh the disadvantages.<NL><NL>Taking risks is by no means an easy task, people might fringe themselves from the consequence of failure. However, without these challenges, an individual can lose the chance to succeed as well as know one’s limits. If people surmount the difficulties and reach the goal, the fruition is incompatible, and the experience of success can also enhance one’s confidence in facing different scenarios in the future. In addition, if failure really occurred, lessons can also be learned and experience can be amassed through the mistake, which can further avail people in averting the same mistake while preparing themselves for  better performance.<NL><NL>People who stand on the opposite side might  assert that taking risks could result in pressure, which can turn out to be detrimental for individuals, leading to  underperformance, eventually. However, they might overlook the fact that on most occasions, failure is unavoidable; the way to overcome the fear is to face it. People who are always trying to escape from facing failure will stand no chance to improve themselves, as mentioned, failure can be conducive if people are willing to accept it, the experience accumulated in the process can avail oneself in dealing with manifold situations while remaining calm in the future.<NL><NL>In conclusion, though taking risks means failure might happen, I believe the experience and lessons which one can learn in facing risk decisions can outweigh the disadvantages.

task: Some people believe that studying at university or college is the best route to successful career. While others believe that it is better to get a job straight after school. Discuss both views and give your opinion
essay: Without any ,doubt society is divided into two groups as per the distinct mindsets of different people. Therefore, this has become a debate able issue whether to make a successful career an individual should study at university or college, or they should immediately find  employment right after completing  school. This essay will not only shed light on both the perceptions but also my point of view will be elaborated in the conclusion<NL><NL>On one side of the argument there are people who argue that the benefits of studying at university or college considerably outweigh its disadvantages. The main reason for believing this is while doing higher education students mind become more broaden, for example when I was in a school, I studied many computer courses but I only gained the basic understanding of the subjects  because schools don’t teach core concepts they just provide basic knowledge to the students which is not enough for them to become a successful person in this modern technological world, On the other hand when I attended the university I got more understanding because of the practical knowledge that I got from there as the university prepares students to be more hands-on rather than just providing theoretical information, for instance, according to recent research conducted by googling it is observed that 80% of universities don’t teach only theoretical knowledge of the subjects but side-by-side also teach practical understanding, so that students should be ready to crack any job interview and get the job which they wanted <NL><NL>On the other hand, it is also possible to make the opposing case it is often argued that students should start the jobs straight after finishing their initial education people often have this opinion because they think that they would become more responsible and would have more practical knowledge as compared to those who directly enrol themselves in higher education. To exemplify it one of my friends was doing a job right after finishing  school, he was doing a job in the automobile industry and was earning a good amount of money apart from that he also paid his complete education fee on his own he didn’t take a single penny from his parents, his father always say that I am proud of my son that how responsible he was during his early age of life, secondly he got  admission in the engineering university and was doing automobile engineering and he always scored good marks in every subject not only that he also got the job right after completing his degree because he already had a decent amount of experience in this industry he did not found the job, job found him, hence it is also suggested that students should start the job after completing his or her school <NL><NL>As we have seen that there are no easy answers to these questions. On balance ,however, I believe that individuals should complete their higher education first rather than doing any kind of employment

task: Some people believe that studying at university or college is the best route to a successful career, while others believe that it is better to get a job straight after school. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: After finishing  school, everyone should think about what they will do next. While some think that getting a position after high school is the best option, I agree with those who suggest that a student can have a shining future if they go study at a university or college. <NL><NL>Many people believe that it is unnecessary to enter other institutions in due to receive a great job. Proponents of this view may suggest that young people should go to  work after finishing their studies at school because former pupils can start earning money and learning how it is to be an adult. For example, my friend's parents suggested her to get a job after her study, and she started earning money for her living in the cafe. However, It was the only place where she could work after school, but at least, she managed to make some money for herself.<NL><NL>On the other hand, I am in agreement with those who say that in order to have a great profession, students have to get further knowledge. An important reason is that you can only get a well-paid position if you have  evidence of your knowledge. For instance, you can not work at a law company or at a hospital without finishing particular courses.<NL><NL>In conclusion, whereas many are convinced that the best variant would be to go working after getting basic education, I side with those who suggest that if people want to receive a great job, they have to enter  university.

task: Some people believe that studying at university or college is the best route to a successful career, while others believe that it is better to get a job straight after school.<NL><NL>Discuss both views, and give your opinion.
essay: Most of the students who are trying to get a good job or business right after their schooling is often failing. But  the people who are choosing to study in the educational institution/university and take a little more time are easily getting a successful career.<NL><NL>Firstly, most of the admission have vast knowledge in Universities that help them to get a successful job. In ,Universities admissions are intended to get more experience before and there are lots of paths that can lead to the right way. For ,example a student who is new to the educational institution comes in and doesn't know what to do or what to be, he can learn what the academy teaches and what he likes to do so he can follow that path. However ,on the other hand,  the enlistments  that are looking for jobs right after their schooling is often failing. For instance, you just finished your schooling and have no idea of what you are going to be, and how to be it, it will take a long time to learn it. For ,example if an enlistment wants to learn how to be a doctor he can go to college, he can read books, attend classes, etc.  Do you know that if a student becomes an adult and didn't finish college yet he can choose to finish it when he is an adult?<NL><NL>I also believe that studying at university and college is the best route to a successful career.

task: some people believe that studying at university or college is the best route to a successful career, while others believe that it is better to get a job straight after school. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: The line chart shows changes in the percentage of attendance in music concert at one city. The population is divided into five age groups:16-24, 25-44, 45-54, 55-64, and 75 years old and above. <NL><NL>Overall, it is clear that the percentage of attendance in all age group were rose except for percentage of people from 55 to 64 years old. Although the percentage of some age groups were fluctuated, they showed rising trend in general.<NL><NL>Looking at the chart more closely, one can see that the largest age group comprises 16 to 24-year-olds and that it grew steadily from 2010 to 2015, gradually reaching nearly 70 percent. In contrast, the oldest group, made up of people 75 years and over, consistently have the lowest rate of all five age groups. They surged initially, increasing from 10 percent in 2010 to 20 percent by 2011. However, this figure eventually settled into a slow increase, increasing to 20 percent by 2015. It is noteworthy that people from 55 to 64 years old remaind stable during the whole period. The number of the second largest group which comprised of people from 45 to 54 plunged initially, decreased from 52 percent of 2010 to 40 percent by 2011. Yet, this figure eventually bounce back to 50 percent in 2012, and maintained at the same level. The number of people from 25 to 44 years old decreased from 40 percent in 2010 to 30 percent by 2012, which is nearly half of figure in the largest group at the same time, but it ascended to 48 percent in 2015.

task: Some people believe that studying at university or college is the best route to a successful career, while others believes that it is better to get a job straight after school. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: Education is one of the most crucial parts of people's lives. Some people are firm believers in getting higher education before working. Others, however, have shown intense devotion to getting a job. This essay will discuss both points of views and explain my opinion.<NL><NL>The first and most obvious one is gaining specific knowledge. There are many professions requiring specific academics such as doctor, lawyer and accountant which the school did not have in a syllabus. Thus, these kinds of curriculum have to be learned in the colledge. Moreover, the difference between university and school is self-study. The rationale behind this is that students have to do research by themselves by data-gathering and synthesising sources.<NL><NL>On the other hand, some people believe in direct working. This is an account of the more they work the more soft-skill they get, so these people will have more experience in working compared to the one in the same age. A great example for this can be seen that artists do not require a college diploma or entrepreneurs can learn by trying and making a lot of mistakes.<NL><NL>In conclusion, there are several benefits both in future study and going straight to work. From my perspective, working or internship before learning at university is the best solution. This is an account of ensuring the passion that they have to spend less of their life. According to research from a local university, it indicates that more than 40 percent of learners are not satisfied with their faculty leading to lack of passion to study. However, the students who have internships before  learning are eager to learn and tend to be successful in their future life.

task: Some people believe that studying at university or college is the best route to a successful career, while others believe that it is better to get a job straight after school.<NL><NL><NL>Discuss both views and give your opinion?
essay: A faction of the society opines that working right after completing school has better career prospects. However, the other set believes in the importance of college or university learning in charting a successful and prosperous career. Despite seeing many examples of college dropouts building huge businesses, I strongly agree with the latter view that academic education plays a critical role in a person's career path.<NL><NL>On the one hand, the obvious reason for recommending working right after completing school, is the success of a few billionaires who skipped academics and made it big. For example, Facebook built by Mark Zuckerberg, and Apple built by Steve Jobs are inspiring stories of college dropouts. Both these highly talented individuals did not complete university education and rather went about building their companies which are now massive business conglomerates. On the other hand, many stories of thousands of college dropouts are unknown because they did not find good jobs or create a successful business, and are still struggling to make ends meet. Therefore, it is incorrect to bias one's opinion, keeping in mind, only a few successful people. <NL><NL>In contrast, the benefits of completing higher studies are manifold. Not only does the individual gain immense knowledge, but also gets to build a huge network of friends and acquaintances. The course curriculum often teaches examples of hundreds of companies and the reasons of their pitfalls and success. Furthermore, this knowledge gathered by discussing case-studies with peers is considered immensely beneficial later in their careers. To illustrate it further, an extensive survey conducted on 1000 executives of mid-sized companies, demonstrated that almost 80% of them gave credit to their alma mater for the success they have built. In addition, they always prefer to choose employees who have completed their college education.<NL><NL>In conclusion, from the arguments and explanation given above it is clear that despite having a few phenomenal college dropouts, majority people in the society value higher education. I firmly believe that completing higher studies is an imperative determinant of one's future career success, and strongly advocate that students should not drop out midway during their studies.

task: Some people believe that studying at university or college is the best route to a successful career, while others think that it is better to get a job straight after school. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: Upon high school graduation, students face the dilemma of continuing their studies at university or taking a job. While some believe it is better to pursue higher education, I agree with the idea that enrolling at a university leads to more success in their careers.<NL>Some may argue that working after high school helps those graduates develop an independent life and gives them an insight into their future careers. First, they can learn to live independently by managing their own income and spending. In Vietnam, students taking jobs after high school and living away from their parents are more self-reliant adults who can cover the compounding costs of accommodation, transport and food without asking their parents for a monthly spending allowance. Second, they are given the opportunity and time to observe how other people work in their workplaces. As a result, they may acquire a better understanding of their chosen profession and thus make a rational decision about their future, whether it is better to go back to university or to run a business. <NL>However, I believe it is more beneficial for students to continue their studies. One benefit is qualifications are an essential prerequisite for employment in certain professions. It is considered illegal to practice medicine without medical degrees or give legal advice without law degrees in most countries in the world. Another benefit is people with post-secondary education and years of experience in an industry have a higher chance of rising to the top and becoming leaders or managers of their companies. This is because the diplomas or degrees in addition to work experience they possess can convince others that they the necessary skills to regulate the operation of a company’s department.  <NL>In conclusion, while the option to work after school seems attractive for several reasons, I believe that pursuing a degree is more likely to lead to an envious career.

task: Some people believe that studying at university or college is the best route to a successful career, while others believe that it is better to get a job straight after school. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: There has been a difference of opinion regarding the merits of continuing a higher education as people believe that is better to get a job straight after school. I would argue that are more benefits in going to college or university. <NL>The option to start a work immediately is attractive for several reasons. The access to have an independent lifestyle as long as younger people start earning money, a wider range of possibilities come with it. In this way, they will be able to afford their own apartment or start a new family. In terms of their career, getting a job brings the opportunity to gain experience in specific fields. Indeed, spend time working in a real industry and sharing different points of views with co-workers and bosses, gives an invaluable knowledge about the process.  <NL>Despite the arguments mentioned above, I believe that is more beneficial for students to continue their studies. Firstly, academic qualifications are required in the majority of professions. For example, it is impossible to become a doctor, teacher or lawyer without having a degree. As a result, nowadays a large number of industries and hospitals are only hiring people who have a bachelor degree or higher. Secondly, in recent years, the job market is becoming more competitive and sometimes there are hundred of applicants for one position in a company. Subsequently, young people who do not have a degree will not be able to compete and without a job is more difficult to continue growing in a career. <NL>By way of conclusion, I believe that students will be more successful in their lives if they continue their studies beyond school level.

task: Some people believe that studying at university or college is the best route to a successful career, while others believe that it is better to get a job straight after school.<NL>Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: Nowadays, everyone aims to have a successful career. While some people believe that to be successful university or college education is important, others argue it to be unnecessary and one should start working after their secondary schooling. I would agree with the former view, however, both the sides will be dicussed.<NL><NL><NL>To begin with, those who believe that joining a job staright after school is better argue that in higher institutions only theorectical knowledge is imparted whereas in real life practical knowledge is more important. For instance, to become a car mechanic only practical knowledge about how to repair a car is required and one gains expertise in skills with experience. Moreover, by doing a job straight after school one can  start earning and become self- dependent. In other word they do not need to ask for pocket money, while their counterparts be still be dependent upon their parents. <NL><NL><NL>However, I strongly belive that university education is improtant. One of the benefit of university education is that an individual learn basics of the major course. This narrows down their focus and helps them to gain perfection in their field. Furthermore, nowadays it is essential for an individual to aquire university education to qualify for a job. Many professions such as doctor, lawyer require license which can be only gained by appropriate qualification. If the individual have a degree then only they can earn a white collar job and a good salary.<NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, although by joining a job staright after school can make start earning early and self dependent but to aquire a good job one needs a good university education.

task: Some people believe that studying at university or college is the best route to a successful career, while others believe that it is better to get a job straight after school.<NL>Discuss both views and give your opinion. You should write at least 250 words.
essay: Many people set their goals to be finish advanced learning at university. Otherwise, some  choose to apply for work instead of getting a diploma from college. Pros and cons of early employment will be discussed in this essay briefly. <NL>Students that struggle with financial problems tend to stop reaching higher level of academic and enter the workforce after finishing highschool. Working early will help them to be sustainable with their daily purposes like accommodation. Moreover, they can support their family finance and gain more experiences in life, compared to their peers. So that, jumping straight into work after school will help people to avoid some expenses like tuition fee, living costs, which is pretty expensive and instantly make money to afford their lives <NL>However, this seems to be not an ideal choice for numerous people. Recently, it might be difficult to get a job steadily without a degree from university. It is because in today’s society, jobs mostly require technological knowledge or computing skills because of the rapid development. So that, without some specific diplomas, people could only enter labour work like plumber or tailor factory, which has lower wages and maybe worse working environment than intellectual work.<NL>Overall, joining a job after school is really useful if people want to support their finance problem. Otherwise, it might be a shortage for them from having chances to enter in a better workplace and to have higher salary.

task: Some people believe that studying at university or college is the best route to a<NL>a successful career, while others believe that it is better to get a job straight after<NL>school.<NL>Discuss both views and give your opinion
essay: There is always a conflict for a student whether to aim towards getting work or opt for a graduate degree. Some people think it is favourable to go for higher studies, however, others believe it is best to get a job immediately after school. In this essay, we will discuss both the views and provide evidence on why it is better to go to a university or college.<NL><NL>On one side, there are individuals who argue that opting for skilled labour as soon as a student finishes the secondary education is more preferable as it has its own perks. One of the main reasons, students currently choose to get the work after secondary education is because they want to be independent. For example, today's teenager thinks that, as soon as they start working, they can earn money and get settled by themselves rather than depending on others. This thought of being self-sufficient and independent has pushed a lot of youngsters today in getting placements soon after schooling.<NL><NL>On the contrary, it is often argued that having a degree from a university or an institute has been always beneficial for an individual as it will yield them to get a successful career in a sector where there is a requirement for a graduate certificate. For instance, to acquire a job in the field of doctor, teacher or lawyer a specific area of degree is compulsory. One cannot obtain such a profound career without having an academic background. Therefore, having a higher qualification is essential to have a better job opportunity.<NL><NL>In conclusion, I would say that it is always more enticing for youngsters these days to grab the opportunity of working and settling after the school finishes, nonetheless, in my perspective to pursue a specialized occupation, it is necessary to have a proper education from a recognized institution or university.

task: Some people believe that studying at university or college is the best route to a successful career, while others believe that it is better to get a job straight after school. Discuss both views.
essay: Whether a university’s role should be to prepare graduates for specific jobs or simply to educate without a particular vocation in mind is a debatable issue. This essay believes that universities fulfil both purposes. The essay will first discuss the function of vocational courses, followed by a discussion of more traditional tertiary education.<NL><NL>Some students have a very specific job in mind when they enrol at university. Medicine, dentistry and accountancy have clear career paths and they allow people to focus on and then undertake a certain profession upon graduation. This suits those who have decided on a career and it avoids them wasting time studying a more general subject like English. For instance, in the United States, you must complete four years of higher education before you can study law and many feel that these four years are a waste of time, that would have been better used focusing on their chosen discipline.<NL><NL>However, this is not suitable for everyone and many people have no idea what job they would like to do when they are 18. For these young people, it is better to do a non-vocational course, such as philosophy and simply add to their intellect without a career goal in mind. If they were forced to study a more practical subject, they are more likely to quit or become disillusioned because they don’t see the point of their chosen subject. For example, The Times recently reported that only 50% of law graduates actually want to become lawyers at the end of their studies.<NL><NL>In conclusion, the function of the college is to both prepare students for the workforce and provide knowledge and which one a person chooses should depend on their preference at the time.

task: Education of young people is highly prioritized in many countries. However educating adults who cannot write or read is even more important and governments should spend more money on this. To what extent do you agree or disagree
essay: Education of young individuals is highly prioritized in many countries, however, there are adults who are not able to write or read and I strongly agree that educating them is more crucial and governments should take some measures and spend money on this.<NL><NL>To begin with, there is no doubt that today education is essential and it should be prioritized, hence from my point of view there should not be a person who can not read or write. And that is the reason why I strongly believe that governments should spend more money on this, for instance nowadays unfortunately there are many people who can not afford to go to school and be educated due the the lack of money but if governments give those residents money to attend to school and learn how to write or read that problem will be solved in no time.<NL><NL>Secondly, if people do not know how to write or read they will never be able to find a job and needless to say that without working they can not survive and it can lead them to commit crimes to live. For example, they can rob others, I remember 2 years ago I read that an adult robbed a family to feed him and his family, consequently governments from around the world should spend as much money as they can to help these adults educate.<NL><NL>In conclusion, personally, I reckon that educating adults who can not write or read is vital and governments should spend more money on this, otherwise, it can lead to terrible consequences.

task: Education for young people is important in many countries. However, others think government should spend more money for education in adult population who cannot read and write. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: It is argued by some public that learning is very crucial for young communities in wide places of the country. In contrast, it is considered by others that adult nations who can not know read and write are very critical and the government should give them more payment. In my opinion, I believe that the ministry should provide more money for young people. However, adult nations need to study how to read and write, so the polity has to cover their needs and specialized some money for them. <NL><NL>    One evident benefit of outlaying more pay to study young public is  to flourish the economy  the workforce and their energy. In other words, if the young population have more experience and knowledge, they will achieve many things and serve their society. Moreover, authority ought to take care of these categories of humaneness due to, they have full power to protect the world. Also, they will aid their kids to learn and tell them about the correct values.<NL><NL>    On the other hand, the government have to give specific money to adult because  they have a prominent role and are considered  a  basic key to educating their young children. For instance, if adult folk have a background or ideas that will affect  their knowledge of their young generation. Also, they want to save their rights to teaching.<NL><NL>  To sum up, even though  education is very useful for young people to rise the nation, it is very necessary for an adult to assist their children in the education system.

task: Education for young people is important in many countries. However, some people think that the government should spend more money on education for the adult population who cannot read and write. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Education is an inevitable factor in life and most of the countries following the same in the case of young people but in the fact of adults who do not know writing and reading some people believe that authorities should spend more money on their education. However, I totally agree with the statement and explain the reasons in the following essay.<NL><NL>Firstly, the unliterary people are facing many problems due to the improper knowledge of examine and writing. For example, when they go for their different needs they want to depend on others to help them translate the data. Also, to fill the forms or applications for various situations like the hospital, bank, and all. Therefore, it creates a lot of issues when always required the support of others. Moreover, to find a job basic education is a must. Particularly, for communication as well as knowledge.<NL><NL>In addition to that, when traveling from one place to another at least to read the name board of the place reading accuracy should be necessary. On the other hand, uneducation maybe not be their mistake may it caused due to their circumstances. For instance, in the early days, the education facilities and financial background are not much stronger than now. Hence, it might lose the chance for their academic. Furthermore, right now if the government helps them to learn minimum basic education as free it will provide good support and future for the uneducated adult people. <NL><NL>To conclude, living without dependency even in writing and reading is essential. So, authorities should take maximum measurements for that. Not only does it help them to live independently but also gives an option for opportunities.

task: Some people believe that governments should make laws about people’s nutrition and food choice while others argue that it is their choice. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: The pattern of eating food has been evolving for many years. Therefore, public authorities should regulate the consumption of eatables thinking some folks while other opposes that humans should not be limited for the same. Analysing that I opine, the ministry needs to make laws in order to create a barrier for obesity and health problems that are being faced by humans globally.<NL><NL>On the one hand, more and more population is becoming obese as junk food is the major meal of the day. In America, almost 60 per cent of the citizens rely upon burgers and pizzas for their daily consumption as it is readily available and tasty in comparison to other eatables. Clearly, such sort of health concerns is alarming to the law because citizens are being careless by choosing unhealthy preferences. Thus, it needs to regulate strict laws like banning fast-food chains in order to create awareness among residents.<NL><NL>On the other hand, it is a basic right of the public to consume as per their taste buds. Consequently, government has no role to play in this case yet society should be clearly responsible for the products they eat. From some stats, it led to a big fight when some people protested to close the pizza stores all over the country. Furthermore, every individual has the freedom to consume as per their desire even if it is harmful to them, they are only responsible for it. If it is not harming others then why would authorities need to make any laws since the population is only to be blamed for the damage they are causing to themselves?<NL><NL>In conclusion, in my opinion, the health issues arising around the Earth mainly contributing to humans not eating healthy food should be considered by the government as it is causing damage to the mass now. Although the public has the right to eat whatever they want, lawmakers should regulate it because  the problems like obesity are elevating.

task: Nowadays, more and more people want to get things done instantly (services, information,<NL><NL>tasks). Why is this? Do you think this is a positive or negative development?
essay: In recent times, many people want their work to be done immediately. I think this is because of the internet, which many people used to do their tasks within minutes. In my opinion, While it has made life easier for many people, others could suffer from chronic illness.<NL><NL>Now, some people are used to the speed; this is due to the existence of the internet in their life. In fact, many governmental institutions migrated to the internet because by doing this, many people can pay online and avoid spending most of their time in long boring queues. As a result, some people tended to do their work with a couple of screen clicks.<NL><NL>On the bright side, doing tasks in no time has made many people feel comfortable. For example, before the invention of the internet, people who were carrying out research had been struggling to find the information. In other words, people instead of spending days at the library trying to get the correct data, it takes a couple of minutes over the internet to find it. Despite finishing work almost immediately has its positives; however, some people suffer from chronic diseases.<NL><NL>By contrast, if many people tried to finish work promptly, they would most likely suffer from stress. As a matter of fact, these people who are trying to deliver their tasks quickly will often negatively affect their health. As a consequence, as long as people are always stressed, they will most probably struggle with chronic diseases such as Hypertension and Diabetes.<NL><NL>To conclude, life has become faster due to the existence of the internet. Personally, I believe that even though this trend has positively affected life as it allows many people to find what they are looking for rapidly, it has some drawbacks because it makes others always stressed, which can result in chronic diseases.

task: Nowadays more and more people want to get things done instantly (services, information, tasks). Why is this? Do you think it is a positive or negative development?
essay: This century is called as a century of technological advancements and improvements, which has made access to everything plausible within minutes.Therefore, everyone wants their work to be prioritised and completed instantly.There are a number of factors influencing this behaviour such as excessive use of internet, mobile phones to name some.<NL>Apparently, the current generation has cheap and fast access to the internet, which has made many tasks quite easy and can be done immediately within few clicks.For instance, for booking a train ticket earlier, a travel agent was required, which now can be done within minutes on internet.Moreover, anyone can now have a video conferencing from one part of the world to the other part of the globe with their mobile phone and internet, which was implausible few decades ago.Thus, easy, and handy access to almost everything has led to the increase of expectations of the people.<NL>Although, these inventions have done wonders for the humankind, in my opinion, there has been a significant negative development as well.For instance, nowadays a lot of youths are experiencing anxiety issues in contrast to previous generations.Moreover, excessive use technology is having a detrimental long term effect on physical and mental health of every individual.Additionally, it has been observed that now people are less patient and hard working as compared to our ancestors.Thus, the technology upgrade has led to changes in the attitude, which is having a serious negative impact on the society.<NL>In the nutshell, technological inventions have definitely improved quality of life, but exorbitant use is having pernicious effects as well.Therefore, it is necessary that the technology is used adequately and efficiently so that the time saved can be utilised in an effective and a productive manner.

task: It is important for all towns and cities to have large outdoor public spaces such as squared and parks. Do you agree or disagree with this statement?
essay: There is no denying the fact that  public spaces in towns and cities can be an arguable subject. While it is a commonly held belief that some individuals believe that outdoor public spaces it is important for towns and cities. there is also an argument that opposes it. In my opinion, I consider that  public spaces it is crucial because they can be used as venues for cultural events, and festivals.<NL><NL>To begin with, parks and squares can help  prompt community interaction like social hubs. In other words, it serves as a space where individuals from different backgrounds can interact, fostering a sense of community and belonging. In addition, it can assist in elevating the levels of health and well-being. For example,  it provides environments that encourage physical activity and relaxation, which are essential for maintaining mental and physical health.<NL><NL>Another point to consider, outdoor public spaces have an environmental benefit. It is also possible to say that, it helps  reduce urban heat islands, improve air quality, and provide habitats for local wildlife. Moreover, it can be used as a landmark for economic advantages. For instance, Well-maintained public spaces can boost local economies by attracting tourists and increasing the value of surrounding properties.<NL><NL>In conclusion, despite people having different views, I believe that I tend to believe that public spaces such as squared and parks it actually important for all towns and cities because they will help boost the economy and increase community interaction, I suggest that the government make programs that help in building beautiful public spaces.

task: Some people think that it is a waste of money for countries to host big sporting events like the world cup, and that the money would be better spent on other things. However, others think that hosting large sporting events has a clear, positive impact on a country.<NL>Discuss both these views and give your opinion.<NL>
essay: People have different opinions as to whether nations should spend the national budget on hosting international sporting events. Personally, I believe that the events have beneficial impacts on the host nations as a whole.<NL>    Advocates of the former view might assert that spending on sporting events could hurt countries’ economies. Staging the international sporting events would incur enormous expenses, to the detriment of the host nations’ budgets. The expenditure on renovating their stadiums, implementing higher levels of security, and hiring performance artists is so significant that hardly can poverty-stricken nations afford it. For example, instead of spending billions of dollars on hosting the 2010 World Cup and then drowning in debt, South Africa should have been expended those budgets on addressing the physiological needs of their citizens, such as improving the standard of living and eliminating starvation.<NL>    However, I support the view that nations might reap a multiplicity of benefits from staging those sporting events. Firstly, A wide range of employment opportunities are available during years of planning and investment, and this will contribute to a decrease in unemployment. Secondly,  enthusiasm and excitement are an indispensable part of these events; it is clear from this emotional boost that people of the host nations will experience a drastic improvement in their life satisfaction. Lastly, such events are conducive to the development of culture and tourism in the host nations. Social cohesion and cultural understanding are further developed, thanks to stadiums and arenas thronged with flows of people from all over the world.  <NL>    In conclusion, I concur with the portion of people who believe that the benefits of hosting international events would outweigh the drawbacks, although it might dig immensely into countries’ economies.

task: Write about the following topic.<NL><NL>Some employers believe that job applicants’ social skills are more important than their academic qualifications. To what extent do you agree or disagree? <NL><NL>Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.<NL><NL>You should write at least 250 words.
essay: At present, the hiring process has become more complex and competitive in the job market, and priorities various qualities are often employed when evaluating job applicants. Some people argue that not only academic qualifications are highly required, but also extroversion is also have great importance. This essay supports the assertion to a major extent despite some inhibitions.<NL><NL>To embark on, one of the paramount reasons is effective communication is a vital skill in any professional setting. This means that employers value candidates who can express themself clearly  interact confidently with their colleagues and handle client and other related professionals. The best illustration is  customer service, an employer could able to communicate properly and address customer concerns to satisfy and express loyalty. Probing further, strong social skills built an individual reputation, resolved conflicts, and collaborated with the team.<NL><NL>On the other side, teamwork is another crucial aspect of the modern workspace. Employers often prioritize candidates who can work collaboratively, contribute ideas practically as well as theoretically and adapt to different teams. For instance, employers in construction project-based work have a combination of social skills to effectively coordinate with the workers and a theoretical understanding to solve problems that may arise on the construction site.<NL><NL>To conclude, social skills demonstrate a candidate's ability and quality of work with their colleagues and clients although academic qualifications elaborate the knowledge and experience in a particular field. Effective communication and teamwork are fundamental to success in today's professional work environments. I believe that both played essential roles in the modern era.

task: Some employers believe that job applicants’ social skills are more important than their academic qualifications. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Some recruiters suppose that for candidates, soft skills are more crucial than their academic background. I totally agree with this notion, as social capacities are essential when looking for a job. <NL><NL>The excellent soft skills of job seekers have apparent benefits. Firstly, communication is one of the most important skill for everyone. This is primarily because in modern days, you have to interact with different people. Good communication helps you to explain your idea in a clear way and make others understand what you are talking about. Secondly, various companies demand teamwork skills, which means that employees need to coordinate with colleagues and superiors at work. This not only helps their work complete smoothly but also brings high efficiency. <NL><NL>Nowadays, academic qualifications are still a prerequisite when applying for a job at many companies. Apparently, many positions require a certain academic level, it evaluates a person's academic ability and prospects in the professional field he or she studies. However, applying school knowledge to real work is quite a challenge. Therefore, during the recruitment process, some employers soon realized that other social experiences are also necessary and play an important role. They contribute greatly to timely and efficient completion. Therefore, I think these soft skills are extremely important for candidates when looking for a job.<NL><NL>In conclusion, I believe social skills play an important role in a company or organization. It not only brings more job opportunities but also helps workers quickly integrate and get promoted within the organization.

task: Some employers believe that job applicants’ social skills are more important than their academic qualifications. Do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
essay: Some recruiters suppose that for candidates, soft skills are more crucial than academic background. I totally agree with this notion as social abilities are the bottom line when getting jobs.<NL><NL>Firstly, being equipped with interpersonal skills such as communicating and interacting with co-workers helps job applicants to discuss with others and figure out solutions in any type of working environment. Hence, even a newbie who does not much specialized knowledge can contribute to solving and accomplishing assignments. Although academic capabilities play vital roles in the working process, they might become less effective in teamwork tasks requiring novel ideas from different perspectives if individuals are not able to connect with other colleagues in the workplace.<NL><NL>Secondly, the ability to multitask is also important in people’s careers, especially in these days and ages when everything happens fast and simultaneously. If a worker is merely good at technical knowledge, he might be confused due to a lack of capability to complete different tasks constantly. Consequently, he will become overwhelmed by heavy workloads with tight deadlines then. For instance, in the advertising field, being able to handle many tasks is always prioritized as the employees have to monitor campaigns, make new plans and meet clients’ requests at the same time and their performance outcomes will be evaluated based on all the aforementioned scopes as opposed to solely professional knowledge.<NL><NL>In conclusion, despite the undeniable importance of candidates’ educational backgrounds, I believe that being good at soft skills such as communication or multitasking is crucial in people’s careers since it can help them to improve not only individual results but also collective outcomes.

task: Job applicants’ social skills are more important. Some employers believe that job applicants’ social skills are more important than their academic qualifications. Do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
essay: Some recruiters value social skills more than academic qualifications when it comes to assessing candidates. I disapprove of this opinion because our professionals will help us most in handling tasks, and interpersonal ability can be acquired continuously after being employed.<NL><NL>First and foremost, many jobs prioritize your certificates or experience in relevant areas. For example, right at the first round of employment, programmers are required to finish at least a good Bachelor's degree in computer science in order to pass. This is because this type of document reflects clearly your level of problem-solving, critical thinking and understanding of what you're going to do in those positions, otherwise, just being decent in sociability doesn't help you anything in coding or system designing.<NL><NL>My second argument is that people skills can be gained through the working process. For instance, most technological firms in Vietnam often organize seminars or side activities to consolidate their employees' communication and English qualities. By doing so, instead of including conversational potential as a must-have criterion when interviewing, companies can teach their staff later, encouraging them to develop their well-rounded capability to be able to promote themselves to higher positions such as project manager or negotiator, and more than that, it's also the best way to bond every member in the organization together.<NL><NL>To conclude, some employers say that for an applicant, his social qualities are more valuable than his achievements in education. I strongly refute this point of view since the knowledge you obtain from your academy is the most helpful tool to complete your deadlines, as well as people can ongoingly learn soft abilities after joining the companies.

task: Some employers believe that job applicants’ social skills are more important than their academic qualifications. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: It can be viewed nowadays that some people are employed but not according to the degree that they completed in the university. This is because their authority has seen their potential skills not aligned with their bachelor's degree. I strongly believe the administration employs workers according to their skills, not their scholastic qualifications.  In the following paragraphs, I will discuss my point of view to attest to my belief and provide additional examples to support my claim.<NL><NL>Many believe that if someone gets hold of their diploma and earns high marks written in their transcript of records would entitle them to land a good position in their job; however, executives do not see it that way. Graduating from an elite University does not guarantee that your first job will give you a six-digit salary. One should be able to apply all the theories he has learned; with this, the company employee evaluators will see if his skill matches his credentials. As a teacher, when I applied for my first teaching job, I underwent an interview process following a written test. I was asked to do a teaching demonstration in front of the other applicants, which tested my skills to the core. Had I not delivered a proper and satisfying demonstration, I would not have continued to explore and expand my skills further. <NL><NL>In conclusion, I believe that the association board search for applicants that can perform better than just looking at their inked marks on a piece of paper attesting that they are degree holders. They can hone skills to make such applicants become part of the team and make that employee an asset in the company.
