task: Some employers believe that job applicants’ social skills are more important than their academic qualifications.<NL>Do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
essay: In today's ,world social skills are given utmost importance over the educational background and many of the recruiters try to employ candidates with such qualities.  I partially agree with the statement and I would like to elaborate on it in detail below.<NL><NL>The merits of outstanding social skills are apparent.  Firstly, communication is the key factor that helps to interact with different people on the whole and assists in creating a good buyer-seller relationship.  It can promote the growth of the business too.  Secondly, by having good communication skills anyone can excel in their respective fields either it may be sales or any other departments for the matter of fact.  For example, an employee with excellent presentation expertise can help customers understand the products and can convey them to buy that product.  Furthermore, employees with better interaction skills are generally easygoing, which is crucial for the workplace and the employer too.<NL><NL>In contrast, some people believe that academics are the pre-requisites of  employment.  Apparently, there are many positions that require high knowledge and capability of dealing with them smoothly.  For example, an administrative role in a company requires the applicant to have high qualifications to take prompt managerial decisions.  Such qualities are developed when a person has studied the subjects thoroughly.  Not only having social skills but also acquiring higher studies is equally important to run any organization smoothly.<NL><NL>In conclusion, I think both advanced studies and other communicational skills are of equal importance in today’s world.  Having workers with both these qualities make an organization grow and prosper thereby helping in building a strong workforce altogether.

task: Some employers believe that job applicants’ social skills are more important than their academic qualifications. Do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
essay: There has been much discussion revolving around the issue of whether job applicants’ social skills are more important than their academic qualifications. In this essay, I will explain why social skills are more vital, compared with academic qualifications.<NL><NL>The merits of outstanding social skills are apparent. Firstly, communication is the key to career success in this day and age. This is mainly due to the fact that the 21st century is best characterised by constant interaction with different people, no matter the communication happens in person or online. Secondly, the ability to sell products or services is of paramount significance in any business – this requires strong social skills. For example, an employee with excellent social skills is able to have an impact in front of customers or clients; as a result, products or services can be perceived as high-value. Furthermore, employees with better social skills are generally more easy-going, which is very important to the workplace, including the employer. After all, as the saying goes, “Who you work with is as important as what you do.” – An enjoyable work environment needs socially skilful employees.<NL><NL>In contrast, some others may claim that academic qualifications are the pre-requisite of employment. Apparently, many positions require certain qualifications. However, in modern-day society, more and more employers have realised that whether employees can get the results that the business wants is the key to a business’ success. It can be seen that qualifications do not play a key role in this regard.<NL><NL>Having considered both views, I think employees’ social skills are of overriding importance for an organisation. Also, I would suggest employers consider job applicants’ social skills first, which I believe is soundly based on the above reasoning I have presented.

task: SOme believe that many countries, the investment of public money in arts can be justified. Other think that the government should spend more on health and education. Discuss both views and give your opinion
essay: A number of countries are belived to spend money for art activities various acceptable reasons, whereas opponents argue that the governments should fund wellbeing and education sectors more than cultural issues. I definetely agree with former idea due to the fact that I belive that there are no differences between arts and other sevices like schools and hospitals.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with, art one of the most essential ways to be get close the society and to boost the cultural level of the community. For example, establishing vary of art museums, cinemas and concert buildings  enables to create common values for citizens. İf these places had not opened, people would not reach the opportunitiy which can strength invisible emotional communication among the society. In other words, spending money to art sector not only does has effects on community in visible way, but also it might contribute to progress relationships between the citizens. Therefore, funding art definetely is not waste money and it has equal importance like health services.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, no one can deny that public services such as medical services and colleges which provide to live better condition for poeple, one of the most crucial tools to take after its own citizens for rulers. To illusrate, progress of human history generally has been based on novelties which have involved overcoming health and education problems. In fact, the history has shown that the mankind could live more than it had lived thanks to capability of medical services and it have learned that to raech this proficiency have been needed the schools.  Yet, although schools and hospitals quite essential for society, it should be considered that art activities have huge importance in the same way.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To conclude,  a number of people claim that states ought to spend money to colleges and hospitals more than art places, while other belives opposite. It seems to me that arts and other essential services have equal importance aspect for being cruiel needs for community.

task: In many countries, Government likes to spend more money on the arts. Some people agree with this. Others think the government should spend more on health and education. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: According to a section of society, funding on arts by government is acceptable ; However, Others expect regime is spending more in public services such as education and health. In my opinion, government should be investing more money on public institutes.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To embark on, it is important to spend of arts. If  an administration of a country decided to stop funding for music, theatre etc., it would be a serious mistake and that could be destroy national identity. If any country does not emphatize to preverving  folk music , arts, theatre; That will be gradually disappearing. As well as preservating  art will lead great impact on tourism.If people find intersting about about a culture they visit there. As an exemplification,There are 6.2 million traveller visit in the Louver museum in 2012 and luver’s anuual income reached 216 millon dollers.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the contrary, Improving public services is crucial for developing a country. First investing in education are beneficial for long term. As well as expend more in educational system is helpful for sustainable growth of a country in long run.It is government resposiblity  to ensure that every citizen of country is educated. As an exemplification, In Germany universities does not take any tution fee, thus student are encouraged to higher study that’s long time investment make Germany one of the engineering power houses in the World. Secondly, A strong health care system are assure proper medical care for all efficiently in the country.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In recapitulate, I believe in allocating budget in different sector should be based on economic, social and political condition of a country. However, with limited economy education and healthcare should always be important than arts.

task: In many countries, the government likes to spend more money on the arts. Some people agree with this. However, others think government should spend more on health and eduation. Discuss both sides and give your opinion.
essay: It is one of the fads that many countries nowadays pour more funds in art and many people hold the view spent money on arts is necessary, while another group of thinkers support that government funds should be invested on public services and facilities. This essay will highlight both opinions and also elaborate that art certainly requires mastery over the fundamental of it and thus will lead to a logical conclusion.<NL><NL>There are myriad of reasons which will further explain this argument but the most preponderant one stems from the fact that art is a basic human need and so government has a duty to satisfy this need as other need. If governonce spend lot of money on arts they can see new talented artists in own nation. Moreover, another pivotel aspect of this argument is that artists play a vital role for masses. Because they paint various painting regarding culture and traditions as well as many painting are keep in the museum and many individuals like go to museums. For example, we increase their knowledge about history,culture and tradition through movies, songs and paintings made by artists.<NL><NL>On the contrary, the latter view suggest that union should spend money on public services and facilities instead in art. They may think that citizens can reap more benefits from public services and facilities. For instance, with more money spent in progressing education and medical system, students can receive better education to improve employability and patients have more chances to survive from severe diseases. Besides this, nowadays abound individuals face major problem of unemployment. Therefore, government open new  companies and many people join new job and increase their knowledge and learn new skills thus, unemployment decrease day by day.<NL><NL>In conclusion, nevertheless, weighing the both the options, I believe that there is no single conclusion still, l take this ground the effective clap reqiure use of both hands.

task: Historical objects should be brought back to their country of origin. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Historical objects are precious items that carry immense cultural and historical significance. They offer valuable glimpses into the past and act as tangible connections to our ancestry and heritage. According to a belief, it is crucial to repatriate these valuable treasures and preserve them in their original homeland. In this essay, I will elaborate on my strong agreement with this notion and shed light on my support for this subject.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Primarily, artefacts carry significant historical and cultural value for the people of a nation. For instance, the Koh-I-Noor diamond, once part of India's rich heritage, is now housed in the United Kingdom's Crown Jewels collection. Returning the Koh-I-Noor to India would be a meaningful gesture, as it holds deep cultural and historical importance for the Indian people. Consequently, it would allow them to reconnect with their past and preserve a piece of their heritage for future generations.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Furthermore, repatriating historical objects can play a crucial role in strengthening the nation's identity and pride. For example, The Sultan Ganj Buddha, an ancient bronze statue discovered in Bihar, is currently displayed in the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery in the United Kingdom. Returning the Sultan Ganj Buddha to India would be an opportunity to celebrate and appreciate Indian history and spirituality. Hence, having artefacts back in their original context could help  people develop a deeper understanding of their culture and traditions.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, having engaged in the subject matter, while displaying the artefacts in foreign museums may offer educational benefits to people worldwide, we should consider the special significance of these objects to the people of their nation. Therefore, I strongly support the idea that historical objects should be bought back to their country of origin as it can help preserve the rich heritage and foster a stronger sense of national identity and pride.

task: some people say that increasing business and cultural contacts between countries would is a positive developement, while others think that many counntries will lose their national identities as a ruslt. Discuss both view and give your opinion?
essay: It is believed that the international trade and cultural exchange between nations brings significant benefits for each side, while some others think that the tendency  causes  the loss of their traditional and cultural values. In my opinion, the advantages of this phenomenon overshadow the disadntages.<NL><NL><NL><NL>There are a number of reasons why some people believed that  developing business and cultural cooperation has an adverse impact on their national identities. First, the globalisation poses a serious threat to traditional and culture value of a nation. This can be explained by the fact that multinational corporations often use their national image and culture to advertise their items, which trigger curiously potential customers that come from overseas. For example, younger generation in Viet Nam tends to imitate lifestyle and fashion of Korean due to the influence of commercial channels, which poses many challenges for nations on how to maintain their nation identities.<NL><NL><NL><NL>However, In my opinion, I believed that   the positive outcomes of this tendency are immense. First, Multinational companies create a wide range  of job opportunities for local people, which help improve their living standard and boost the local economy. For instance, Apple company has provided thousands of jobs for workers in Viet Nam, Which help them avoid the risk of unemployment and live more comfortably. Second, International commerce and cultural exchange are considered as a golden chance for local companies to flourish in the global market. This means that, In order to compete with international companies, local companies have to be more creative and innovative, they also have much more opportunities to approach new technology and modern machines from other countries. A a result, they can product higher quality and cheaper items, which help them become more competitive with multinational companies. Finally, this trend gives people the chance to explore and understand deeply the culture of other countries. In fact, working in the multinational corporations, A person would expose   different cultures  and languages from their colleagues who come from other nations.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, although this tendency poses challenges  for countries on how to prevent the negative influene of foreign culture, In my opinion, the cultural  and  businees cooperation brings considerably economical and social benefits for nations

task: Some believe technology has made our lives too complex and the solution is to lead a simpler life without technology.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Nowadays, many are of the opinion that technology has complicated our lives and that living without it would make life so much simpler. Although I agree that technology has drawbacks, turning our backs on it would be a huge setback for mankind.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with, technology has played a crucial role in changing human communication, lifestyle and work for the better. Firstly, thanks to the invention of the Internet, people can now be updated with current affairs faster than ever. In addition, social apps such as Facebook and Twitter have allowed them to be in touch with their close ones more often with just a press of a button. Secondly, advances in broadcasting have provided numerous forms of entertainment. This greatly benefits individuals as well as improves their quality of life. Finally, the rise of automation has significantly reduced labour work and increased productivity. For example, manual tasks such as calculating or sorting, and memorizing can now be done by cutting-edge computers with high precision and reliability in a relatively short time. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Even though technology has made our lives become more complicated and it is a negative trend, there are several measures to help to alleviate the problem. One of the most effective ways is to change individuals’ attitudes toward technology. Indeed, instead of considering it as an indispensable part of our life, people should treat technology as a tool with the sole purpose being to ease their lives. By doing so, they will not become too dependent on it and free their minds. Another possible way is returning to low-tech devices. To be specific, studies have shown that people may be happier and more satisfied if they are given fewer options in life. Hence, by using devices with few quirks and features, it is likely that they may experience a more fulfilling life, as well as appreciate what they have. For example, instead of using smartphones, millions of teenagers in Europe are now buying dial phones, also known as dumb-phones, because these help them to stay away from the dramas on social media, control their lives better, and see the world with more grace<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, while I agree that technology is making our lives more complex, humans will not likely lead a simpler life if we reject it. Instead, we should change our mindsets toward it and try to use low-tech devices rather than chasing after the latest technologies to live healthier and simpler.

task: Some believe technology has made our lives too complex and the solution is to lead a simpler life without technology.<NL>To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Thanks to modern technology, our lives become easier and more time-saving. There is no doubt that in this society, technological development plays an essential role in all respect. Not only youngsters but also elderly people should be equipped with knowledge about technology.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Some people claimed that life would be less difficult without technology as it makes them tired and their lives are too complicated. I definitely disapprove about the idea. As I mentioned before, technology is an important part of our lives. Therefore, we should learn how to interact with modern technology instead of being controlled by it. The more the society develops, the more human beings have to improve their thoughts, their knowledge about anything. Technology should be considered an accompanist, a tool which support our lives. Or else, we, the human would turn out to be a slave. I mean, more and more people involved in technology addiction, especially the young. They spend all day looking at televisions, mobile phones, computers or tablets without mentioning their studying, family and friends. <NL><NL><NL><NL>There are hundreds of well-known names, for instant: Google, iPhone, Amazon, Tesla,… which provide our human’s life with suitable multiple choices. If we do not know how to make a chocolate pie, just google on Google. What’s more, a mail sent from an overseas student to her family via E-mail for every single day within one minute is totally possible owing to the Internet – a great invention in human’s history instead of using postage by trains, wagons or even birds. Much appreciation to many applications on smartphones that save our lives, out time: housewives do not need to go shopping for food, clothes, household things since we have Lazada, Tiki, Grab,… A click and we have all the stuff delivered right at the front door. The advantages of technology is countless that we can not mention all at once.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In short, life without technology nowadays is more difficult and complex from my perspective. Regarding to the pros and cons of modern technology, we had better think about what is crucial and what is unnecessary. Try not to be controlled because the human beings must be a dominant of all things.

task: The shortage of housing in big cities can cause severe consequences .Only government action can solve this problem .To what extent do you agree or disagree
essay: Accommodation is an essential need in our lives.The scarcity of shelter can cause serious problems.Some people believe that it is the role of the government to solve problems of shelter.The government can act by creating affordable housing trusts , introducing new home zones and giving incentives to small builders.I completely agree that it is solely the government's responsibility to solve shelter deficits in cities.<NL><NL><NL><NL>The creation of affordable housing trusts aids by giving people mortgage to buy apartments that can be paid over a certain timeline.By building more apartments and giving loans it helps to mitigate the problems of housing in towns.For example an apartment can accommodate a tremendously higher number of individuals than a house which occupies and wastes land.Furthermore the government can introduce new home zones in virgin lands which are nearby the metropolitan.This is done to empower individuals who want to build houses and are unable to purchase land or apartments in the city.As a result it helps to decongest the number of people in towns and provides solutions to housing problems.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Also the government should give incentives to small builders to enter the market of constructing houses as independent builders.Likewise this helps people who are unable to afford professional builders to build their homes.In doing so the government will be increasing the number of houses for it's citizens.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion ,I believe that it is the government's main responsibility to curb the lack of homes in the metropolitan area by providing several measures to accommodate it's citizens.

task: The shortage of housing in big cities can cause severe consequences. Only government action can solve this problem.<NL><NL>To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: The population growth in major cities and demand for houses has increased in parallel, which brings detrimental problems. It is said that just government can help to omit this issue which I believe is the same for these issues.<NL><NL><NL><NL>People would not expand their families unless their city could support all the family members' housing. As long as people could not find a city with large numbers of apartments or flats for their children to live in, they may not convince to bring their offspring. Consequently, governments should construct buildings to decrease public worries. Urban areas that are deprived of enough houses would not be enlarged in population; as a result, that country contains old society, and many economic problems would occur as well.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In addition, if people do not find any place to live in their city, they might immigrate to other cities or even other countries. People employed in a new job, young adults, in particular, want to live in a suitable house; if they have faced not having a home, they will resign or change their living areas. As a result, that town lost its workers, so in my opinion, governments should make architecters to design a place that can include many residents; moreover, develop the suburb to encourage people to live there to reduce problems. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, a shortage of living places stop families from bringing children and drops the number of jobs demanding, which hits the country's economic growth. From my point of view, governments must take actions to overcome this issue.

task: Some people think the money spent on developing technology for space exploration is not justified. However, there are more beneficial ways to spend this money. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: the issue of whether the money should be used justified has been raising a lot of debates. Some might say that there are so many ways to invest money such as help poor people, construct infrastructure or develop computers or so on. On the contrary, others insist on the opinion that in the development of technology, people should open their knowledge by exploring the earth to promote human life. Viewing from a general perspective, I personally agree with the former opinion for the following reasons.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with, the funds of the countries should be invested in by taking care of the inhabitants and environment because this is the main factor which builds a nation. Firstly, citizens are the element of the foundation of the countries so if their life is great, the nation will be the development. For example, using funds to help the homeless have a house and settle down, if people’s lives are stable then the country will be stable. Secondly, building or repairing infrastructure makes the state look beautiful and clear because the outlook is traits to appreciate the development of the nation-states. For instance, fixing the old building can substantially help the countries become more developed and prosperous. Finally, make use of wealth on  growing the public, bringing the country's economy and socializing expansion.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, some of the population think that exploring space can help  society predict everything before this happens so that a human can prepare to confront or find the way to fix it such as climate change or earthquake. However, if the crowd spend a lot of cash on space exploration and do not care about society and habitat <NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, it is not justified to invest money to investigate  the galaxy while there are so many beneficial ways to use capital like making the nation better than by caring for people and reducing the environment.

task: Some people think that money spent on developing the technology for space exploration is not justified. There are more beneficial ways to spend this money. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: The technology from the very beginning has two aspects, if it is used in the right way it is beneficial for survival, but if it is utilized in the wrong way it may be worse for the whole mankind. A  popular stratum of society believes that spending wealth in the development of space exploration is necessary. However, in its sharp contrast, others opine that it is the sheer wastage of money which could rather be used to eradicate other issues of the community. I would like to delve into both the arguments before making an opinion.<NL><NL><NL><NL>The first school of thought claims that evolution of space technology has brought humans the possibilities of life in outer space, which is a huge achievement. According to some researchers, the end of the earth can be expected as a consequence of factors like pollution, global warming, etc. So, the space scientists are working on projects to produce habitat on other planets. They believe that without exploring the space or other planet physically we cannot have any idea about it. Moreover, without having prior knowledge of other spheres we cannot live there. In addition to this, developing space technology is compulsory.<NL><NL><NL><NL>However, another group of person opines that spending wealth on space technology is surely a wastage of it. Every year a huge amount of money is spent on this by different countries to just prove their strength. They believe that as we live on earth humans should not face problems in their daily life to run their lives smoothly. Instead of spending too much money on space exploration program e governments should spend on social issues. For example, governments should provide jobs for their pupil, they should construct better infrastructure  for better development, they should provide better medical facilities and much more.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In the conclusion, I would conclude that developing automation for space exploration is good for mankind, but this fact cannot be denied that it requires a huge amount of fund. The governmental bodies should also keep a regular check on social issues to bring happiness into people's lives and on planet earth.

task: most people decided to have children in their later age than in the past. why? do the advantages of this outweigh its disadvantages? Give reasons for your answer and include relevant examples,e.g from your knowledge or experience
essay: In the present age, people tend to have children at an older age. From my perspective, it has more drawbacks than benefits. This essay will discuss the main reasons associated with this epidemic and reveals why it has more disadvantages.<NL><NL><NL><NL>The main reasons for this global problem are people's career and their freedom. Nowadays, individuals' career and their position in society have great importance. Everyone tries to enhance their performance and get promoted; therefore, having a baby is a huge obstacle and prevents parents from reaching their goals. What's more, people without children have freedom. In other words, they do whatever they want and enjoy their lives. For example, a single person can travel or go to parties anytime without worrying about her baby.<NL><NL><NL><NL>However, having children at an older age has significant drawbacks. First of all, old parents' offspring may suffer some disorders like Down syndrome. This problem is more common among old mothers' children, which causes irreparable problems in society. Secondly, older parents are not energetic, and they can't play with their babies properly. They get bored easily, and in the future, because of a huge age difference, they can't understand children, and this causes a disparity between them. For instance, teens with young parents have a good relationship with them.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To conclude, having a baby in old age has various reasons, like the importance of job prospects and liberty. On the other hand, it has serious demerits like disability and parents' impatient. I personally believe that the benefits of this epidemic cannot overshadow the disadvantages.

task: NOWADAYS, MORE AND MORE PEOPLE DECIDE TO HAVE CHILDREN  IN THEIR OLDER AGE. WHAT ARE THE REASONS? DO THE ADVANTAGES OF THIS OUTWEIGH DISADVANTAGES?
essay: In the current era, Many individuals are prone to give birth in their older age for various reasons. Personally, elderly people are not an appropriate age to have a baby so negative outcomes would outweigh advantages.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Firstly, there are many crucial reasons why some individuals decide to have a baby at an old life in the developed world such as generating a bunch of income, which provides job security and a better lifestyle. Moreover, Some claim that giving childbirth at a young age when they are not ready not only provides a number of responsibilities to them but also reduces the freedom, which allows them to hang out with their comrades and family. In addition, from the medical surveys, 80% of mothers in an elderly life spend most of their time on hectic work due to lack of income.   <NL><NL><NL><NL>However, common abnormalities of childbirth such as Down syndrome, heart problems and other issues due to lack of nutrition in pregnancy are the most horrible effect which affects both mother's and offsprings' lifestyle in the short-term and long-term. Furthermore, the ability to take care of offspring at that life significantly decreases as they are too old to carry their offspring and play with them. Most medical research shows that a large number of abnormal children mostly happened in this phenomenon and mothers experienced losing childbirth before giving birth as physical issues. <NL><NL><NL><NL> In conclusion, Although generating incomes is vital for some communities, people should be more concerned about this as negative outcomes affect either mother or children, which leads to physical and mental issues after give-birth.

task: More people decided to have children in their later age than in the past. Why? Do advantages of this outweigh disadvantages? Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
essay: In today's world,a lot of adults have begun to think that it will be better for them to give  birth to a child in a more mature age than people used to do in the past. There are different reasons which could support this decision and its benefits, but also there are some drawbacks which will be discussed in this essay.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, it has become extremely popular among women to get pregnant at the age of 30-35 while earlier it was important to become a mother before 20. First of all, in the past,the main role of a woman was to be a good housewife and take care of children. This is because there were a lot of prejudices about the female part of  society and their duties to the world. Therefore, young girls used to think about pregnancy at the age of 18 since they were told that after this age it would be difficult to get a good family. For instance, the majority of women who lived in the Soviet Union under the pressure of  society were forced to give  birth at a very young age.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Doubtless, there are both advantages and disadvantages to this approach. Firstly, when a person becomes a parent at an adult age it is likely to have more opportunities for his child and would be able to be responsible for someone's life. On the other hand, with the time woman's ability to get pregnant decreases and it might be hard to give  birth at the age of 30. For example, some female could become infertile due to the fact that they didn't give  birth when they were young.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To conclude, the major reason for people to think about pregnancy at the more adult age is that they would be more responsible and would have an ability to give their infants everything they would need for  development. Advantages of this decision far outweigh its demerits.

task: You should spend about 40 minutes on this task.<NL>More people decided to have children in their later age than in the past. Why?<NL>Do advantages of this outweigh disadvantages?<NL>Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience. <NL>You should write at least 250 words.
essay: In these career oriented world people are postponing their family planning to late stage of their life. Perhaps, the most important reason is goal oriented. In my opinion, benifits of having offsprings in later age offsets the drawbacks entailed by this trend, as one can focus on their career and enjoy their life.<NL>The major disadvantage of this trend offers is related to health. Having childrens in later stage may pose a risk to the mother because they may not be healthy enough to give birth to child. These may result in birth of a child with abnormal syndrome. For example, a research published in gynegology has found that females giving birth after the age of 35 years are highly prone to give birth to a diseased child.<NL>Firstly, primary reason behind planning children in later stage is that these days people are becoming more career oriented. These means that they have to put their energy, time and money in acheving their dreams.<NL>These may make them competent for upbring of their childrens in a well manner.<NL>Moreover, having childrens at later stage offers several advantages. The first obvious benifit is that people can acheive the heights in their careers as they can focus on theri career. They can devote all their resources and energy in to acheving their dreams. For instance, a growing body of research have found that 80% of people are successful in their career those who have planned their offspring in later stages of life.<NL>Secondly, people can enjoy their life because they donot have responsibility of nuturing their childrens. This further encourages them to explore the world in the way they want. For example, they can travel to the tourist places, explore the landscape and culture of other nations. Also they can develop their hobbies.<NL>In conclusion, despite of having a disadvantage of helath, having childrens in later stge of life offers more advantages of acheving career and enjoying life.

task: More people decided to have children in their later age than in the past. Why? <NL>Do advantages of this outweigh disadvantages?<NL>Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
essay: Among the various changes we are encountering daily between the previous and recent times, is the new mindset that prefers to have offsprings in an older age. This shall have some pros and cons but are these merits enough to take such decision or not?<NL>In the past, women, whether educated they have been or not, were accustomed to getting married at her early 20s ages and directly have a baby on her bare hands just after one year of marriage. Since the life at such moments have been much easier, cheaper with less needs, for instance, one would only aim to send his child to a considerate school. To put it in another way, no luxurious requirements, unlike nowadays, as participating in a well-known club for different trainings and exercises or going out for costy trips frequently. Meanwhile, no much concentration was given to the way of raising children properly, but just in a similar method that this young mother has been brought up even if it was a false way of raising.<NL>Nevertheless, at the recent moments, people are paying more attention to this issue regarding marriage and children. Should they be able to offer a relatively high standard of living to their children or not has become a serious concern that mostly yields to postponing the intention of having children just after marriage. For example, having a man in a relationship but never take a forward step until his savings reach to a couple of hundred thousands, this may last to up to 7 years. Despite being more immersed in work and practical life, youth are now frowning of taking a huge responsibility as marriage and bringing up children. Whilst these may not be positive reasons, a one crucial aspect is the delicate focus on how children are raised in order to supply them with proper mentality and spirit. For this specific purpose, I would greatly argue that the benefits of having children in older years exceeds its drawbacks.<NL>In conclusion, to have children and bring them up properly is not easy matter, so the society is tending, conversely with the past, to do so at the most suitable age, which happens to be an older one. Many reasons for such way of thinking including mainly getting stable humans, for that in my view point, I think the strengths of this decision overcomes its weaknesses.

task: Nowadays, more and more people decide to have <NL><NL><NL><NL>children later in their life. What are the reasons? Do the <NL><NL><NL><NL>advantages of this outweigh disadvantages?
essay: In recent years, a noticeable shift in family planning has emerged and many people prefer to have children at their later stage in life. Several reasons are responsible for this, and I believe that it has more consequences. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Firstly, couples want to spend quality time together before having their first child. This is because they can enjoy their life with each other, and be able to know one another. In this way, mutual understanding becomes stronger, and enjoy the time they spend with their young ones. For example, research studies have shown that couples who spend more time together understanding each other can later take good care of their babies and there is also less chance of divorce rate after having children birth.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Secondly, people choose to concentrate on their careers first and then have babies it is because they can take better care of their juveniles. Additionally, they think having children can escalate the expenditures and financial responsibilities of parents. Therefore, they achieve a stable financial position before starting the family as a result this can enable parents to give better education and lifestyle to their children. For instance, parents would be capable of enrolling their juveniles in schools where they get quality education and learn co-circular activities, which are not available in all schools.<NL><NL><NL><NL>However, the drawbacks can not be underestimated. The main problem caused by giving birth later is related to the fertility of both genders. After a certain age, sometimes their fertility rate starts decreasing, due to which they face difficulties in conceiving babies, and pregnant women require special care. To exemplify, studies show that children who are born in later years are often born with some abnormalities, either in terms of physical or mental. Thus, they face problems to survive in this world.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, although there are various merits of giving birth to a baby, a single disadvantage is more dangerous for both mother and child as they are sometimes prone to death.

task: Nowadays, more and more people decide to have children later in their life. What do you think are the reasons for this? Do the advantages of this trend outweigh the disadvantages?
essay: Modern days with the shift of lifestyle and priorities, many prefer to have children at a later age. It is uncommon to see women give birth at the age of 18, usually is after 30 years old. Studies has shown there are several factors contribute to this trend, from higher living standards, different life priorities, and parents choose to be more emotionally prepared. In this essay the factors will be discussed followed with my opinion on this.<NL><NL><NL><NL>As the world develops, living standards have become higher. Consequently, this increases living expense. In order to make sure children gets a decent tertiary education many parents start saving for their children education fund early. This, is only a tip of the ice berg as children will incur other expense such as food, medical, clothes, etc. Adding up all these, many modern young couples have family planning and priorities on reaching stable financial situation before having children. This is an inevitable impact as the economy grows and people try to make more money for a comfortable life.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Secondly, as society becomes more educated, both men and women spend longer time in formal education. By the time university students graduate, they are on average 25 years old. Some of the more ambitious ones will choose to focus on their personal goal or career accomplishment before settling down on forming a family. One thing leads to another, couples choose to get married late will eventually starting the parenthood journey late. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Another key factor on why people choose to have children late is they prefer to be more matured, emotionally and mentally before their children come along. This is because many view having children as a enormous task in life, it involves a lot of coaching to the young ones and setting their future path correctly. Hence, they prefer to take longer time for preparation.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In summary, there are benefits as well as downsides of having children late. In my opinion, it brings more advantageous as it allows parents to be better prepared in terms of financial and emotional stability. It benefits both the parents and children.

task: Nowadays, more and more people decide to have children later in their life. What are the reasons? Do the advantages of this outweigh disadvantages?
essay: In the contemporary era, most  couples want a baby later in their life. Although it has some flaws, I personally perceive that people not only give preference to make their career first but also want to spend time with each other are the main positive reasons which far surpasses its negatives.<NL><NL><NL><NL>First and foremost, the underlying point associated with the trend of children later in life is that couples give importance to their careers. This is because, partners perceive that settling down first by achieving their goals within deadlines, makes them successful person. After that, they provide a much better life for their future children due to they want a child  later in their life. For example," The Times" published in 2020, mostly all famous personalities follow this trend and have babies later, this also helps their children to live a luxurious life.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Moving on, another worth mentioning favouring attribute is that newly married should have to spend time with each other. To be more specific, new couples try to understand each other by spending quality time together. So that they never face any struggle or misunderstanding in the upcoming future on serious topics. To epitomise, Tim Cooper, from Sheffield Hallam University in the UK, researched and concluded that understanding between couples helps in the growth of children rather than creating issues in front of children.<NL><NL><NL><NL>However, on the contrary, the attributed drawback related to this sometimes twosome have to face consequences for having babies because age affects ,ancestors is said that having a child before 30 years old is best. Despite couples do not have much knowledge, so newly born suffer from myriad issues, so having babies after their 30s is not an issue according to doctors.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, children at a later stage are a favourable concept. All the few want earlier, I tend to recommend that after making a successful career. Besides, this mutual understanding between couples plays a vital role for babies later in life. From my perspective, I am certain that its advantages outstrip its disadvantages.

task: Nowadays, more and more people decide to have children later in their life. What are the reasons? Do advantages of this outweigh disadvantages?
essay: In the present age, the major section of  society has a mindset to conceive a baby after entering  the thirties. People believe that they should first focus on their career and after being successful, they will plan regarding family life. In the following paragraphs, I will discuss  the possible reasons for this thinking and further, I will give valid points as to why having children later in life could possibly lead to disadvantages.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with, the root cause for this mindset is that nowadays, society has money minds and they want to earn a handsome amount of money in the initial stage of their career. For the purpose of earning money, young couples avoid conceiving, because they think that with kids, they will not be able to target  their careers. Furthermore, the young generation like to do social interactive activities by having parties  and going on vacation with friends and they like to enjoy their life like a free bird. But, our generation believes that after having a child, life will not be the same. So, that's why couples avoid having kids at the early stage of marriage. For instance, after a child, you cannot go to late-night parties and you cannot leave him alone at home. So, after having offspring, your whole day revolves around them and you cannot spare time for yourself and it is a valid reason by people do not want to conceive early.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Though  people want to have kids later, there are certain drawbacks to choosing this path. Firstly, after a certain age, the count of sperm decreases and similarly females also start facing hormonal issues due to which sometimes it becomes impossible to give birth to a baby naturally. The second drawback is that when  individual plans to have offspring at a later stage, in this case, the age gap between parents and children increases. Due to this, there is a generation gap among both  generations which leads to clashes between children and parents. <NL><NL><NL><NL>So, in the end, I would like to conclude that though a career also matters in the individual's life  at the same time, he should also focus on family growth and try to maintain a balance between both roles.

task: Nowadays, more and more people decide to have children later in their life. What are the reasons? Do the advantages of this outweigh disadvantages?
essay: In my opinion, the given statement stands partially true. Many of the married members of any family, prefer to have children at their early ages. Over the period, the decisions are changed. There could be many reasons for taking such decisions. For example, the raise in the cost of living. Due to increased prices of all the basic needs, people are finding it difficult in raising them, providing them the basic education, and taking care of them.<NL><NL><NL><NL>I believe this is the major reason behind taking such decision. Talking about the advantages and disadvantages, there is a wide scope for advantages being outweighed.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Planning for children after certain period of time, from the marriage day, it gives the couple/family a lot of time, to think about the future. Also in laying a path for their (children) lives. Parents will be able to plan according to their financial status, balancing the requirements. It given an advantage of planning their education, the best institution to chose, and also a strong support with some savings made.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Talking about the disadvantages of having children at early age, it becomes a big challenge in taking up such big responsibility. One should become more stabalized in terms of finance, and ready to spend a lot on education and other expenses.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Being a family of 5 members, with 2 siblings, I really found it very difficult for my parents in rising us. Since, they were not financially stable, and they had to make many debts for providing us all the basic needs like clothes, shelter (rented house), education fee, etc. It took them almost 20 years for them to clear all those debts. Hence I believe, and advice to the point of having children at right time, when couple are really ready to take the responsibility.

task: Many students find it difficult to focus or pay attention at school nowadays.<NL><NL><NL><NL>What are the reasons for this?<NL><NL><NL><NL>What can be done to solve this problem?
essay: Recently, it has become notoriously difficult for students to focus on their lessons. In my opinion, this is a partly natural phenomenon that has been exacerbated by technology and the solutions lie in strict restriction and supervision.<NL><NL><NL><NL>The cause of a lack of concentration at school is both the pervasiveness of technology and human nature. Firstly, people have always struggled to focus. Very few pupils enjoy concentrating on tedious lessons and completing endless assignments at the department. However, this has become worse as corporations exploit fundamental human characteristics. Research has shown that the number of hours one spends on a laptop, smartphone, or tablet has a direct correlation with a shorter attention span. The reason for this is that technology supplies passive, immediate gratification. Therefore, schoolkids cannot focus because of a combination of human susceptibility and predatory consumer electronics companies.<NL><NL><NL><NL>The most feasible solutions are for parents and schools to monitor students strictly. This begins with parents. They must either approve or purchase a child their first smartphone or tablet and manage their early interactions with technology. Many parents consciously gift young children these devices to help them learn how to use technology and aid their cognitive development. By waiting until later in life to approve a smartphone or limiting daily screen time, this issue can be greatly mitigated from the onset. Schools also have a role to play as they must enforce strict rules banning the use of smartphones at institutions. For example, in many Asian countries, students' phones are confiscated if they are found using them during classes.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, a lack of focus at school is driven by human nature and modern technology, accordingly, parents and schools must work together to curb the worst excesses. Government regulation would also help but should not be expected.

task: Many students find it difficult to focus or pay attention at school nowadays. What are the reasons for this? What can be done to solve this problem?
essay: Concentrating on lessons is one of the most common problems for a lot of pupils at schools. There are some reasons  why is this happening and also the solutions for them which will be discussed in this essay. <NL><NL><NL><NL>  The first reason for the absence of concentration are subjects that are taught in a monotonous way. In such case, kids get distracted by other things they bring to school from home. For instance, in our era of technology, even elementary school students have a phone or tablet where there are numerous apps and games. As a result, a child pulls the phone out of his pocket as soon as the lesson gets boring. The solution is for the teacher to engage students in different interactives to better grasp the topics. This method will decrease children’s interest in participating in discussion and hols their attention. <NL><NL><NL><NL>  Another reason is a teacher’s approach to everyone. Situations, when no attention is paid to some students, occur frequently and as a result, a kid starts doing anything but not listening to the pedagogue. However, if some kids can tell their parents about that type of accident, there are some who does not. Moreover, somebody can even believe it is normal behaviour for a teacher. For instance, some teachers can offend students because they do not meet the standards they imagine in their heads. To tackle this issue, the entire teaching staff ought to attend psychologist sessions before starting to work with children. <NL><NL><NL><NL>  In conclusion, both problems can be solved if the efforts are made, especially when a person likes the job and is ready to do anything to involve pupils in the process of education.

task: Many people use social media on regular basis in order to keep in touch with the news and with other people.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Do you think that the advantages of this development outweigh the disadvantages?
essay: In contemporary society, social media has consistently been a topic of interest among the masses. The statement that many individuals prefer to choose social media as a tool to communicate with others and read the newest released news presents a viewpoint that is both thought-provoking and debatable. Despite recognizing the merits and drawbacks behind this viewpoint, I am inclined to believe it has more disadvantages, as I believe social media leads to  serious mental health trouble and increases misleading information in society.<NL><NL><NL><NL>It is clear that social media, such as Instagram and Youtube, are platforms with a 24/7, non-stop cycle of news reports and numerous fack and true information just continuously appears on one's pages. The algorithm behind  social media makes people hard to identify which information could be trusted. Furthermore, the news on social media sometimes is full of prejudices and negative emotions, if individuals are not clever enough, it is easy to be misled. It is therefore reasonable that if a person uses social media as the only resource to obtain knowledge is dangerous.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Moreover, the aforementioned perspective does not emphasise the main problems which stem from social media - depression, lack of essential interpersonal communication skills and body shame. Those problems are not only struggling teenagers but also  adults. For example, the texting culture makes people capable of writing reasonable sentences on the internet but afraid of talking in front of others. I believe this is the crucial reason  why so many people suffer from the loneliness epidemic. Such instances support my viewpoint and suggest that addiction to social media leads to mental health and social problems.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, given the consideration that social media causes numerous mental issues, lets people leak communication skills, and continuously spreads pessimistic information, my allegiance that using social media as the basic platform to read the latest news and text with others has more drawbacks is steadfastly consolidated and controvertibly firm.

task: Nowadays people use social media to keep in touch with others and be aware of news Do the advantages of this outweigh the disadvantages
essay: In the digital live that we live in. social networking has revolucioned the way we comunicate and connect.<NL><NL><NL><NL>These platforms have successfully linked people from all over the world, breaking geographic and cultural barriers.<NL><NL><NL><NL>However, they have also raised questions about the role of love in this virtual enviroment. it is possible to find and experince love through social networking, or is it merely a fleeting illusion?<NL><NL><NL><NL>Firstly it is undeniable that social networking has provied new opportunities for love and relationships but also this relationship nor always work good. Through this plataform people can stablish 'connections' with individuals they would have ever otherwise met. this has oppend doors to intercultural relationships and a diversity of love expirence. Additionally, exesice rellance on social networking can result in a decline in interpersonal communication skills. Virtual relations can limit the ability to read people's emotions and gesture, making it difficult to stablish an empathetic and profound connection.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In summary, Love in social networking is a complex phenomenon that presents both opportunities and challenges, while these plataforms can provide a space to meet new people and stablish connections. it is important to remember that true love reavires genuine human interaction, based on empathy, respec and effective comunication. Social networking can complement our love lives, but it cannot replace the genuine expirence and emotion that rise from face to face interactions. Untimately, finding a balance between the virtual world and real world is vital to cultivate automatic and meaningful romantic relationships.

task: 17 Many people use social media every day to get in touch with other people and obtain the news. Do you think the advantages of this way outweigh the disadvantages? (MEDIA)
essay: It is said that there are numerous platforms available for social networks to update themselves with the happenings around the world.  In my opinion, they should use social websites to connect with the communities around them. In this essay, I will hand down several benefits of using social applications followed by their disadvantages. <NL><NL><NL><NL>   On the one hand, the main issue with the advantage of using social sites is eliminating the barriers to communication between people caused due to distance. Also, introverts using social networks to link with each other is one of the values that help them in many ways. Moreover, individuals can update themselves with the latest news that has been trending in the world. For instance, there are a lot of applications that help connect people with similar interests and provide different various skill sets used across life today. <NL><NL><NL><NL>   On the other hand, overuse of social media platforms can lead to the waste of valuable time, which could be used more effectively at work. Furthermore, it has become increasingly common for people to live a life of technological development; therefore the cybercrime rate has increased significantly in the past few years. For example, recently, some people were robbed by  fake profiles on the internet. There is no doubt that criminals of online theft of personal information are becoming more and more serious consequently these platforms need to be verified to avoid the loss or theft of personal information online.<NL><NL><NL><NL>   In the nutshell, if used carefully, social media can help find things suitable for each person. By contrast, it can lead to a severe loss of time and maybe money with irrational use.

task: Some people use social media to keep in touch with other people and news events. Do you think advantage of technology outweigh the disadvantages
essay: A Small  number of  the public utilise online websites such as facebook to have conversation with friends and some others use the Internet to know more about current announcements. This essay is going to explain how technology benefits us by providing breaking news around the world in seconds at any location, and also how social media fills the gap in long distance relatives.<NL><NL><NL><NL>People are now in a technological period where distance does not matter for sending digital information such as photos and  videos. Real time broadcasting is helping countries to reach almost all nations in the world if they want to provide urgent messages. Apps like whatsapp are now a basic need for any smartphone user, through which connecting to other people from any place is now simple. Also services like youtube helps to conway story on their live channels.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Although advancement has brought changes in daily life, this comes with cost. The main problem of technology is there is no one to control things happening on the internet, since tracking of information such as age, location, education and interest of individuals are now done by new generations phones and cookies on websites customers visit. The spread of fake news is now a  major concern as it can harm not only the victim of it but the entire circle of his or her friends. <NL><NL><NL><NL>By considering this information, although the Internet can sometimes be harmful, use of this modernization can provide a better standard of living for humans. Easy connectivity can save lot of time and energy and thus advantages of technology are considerably more.

task: Nowadays people use social media to keep in touch with others and be aware of news.<NL><NL>Do the advantages of this outweigh the disadvantages ?
essay: Nowadays, there are numerous platforms available for social networking and to update themselves with the happenings around the world. In my opinion, they should use social sites to connect with different communities around them, but with caution. Further in my essay, I will pen down a few benefits of using social applications, followed by their disadvantages.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with, the primary advantage of using social media is eliminating the communication barrier caused due to distance. Moreover, one can update himself with the latest news that has been trending around the world. Also, getting to know different people globally proves beneficial in exchanging knowledge and different thought process, which assists in widening the perspective. For instance, one of the employment-oriented online services helps connect people with similar interests and gives an insight into various skillsets used across the firms. This can bring like-minded groups closer.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the contrary, the over abuse of social platforms can lead to loss of valuable time, which otherwise could have been used for productive work. Furthermore, lately, the cybercrime rate has increased tremendously in the past few years. For example, recently, a woman was robbed by a fake profile who claimed to be a bank official. Since the practice of such platforms does not come with identity verification, which means there are high chances of confronting fake profiles.<NL><NL><NL><NL>I believe that the advantages of using social media are more than its disadvantages because it helps exchange knowledge, and the only downside is its uncautious use.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, if used cautiously, social media can help find like-minded people. Conversely, it can lead to a severe loss of time and money with continuous irrational use.

task: Some people believe that watching television is bad for children. Other people believe that watching television is educational for children. Which opinion do you agree with and why? Give specific details and examples in your answer.
essay: Regarding we are in the centure of development and modernization, everything ride on technology. Therefore, nowadays there are different thoughts about children's watching TV. Despite it has some harmful sides, I mostly agree with that televison is educational for children.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On one hand, watching television regularly causing them to spend most of their time staring at one point in front of the television. Due to they are sitting at one place all day, they may become lazy as that kind of children prefer watching televison or playing online games rather than playing outside with their friends. This can affect their communicativity which may apart them from  their peers.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, television offers a plethora of educational programs that stimulate children's curiosity and enhance their learning experience. Channels dedicated to science, history, and nature provide engaging content, fostering a love for knowledge. Additionally, televison introduces children to diverse cultures, promoting a global perspective. Through documentaries, travel shows, and international programming, children gain insight into the rich tapestry of the world. Well-crafted children's programs encourage creativity and imaginative thinking. Animated shows and series with positive themes contribute to the development of a child's storytelling abilities and problem-solving skills.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, television for children is a double-edged sword, offering educational enrichment while posing potential risks. By conscientiously managing screen time and content, parents can harness the positive aspects of television, ensuring a healthy and constructive viewing experience for their children.

task: Some people think watching television is bad for children in every way other belive it is good for devolping children as they grow up discuss both views and give your own opinion
essay: There are controversial debates about whether spending time watching television is suitable for kids or not. Some believe watching tv programs aids in shaping a minor's developmental process as he/she ages, while the other group assumes it's not effective and the cons side is heavier than the pros.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, It is believed that offspring who watch TV programs, tend to be more obese than others when they grow up. This is due to their habit formation during childhood, Sitting in front of an LCD and not having physical activity. Another reason which made these groups of people against TV  is that there are fewer age-limited animations and movies for kids nowadays, Which could lead to early puberty in those kids. Moreover, Juniors who are constantly watching TV while being too close to the screen, is proven to have eyesight problem in teen ages.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, Advocates of the discussed theory, which is my own opinion on the subject, believe that all mentioned effects of watching TV, could be prevented by parents, if there is controlled and limited time during the day when a kid is allowed to watch their favourite cartoon. It's not only safe and enjoyable for the kid, But also prompt their mental and social skills growth, by being familiar with social greetings and different culture and it will help to shape a personality feature named "acceptance". Hence, adding physical activity during the day  could prevent obesity. Furthermore, children who grow up watching TV can perform social interactions more easily, during a process called "modelling". It is obtained through ages of observation of educational programs on TV.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, there are different rationales among parents on TV watching habits in children. While it could prompt the modelling and acceptance of mental processes and behaviours, it couldCorrespondingly cause eye-related conditions in the long term and it is up to parents to choose between options.

task: Some people believe that what children watch on television influences their behavior. Others say that amount of time spent watching television influences their behavior. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay: People have differing views about the impact of watching TV on children’s behavior. Although watching television can bring certain benefits for our kids, I suppose the disadvantages should not be ignored and this essay will analyze the reasons.<NL><NL><NL><NL>First of all, there are a variety of programs on television, but not all of them are suitable for children. Children tend to mimic what they see on the TV and without parental guidance, they will accidentally watch shows that are inappropriate for them. This will cause the kid to misjudge the information from the shows, they cannot distinguish right from wrong. For instance, when a TV show is broadcasting the violence content, children who saw it will think that action is allowed and they might imitate it. Thus, this could influence a child's behavior and in the worst case scenario, it becomes a start of future crime.  <NL><NL><NL><NL>   Secondly, we cannot discount the effect that screen time has on children, particularly on the physical level. If children are exposed to a TV screen for an excessive amount of time, it will affect their eyesight problems and makes children’s bodies weak due to a lack of physical activities and leads children to a sedentary lifestyle. Not to mention, they can be at risk of certain diseases such as obesity. Additionally, the amount of time letting children watch TV can also negatively affect family relationships. When parents are too busy and their kids are getting noisy and impatient, they tend to use TV as a distraction. As a result, children are lacking in paying attention to everything. The analytical report has defined, when kids are watching a long period of television, it will affect their behavior.<NL><NL><NL><NL>   In conclusion, the behavior of the children will be affected by both type and duration of time of watching television. Therefore, parents should take responsibility for the selection of TV programs and watching time management.

task: Task Some people believe that what children watch on television influences their behaviour. Others say that amount of time spent watching television influences their behaviour. Discuss both views and give own opinion
essay: In this modern times, watching television has become increasingly popular among kids.It is often argued that children's behaviour was effecting by the stuff which they usually watch on tv, whilst others disagree and reckon that it is the amount of time which they spent in front of television.This essay intends to analyse both perspectives.however,I am with the latter view.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with, there is a number of arguments given by those who advocate that kids are influencing by watching tv. today there are a vast number of cartoons and animation available on tv ,which attracts a lot of teenagers . Although these shows and stuff are not real , it still can be able to affect children's behaviour.since they publish various sort of violent scenes such as murder, robbery.,which directly or indirectly impacting kids lifestyle.For example,  recent research of university of manitoba shows that about 80% of teenagers learning different soft of bad stuff by watching tv shows.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand ,it is also noticeable fact that in today's generation children's watch tv whole day they can live without food but they will not able to spent a day without watching the television.Since many interesting and modern shows and animation available right now .so kids are highly attached with those .For instance, research indicates that around 70%of kids spent their maximum amount of time  watching the television.Therefore,it can be say that this is the main reason why tv affecting teenagers behaviour.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion,I would say different people can have different opinions on this issue as far as I am concerned I believe parents should allocate a specific time for kids to watch the television.

task: Some people believe that watching television is bad for children. Other people believe that watching television is educational for children. Which opinion do you agree with and why? Give specific details and examples in your answer
essay: People have different views about whether watching television is educational or harmful for children. While there are some downsides to watching TV for children, I believe that children can learn a plethora of things by watching the right content on the television.<NL><NL>On the one hand, watching TV in excess can have detrimental effects on children. Firstly, watching television for long hours can make children physically feeble and it may affect their eyesight. Secondly, in today’s jet set age most of the families are nuclear and both of the parents are working, so it is possible for the children to get exposed to harmful / inappropriate content. For instance, there is adult content in every movie and sitcom nowadays and also film stars are seen drinking alcohol and doing drugs on television. This could have a detrimental effect on children.<NL><NL>On the other hand, watching TV can be beneficial for learning new things for the children, if they are allowed to watch for limited time and under the supervision of elders. I believe there are numerous channels such as Discovery, National Geographic and Animal Planet which telecast programmes that are educational and thus enhance a child’s cognitive skills. These types of channels broadcast episodes related to science in daily life, flora and fauna, and biodiversity. Children can learn a lot about nature by watching these on the television.<NL><NL>In conclusion, watching TV in excess can be detrimental for children, but I believe that it could be educational if seen if watched for a short amount of time under parental supervision.

task: More and more people are becoming seriously overweight. Some people think a solution can be to increase the price of fattening foods. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: In this day and age, gaining weight is a global problem. The increasing number of residents are becoming victims of obesity. Some people argue that to solve this situation, it is necessary to go up the expenditure of food which is high in fat. It seems to me that, being overweight is not only by food but also due to human habits. I will shed light on my opinion in the following essay.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, there is no denying that pricing fattening foods at a higher cost can demonstrate some effectiveness in reducing the risk of obesity. Firstly, when unhealthy food items become more expensive, people are more likely to reconsider their choices and seek out more nutritious options. For instance, if a bottle of sugary water costs more than a bottle of water, people will choose the latter, thereby reducing their calorie intake. Secondly, this price growth will motivate individuals to reduce the frequency and quantity of purchases, reducing overall consumption and thereby the likelihood of obesity.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, other measures with far-reaching impacts should be given greater consideration. Nowadays, a large number of people are leading a sedentary lifestyle which is considered as one of the major reasons for obesity. Therefore, physical exercise plays a vital role in maintaining a healthy body. Besides, participating in counseling sessions with nutrition experts can provide valuable insights into a healthy and balanced diet. For example, by gradually transitioning from fat-heavy to more nourishing food options, individuals can make better-informed choices for their daily diet, leading to a significant decrease in obesity rates over the long run.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, it can be argued that while the rise in fattening food prices can be a viable solution to a certain extent, other measures still need to be taken to comprehensively reduce this obesity circumstance

task: Some people think news has no connection to people’s lives, so then it is a waste of time to read the news in the newspaper and watch television news programs. <NL><NL><NL><NL>To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: News from newspapers and TV is really important in our lives. A section of society thinks news does not matter and is a waste of time. While the news is super useful for staying informed, using it the wrong way can have some bad results. The upcoming article will delve into my ideology before making a conclusive stance.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with, news is a vital tool for making people aware and teaching them important things. In other words, news outlets all around the world played a big role in sharing knowledge about the virus, like its symptoms, ways to stay safe, and how vaccines work. For instance, during the COVID-19 pandemic, news was the best way to learn about how the virus was spreading. This information directly influenced how the public acted, making them follow safety rules, get vaccinated, and help fight the virus together. Hence, the news is a crucial way to stay updated about uncertain events worldwide.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Nevertheless, there are some problems with news when it comes to spreading false information. Put differently, news channels might share material that is not true or is made up. They are often in a hurry to be the first ones to tell a story, and that can mean they do not check if the information is right. Also, these platforms can make it so that the public only sees and hears stories and ideas that agree with what they already believe. This can make society more split and stop people from having good conversations. Thus, the spread of false news can lead to confusion, mistrust, and harm to individuals and society.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, having engaged in the subject matter, I agree that news is super important for keeping up with what is happening around us. However, we should remember that using it the wrong way can mess up the facts. Therefore, it is imperative to be careful when reading news online and check it from different places to avoid these problems.
