task: In some cities, people are choosing cars instead of bicycles, while in other cities riding bikes is replacing cars. Why is this the case? Which development do you think is better?
essay: In this present world, people are choosing the suitable transportation tools for them according to specific factors related to their condition. Even if these tools are vehicles or bicycles it does not matter, the financial burden is the master key. I believe that riding bicycles is of paramount importance if it comes to environmental issues and green earth as a future plan.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Firstly, a large sector of people asserts that the economic factor is the main parameter for their transportation when it comes to their selection between cars and bikes. For instance, there are enormous percentages of people using bicycles, especially in developing countries. Moreover, the escalated price of private cars and even gasoline because of world inflation makes the other solution valuable. Hence, it is proven that economic and financial incomes are the main determinants of our lifestyle.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Furthermore, the universal direction toward the environment is to go green. For example, the World Organization for Health conducted a study reveals that earth pollution is accelerated by the usage of petroleum products in transportation. In other words, cars and vehicles have a lot of deleterious carbon emissions which affect the world's sustainability if compared to other machines. Therefore, it is clear that the green world is a direct result of natural resources being used for transportation.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, after this essay has manifested the points mentioned above, it can be said that the financial case does not only has a myriad effects on our lifestyles but even also our travelling tools. I believe that riding bicycles is of paramount importance to keep our lives healthy and sustainable.

task: Historical objects should be brought back to their country of origin. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Many contend that historical assets should be returned to the country they originated from. While I partially concur with this opinion, it should not be a universal rule.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Proponents of the return of these relics point to their historical importance. This can be explained through the hypothetical scenario of Japan discovering a diary written by Ho Chi Minh during his stay there on his journey to seek national salvation. As the Japanese are generally unfamiliar with this historical figure, the diary possesses minimal relevance to them and limited commercial value for local public display institutions. It naturally should be repatriated to Vietnam, where Ho Chi Minh is revered as their greatest leader. Vietnamese historians would gain valuable insights into his revolutionary journey through the diary, and the museum exhibiting it would attract more visitors eager to witness his handwriting and explore the accompanying narratives.<NL><NL><NL><NL>However, there are also historical objects that do not require repatriation. For example, after the Vietnam War, the United States withdrew the majority of its military weaponry, a part of which would already suffice for reutilization for exhibition and other purposes. It is therefore unnecessary to reclaim the American tanks currently on display at the War Remnants Museum in Ho Chi Minh City. These foreign exhibits have long been the essence of the museum, drawing numerous visitors, enabling them to experience the war more authentically, and inspiring them to learn history. This, coupled with the substantial costs concerning specialized approaches to transporting such large, rusted vehicles to the United States, justifies their retention in Vietnam.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, origin should not be the sole driver of historical artifact repatriation. Other factors, such as delivery expenses and the specific needs and interests of each country involved, should also be taken into account.

task: Historical objects should be brought back to their country of origin. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Historical objects are precious items that carry immense cultural and historical significance. They offer valuable glimpses into the past and act as tangible connections to our ancestry and heritage. According to a belief, it is crucial to repatriate these valuable treasures and preserve them in their original homeland. In this essay, I will elaborate on my strong agreement with this notion and shed light on my support for this subject.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Primarily, artefacts carry significant historical and cultural value for the people of a nation. For instance, the Koh-I-Noor diamond, once part of India's rich heritage, is now housed in the United Kingdom's Crown Jewels collection. Returning the Koh-I-Noor to India would be a meaningful gesture, as it holds deep cultural and historical importance for the Indian people. Consequently, it would allow them to reconnect with their past and preserve a piece of their heritage for future generations.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Furthermore, repatriating historical objects can play a crucial role in strengthening the nation's identity and pride. For example, The Sultan Ganj Buddha, an ancient bronze statue discovered in Bihar, is currently displayed in the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery in the United Kingdom. Returning the Sultan Ganj Buddha to India would be an opportunity to celebrate and appreciate Indian history and spirituality. Hence, having artefacts back in their original context could help  people develop a deeper understanding of their culture and traditions.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, having engaged in the subject matter, while displaying the artefacts in foreign museums may offer educational benefits to people worldwide, we should consider the special significance of these objects to the people of their nation. Therefore, I strongly support the idea that historical objects should be bought back to their country of origin as it can help preserve the rich heritage and foster a stronger sense of national identity and pride.

task: More and more people are seriously overweight. some people suggest the solution to this problem is to increase the prise of fastening foods. To what extent do you agree or disagree
essay: It cannot be denied that today more and more people are seriously overweight. Some people suggest the solution to this problem is to increase the costs of  fattening foods. I definitely disagree with this statement. <NL><NL><NL><NL>I think that increasing the price of  fattening foods is not the solution to this issue. From the way  I think, the solution to this problem is organizing a lot of sports centres and other places where people can do physical activities. Because there are many villages in our country that do not  have sports centres.  Another solution would be attracting people to a diet that is useful for our health. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Although there are valid arguments to the contrary, I will argue that stout people  are in need of art. For instance, in film, we must see them. The film is not nice without them. However, being overweight can cause serious illnesses. For this reason, people should avoid it. Being thin can cause serious diseases too. So I can say that increasing the price of  fattening foods is not a solution.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Some people outweigh others because of illness. Nevertheless,they want to eat that food.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Way of my conclusion, I reiterate my position that  increasing the costs of fattening foods is not the solution to this issue. However, I am concerned that the steps mentioned above would be helpful. This is such a complex problem that I do not believe any other solution will be found in the near future. From my perspective, one of the most important methods to resolve this problem is increasing sports centres in many parts of the country.

In my perspective, I compeletly agree with this settling and reckon that enlarging fatty diet cost will be a perfect completion.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Firstly, the huge amount of fast-food restaurants that sell their product with affordable price so that people more interested to buy their dishes. task: some people think that newspapers are the best way to get news. However, others believe that they can get news better through other media platforms. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: In recent years, science and technology are  constantly developing, the media is no exception. Therefore, some people think that newspapers are the best way to get news. However, others believe that they can get news better through other media platforms. Personally, I agree with both of view and give the reason below. <NL><NL><NL><NL>First and for most, newspapers are suitable for most senior citizens. Because they have a habit of reading a newspaper every day. And it is difficult for them to change a habit. Moreover, newspapers are a more reliable source of information than those of media platforms. Newspapers are written by professional journalists and they have to be checked, edited carefully before the reaching the reading public. <NL><NL><NL><NL>However, media platforms is also the convenient way to approach to the new information. With the widespread of the internet, readers can receive the information faster. They only have portable devices such as smartphones, laptops and so on. It is easy to access a huge storage of news in just a few clicks. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, both newspapers or media platforms have not only advantaged sides but also disadvantaged sides. Newspapers are very popular, but that is not the best way to get access to source of information. Furthermore, online news attract people to read, thanks to the constant advancement in technology

task: Young people are often influenced in their behaviours and situations by others in the same age. This is called “peer pressure”. Do the disadvantages of peer pressure outweigh the advantages?
essay: It is quite common these days that the young are much influenced by peer pressure. It is my belief that the positive effects of this phenomenon could certainly offset its disadvantages. <NL><NL><NL><NL>There are several drawbacks to peer pressure. A common reason is that young people’s mentality is negatively affected, which can lead to worry or depression. In fact, working or studying with better students can make young people uncomfortable. For example, when I study in a class with a lot of classmates who learn much better than me, I feel very pressured and ashamed. Another negative aspect can be that the youth often feel uncomfortable with their appearance. This means that if peers just pay attention too much attention to appearance and make judgments, young people can feel uneasy and try to be as  fashionable as possible, which can be very costly.<NL><NL><NL><NL>However, in spite of these negative effects, peer pressure can bring about important benefits. One obvious advantage is that young people have opportunities and environments to develop themselves better. In fact, if young people are surrounded by good people, they can learn from them such as trying anything new or discovering new ideas to help them overcome some difficult problems. For example, my colleagues in my brother’s company work productively and solve problems quickly; therefore, my brother day by day works more effectively and productively, and he has just been promoted to manager. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, it’s common that young people are often influenced in their behaviours and situations by peers. While this can make them sometimes stressed, there can be a lot of benefits in helping young people to have  motivation to grow and succeed.

task: Some people think that employers should not care about the way their employees dress, because what matters is the quality of their work.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?
essay: There is an opinion that employers should not overly concern themselves with what their employees wear, as their quality of work should be the primary focus. I wholeheartedly agree with this viewpoint, and this essay will elaborate on my reasons.<NL><NL><NL><NL>The major consideration for employers should indeed be the quality of their employees' work. When employers prioritize work performance over dress code, they create an environment where employees can focus on their tasks without unnecessary distractions. For example, in the tech industry, companies like Apple have adopted a more relaxed dress code, allowing employees to wear casual attire. This approach has contributed to a culture of innovation, where employees feel comfortable and empowered to generate groundbreaking ideas. By emphasizing work quality over attire, companies like Apple have demonstrated that allowing employees to dress comfortably can lead to enhanced creativity and productivity.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Furthermore, an excessive focus on dress codes can negatively impact inclusivity and diversity within the workplace. When employers impose strict dress codes, they may inadvertently exclude employees from various cultural backgrounds who have unique clothing preferences or requirements. For example, in multinational corporations with employees from diverse cultures, mandating a Western dress code might alienate those who prefer traditional attire. Embracing a more flexible dress code policy fosters an inclusive environment where employees from different cultural backgrounds feel respected and valued, contributing to a more harmonious and diverse workplace.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, employers should place their main focus on the quality of their employees' work rather than micromanaging their attire. As exemplified by companies like Apple and multinational corporations, this approach not only enhances work performance but also fosters an inclusive and diverse working environment.

task: Some people think that employers should not care about the way their employees dress, because what matters is the quality of their work. To what extent do you agree or disagree
essay: In this modern workplace, the trend of dress codes is changing as employers focus more on results than rules that employees must follow. Although I agree that people should dress formally in some professional settings, there is no one-size-fits-all answer for every industry.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, professional attire plays a key role in certain professions, such as the hospitality industry, and healthcare sectors, to name but a few, which is considered a must for many jobs. For example, clients are able to recognize waiters or waitresses at a hotel by clothing, thus facilitating work procedures and saving time and effort. The uniform is also a norm among soldiers and police officers, which can not only make them easily identified but signalize the image of authority and trustworthiness. Furthermore, formal wear is usually required on some occasions to show our respect and professionalism to others. For instance, interviewees should put on office attire in the meeting, thereby impressing interviewers with professional attitudes. <NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, the uniform may deprive us of creativity and the pursuit of freedom, which should not be de rigueur in all contexts. It is par for the course for employees working in high-tech companies to wear casually. After all, they do not need to serve customers face-to-face or present seriousness to others. More importantly, dress codes should not steal the show in the workplace, instead, they must place high emphasis on the work results. Furthermore, with the increasing number of people working at home and becoming self-employed, it is unnecessary to regulate subordinates what to wear at work. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, while business clothes should not reign supreme in all businesses, it is still the order of the day in many professions according to professional settings and requirements.

task: Newspapers have a significant influence on people’s ideas and opinions. Why is this happening? is it a positive or negative situation?
essay: Nowadays, it has been noticed that the impact of Printed press is more influential upon shaping up the thinking process of every individual’s attitude. Readers’ are having a firm believe upon it and they store it in their memory to further spread it. The reason is early ages when internet wasn’t invented but, there was an authentic source of newspaper that helped to enlighten people regarding the current situation of that era, which ultimately led people act proactively. For example, in 1947, during the partition of Indo –Pak the newspapers were the only source on which people believed and took preventive measures, before the chaos happened. For instance, during the Covid -19 several people lost their jobs and there was printed media helped people to get aware about the current job openings. Therefore, Broadsheets provides a wholesome information about the current situation.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, newspapers have had positive effects on people's judgement and belief and at the same time, it has created job opportunities and enlightened the public.

task: Young people are often influenced in their behaviours and situations by others in the same age. This is called “peer pressure”. Do the disadvantages of peer pressure outweigh the advantages?
essay: It is true that peer pressure has been a phenomenon, defining the influence of young people on their friends of the same age. In my view, its disadvantages do not outweigh the advantages. <NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with, peer pressure brings numerous disadvantages. One of the undeniable reasons is the career comparison among people, which became popular nowadays. The fact that some could become successful early and others may not due to the difference in their chosen majors; therefore, having a career compared is not a good idea that might get us uncomfortable. A good example of this is the rate of depression in the youth, some feel stressed out while being involved in comparing with others’ success. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In addition, young people could copy the bad habits of churlish friends such as smoking or drinking wine too much; from that, effecting negatively on their health. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Despite having limitations, peer pressure actually has some significant benefits, which would be a good friendship. It is true that everyone needs someone with whom to share  happiness and sorrows. Furthermore, young persons can learn vital skills such as leadership or good communication by encouraging each other. Therefore, it is a great way to help in sorting out difficulties in their life and develop their career together. This is particularly the case for the Nobel prize, many people working together to achieve the title is better than acting alone. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In short, I advocate that although peer pressure has both pros and cons, we should consider its advantages to live comfortably while eliminating any unnecessary limitations with no doubt.

task: Young people are often influenced in their behaviours and situations by others in the same age. This is called "peer pressure". Do the disadvantages of peer pressure outweigh the advantages.
essay: It is an undeniable truth that youngsters are encouraged by their friends, parents and teachers. task: In some countries, celebrities complain about the way the media publicizes their private lives. Some people say that they should accept it as part of their fame. Do you agree or disagree?
essay: It is inevitable for prominent people to have a lot of attention from the public. Therefore, some famous individuals make a complaint to the media in order to have their boundary. Some people insist that they have to admit this phenomenon as part of their fame. However, I strongly dissagree with this opinion. This is because famous people have a right to have private space in their life and they might be a victime by criminals. <NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with, emient people have a right to have their own space in their daily live. In fact, everyone needs their private room where they can be protected by externel factors including famous people. Having a boundary plays a pivotal role in people's live. When people's right are invaded by other elements, they might be able to have mental issues such as depression, anxitey and so on. To cite an example, some celebrities in South Korea struggle with thier mental problems since they do not have enough space for their schedule. They protest to media companies to stop posting their life in order to tackle this problems. Sometimes, they have medicines or conduct sessions to deal with their stress. Moreover, This situation might lead their fandoms to have a sense of worries and a lot of entertainment companies to lose their assests as a prominent people in our society. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In addition, celebrities might be able to become victims by awuful people. The number of criminals has been increasing nowadays, some people, called a stoker, cross the celebrities'private room. They are more likely to invade eminent people's daily live by following their schedules every single day and taking a majority of pictures. Sometimes, they even attack celebrities physically. For example, there was a serious crime in China. One of prominent actress, named Wan Wei was captured by a stoker. The criminal said that he was able to check her lives by watching media news all the time. This means that too much information about celebrities' life might cause deterimental situation for them such as stoking, captures and so on.   <NL><NL><NL><NL>To sum up, it is evident that some people reckon that they deserve to monitor celebrities' life because of their fame. However, I totally dissagree with it, since famous people have a right to have their boundary and might be targets by criminals.

task: Schools should focus on academic success and passing examinations. Skills such as cookery, dressmaking and woodwork should not be taught at school as it is better to learn these from family and friends. To that extent do you agree or disagree.
essay: It's argued that schools should pay more attention to students' academic success in exams instead of teaching cooking, sewing and crafting skills as they can be acquired from relatives and friends. This essay strongly disagrees with the opinion because these skills support a well-rounded education for all students and can contribute to a stable income in the future.<NL><NL><NL><NL>It's undeniable that culinary, sewing or wood-making classes make up a well-rounded education for students besides the traditional academic subjects. In the learning process of these skills, pupils can apply knowledge from other classes and take on numerous soft skills. For example, learning about culinary can help combine a myriad of information from biology into understanding how different food combinations affect our bodies, practice making meal plans and prepare healthy dishes on their own.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Another reason for my disagreement is that we're experiencing the rising number of unemployed people due to the Covid-19 pandemic and the global financial crisis. Therefore, students who are able to excel in numerous skills can help a student have more diverse career paths and ensure a continuous source of income without depending on a sole job. For instance, after being laid off in their 30s, a couple in China recently became an Internet sensation for utilizing their cooking skills to successfully change their positions from software developers to street food merchants. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, this essay strongly disagrees with the belief that schools should only focus on students' academic success instead of teaching them life skills such as cooking or crafting. The reason is that these subjects add up to a well-rounded education for the students and can ensure them a more stable income in the future.

task: Schools should focus on academic success and passing examinations. Skills such as cookery, dressmaking and woodwork should not be taught at school as it is better to learn these from family and friends. To that extent do you agree or disagree.
essay: There is the number of people who thinks that schools should focus only on  academic success and help students to pass their examination and skills like cookery, dressmaking and woodwork should not be taught in  schools. They state, that these skills can be developed by parents as well as by friends of that student. From my perspective, I strongly believe that this statement is correct, but I will be explaining both points of view with the support of some relevant examples.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To commence with, schools should focus mainly on the studies of the students. Providing them with better education,  is the main objective that the parents send their children to school. This helps them to get better remarks in the examinations, which help them to improve their academic background. In addition to this, students with  excellent academic records may receive  better job opportunities in future as compared to  other people. For  instance, there are many countries with parents who want their children to be a doctor or an engineer, instead of chefs or fashion designers. This kind of fields can only be achieved if the children focus more on their studies and examinations instead of some other activities. Even there are few guardians or parents who suggest that the school should provide sports activities instead of some extracurricular activities.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In contrast to this, students and their parents prefer that school should have some other skills aside from the subjects and examinations, such as cookery, dressmaking and woodwork. This helps them to develop their resume stronger and opens many industrial opportunities. Let's assume that the school have some other activities such as cookery, this will help the student to grow their foundation if he or she wants to be a chef.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To conclude, schools should provide some  other extracurricular activities but should not make them mandatory for every student to learn them. This will help students  achieve whatever goal they want to achieve.

task: Some people think that governments should change the way individuals live, while others believe they should choose the way themselves. Discuss these both points of view and give your opinion?
essay: Children from a rich family background do not deal well with the hardships in adult life in comparison with those who have a mediocre family background during their childhood days. I completely agree with this idea and opinion because the children from a poor family have good time management skill and also have a better emotional quotient in life.<NL><NL>Firstly,these children with less money tend to be happy with what they have at present and so do not expect a lot from their parents.Moreover, they do not live in a big house or a mansion with separate rooms but live in a small hut . Despite of these poor facilities they live happily with their family without complaining about them. For example, the children without a lot of money travel mostly by bicycle and public transports from their childhood, so they would not find it difficult to travel in their adult life compared to the wealthy children.<NL><NL>The next important reason for me to agree with this opinion is that they are better with time management and money management skills. These children help their parents to overcome the financial burden by doing  local errands for money which help them to manage time in adult life.For instance, perhaps during their childhood days they help their parents with the household work , after they are finished with school.Furthermore, middle class children tend to work part time in their neighbourhoods to help their family financially.<NL><NL>In conclusion , children with a middle class background have better management skills which are crucial for facing adult life.Unlike the children with wealthy parents , they have a better emotional stability to deal with the problems of adulthood.

task: Some people think that it is better for older schoolchildren to study a large number of subjects and develop a wide range of knowledge. Others argue that they should study a smaller number of subjects and focus on details. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: Over the past decade, by virtue of advanced living standards, the educational system has gained popularity in various countries, leading to a paradigm shift in the application of multiple subjects at schools. This, therefore, is believed to be beneficial for learners. Despite the many positive ramifications that may derive from the argument, this educating style is likely to be predominantly disadvantageous to students due to the rationales outlined below. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Admittedly, advocates of the statement that adolescent students should better learn a variety of subjects at schools may argue that this implementation not only offers learners many useful skills but also enables a foreseeable well-rounded individual. First, when attending to some intellectual subjects, namely chemistry or math, students are able to enhance their cognitive abilities. Some examples of this, particularly include the improvement of problem-solving skills like balancing chemical equations or addressing chemical reactions. Second, since a multi-subjects educating style is implemented, this necessitates a well-developed citizen. By studying many majors at schools, students might get a deeper insight into every aspect of life, leading to a complete understanding of their future.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Nevertheless, despite the feasible positive impacts above, focusing on some chosen subjects is still the optimal choice. First, favorite majors act as incentives for youngsters’ passion and motivation in learning. It should be remembered that once adolescents are encouraged to engage in the fields they are interested in, they will have opportunities to foster their talents and potential abilities themselves, therefore minimizing teachers’ efforts in terms of helping learners understand the lessons. In addition, once students can select their favored subjects, a self-learning style will be granted. If young learners can make a decision on what they will study, their independence and autonomy skills in learning will be ensured, leading to a responsible individual later on. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, despite the ubiquity of multi-subject avenues in education, prioritizing several selected subjects remains the most preferred choice due to the autonomic and favorable features. Because of these merits, I do expect government development aims to be drastically altered in the foreseeable future.

task: Some people think that robots are important for humans’ future development. Other think that robot have negative effects on society. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: Artificial intelligence and mechanical electronics have been the core of contemporary advancement. Robotics is now a field that is not unknown and the spike, we are seeing in its implementation is something huge. Today, robots are present everywhere whether it is at home as your cleaner and vacuum or in the operation theatre as surgeons' assistants. However, the opinions on it are quite the opposite. Some believe that it is the best invention in the history of mankind while some believe otherwise. I opine that its benefits are weighed higher on the scale as compared to its drawbacks<NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with, robots have taken the world by storm through the outcome and  their performance. The first and foremost advantage is it has never been so easy to solve complex problems as it is today. robots have the innate ability to do various tasks together and to provide accurate answers. Secondly, they are now sharing the workload of human beings by performing various levels of  work thus providing them with  a sense of relaxation. For instance, many surgeries are now performed by Da Vinci which is a specialized robot to assist surgeons and in this way, half of the burden has been reduced.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other side, there are drawbacks that should be taken into consideration. One of them is the industry will soon be converted into an AI-driven workforce and as a ,result millions of people will be jobless as e!employers will prefer this one-time investment instead of paying an amount every month to the employee. Another thing that is alarming is the lack of power to change decisions timely. These electronics work on the installed and manufactured intelligence therefore they do not have the capability to switch their mode according to circumstances. For example, if a robot is teaching a class that is not disciplined, it has no power to process how to keep children motivated.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, I would like to say that in spite of a few deficiencies, it is going to help human beings in great ways in the near future . All we need to understand is that these creatures can take up our responsibilities but can never give us  emotional support. So, use the robots but stay connected to the people

task: Some people think that robots are important for human’s future development. Others think that robots have negative effects on society. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: Robotics is an interdisciplinary field that integrates computer science and engineering to design machines that can help and assist human beings. A stratum of society opines that automation of tasks by robots is a positive development for the future whereas another section believes that this would bring some negative impact on the society.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, cost effectiveness, improved quality assurance, increased productivity etcetera are the major advantages of employing robots in real life. The cost of investment to purchase a robot can be recovered in a relatively short space of time as the they will not avail any lunch breaks, holidays or sick leaves unlike the regular employees. The decline in concentration levels due to repetitive tasks for a long time found in human beings are not observed in the case of robots. In addition to that, automated robots can be exposed to toxic and hazardous environment like nuclear power stations, rigs and mines were human body is vulnerable to potential injuries caused by various chemicals and radiations.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, one of the biggest concerns surrounding the introduction of robotic automation is the impact of jobs for workers. With the advancement in machine learning and artificial intelligence, industries have introduced robots to automate tasks were no human intervention is required. This has caused a sudden decrease in need of human employees to perform the same task resulting in unemployment. Furthermore, robots run on a specific algorithm designed for it and are not ready for unforeseeable situations like hacking. For instance, if these automated machines are used in banking systems then there are possible chances of accounts getting hacked leading to various fraudulent activities. <NL><NL><NL><NL>To summarise, the advancement of robots is unquestionably a positive development in a variety of fields such as medicine, factories, manual labour, and many others, but the algorithm on which they operate must be fully secure and equipped with the most up-to-date devices in order to reduce the risk of hacking, fraud, and malfunction.

task: Some people think that robots are important for human’s future development. Others think that robots have negative effects on society. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: In recent years, humans are heavily adapted to advanced technologies and it has become an integral part of life. Robots are considered to be one of the greatest innovations of mankind. Certain individuals believe that they are harmful to humans while some stratum of society argue that they are crucial for the future. I personally believe that robotics is a positive development for the world.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with, some people assert that these techno-savvy machines can endanger human life. This is because robots are not emotionally intelligent to distinguish what set of operations are right or wrong; which can have a detrimental effect. To illustrate, a recent accident involving a Telsa electric car that killed two people points fingers at its autonomous driving feature. Moreover, these robots running on a specific algorithm are in the early stage of development that can be exposed to hacking. For instance, if these machines are employed in the banking sector, there is a high probable chance of account hacking and other fraudulent activities. <NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, benefits derived from the invention of robots are significant for the development of the future. Most importantly, these automated machines can be deployed in places that are hazardous to humans. For example, a robot called Mini-Manbo has become the central part of the cleaning-up process in the damaged Fukushima reactor, where it is dangerous for humans to execute these tasks. Additionally, the heavy automation by robots in the automobile industry and hazardous chemical plants has reduced stress on employee’s health and increased productivity and precision in these sectors.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, although, some argue that robots can be potentially life-threatening and cannot be considered safe to be employed in various industries such as banking, I strongly believe that they can bring a positive change for the future.

task: The best way for a country to prepare for the future is to invest more resources in its young people. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
essay: It’s an undeniable fact that today’s youth is the future of the nation. However, I agree to a large extent with this opinion that for growth and development, it is important to invest more resources in its youth is the best way for a country to prepare for the future. This piece of writing will explore various dimensions and elucidate distinctive assumptions regarding the statement in the looming paragraphs.<NL><NL><NL><NL>First and foremost, investing in the education of young people should be the primary focus. Educated people will be an asset for economic growth. Secondly, schools should focus on educating children making them career-driven and preparing them to learn financial management. Furthermore, this will foster innovation, responsibilities and creativity which is quintessential for the country's growth. Additionally, not only education, health and well-being should also be the primary focus area. Health individuals will be more productive and contribute more to the economy According to a report by the World Health Organization, good health can boost economic growth by up to 4% a year.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Despite the fact, focusing solely on young people may not be enough. For instance, investments in infrastructure can facilitate trade and improve access to services, boosting economic growth. Moreover, investments in technology can increase productivity and create new industries. Lastly, investments in healthcare for all age groups is essential for a healthy and productive population.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To conclude, different people have different notions regarding the statement, but I have a plethora of reasons to advocate that although investing in the younger generation has huge benefits however, investing in other resources should not be overlooked.

task: Children find it difficult to concentrate on or pay attention to school. What are the reasons? How can we solve this problem?
essay: It is true that many children find it difficult to focus on the course at school. There are many reasons behind this phenomenon, so we need to take a comprehensive approach to mitigate it.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, several factors contribute to this aissue. One of the reasons is the development of technology such as the applications of smartphones. With smartphones, many students are addicted to the virtual world brought about by mobile games and gain a sense of achievement<NL><NL><NL><NL>, which cannot be found in schools. The influence of the environment is another main reason. For example, if the juveniles around them behave badly in schools like talking to others or sleeping in classes without being punished by teachers, which may have a bad impact on them and they may imitate this behaviour, leading to their lack of focus on their school work.<NL><NL><NL><NL>However, many measures can be taken to solve this problem. To begin with, parents can take children to do some outdoor activities such as kite flying and hiking. They are good ways for juveniles to get close to nature and be away from the virtual world. Then the children may understand the beauty of the real world. Furthermore, improving teaching quality is also important, which means teachers can make their teaching content more abundant to increase the opportunity for interaction with students. For instance, teachers should introduce more entertaining activities in classes such as brainstorming and group discussions. By doing so, the minors can focus more on the course at schools.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, the development of technology and the influence of the environment are the main reasons why it is difficult for students to catch the course at school, but actions should be taken along several aspects through doing outdoor activities and heightening teaching quality.

task: Many customs and traditional ways of behaviors are no longer relevant to the modern life and no worth keeping. Do you agree or disagree?
essay: Some people argue that many traditional customs and behaviours have been updated in the modern world and should be abandoned. However, I completely disagree with this point of view and believe those traditional customs deserve to be kept.<NL><NL><NL><NL>The main reason why most traditional customs are worth keeping is that they are still useful in the modern world. While some traditional customs including unconditionally following policies made by the king have been replaced by the democratic political system, there are still quite some traditional customs that adapt well to modern society. For example, people in east asian countries are still used to shaking hands when they meet new friends or business partners, which has been followed for more than 1000 years and is still a great way to help quickly establish friendship or business cooperation. Consequently, those kinds of traditional customs should be kept.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Another important reason for keeping certain traditional customs and behaviours is that they are essential records of human history. For instance, in the Western world, people celebrate Christmas and in many countries in East Asia and Southeast Asia such as China and Vietnam, people celebrate Lunar New Year, which gathers family members together and reminds people of the history of their ancestors. These traditional customs have built a bridge between modern civilization and ancient history, which is a priceless treasure in human beings’ history. Therefore, it is important to preserve some traditional customs.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, although some outdated traditional customs deserve to be abandoned in the modern world, I firmly believe that some traditional customs are vital parts of human history and are still applicable in modern society and thus should be kept.

task: In some cities and towns all over the world, the high volume of traffic is a problem. <NL><NL><NL><NL>What are the causes of this?<NL><NL><NL><NL>What actions can be taken to solve this problem?
essay: Over the past few decades, the increasing number of vehicles, both private and public, has become an issue in many parts of the world, especially in urban areas. In my opinion, there are two key reasons behind this situation, and several solutions could be effective to deal with it. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Regarding the causes, it may come from  overpopulation and the breakthrough in technology which encourages people to travel more. The very first rationale is about the higher total of inhabitants in many areas around the globe. Indeed, the world population has reached eight billion citizens recently. The more humans, the more vehicles are needed. To satisfy their demand for travelling and commuting, people have a tendency to afford their own transport, such as a car or a motorbike, which allows them to move at their convenience. The growth in the number of vehicles  on roads, however, has been responsible for air and noise pollution in metropolises. For example, Dehli, one of the most inhabited megacities, is famous for not only its authentic traditions but also the poorest quality of air which is covered with overwhelming exhaust fumes from private transportation all year round. Another reason that needs consideration is the development of mobile technology. Such achievements make travelling much easier than ever before. Visiting a foreign city is now in hand thanks to the investment in air travel. Nevertheless, this  can cause some disruption and annoyance in the local areas where the airports are constructed. <NL><NL><NL><NL>The aforementioned issues may be addressed with two possible methods. First of all, there should be a nationwide regulation to control the number of childbirths. Like China, its one-child policy 20 years ago is now efficient to reduce and keep the number of its locals under supervision. Fewer car users have encouraged lower use of transport. Besides, public transport ought to receive more investment. The national budget can be spent to purchase more buses, build more railways and train more staff to meet the growing needs of travellers. When passengers can enjoy their trip in a subway, obviously, not many people desire to buy and maintain a car anymore.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, overcrowding and new technology are loaded in favour of the transportation on roads. The mentioned ways may be taken into consideration to solve this problem.

task: In cities and towns all over the world, the high volume of traffic is a problem. What are the causes of this and what actions can be taken to solve this problem?

So, to make people alert about this danger government should conduct awareness programmes for instance: performing road drama, mass discussion, health education explaining the diseases (lungs and skin diseases) that can arise due to pollutions (air and sound pollution) and many more. <NL><NL><NL><NL>To sum the above statements, people uses their own vehicle to comfort their daily living and also because they are not aware of its conscequences. However, there are few steps that can be taken to solve these problems such as using public means of transportation, creating awareness programs and so on.

task: In some cities and towns all over the world, the high volume of traffic is a problem.<NL><NL>what are the causes of this and what actions can be taken to solve this problem?
essay: Traffic congestion is becoming a global problem and, in some arias this lead to a major drow back of the economy. Most of the time, rising urban population and shooting level of private vehicles on road are the main problem but, improper development of the roads is a rising cause . When  people use an improperly planned locomotion network , their probability of traffic on rods will rise without a doubt. for example . in Sri Lanka , most of the traffic congestion occurs around Colombo city  where  more people live , work and study. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Secondly , when we consider  the solution for this traffic congestion , improvement of the quality and number of public transport facilities is more important. apart from this, the road system should be well organised and properly maintained. most importantly , the development of the country should be spread to both urban and rural arias of the country to prevent local migration of people. For instance , a study was done by one of the universities in Sri Lanka suggest improving facilities in less developed cities in the country to prevent the expansion of the urban population and improve public transport facilities like trains and buses to prevent rising traffic congestion in major cities like Colombo and Kandy.<NL><NL><NL><NL> In conclusion, principal reasons for expanding traffic in most major center around the globe are rising urban community , expanding private vehicles on the avenue and poor quality pathway network . As a prevention strategy , the introduction of luxurious public shipping facilities , upgrading the quality of the road network and versatile  advancement towards the rural arias can be proposed.

task: In cities and towns all over the world the high volume of traffic is a problem. <NL><NL><NL>What are the causes of this and what actions can be taken to solve this problem?
essay: Traffic congestion is a serious issue in many parts of the world. This is because of the poor infrastructure of the roads and lack of proper public transports .Improving the public transport systems and proper connectivity of roads will solve the issue to some extent.<NL><NL><NL><NL>One  main reason for high traffic jams is that roads are not properly connected and narrow lanes of the main roads of the cities.Most of the working-class people, as well as school children, start their day at the same time.If there are no flyovers,underground bridges or additional lanes,traffic gets concentrated at the same place.Moreover,insufficient lanes for many vehicles to pass through at the same time increase the problem.Furthermore,many cities have not improved public transport systems forcing people to take personal vehicles.For instance,even if each member of a family takes their vehicle for work then traffic problems aggravate.These are the reasons for a high volume of traffic jams in the developed part of the world.<NL><NL><NL><NL>The main solution for overcoming this issue is to increase connectivity  in roads.Constructing fly-over bridges,underground passages will help in diverting traffic to a certain level.Additional by-lanes connecting the main road also divert traffic present on the main roads.Another solution is upgrading public transport systems at regular intervals in the urban areas.Government should increase local buses in the routes where traffic jam is seen the most.Also,new forms of transport like over-head metro rails do make a big difference in reducing the volume.For example,Dubai,one of the busiest cities in the world constructed Dubai metro rail as an answer to their traffic woes.These solutions help in overcoming traffic jam issues to a large extent.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To conclude,high vehicular traffic congestion is a major issue in the modern world.Bad infrastructure and poor connectivity are the cause of this problem;however,improving connectedness and increasing public transport services solve this problem to a large extent.

task: In some cities and towns all over the world, the high volume of traffic is a problem. <NL>What are the causes of this and what actions can be taken to solve this problem.
essay: The hiking traffic congestion is a growing concern for many cities nowadays. The main reasons for this includes, decrease use of public transport and a lack of alternative means of travelling or mass transit projects. There are various measures that can prove effective in this regard.<NL><NL><NL><NL>The unpopularity of public transportation is one of the main reasons that is causing traffic jams and transportation problems in various metropolitan cities of the world. Either non-availability or substandard public transport encourages public to use their personal vehicles that results in traffic issues, particularly during peak hours. A lack in alternative transportation methods like the underground subways, trams and trains are yet another contributory factor that urges people to use their self owned transports causing a considerable choking of the roads.<NL><NL><NL><NL>There are various steps that can be taken at both the government and individual level to fight this growing issue. Firstly, the most instantaneous results can be sought if the government encourages people to use public transport by making it more comfortable, convenient and cost effective. In other words, if the quality public transportation is made available to the citizens that is parallel to their personal cars in comfort, yet at a lower cost, can encourage people to prefer using public transport. For example, the public in the European countries prefers to use public transport rather than using one of their own because it is equally good and more affordable.<NL><NL><NL><NL> Secondly, another factor that can be of great value in the long term, is to minimize the traffic congestion is by constructing the alternate means of transit. Since cities are expanding due to urbanization, it has resulted in the shrinkage of roads that are not enough to meet the transport requirement of a relatively bigger population. Hence there is a need to build alternate roads, ring roads, subways or rail tracks to divert the influx and avoid traffic jams. For instance, the construction of a new ring road around Lahore, the provincial capital of Punjab, Pakistan has resulted in negligible transport issues that used to be a big problem in the past.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To conclude, encouraging public transportation and constructing the alternative transportation methods are the few solutions that can help in solving the growing issue of traffic congestion. It is therefore suggested that the authorities should focus on taking these measures in order to combat the traffic problems effectively.

task: Some people think parents should read or tell stories to children. Others think parents needn’t do that as children can read books or watch TV, movies by themselves. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay: Some people argued that there is no need for parents to read stories since children can help themselves with reading and watching videos. While I understand that there are difficulties for busy fathers and mothers, I believe storytelling is a great measure to help offspring's development.<NL><NL><NL><NL>First and foremost, the company of the guardians help preschoolers build their sense of security. It is essential for little ones to feel secure in order to further other ability towards socialisation. Neglected babies, for example, are proved to have emotional control and communicational problems in their adulthood. In addition, regular daily schedules, such as bedtime stories, assist young children's brain development and reduce the tension from the environment. Similarly, parents could better bond their descendants by spending time together reading.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, even though small kids are fond of video clips, these media hamper their abilities of imagination and discourage the stimuli of verbal and interpersonal skills. Online free youtube content, which is evident especially, often created only for catching views' eyes for clicks rather than educational information. Although pupils could improve word capacity by reading books themselves, it becomes thorny when young learners forgo their connections with families and lose their motivation of human contact. Generations born with smartphones, for instance, tend to feel alone and isolated than older generations and lead to mental health issues in formative years.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, despite the time saved for adults, there is no way of merits to leaving youngsters by themselves. Parents should be aware of the repercussions and share time with the young by telling stories.

task: Some people think that museum should be enjoyable places to entertain people, while others believe that the purpose of museum is to educate. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Discuss both views and give you own opinion.

task: Many students find it harder to study when they are at university or college than when they were at school. Why is this? What can be done to solve the problem?
essay: The transition from school to university presents a formidable challenge for many students. This essay will explain why this is the case and then suggest several measures to overcome these difficulties.<NL><NL><NL><NL>This shift in academic rigour can be attributed to several key factors. Chief among these is that university courses are characterized by a greater depth of knowledge and a faster pace of learning compared to school. This demands a higher level of critical thinking, independent research, and analytical skills, all of which freshmen may severely lack. Another contributing factor is the newfound independence that comes with university life. Unlike school, where there is often a structured timetable and close monitoring by teachers and parents, university students are expected to manage their own time, which can be a daunting task for those unaccustomed to this level of autonomy.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To address this issue, higher education institutions can adopt a range of strategies. One such approach is the implementation of comprehensive orientation programs designed to equip incoming students with essential study competencies, effective time management strategies, and awareness of available campus resources. Additionally, by creating smaller tutorial groups within larger classes, these institutes could provide students with a more conducive environment for asking questions and seeking clarification. Moreover, universities should promote a culture of open communication between professors and students, encouraging them to seek help when needed.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, the transition from high schools to tertiary education poses a significant academic challenge for students due to the differences in terms of curricula and greater independence required. By initiating specialized orientation programs, cultivating smaller learning communities, and advocating open channels of communication, universities can help students overcome these challenges and thrive in their academic pursuits.

task: In some countries, there has been an increase in the number of parents who educate their children themselves at home instead of sending them to school. Do you think the advantages of this outweigh the disadvantages?
essay: It is still a subject of debate whether the homeschooling system for students is the right path for them as many people say that traditional schools have more suitable feasibility for pupils. In this essay, I disagree with the motion; in contrary, I believe that the drawbacks outweigh the benefits.<NL><NL><NL><NL>First and foremost, students may have more direct learning from the teacher, but it is undeniable that the homeschooling curriculum is not as structured as schools in general. This phenomenon in fact becomes a hindrance for the students and makes their knowledge inequivalent to each other. For example,  homeschooling children who move into a real institute to pursue their education may have more difficulty keeping up with the materials since they have different insights from their educators. As a result, this just lead a pressure for the learners and may push them to   burnout.<NL><NL><NL><NL>More than that, homeschoolers are likely to be out of touch with society since they do not have peer groups in their learning journey. Many parents might think this is a great choice to make their kids more safe and not experience bully, however, this actually lets the students lack  social relationships which is a crucial part of their personal growth. For instance, pupils from home learning systems tend to be loners or cannot make friends on a daily basis because they are not used to crowds. This issue is actually will affect their ability to survive in their adulthood later on.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To sum up, the advantages of learning at home for kids do not outweigh the disadvantages as it is in fact  this phenomenon has more disadvantages in  society. Not only learners will have less knowledge among the students, they will also hardly survive as human beings.

task: In some countries, there has been an increase in the number of parents who educate their children themselves at home instead of sending them to school. Do you think the advantage of this outweigh the disadvantages?
essay: In this present world, some family prefer to studied their children at home rather than school. In my opinion, I consider that being study in school will be more effectively.
