task: In some countries, there has been an increase in the number of parents who educate their children themselves at home instead of sending them to school. Do you think the advantages of this outweigh the disadvantages?
essay: There are more and more parents who would like to teach their children at home rather than letting them learning at schools in some states. I think these parents' views are unreasonable and its disadvantages outweigh the advantages, because firstly, schools have more professional learning resources than home and secondly, pupils obtain the unique group experiences at schools. <NL><NL><NL><NL>The education departments and agencies control the largest amount of education resources than single family. Kindergardens, schools and collages own a lot of teaching materials, instructing aids, professional teachers and considerate libraries for students. Meanwhile, the governments invest a large number of money to each school in order to continue improving teaching and learning efficiency of them. Kids will be difficult to access these benefits if parents do not send them to schools. For example, in Shanghai, each primary school is funded by the local authority nearly one million pound to develop their teachers' group and teaching devices, which is impossible to be achieved in any pupil's home. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In addition, students can acquire the experiences of collective lives. Some people might argue that teaching children at home which is one-to-one model. This will be more effective for learners to get a better grade in exam. However, examination is not the only goal of the education. Understanding how to cooperate with others and communication skills in the same age groups are also essential to each child. For instance, except for lessons, there are many activities and workshops organised in schools. Pupils could understand a lot of rules to cooperate with others and the communication strategies to make others feeling comfortable. These experiences can only be acquired at schools. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, I believe its disadvantages overweigh the benefits that teaching children at home rather than sending them to schools, because children cannot access many professional instructing resources and get collective experiences.

task: The typical teaching situation of a teacher and students in the class will not exist by the year 2050. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Numerous characters deem our conventional educating program will be altered, and students will not be attending class; in contrast, certain groups of people oppose and affirm pupils will be studying at school. Besides this, the old educational program will be lasting as usual. I reckon the current model will surely be changed by the 2050s.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Firstly, I view the revolution has already started. Thanks to cutting edge technology, now we have more options to continue lessons and business. For example, all college, universities, and companies stopped to work because of coronavirus, rendering people to live under quarantine, but still, my university's teachers have been lecturing their lessons using the internet and social channels including Facebook, Google Meet, and Zoom. Hence, this trend will definitely influence the traditional tutor and student interaction.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Secondly, this brand new teaching approach is more sustainable and effortless than any method which had been existed before. As arriving at school and coming back home takes a lot of time, and we usually do not attend class when we ill. However, we can take a course from schools by using a mobile phone or computer today, which is simple and has no obstacle. For instance, since I started acquiring knowledge from the internet curriculum; I realized that it took fewer hours than taking tutorials from the college. Thus, I prefer this new trend and presume its enhancement is inevitable. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, from the arguments and examples given, I firmly believe gaining information process will involve in 2050, as adolescents and children are advocating this new internet-based way of informing.

task: The typical teaching situation of a teacher and students in the class will not exist by the year 2050. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: With the rampant progress in technology, it is undeniable that there shall be numerous changes in the future. There is a school of thought that thinks that by the year 2050, the usual teaching methods shall be completely eradicated. In my opinion, I disagree that the traditional teaching methods will be replaced entirely in the future. In this essay, we shall discuss this topic further.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Online education is a double edged sword, and there are various reasons for it. On the one hand, it is convenient, cost-effective and saves time. To illustrate, the individual does not have to commute to reach college or have a discussion with his/her tutor thereby saving time, and money, and plus the person can attend classes or lectures at the comfort of his/her home. Similarly, he/she can attend or review any missed lecture anytime. Additionally, the cost of infrastructure for building college or universities will be exempted as there is no need for any classroom.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, there are some drawbacks to this development, for instance, as almost everything is done online and so this makes it completely reliable on the internet connection. Moreover, loss or any disruption in connectivity can hamper the entire process. Furthermore, the cost of these internet connections are not always affordable. Lastly, such online classes decline the gist of learning which as physical interaction which eventually leads to loneliness and depression.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, online education cuts both ways; therefore, it shall be unnecessary to completely remove physical education and replace it with computerized study. Nevertheless, there could even better alternatives that shall benefit the teaching system in the future.

task: Large public places such as parks and squares are essential in both citites and towns Do you agree or disagree?
essay: Big out door spaces are nesassary for people lives around the arban area  or in different activities no matter what type of familes they are  , i strongly agree with this nation  as its help creating more clear invronment and also allowing kids and familes to have such anjoying time togther with out the need to speend alot of money .<NL><NL><NL><NL>generally having a large  green spaces between the city nighberhood is helping clear out the air and better inviroment ,  in incetence in contry side area where its more widere in space pepole can do a vraity of actvites like playing foot ball or basketball,  <NL><NL><NL><NL>not to mention having a big out door spaces helps famileas to have more intertaning things to do together during holidays , for example on summer holiday pearents can take there children to the parks to have fresh air , play together or  meeting park other family memberes and have  a lunch , which more cheaper  in cost wise .<NL><NL><NL><NL>in conclusion i couldnt agree more how amportent is to have a huge green open earas that can incloud defferent options for the familes to enjoy there time an also providing more healthy life style by increasing the O2 level in the air .

task: It is important for all towns and cities to have large public spaces such as parks and squares, Do you agree or disagree with this statement?
essay: Today, people prefer to live in a town that caters to all the basic needs necessary to live a comfortable lifestyle. Some believe that a town must have some spacious public areas where different age group of people can spend their  time. I am in complete accordance with them for certain reasons which will be discussed further.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Cities with large public areas have their own advantages. Residents can socialize with their friends easily without any fear. For example, children can play at the park with their age group and get the opportunity to make a new buddies. This also helps in their growth as they learn to acclimatise to a new environments apart from their home. Secondly, senior citizens get an opportunity to meet like-minded people and sometimes get an opportunity to find gossip pals too. Such areas make them overcome the feeling of loneliness in their life. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In addition to this, town centres of any city connects different age group at one place and caters to their shopping needs at one place. Youngsters get to hang out with their mates and do activities together. To exemplify, many new cafes, and play stations give you a personal space to spend quality time with your close ones. Not only that, the chances of getting cheated at such places get reduced as lots of people visit there regularly.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Others have their own reasons to not agreeing with my statement which cannot be ignored. They believe that space should be utilised to grow industrial areas which in return will increase the job opportunities for the citizens. It will increase the influx of money which can improve the standard of living of city dwellers. Moreover, with the increasing population, we need areas to develop more houses than parks. This need cannot be totally overlooked as well. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, every city should try to balance the needs of everybody living in it. Spacious public areas encourage a healthy lifestyle, socialisation and a safe atmosphere which is imperative in today's fast-paced routine. Substituting it with industrial or residential development will cause harm to people over a long period of time, therefore, I strongly back with the former viewpoint.

task: It is important for all towns and cities to have large public outdoor places like squares and parks. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: There is a hot issue about whether all towns and cities should have large public outdoor places like squares and parks. I disagree with that opinion, in my perspective, I assume that not all towns and cities need it.<NL><NL><NL><NL>A large public outdoor place contributes to citizens have fun there and offers them opportunities to involve diversity activities like amusement competitions. Having a spacious public outdoor area not only cost a huge amount of taxpayers money but also need to use a huge public space source which ought to have better usage than squares or parks. For example, in some developing cities,they can not afford the expend of building large public amusement park which is a waste of government’s fund that could be poured in education or the local economy so that could change local society instead of a park. <NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, the public area can not be fully used due to the less population, even if there is a large public in some tiny cities.It turns out that is a waste of money as well. However, things will completely different in metropolitans, because a large number of populations have more need for amusement. So, there is no need for small towns and tiny cities to have a large public area, especially for those developing cities and those that have less population.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In summary, metropolitans could afford the expend of building a large public area instead of tiny and underdeveloped cities, besides less population also will result in a waste of money due to the low-frequency usage.So, that is not paramount for all towns and cities to have large public outdoor places

task: It is important for all towns and cities to have large public spaces such as squares and parks. Do you agree or disagree with this statement?
essay: It is crucial for all metropolitan cities and towns to have some recreational facilities like parks and squares because of their numerous benefits. A number of arguments surround my opinion , and I will discuss it in upcoming paragraphs.<NL><NL><NL>To commence with,  the first and the foremost merit is that it is beneficial for the health of people  because in morning time they can go for walking as well as in the evenings, also older people can spend their free time with their loved ones,and they can discuss about their daily happenings.  In addition, young people do lot of exercise in parks and gardens to keep their health fit and healthy,otherwise if there is no park they glue with electronic gadgets like mobile phones and computers and many more. <NL><NL><NL>Furthermore, little children get best place to play, they play with their friends in parks if any garden or square is not available for kids then they use roads and streets for playing it can lead to serious incidents.Moreover ,parks have some educational value too ,in schools ,students learn about environment protection in their studies and teachers can take their pupils to parks because students can see those pictures so lively which they see in their school books and they know about importance and protection of tress and flowers. <NL><NL><NL>In recapitulate, parks holds immense importance regarding education, health for people of every society ,so government should build parks in every city and town.

task: Q. In some countries, celebrities complain about the way the media publicizes their private lives. Some people say that they should accept it as part of their fame. Do you agree or disagree?
essay: It is inevitable for prominent people to have a lot of attention from the public. Therefore, some famous individuals make a complaint to the media in order to have their boundaries. Some people insist that they have to admit this phenomenon as part of their fame. However, I strongly disagree with this opinion. This is because famous people have a right to have private space in their lives and they might be victims of criminals.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with, eminent people have a right to have their own space in their daily lives. In fact, everyone needs a private room where they can be protected from external factors including famous people. Having a boundary plays a pivotal role in people's lives. When people's rights are invaded by other elements, they might be able to have mental issues such as depression, anxiety, and so on. To cite an example, some celebrities in South Korea struggle with their mental problems since they do not have enough space for their schedule. They protest to media companies to stop posting their life in order to tackle this problem. Sometimes, they have medicines or conduct sessions to deal with their stress. Moreover, This situation might lead their fandoms to have a sense of worry and a lot of entertainment companies to lose their assets as prominent people in our society.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In addition, celebrities might be able to become victims of awful people. The number of criminals has been increasing nowadays, some people, called a stoker, cross the private rooms. They are more likely to invade eminent people's daily lives by following their schedules every single day and taking a majority of pictures. Sometimes, they even attack celebrities physically. For example, there was a serious crime in China. One prominent actress, named Wan Wei was captured by a stoker. The criminal said that he was able to check her life by watching media news all the time. This means that too much information about celebrities' lives might cause detrimental situations for them such as stoking, captures, and so on.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To sum up, it is evident that some people reckon that they deserve to monitor celebrities' lives because of their fame. However, I totally disagree with it, since famous people have a right to have their boundaries and might be targeted by criminals.

task: In some countries, celebrities complain about way the media publicize their private lives. Some people say that they should accept it as part of their fame. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Do you agree or disagree?
essay: In some countries, famous individuals often feel unhappy about how  publishing interferes with their private lifestyle. Some argue that it is just part of being famous. However, I believe that celebrities, like anyone else, should be treated with respect and have the freedom to control what they share with the public. In this essay, I will share my thoughts on this topic and reach a final conclusion.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with, some people believe that celebrities should accept media intrusion because they willingly choose to be in the spotlight. They share parts of their lives on social publishing, give interviews, and attend public events, which makes people interested in them. This sometimes blurs the line between their public and private life, leading the news to focus on personal matters. From this perspective, it is essential for personage to understand that fame has its ups and downs, and they should be prepared to handle both aspects.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Be that as it may, we should consider the human side of fame. superstars are just like regular people and deserve privacy and respect for their personal lives. The constant media attention can cause stress and emotional problems, and it can even harm their relationships and families. Being famous does not mean they should give up their right to privacy. Therefore,  publishing should focus more on their talents and achievements rather than invading their private matters without permission.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, after discussing this topic in-depth, I agree that superstars have the right to complain about the news's intrusion into their private lives. While fame may be necessary for them to gain popularity, it should not give the media unrestricted access to their personal affairs. Finding a balance between public interest and respecting personal boundaries is crucial for maintaining a better relationship between public figures and the news.

task: Some universities offer online courses as an alternative to classes<NL><NL>delivered on campus. Do you think this is a positive or negative<NL><NL>development?
essay: Education for universities always developing and changing for students to study easily without worrying about anything and nowadays they offer online classes for the one who cannot attend regularly because of difficult transportation or far distances. And I believe that this trend has so many benefits for everyone with current situations.<NL><NL><NL><NL>    Although online classrooms are already available in some universities since the covid-19 pandemics has happened, after that, almost every universities in the world have online courses now. By teaching from online, students does not need to care for physical contacts and focus only on studying and even they are sick or ill they no longer need to be restrained by fearing of infecting other people. Moreover, they will have more free time as there is no more transportation to get to the destination place because we can learn from the home with comfort. Also, students can now study from any universities from anywhere in the world despite their home countries.<NL><NL><NL><NL>    There are still left advantages for this phenomenon beside aforementioned ones. For example, because of the fees for online learning are always cheaper than learning on campus, people with tighter finance can now afford for their desire subjects. However, whether many of positive facts are existed, few drawbacks of this phenomenon also need to be considered. The most crucial thing is that there will be less practical practices for students compared to the campus and it is not possible for them to learn and practice in practical subjects from online. Lastly, there are still people who prefer more campus than online for the reasons which they think they feel unsatisfied and not effective learning from online.<NL><NL><NL><NL>    Overall, it can said that even though some few disadvantages are existed, its positive developments are outweighing them.

task: Some universities offer online courses as an alternative to classes delivered on campus. Do you think this is a positive or negative development?
essay: Under the development of sophisticated advanced technology, some higher education institutions can provide courses learned through the internet instead of traditional classrooms. In my point of view, this trend would create several benefits but there would be some drawbacks arising.<NL>On the other hand, attending indirectly interactive courses is immeasurably beneficial to both professors and students. In other words, online courses bring so a wealth of convenience to learners since they enable students to save their quality time and finance as well. To be more specific, students can take part in any courses that they are interested in regardless of geographical distance or travel cost, which helps to reduce various burdens and enhance the gross enrollment rate significantly due to this flexibility. In contrast, a fixed curriculum in traditional classes makes students arrange their time and own schedule passively, which can limit their time management skills. In Vietnam, for instance, during the quarantine, online classes offered to students enable them to acquire knowledge sufficiently in safety without any time pressure or extravagant price of traveling.<NL>On the other hand, there are also compelling reasons why this trend may bring some disadvantages. To start with, students may lose face to face interaction in unsociable learning hours, which can lead to non-comprehensive development in several immensely essential skills including interpersonal and communicative ones. Therefore, students are not able to be well-equipped in seeking jobs in the future which can affect career path negatively. Also, without competitiveness among peers, learners can easily lose the drive to try their best in order to have their desired academic results. An illustration of this is that, in some local high schools in my hometown, students usually have better performance at school compared to the online courses.<NL>In conclusion, e-learning can bring so many pros to learners. Nevertheless, the downsides would emerge.

task: Some universities offer online courses as an alternative to classes delivered on campus. Do you think this is a positive or negative development?
essay: In parallel with the incredible development of technology, online curriculum has become one of the common features of university education, which is step by step replacing face-to-face classes. From my perspective, this movement brings about both positive and negative impacts to students.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, offering online courses is considered to be very essential with students who always up to the ears with full-time learning schedule, especially those living far from the hall. In other words, online courses offer learners a flexible time to attend the lesson so that they can postpone the lessons to do their job or arrange it easily in their busy timetable without any worries about missing courses taught in the campus. This is extremely advantageous for students who have part-time job, which helps lighten their financial burden. Moreover, by purchasing online courses, students can have an access to the unlimited sources of accurate information which are provided by host academy. Thus, it is very beneficial for students who are seeking for crucial information for their essay, as well as those who slow on the uptake can replay the lesson as many times as they want.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, online education still has some vital disadvantages which merely traditional classes can afford. Firstly, it is impossible for students to interact directly with their tutors and peers, which plays an integral part in their understanding the lessons. This is due to the large number of students studying online, it is time-lacking for both students and professors to communicate with each other. Secondly, the online learning solution requires lots of self-discipline to become effective, which just a small number of students can make it. For instance, first things may appear on the top are gaming badges, media, following are notifications from social network and pop-up advertises, which are real nuisances to the learning process.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, having online tertiary education as an alternative choice is beneficial to some students. However, I think that the drawbacks are harmful in the long run and it should be taken into account.

task: Today, people are surrounded by advertising. This affects what people think is important and has a negative impact on people's lives. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: In the contemporary era, the existence of advertising has crept into many aspects of daily life. From my perspective, this tendency has raised many disruptive concerns relating to the issues of manipulating public opinion and fostering overshopping.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with, the popularity of advertisements can form a negative perspective on daily activities. It is true that the high density of advertisements leads to memorable footage stuck in the audience's minds. This might have the impact of changing their mindset in the long-term whether they are exposed to too many of these advertisements. For example, people watching car advertisements usually recognize that the background of these tends to be decorated in a luxurious way leading to a mindset that only the high-order classes can buy them. Because the target audiences of car sellers are often the high-income people, however, it could be seen that advertisements release in the public eye. Thus, it is understandable that many people hold a belief that owning a car is a represented aspect belonging to the rich community. Nevertheless, it is noticeable that this is a mistrustful idea and stereotype, and many forms of advertisements are manipulating the public to push their sales.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Furthermore, the high density has not only shifted people’s perspective  but also led to detrimental activities. Firstly, many advertisements promoting their items tend to constantly repeat not only on TV and smartphones  but also on billboards whether people going out, this would stick in customers’ memories and lead to a feeling of curiosity or fear of missing out. Therefore, trending products are usually hunted and attracted by a plethora of consumers. However, there are a variety of top trending products from several aspects of the market, leading to the customers’ tendency to splash all their money on them. It reckons that this is an expenditure habit and also harms the surrounding environment due to the high demands of producing too many items. Zara, a fashion brand, for example, is a well-known case of fast fashion. This company is usually boycotted because it would like to release a new collection for every new season and overproduct them. Therefore, the consumption is always lower than the production and the leftovers actually contribute to the global garbage dump more seriously.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, it is true that many advertisements around daily lives have many highlighted negative impacts, including distorting the audiences’ views or breeding overconsumption.

task: Today people are surrounded by advertising. This affects what people think is important and has a negative impact on people’s lives. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: The advertising industry has undeniably thrived in recent decades, infiltrating many aspects of daily life including preferences. From my perspective, I consider this growth to be completely negative as it leads to a distorted perception of reality and overconsumption among consumers.<NL><NL><NL><NL>My foremost concern lies in the tendency of advertisements to cause audiences to falsely perceive the relative importance of major factors in their lives. They generally prioritise material possessions and physical appearance while failing to appreciate the value of other positive qualities. A prime example is advertising campaigns run by cosmetics brands which often praise physical attractiveness as being vital to a healthy relationship, although reliability and sympathy have been long proven by experts to be more influential in fostering personal connections. This well-established truth would likely be more popularly embraced if marketing messages did not exaggerate the significance of physical appearance.<NL><NL><NL><NL>The consumerism caused by excessive advertising is another reason for my disapproval of its popularity. Marketers nowadays are armed with new customer insights and advanced technical tools to skillfully entice viewers into making impulsive purchases. To illustrate, TikTok has developed a detection feature that can constantly identify the preferences and hobbies of users based on their content search, subsequently prompting suitable buying suggestions that accurately trigger their temptation to buy these things. This has given rise to impulsive buying that consequently leads to not only personal debt but also excessive waste which contaminates the environment since more unwanted obsolete items would be discarded. It is a testament as to why advertising campaigns are detrimental at both individual and societal levels.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, the prevalence of advertisements appears to me as a disadvantage as they distort the audience’s view of life and breed overconsumption. That is why governments should issue more stringent laws to restrain the development of the advertising industry until the aforementioned issues are comprehensively addressed.

task: In many countries, people decide to have children at a later age than in the past. Why? Do the advantages of this development outweigh the disadvantages? Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
essay: These days, many couples opt for delayed childbirth. This trend can be attributed to career priorities. From my point of view, I consider that it has more drawbacks, especially the health of their offspring.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, postponing parenthood can bring about significant advantages. Firstly, parents have financial stability after concentrating completely on their career. Therefore, children may receive a better education quality in a precious school. In addition, when pregnant at a later age, couples are more mature in emotional aspect, so their spouse relationship can become more stable. Furthermore, they would be ready to take care of their children. For instance, children who were born in families by elderly parents tend to be paid more attention than others since their parents have more family time.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, embarking on parenthood at a later age can have unexpected disadvantages. First of all, that can increase the generation gap between parents and their offspring, leading to familial conflicts. In terms of the long run side, parents may not be around for as long as their children need them. Moreover, babies in such families are susceptible to mental diseases due to gene fault. As a case in point, according to health-related studies, infants who were born by mothers over 35 years old are prone to Down syndrome.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To sum up, opting for pregnancy at a later age can be because of heightened monetary burdens. That brings certain pros and cons about health and family aspects. From my perspective, the disadvantages should be given more concern than advantages.

task: People nowadays tend to have children at older age <NL><NL><NL><NL>Do the advantage outweigh the disadvantage
essay: Nowadays, people tend to give birth at an older age. This might be due to emotionally preparation of the parents for the process, however, delay in the ability to conceive can also be disadvantage which I believe outweigh the disadvantages which can be medically corrected.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Firstly, many people nowadays believe that child birth and child care is not a small deal, that is why some people want to prepare either emotionally or financially towards having their children. task: People nowadays tend to have children at older age. Do the advantages of this outweigh the disadvantages?
essay: In the world today people tend  to give birth and start families at a later stage in their lives. From my own point of perspective, the merits outweigh the demerits because there might be unpalatable consequences resulting from this such as difficulty  in conceiving a child.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with, Despite these disadvantages, there are certain benefits which can be encapsulated under the umbrella of stability, both: financial and familial. As a couple progresses in life they should have greater financial resources to draw upon to support their children and reduce the negative impact on poverty. In addition to the financial stability, there’s also stability in the family which should increase as the couple matures. As a result, children born at a later stage are less vulnerable to the negative consequences of divorce and family break up which are less common in older pairings.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Although the positive aspects appear to have great strength, there are also significant negative factors to consider. Foremost, as people age, they suffer from a greater amount of genetic degradation which can increase the chances of having a child with a genetic defect such as Down's syndrome. Another factor which can have a detrimental effect on a child’s quality of growth is the fact that older people tend to have less energy which means they are less able to cope with and raise their relatively more energetic young child. Moreso, there is also a generation gap in terms of relatability. As the age gap between the child and the parents increases their ability to relate to each other and share the same ideas about life could be placed under severe pressure. This may have negative consequences on the child’s upbringing and development. For instance, there could be numerous intra-family conflicts between youngsters and their elderly parents.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, given the greater number of negative elements in comparison to the smaller number of positive aspects of giving birth at an older stage in life, it is reasonable to conclude that it is more beneficial to conceive and raise children at a relatively earlier age.

task: More people decided to have children in their later age than in the past. Why?<NL><NL>Do advantages of this outweigh disadvantages?<NL><NL>Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
essay: Currently, it is quite common that people prefer to have babies later than it was in past. task: More people decided to have children in their later age than in the past. <NL>Do advantages of this outweigh the disadvantages?
essay: Nowadays, most individuals chose to have kids in their later age compared to what it used to be in the past. In my opinion, I believe it is more beneficial to have kids at later age than at young age because it makes one fully prepared for child care and also reduces the rate of over population.<NL><NL>On the one hand, there are many advantages of late child birth. Firstly, it enables one to be fully ready for the responsibilities that come with having children. This means that when people delay giving birth till their later age, by then they would have been well established financially, morally and education wise. The reality is that people who give birth early are not yet ready for the consequent duty of care. This difference can be seen when comparing  children education between the American and the Nigerian. Early child birth has made many Nigerian unable to afford their kids' education, whereas, the American which mostly give birth at later age have highest level of children education. It can, therefore, be logically deduced that giving birth at later life prepares one for the task of caring for them. Secondly, giving birth at later age helps to control population rate. If people start having kids at young age, they tend to have many kids before menopause, hence delaying child birth will help individual family to give birth to fewer children.<NL><NL>Despite the numerous benefits of giving birth at later life, it however, has some few drawbacks. First of it is the reduced chances of conception. Scientists have shown that the best chance of conception is between the age of 18 years to 28 years and the chances keep decreasing with age. This means that people who decide to wait till later age risk not having kids at all. Furthermore, delaying child birth could also result in certain complications during labour and delivery. For instance, conditions like miscarriage, early onset of labour and other complications, are associated with pregnancy at later life.<NL><NL>In conclusion, although, birthing children at later age has its merits and downsides, on the balance, I however believe the benefits surpass any drawbacks it may have.

task: The best way to teach children to cooperate is through team sports at school. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: The assertion that team sports are the best method to teach youngsters how to cooperate is a viewpoint that has gained considerable attention. Although team sports can indeed foster collaboration skills, I believe that there are other effective avenues for teaching cooperation as well.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Essentially, team sports are very efficient when it comes to teaching young people how to cooperate with each other. Through a competitive environment, teenagers develop teamwork skills, self-esteem and strategising. For example, students can have many opportunities to recognise the strengths as well as the shortcomings of each teammate which can be used to better compete against their opponents, especially in sports with more than 5 participants such as football, volleyball and basketball. Additionally, playing sports also stimulates a working environment where people work towards a common goal together. Thus, pupils learn how to work together more effectively when they engage in these sporting activities.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, it is important to recognize that cooperation skills can be cultivated through a range of activities beyond team sports. Firstly, cooperative learning strategies in classrooms, group projects, community service activities and even creative pursuits like theatre or music can also provide valuable opportunities for young adults to develop collaboration skills. In fact, these activities promote cooperation, and the ability to work effectively in a group setting. They encourage the youth to understand diverse perspectives, value teamwork and appreciate the benefit of collective effort. Secondly, not all offspring may be inclined toward or have the opportunity to participate in team sports. Thus, it is essential to provide a range of activities and environments that cater to diverse interests or abilities, ensuring that all youngsters have a chance to develop their cooperation skills.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, while team sports offer valuable opportunities for teaching offspring to cooperate, I believe that cooperation skills can be developed through a variety of activities and environments. By providing a balanced approach that includes all activities, we can effectively nurture the value and skill of cooperation in adolescents.

To conclude, although sports activities help in cooperating, teachers should focus on other  academic group projects to unite students in the schools. Therefore, such initiatives would  bring harmony in between the people.

task: Public health is becoming an urgent issue now a days. some argue that government should create nutrition ad food choice law to improve public health while others believe that it is a matter of personal choice and responsibility. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: Some argue that government should be responsible in public health while others believe it is the sole responsibility of the people because nowadays the people's health is one of the major concern. Although, others believe that government should combat malnutrition in the country, having a good health should be more concerning to the citizens. <NL><NL><NL><NL>It is said to believe that government should should ensure that the people are having enough food to avoid hunger. They are responsible in monitoring the amount of stocks available in the country and should subsidize the value for the benefit of the citizens. For instance, the food and drug administration is the agency that protects and ensure the rights to health of the Filipinos and resulted in decrease number of malnutrition in the nation. However, I believe that an individual should be responsible in maintaining a good health.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, having a healthy body is a personal choice. People should be more optimistic in looking for one's welfare and not relying in the government. Having a good health is crucial to avoid straining the government's budget for the budget should be allotted in more important projects such as road infrastracture and providing jobs to people. For example, eating a balance diet and exrecises are one of the many ways on improving health. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, public health is something should be address nowadays. Although, others believe that government should promote health to every mankind. I believe that people should be more concern with their own body to achieve a good health. As the saying says "Health is Wealth".

task: Some people argue that governments should make laws regarding people's nutrition and food choices to improve public health while others contend that this is the freedom of personal choice and responsibility. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay: Now a days people are demanding strict legal provisions on essential nutrition and food behavior to improve people’s health.  However, the others advocate that taking vitamins and food is completely individual choice. In this essay, I will discuss on both perspectives and will put my own viewpoint at the end of the essay.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, some group of people strongly believes that the government should be responsible for formulating laws on public health. This is because people are paying taxes to the government from their regular income. For example, the government collects its revenue from the taxes of its citizens so the government has to act on voicing for people’s health. Thus, some set of individuals emphasize on the responsibility of health ministry on advancing legal laws on public health.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, some second on the sole responsibility of government in developing laws for health of its native. They state that the wellbeing is completely a personal choice and dependent on individual’s right to be fit and healthy. For instance, some trusts that the different food habits and supplements work differently on each individual’s body. Furthermore, same provisions on health laws may not create the same benefit to all individual because each individual has different body type and have need different preferences on food. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, some agrees that government should be made accountable for legalizing health laws whereas some disagrees and believes that health is an individual preference. In my view, though health is a personal choice but it should be legalized and constantly monitored from the government also to create equal health benefits for all people.

task: Some people think that public health within a country can be improved by government making laws regarding nutritious food. Others, however, think that health is a matter of personal choice and responsibility. <NL><NL><NL>Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: Globalisation and Industrialization has impacted working and eating habits of almost everyone residing in Tier 1 or Tier 2 cities. Fast food chains and QSR restaurants have emerged as a go-to place for people in corporate jobs due to high workload. Public health in general, depends majorly on these two factors. This essay will discuss both aspects of government intervention in regulating availability of different eating options in order to improve general health in the country. <NL><NL><NL><NL> Although eating habits are unique in every region, religion and even generation, there is one similarity, which is need of nutrition for our body to maintain immune system and ability to perform the required tasks. Depending of various job types, different diet patterns are more appropriate for different people, and accordingly humans have developed their eating habits around it. This directly affects the health which, albeit gradually, improves overtime if we consume nutritious food; and remain physically active throughout the day.<NL><NL><NL><NL>I strongly advocate that maintaining overall health should be the responsibility of oneself in general. However, authorities should ensure that private companies are not overburdening their employees to perform more than what their job entails. Regulating nutritious food entirely may result in favouritism and undue inclination towards one industry, hampering the level playing field for various businesses. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Partial involvement of government in releasing the minimum nutritional requirement for people, enabling transparency on the ingredients used in food items being sold in outlets or supermarkets, guidance on leading a healthy lifestyle will always ascertain the good of their citizens.

task: Some people think that public health within a country can be improved by government making laws regarding nutritious food. Others, however, think that health is a matter of personal choice and responsibility. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: Many people believe that the level of health and hygiene can improve only by the government`s monitoring such as imposing some policies related to food supply; however, others are in this opinion that personal decision and responsibility have played a vital role in this subject. In my perspective, both the government`s legislation and personal care, are necessary.<NL><NL>On the one hand, one of the important causes of health problems is the food which people consume. If governments legislate various laws related to this issue the level of problems, which people face during their life, will increase, and life expectancy will be extended. Moreover, by improving the agricultural techniques, the mortality reduction emerges that is because better nutrition will be shared among people. To illustrate, If urban centres start to deliver clean water and remove waste, the dramatic reduction in water and nutrition will be occurring, general personal hygiene grows. So, governments can be a crucial aid for declining in mortality rate and rising in health level.<NL><NL>On the other hand, people were given advice about what are the causes of disease and how they can prevent infectious disease by caring about personal health, so what they need is to pay attention on little easy subjects such as watching their hand, do not use others brush, and visiting a doctor in every specific period to check up. Furthermore, sports have been one of the necessary fields that decrease the risk of being sick, so provided that one has a regular daily exercise, they will not face difficulty especially when they become old. Thus, without personal-care, public health will not develop.<NL><NL>To conclude, it is obvious that states are vital aspects to promote health-related items as well as self-attention. In my notion, both self-care and the state-care about the aspects which affect health are equally important, and these hygiene improvements can be more effective if both groups cooperate.

task: Some people think that public health of a country can be improved if the government make laws regarding nutritious food but others think that it is the matter of personal choice and personal responsibility. Discuss both views and give your opinion.<NL>
essay: Nowadays, healthcare condition is becoming more and more essential to each individual. Some people argue that the government should take measures to improve health of their citizens by imposing food laws. Others believe that everyone has responsible for their own health. This essay will discuss both points of view before coming to a reasoned conclusion.<NL><NL>On the one hand, in fact governments play a critical role to ensure well-being of their citizens. First of all, governments are responsible for the quality and safety of food in the market, they could introduce strict laws to make sure that public heath will not be damaged by polluted or expired food. Moreover, using unauthorized chemicals, selling unhygienic and low-quality food should be forbidden by the government. For example, eating fast food may lead to severe diseases such as increase in blood cholesterol, raise blood pressure and obesity. In some countries, the government imposes a high tax on junk food with the objective of discouraging its consumption. All of these are measures that can have a positive impact on public health.<NL><NL>On the other hand, in my opinion healthy lifestyle is a choice and habit of an individual, each person should hold accountable for their health, and the government cannot monitor the lifestyle of every citizen.  For instance, if people follow a sedentary lifestyle such as eating junk food, being a potato couch, being ignorant to break their bad habit and so on, they will surely suffer from physical health issues. However, the government cannot do much to help these people. Furthermore, the choices of individuals greatly affect the overall health condition of a nation. Thus, each person should choose more suitable food according to their own physical conditions, and retain a kind of good eating habit for long term so as to have a healthier lifestyle.<NL><NL>In shorts, there are several reasons for health problem, and I strongly believe that both governments and individuals should join hands to improve the situation.

task: Some people believe that the main purpose of schools is to turn children into good citizens and workers instead of benefitting them individually.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: There is belief that says "The main purpose of schools is to turn children into good citizens and workers instead of benefitting them individually". I mostly agree to this statement. A school teachs not only an academic lesson but also a social lesson to correct students' conduct. Moreover almost all school have similar lessons, so students will grow up to be same good adults. But maybe there are some places that are not similar to others.<NL><NL><NL><NL>First of all, In every school, they teach general academic subjects such as Math, Science, English and etc. In addition to these subjects, there are lessons intented to make the students become responsible citizens of the society. For example, social studies or law studies that teach students what they should and should not do. And that they will recieve punishment if they do something wrong. Also, when students spending their time in schools, they will learn how to behave and interact with each other. School disciplinary is also the way to guide children to the good path.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Furthermore, because every school have the same standard for the graduated students. Their curriculums tend to be the same. And that has a negative effect on the student. Because everyone has his own talent. Teaching students the same thing doesn't mean that thay will get equal score. To illustrate, when someone who's good at drawing and someone who's good at Math study Algebra together, he who excels at Math will do better. But, does this mean that students who get bad grades are bad student? No, they may be bad at Math but they have something they good at too. Unfortunately that their capabilities have to be measured with an only same standard.<NL><NL><NL><NL>However, some schools may not be like the others. There are a few schools whose intent are not just to bring up their student to be good people but encourage them to be the best version of themself. These schools still have the same requirement for their students to meet. but they support things that are not in the requirement too. To give examples, some schools permit students to join clubs of their interests after studying periods, such as, art club, music club and sports club. Furthermore, these schools curriculum may not limit to just science course and social studies course. They have other course like literature, management and art course too.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To sum it up, every school have similar ways of teaching and preparing their students to become good citizens and workers of the societies. Yet, they teach the same things to every students , despite the fact that everyone is unique and has his own way of learning. Therefore, you could say that this way of teaching doesn't benefit their students individually. That's why i agree with this statement. However, there might be some schools that do it differently. While keeping the standards like other schools, they support their students individually too. For their intentions that students will grow up not only to be good citizens, but also to be themself that they dream of.

task: 23.Some people think the main purpose of schools is to turn the children into good citizens and workers rather than to benefit them as individuals. To what extent do you agree or disagree? Write an essay with no less than 250 words.
essay: Determining the goal of schools is always an interested issue. Numerous people assume that the main purpose of schools is to turn the children into good citizens and workers. However, in my opinion, the major target of studying in schools is to benefit learners as individuals. This essay will discuss both of these aspects.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, set of people believe that study in schools can help people accelerate their knowledge and relevant skills such as teamwork, social relationship, or decision-making. Hence, these sources are strongly supporting to their career. In addition, theories in the classes are fundamental lectures which often include basic principles or regulations. Accordingly, by observing these information, a person can gain the good citizen certificate. Consequently, people can easily become good residents or excellent workers.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, and in my point of view, a good residents or excellent workers is only the grounds to benefit a person as individual because a person can only receive the benefits when they can understand them. For example, learning in school can help people proactive their finance plan. Therefore, they can decide what they want to do or to obtain. Thus, regulations are only support tools in the development progress of the society. Consequently, each person is knowing what decisions made them better.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, turning the children into good citizens and workers are only a number of benefits of learning in schools. The main purpose of schools is to benefit students as individuals.

task: Some people think that the main purpose of school is to turn children into good citizens and workers, rather to benefit them as individuals. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Some communities argue that the main objective of the school is to turn juveniles into good inhabitants and workers, rather than to advantage them as individuals. In my opinion, I partially agree with this statement, and I will elaborate on it in this essay. <NL><NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, in today's world, the majority of young people attend school and dedicate a significant portion of their time to it. As a result, they can learn about acting politely, which leads to kind and respectful folks. Moreover, when they play with various friends, they can learn social skills so they will be good workers. For example, some studies show that if children do not go to school and stay at home, young nations will turn into criminal people. In addition, most criminal communities have no mates so they do not know how to communicate with each other. Therefore, in schools, study is not the only thing to learn there are a lot of crucial things to learn from that place.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, academies do not exist to make good people and gangs. Furthermore, they should teach and help find juvenile talents. For instance, nowadays, our society has various jobs and we do not know which one suits us and which one wants to do. However, In South Korea, numerous educational institutions only teach main subjects such as Korean, English and mathematics consequently, many pupils cannot find their abilities so they lose way about their future. For this reason, academies ought to assist in finding student's talents, and it will benefit our communities.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, I partially agree with this statement. Schools must teach their pupils to turn into good citizens and workers and also help them find abilities because it is essential. So, we must teach them to balance, and that will be good not only for the young public but also for our societies.

task: Some people think the main purpose of schools is to turn the children into good citizens and workers rather than to benefit them as individuals. To what extent do you agree or disagree
essay: In contemporary society, the primary purpose of schooling has been under heated debate. Many people hold the view that transforming students into good citizens and workers is the fundamental goal of education rather than concentrating on individual betterment. From my perspective, I agree with the given sentiment and this course of the essay will elaborate carefully to provide the reasons for my personal opinion.<NL><NL><NL><NL>First and foremost, it is likely universal that a good individual should be useful to certain communities. It means that a well-skilled person might not be defined as a good one if those harms or are unsupportive to society. Therefore, schools in which children's perspectives could be changed officially and openly should mainly focus on educating moral lessons and qualifies alongside particular subjects or skills. Being community-minded, for example, seem to be a necessary characteristic which is needed to be taught by school education, especially in fast-paced life in which there is likely sympathy insufficient. In a nutshell, a community could not be prosperous unless every single citizen is dedicated to bigger purposes.<NL><NL><NL><NL>However, it is indicated that generally moral lessons are unlikely the only target of schooling since the development of societies relies significantly on single and personal innovations. specifically, Throughout the countless year of humankind's life, there was numerous innovative inventions and explorations that were undertaken by genius brains that have been changing human life totally and positively such as America's exploration and invention of the internet and computers, or chronic disease treatments. Therefore, alongside the primary goal, seeking and nurturing individual talents should be taken into consideration in order to create a quality workforce for our community.  Seeking talent shows, for example, specific courses, and modern facilities should be provided free for children when they are still in school seats.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, in spite of individualism development in contemporary society schools should play the main role in educating the young generation to turn out useful and well-educated people in their community. Besides, increasing personal betterment is not likely less crucial, however, it does not seem the major purpose of education.

task: Some people believe that the main purpose of schools is to turn children into good citizens and workers instead of benefitting them individually.<NL><NL>To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Studying is one of the most crucial parts of people's lives. If a question about the main objective of the school is addressed, it will be challenging for us to make a decision. Some people are firm believers in changing pupils to good citizens. Others, however, had shown devotion to not necessary. This essay agrees that schools have to turn students into good workers because they can learn to follow rules and social skills.<NL><NL><NL><NL>The first and most obvious one is that students spend more time at school than at home. As a result, pupils can learn how to respect other people both in the same ages and older people such as teachers. Moreover, in school, teachers can obligate the student to follow the rule, for example, to be on time and be honest in tests. Consequently, kids will know the fundamental rules in the school and will learn the punishments if they do not follow these. Therefore, they can learn how to be a good citizen in the future.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Furthermore, another reason is that students can learn social skills. According to the research in a local university in Bangkok, it indicates that kids who lack  friends will become introverted and might have mental problems leading to a crime. In contrast, School is the place that many kids staying together to learn how to survive in  society using  social skills such as communication and negotiation. So they can learn how to work as  teamwork.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, there are several objectives for the school however the most important one is teaching junior to be  good people in the forthcoming. In my perspective, as children are the foundation of the future so we have to attend to the younger generation and hope that they will become good citizens in the future.

task: Some people think that the main purpose of schools is to teach children to be a good citizen or worker rather than to benefit them as individuals. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: OWING TO THE FACT THAT SOME PEOPLE SPEND THEIR ENTIRE LIFE GETTING AN EDUCATION JUST TO SERVE THEIR COUNTRY IN ONE WAY OR ANOTHER I TOTALLY AGREE THAT EDUCATION DOES NOT BENEFIT PEOPLE IN THEIR PERSONAL GROWTH AS INDIVIDUALS. <NL><NL>TO START WITH A NUMBER OF PEOPLE STUDY EXTENSIVELY IN OTHER TO BE RECRUITED INTO THE MILITARY TO HELP THE GOVERNMENT FIGHT COMBATS, THEREBY IMPEDING THEIR UNIQUE DEVELOPMENT THAT COMES WITH FAMILY BONDS AND SELF DISCOVERY. IT IS DUE TO THE FACT THAT ALOT OF PEOPLE LOOSE THEIR LIVES FIGTHING GLOBAL WARS. THEREFORE, THERE IS A CONSTANT NEED FOR REINFORECEMENTS LIVING PEOPLE WITHOUT THEIR LOVED ONES. ACCORDING TO A SURVEY THAT WAS CARRIED OUT IN AUSTRALIA, A THOUSAND PEOPLE LOOSE THEIR LIVE FIGHTING ANNUALLY, YET A LARGE NUMBER ARE COAXED INTO JOINING FROM THE AGES OF EIGHTEEN.<NL>ACCORDING TO POPLUAR BELIEVE, IT CAN BE CLEARLY OBSERVED THAT HUMANS ARE GROOMED FROM A TENDER AGE TO SERVE THE GOVERNMENT REGARDLESS OF HOW MANY LIVES ARE LOST.<NL><NL>ANOTHER POINT TO CONSIDER IS THE LAWS THAT ARE STRICTLY TAUGHT IN SCHOOLS WHICH GOVERN THE WAY OF LIFE OF THE PUBLIC. IT IS INTERESTING TO NOTE THAT THE PAYMENT OF TAXES IS A VERY KEEN SUBJECT IN A BRANCH OF  SOCIAL SCIENCE COURSE WHICH IS COMPULSORY FOR BEGINNERS IN MIDDLE SCHOOL. MOREOVER, EMPHASIS PLACED ON THE IMPORTANCE OF OBEYING THE RULES OF STRICT PAYMENT WHICH IS TAUGHT TO UPLIFTS ONE AS A GOOD CITIZEN. ADMITTEDLY, IN THE AFFOREMENTIONED  COURSE THERE ARE NO GUIDES ON BEING A BETTER HUMAN, IT ONLY DENOTES WHAT PEOPLE CAN DO FOR ITS SOCIETY.<NL><NL>TO CONCLUDE, I SUPPORT THE NOTION THAT SAYS SCHOOLING NOWADAYS DOES NOT BENEFIT A PERSON FOR HIS OWN GOOD BUT RATHER FOR THE SOCIETY BECAUSE OF WHAT IS BEING PRIORITIZED IN THE SCHOOL SYSTEM AND THE LURES THAT COME WITH JOINING THE FORCES.

task: Nowadays celebrities are more famous for their glamour and wealth than for their  achievements, and this sets a bad example to young people.  To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?
essay: it is true that some celebrities are known for their gla  the work they do. While I agree that these celebrities set a bad example for children, I  believe that other famous people act as positive role models.  On the one hand, many people do achieve fame without really working for  may have inherited money from parents, married a famous or wealthy person, or they  may have appeared in gossip magazines or on a reality TV programme. A good  example would be Paris Hilton, who is rich and famous for the wrong reasons. She  spends her time attending parties and nightclubs, and her behaviour promotes the  idea that appearance, glamour and media profile are more important than hard work  and good character. The message to young people is that success can be achieved  easily, and that school work is not necessary.  On the other hand, there are at least as many celebrities whose accomplishments  make them excellent role models for young people. Actors, musicians and sports stars  become famous idols because they have worked hard and applied th  develop real skills and abilities. They demonstrate great effort, determination and  ambition, which is required for someone who wants to be truly successful in their  chosen field. An example is the actor and martial artist Jackie Chan, who has  world famous through years of practice and hard work. This kind of self  can inspire children to develop their talents through application and perseverance.

task: Young people who commit crimes should be treated in the same way as adults who commit crimes. To what extend do you agree or disagree?t
essay: In this modern era, youngsters who commit offences should be punished in the similar ways like mature people. I do think that younger criminals should be behaved less strictly than older offenders. In this eassy, i will discuss the viewpoint and give relevent ideas about the issue.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with, young adults are less matured compared to adults this is why they should not be considered in same punishedments.Furthermore, sometimes they are more susceptible to being afflicted by bad peers or role models.To make an exmaple, many of them may join the aggressive gangs,in which they commit a sort of illegal works like; smoking, teasting, hijacking and so on. Therefore, the youth should not be punished the same as the grown man who committing the types of offensive words.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Besides, less proper guidance and violations from one's parents can be the main reasons for youngstars becoming criminals.In addition , nowadays parents are often busy with work so that they may be involved with some unwanted crimes like stealing something pen,pencil,sharpner and many more.To explain , punishments must be more flexible for children having such backgrounds. Thus, in this way, it is significant to consider their circumstance and why they inevitably commit crimes.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, if youngstars commit crimes, their lack of responsibility and surroundings should be considered when they are handled by authorities, in order to rehabilitate them effectively. I do believe that age should be considered while punishing because it will help in reducing crime in the society in future.

task: In many countries, more and more young people are leaving school and unable to find jobs after graduation. What problems do you think youth unemployment will cause to the individual and society? Make some suggestions to solve the problem.
essay: Our modern world nowadays faces many challenges, One of the most important one is Unemployment among young people. In many countries, People have problems  finding jobs after their graduation. In this essay, we will discuss the reasons behind this problem, and what are the best solutions to ease it.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Our society finds unemployment a serious issue and plays a major impact on individuals and the community. with regard to the impact on the individual, A person can not generate money without a job, So jobless people will burden their own families because they have to work harder to cover the expenses of their children, instead of enjoying their old age. Moreover, pupils are not able to grasp social and learning skills without a career. Also, unemployment has a negative influence on  society by making people stressed, and frustrated, and as a result of this, People might do illegal things such as becoming drug addicts and joining gangs.<NL><NL><NL><NL>There are many suggestions to solve this problem, Firstly, governments can build industries to broaden their career horizon. In addition to the previously mentioned point, The government should add social lessons to the school's curriculum so they can assist the students to develop their career skills. Secondary , making vocational training  a part of the graduation mission can help them learn academic subjects and earn money at the same time. As a final point, the government should promote local job centres. The activities of these centres should be organized, so the students can easily access job information.<NL><NL><NL><NL>in summary, unemployment is a massive subject, As might lead to serious problems for society and individuals, Such as joining gangs and making people frustrated. so, the government should look for the resolutions like building companies and developing job centres.

task: In many countries, more and more young people are leaving school and unable to find jobs after graduation. What problems do you think youth unemployment will cause to the individual and society? Make some suggestions to solve the problem.
essay: Unemployment among young people is an ongoing and increasing situation in many countries around the world. The fact that students cannot find jobs after graduation is the cause of certain complications and can be addressed/solved/tackled/resolved using several methods .<NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with, there are a huge number of issues related to young jobless people on a personal as well as community level. Firstly, in terms of finance, young people cannot generate income unless they have a career. Becoming financially dependent, they can face a lot of difficulties in maintaining their daily life. Also, they may become a burden to their own family, especially their parents who have to work harder and harder to cover their expenses instead of enjoying old age. Moreover, workless people are one of the reasons that make social evils more serious. A person without a job usually spends most of the time doing nothing, which makes it easy for them to engage in wrongdoing such as robbery, theft, and drug addiction. <NL><NL><NL><NL>To minimize and partially solve this problem,  education for the younger generations as well as government action are the most important. First of all, schools should equip students with practical skills and organize career orientation sessions for students. By doing this, it can be easier for them to find jobs after graduation. Also, motivating and encouraging students to participate in vocational training after leaving school for both studying and earning an income can help ease the problem. Furthermore, the government should promote the operation of local career and job placement centres. The activities of these centres should be propagated so that young people can easily access more job information.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, unemployment among young people today is a serious situation and affects both themselves and society as a whole, but this can be tackled with proper education from schools and assistance from the government.

task: In many countries, more and more young people are leaving school and unable to find jobs after graduation. What problems do you think youth unemployement will cause to the individual and the society? Give reasons and make some suggestions.
essay: In several countries, nowadays, most teenagers commit to end their study, then majority of the fresh graduate student are looking it so tough to find occupations. This problem would cause the lack of workforces to fulfil certain position in the societies. There are some reasons why these problems occured and two solutions which can be used to deal with these matters.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Most of the youngsters feel that they choose their major incorrectly.
