This matter makes them struggle so hard to opt a proper and suitable work for them. This, finally, becomes an obstacle for the graduated student to seek a job; perhaps this the reason why fresh-graduated student numbers are getting more increase.<NL><NL><NL><NL>There are two remedies might be able to utilize to tackle these problems. The fresh graduate students, perhaps, should take special qualification courses or trainings in order to gain their skill which are needed to get an occupation. Some company might offer several jobs which simply meet with certain qualification. This would assist the youth unemployment to obtain jobs. Providing the pre-graduate student with an intensive counceling is equally crucial. As a result of the youth emotional which is still unstable yet, this would trap them into the uncertain circumstances. Hence, some guidances from the university counsellor might help.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclution, due to unmatch program which has been picked by the youth and their mental also bother them to make a decision, this causes most of the graduate students were not fit to any works. However, by giving them professional courses and guiding them with counselling class, it would be the best actions to cope with these situations.

task: Some believe that people are naturally born as leaders while others feel that leadership skills can develop.<NL><NL>Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay: A section of society is of the opinion that leadership skills are innate characteristics whereas others oppose it.I agree with the latter because it can be learnt.This essay will discuss both sides of the argument as well as my stance in the subsequent paragraphs with examples.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On  one hand ,there are several reasons people opine that leadership is an  inborn feature.some skills can be seen that run in the family.For example ,Shatta wale is a  famous musician because he was born into a family of musicians.Both his mother and father are famous artists.Moreover, a person who is a leader starts from their children by how they organise people .<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand,I and some schools of thought opine that leadership can be  learnt.There are instances a person is not born into a family of leaders but turns out to be a good leader.Individuals attend schools to  able to learn how to manage individuals.For instance ,to be a president of a country,one should have a  good educational background.Furthermore,it can be acquired by Votes.To illustrate,in  nursing training  to be a president or financial secretary people must vote for the individual before.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion,This essay argued both sides of the argument about whether leadership skills are learnt or developed.Although some schools of thought and I believe that leadership can be acquired by Votes and hard work,others opine that it  innate characteristic.

task: Some believe that people are naturally born leaders while others feel that leadership skills can develop. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: There is a tremendously controversial prospective heating up a debate the origin of the leadership. While some people hold a strong view that it is a natural skill, the opposites make a statement that a person can become a leader through the experience as well as the knowledge. This essay will discuss both point of view and my personal opinion about this phenomenon<NL><NL><NL><NL>Evidently, a wealth of people are naturally born leaders since they own the strong characteristics to become a leader such as being outgoing person, gregarious and full of energy. All these personality traits help the leader to manage, to gather people together and to inspire and motivate them. Vladimir Putin, a president of Russia can be cited as an outstanding example that he natural born political leader who inspires many people with his boundless professional abilities, charisma and display astounding skills. Hence, being sociable, charisma and having strong traits are important natural skills for being a chief.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Although the leadership skill is one of natural skills, I still belive that it can be built and enhanced.  There are a bunch of elements that make someone a great leader, such as discipline and resourcefulness, which can definitely be developed through one's upbringing and life period. For instance, to become a pioneer as well as a president of Vietnam, Hochiminh had to spent three decades in this life on travelling around the world and  acquire the knowledge from developed nations in this time to find an ideal way to lead our country. Therefore, beside a natural skill, leadership can be developed by the experience in life. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, although a strong leader's talents and traits are both genetic and can be improved by training, observation, and a lot of hard work, there are many people born without natural leadership skills who can still become good leaders thank to their attemption.

task: Some believe that people are naturally born as leaders while others feel that leadership skills can develop. Discuss both views and give your opinion
essay: It can be observed that the issue of leadership has grown in importance over the last decades. This fact has brought to our lives the debatable aspect whether leaders have an intrinsic power to carry it out or, on the contrary it is other skills which can be developed. I will discuss both sides and I will express my opinion in the following essay.<NL><NL>As far as leaders are concerned, it goes without saying that their attitude can promote the idea of having born with this characteristic in a very successful way. Additionally, many people do believe that there is an awful lot of children who demonstrate these traits from the kindergarten. Hence, albeit they have never learnt these manners, they will grow older accordingly, and this plays an extremely important role. Therefore, not only are there people who have shown the mentioned features from the childhood, but also there is a complex myriad of relationship between management and personality. They are strongly interwoven, and would be really difficult to distinguish them.<NL><NL>On the other hand, it seems to be clear that had it not been for experience and exposure, many people would not have achieved to develop certain traits. In this case, it is highly remarkable that a staggering amount of people have boosted their authority abilities satisfactorily through training. For instance, by reading or even practising, we are quite likely to learn how doing it. It is, thus, when it comes to leadership, strongly indispensable to take into account the strong power of the discipline and diligence.<NL><NL>In the light of above exposed, I am inclined to believe that despite the fact many people could have borne with these characteristics, it is perfectly understandable that we could learn how we do it if we persevere in it.

task: Every day, millions of tons of food are wasted all over the world. Why do you think this is happening? And how can we solve this problem?
essay: Nowadays, to serve a billion people each day we need a huge of food and sometimes people can consume it. In the following essay, I discuss some of reason why people do it and how to solve that problem. <NL><NL><NL><NL>There are a hundred of reasons why a large amount of food is wasted every year. First, since most fresh foods, such as meat and vegetables, are perishable, they usually have expired or best before dates. This means that if people do not consume them quickly enough, <NL><NL><NL><NL>foods will be expired and no longer to use, which results in food waste.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Second, the way humans prepare foods also contributes to food waste. <NL><NL><NL><NL>For example, if foods are badly prepared, either at home or in the restaurant, people will confuse to eat and food waste will often occur as a result. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Nevertheless, there are also a variety of solutions to improve this trend. <NL><NL><NL><NL>First, even if some foods are not use for humans, they can be composted or used to feed livestock or animals. This would not only benefit the agriculture industry but also help reduce land filled organic matter that can be damaging to the environment. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Second, even if the food waste is not use for livestock, it can still be used as a material to produce renewable energy. For example, in Singapore and some develop nations have taken steps to turn organic matter from food waste into biogas, generating electrical power at very low costs. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, even though food waste seems not harmless in today’s world, there are various ways to recycle it. Feeding livestock and generate energy can be two of the most useful ways to tackle food waste.

task: Every day, millions of tons of food are wasted all over the world. Why do you think this is happening? And how can we solve this problem?
essay: There has been an ever-increasing trend that people discard an excessive amount of food waste from all corners of the world. Although this problem can be attributed to a great number of reasons, some feasible solutions can be considered to address this.<NL><NL><NL><NL>There are a number of reasons for this adverse tendency. The first reason for the rise in the amount of food waste is the increased supply of cheap and readily available food, which encourages people to buy more than they really need. For example, in order to increase sale revenue as well as compete with other brands, many fast-food restaurants nowadays have launched plenty of promotion programs such as “By 2 get 1 free”, which has attracted hundreds of customers and thus the huge amount of food waste will end up in landfills. Another reason is that in order to deal with busy lifestyles, people tend to buy food for the whole week rather than go to the supermarket on a daily basis. However, some kinds of fruits and vegetables easily become rotten within a few days and then thrown away.<NL><NL><NL><NL>A wide range of strong measures must be implemented, not only by the government but also by individuals, to combat food waste. This first solution is that the government can develop some action plans to raise consumers’ awareness of food appreciation. This could be done by getting people involved in global food campaigns such as Think.Eat.Save and anti-food waste campaign, helping their citizens to become more conscious consumers and when everyone is fully aware of this, they would think more carefully when it comes to shopping for food. In terms of each consumer, it is important to make a detailed shopping list before going to the supermarket. This way helps them to have time to prepare and decide wisely what products should be bought, which eventually saves a lot of unnecessary food.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, Although food waste seems inevitable in today’s world, there are various ways to improve this problem.

task: Some people think the best way to solve global environmental problems is to increase the cost of fuel.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To what extend do you agree or disagree<NL><NL><NL><NL>?
essay: Global environmental changes are unquestionably the most prevalent and worrying issues in any society, and their prevention should be taken seriously. Despite a few problems, such as plastic production and the absence of recycling, I reckon that the decision of the raising prices for fuel is definitely the best way to prevent the worldwide catastrophe.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On one hand, the main environmental issue of global warming is caused by two significant factors, which are burning fossil fuels and deforestation. Firstly, expensive fuel could actually decrease a number of cars bought by people due to the fact of economic purposes. As a consequence, people would have a lower level of horrible emissions, which are produced by cars. Secondly, if the amount of vehicles is stable, hundreds of new roads would not be needed, and more forests and parks could be saved. Therefore, the greenhouse effect, caused by transport pollution, could be managed by the natural process of carbon dioxide absorption.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, there are still a few factors, which could not be removed by changing a price tag. It is known that plastic has not been already replaced by other materials, so its production could not be immediately restricted. Moreover, most people are not used to recycling various types of waste, consequently, tons of rubbish are supposed to threaten the surrounding area. Therefore, hundreds of humans consider fuel price raising to be an inappropriate solution.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To conclude, despite varying opinions, I believe that the advantages of increasing the cost of fuel completely outweigh the relative disadvantages. Without a doubt, this solution would be the first useful step, which government should take in order to protect the environment.

task: Some people think the best way to solve global environmental problem is to increase the cost of fuel. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Environmental problems like pollution in this world is taking new upper limit and getting worsen day by day. Some individuals believe that the most effective way to deal with worldwide ecological difficulties is to raise the price of fuel. However, I am of the opinion that it will benefit the society to some extent only, which will be discussed in the following paragraphs.<NL>Increase in price of fuel will limit the personal transport of an individual to some levels and commuters will find other alternatives to travel on daily basic such as public transport or electric vehicles. Majorly the middle class families will be effected with this step and persuade them to follow local city transport in the sake of controlling pollution. Recently, in Delhi, the government took initiatives to control the personal vehicle on road by charging double amount on petrol purchase for own carriers, thus the output was quite effective and number of vehicles drop down approximately 80 percent from the service roads. <NL>However, on the other hand, the major contributors of air pollution are the airplanes. In that case lowering the price will not impact much as air travelling is carried by mostly rich people and it is part of luxury. People who prefer travelling by air as compare to road are always keeping the time limit as priority instead of money. Hence, increasing price will not lower the usage of air transport. Thus, we need to look for an alternative solution to minimize the pollution hazard. <NL>In conclusion, increasing price of fuel will profit the community in terms of limiting usage of personal conveyance, but for some who choose time as the limit instead of money will not be effected with this idea. Consequently, I believe inflation in price will not resolve the ecological problems.

task: Films and computers games containing violence are popular. Some people say they have negative effect on society and should be banned. Others say they are just harmless relaxation. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: In this century many teenagers like playing video or online games that contain violence, parents and people believe that it can have a bad effect and make them angry, and some say that films also make them  less patient and be less nicer I will discuss further in this essay about this topic.<NL><NL><NL><NL>First, right now more than half of the them have violence and killing so society thinks that it can affect young children, but not only do these have an age rate but they also decrease stress. Video games help many people with their anxiety and stress relief for example in workplaces where society has  room to rest and play, they will be more influenced because sometimes they forget how strong they are. Movies also can have a bad and a good effect it only depends on how the public sees the movie if you see it with a bad mindset even the nicest film in the world will have a bad impression on you.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Secondly, in many cases they really have a bad influence on children and teenagers and make them angrier, it happens when they are not ready to understand that  life in society is different from playing a game and they believe that they are mixed not separate, therefor they become harmful for the public around them. I think that it depends on the parents which is good for your child to play it or not.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To conclude, video games may have a bad effect on young adults but we should consider other options that can be a push for doing harmful activities like  the environments they are living in or the public they communicate with, but this subject needs more investigation in the future.

task: Some people think that illegal Internet downloads are having a negative effect on the music industry. Others feel that they have little or no impact on artists. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay: The music industry has changed vastly since the golden days of Beethoven and Mozart. With the rapid growth of the internet and smartphones, listening to music has become easier than ever. Instead of having to attend concerts, listeners can just plug their headphones into a smartphone and listen to music online. While this has its fair share of benefits, record labels have been hesitant to expand into the online music industry since it has various drawbacks, including piracy issues and monetization. In this essay, I will discuss the aforementioned issues as well as giving my own opinion.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On one hand, the explosive growth of online music websites has made it exponentially harder for record labels and artists to control and monetize their work. These people are concerned that as the internet music industry grows, so do the piracy issues. This may cause everyone to copy each other, making music seem unoriginal and uninterested. It can also discourage artists to produce and release music, as there are no ways for them to ensure that their music is being used as they intended as well as controlling where their works are being published. Overall, illegal Internet downloads can have negative effects on the artists and the music industry as a whole.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, having the ability to publish music on the internet - where millions of users are actively using and discussing every day - has helped new artists get discovered and grow. Moreover, the growth of music piracy has pushed streaming platforms to take extra steps to prevent illegal downloads. It's not hard to understand why in the early 2000s, record labels and artists were trying to take down music streaming platforms that were allowing users to download music freely and distribute it wherever they please. The most notable case of this is perhaps Napster, as this platform was taken down after a huge wave of protests to protect the rights of composers. Because of this, most streaming platforms like Spotify and Apple Music include features that help artists control their music distribution and monetization. Therefore, it's almost impossible to pirate music now, unlike in the 2000s. <NL><NL><NL><NL>To summarize, illegal Internet downloads can and have caused a ton of issues regarding piracy and monetization, but they helped push the development of tools to ensure these issues never happen again. Therefore, it's safe to say that illegal downloads aren't an issue in the modern world.

task: Nowadays, we are surround by advertising in our daily lives. Some people believe this has a positive effect on society. Others, however, say that it is a negative development. Discuss with both views and give your own opinion.
essay: Advertisements have been part of our daily activities for a long period of time now. There are those who believe that its benefits outweigh its drawbacks and vice versa. I, on the other hand, believe that there is more harm than good that these advertisements bring.<NL><NL><NL><NL> <NL><NL><NL><NL>Due to advertisements, we are able to be updated about upgraded products and trends that will surely make our lives easier. For instance, high-end cell phones and devices have been flooding the market and have shown different upgraded specifications and functions. Through advertisements, we are also being offered  the best deals like huge discounts and markdowns on once popular products. Advertisements have been constantly reminding us to check out the latest trends and upgrades. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Nonetheless, advertisements seem to have become more intrusive nowadays. The means resorted to catching the attention of consumers are barely filtered out already. On the internet, for example, advertisements have been popping up more often that  instantly distract the viewer from browsing the actual content he or she wishes to see. Another instance is paper flyers that have ended up being scattered anywhere in the streets and thus become garbage polluting the surroundings. Every nook and cranny is now covered with sorts of advertisements and has destroyed beautiful scenery. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, advertisements can be helpful in keeping us up to date with the latest improvements that will make our lives easier. However, due to unregulated postings, advertisements may have become more of a nuisance and distraction.

task: Some people think that increasing business and cultural contacts worldwide have positive influences on development; others think that they have negative effects on national identities. Discuss both views and give your own opinion."
essay: In the globalized society, the issue of increasing business and cultural communication worldwide has sparked considerable debate. Some contend that exposure to the culture of other countries too much will greatly negatively affect the acknowledgement of domestic history and culture. I strongly agree that increasing communication among countries fosters development both in personal and professional settings. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Opponents show concern about the fade of national identity by exposure to increasing cultural connections as the history and culture of the native country tend to be easily forgotten by the invasion of the exterior culture. For example, along with the increasing exposure to Western culture, most young adults are more likely to celebrate Christmas instead of some Chinese traditional festival since some young people are obsessed with the unknown culture. They might know the origin of Santa but they have no idea of the origin of the Dragon festival.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Proponents, as I am in favour of, hold the view that emphasizing  communication worldwide positively cultivates  development at individual, enterprise and country levels. At the individual level, worldwide information exchange and multiple languages communication improve the ability of critical thinking and academic learning. At the enterprise level, the popular trend of international trade and international companies provide more employment opportunities domestically. Moreover, the GDP of one country will also be fostered by increasing economic benefits of importation and exportation. Moreover, while young people are attracted to other cultures, the root cause is the lack of propaganda of their conventional culture and civilization. Under positive public guidance, such cultural erosion will be mitigated to some extent. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, while increasing communication in business and cultural settings has some negative effects on the acknowledgement of national identity so far, the positive effect outperforms its drawbacks by improving the personal and country development under correct guidance.

task: Some people believe that robots will play an important role in future societies, while others argue that robots might have negative effects on society.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: Nowadays, people think that robots will impact on future of societies. While it is commonly held belief they are affecting in a positive way that may enhance the future. There is also an argument that robots will have a negative effect on our future.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On one hand, robots can impact people’s lives in a positive way, they can do manual jobs faster with greater precision. Moreover, robots are cheap labour and they are more productive. Furthermore, they assist individuals with disabilities, make their lives more manageable and improve their quality of life. For example, Eufy vacuum can clean the house daily at the same time as the owner sets it in the beginning.<NL><NL><NL><NL>while acknowledging the potential challenges they may pose to society. In other words, they make the person more dependent and useless which can lead to big problems such as poverty. In addition, robots may decrease human interaction and the unemployment range will rise. For instance, today, some factories have started to abandon their employees and replace them with robots.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, there is no easy answer to this question. On balance, however, I tend to believe that people need robots to help them in some different tasks, but they need to use them with limitations to preventdependancy and miscommunication.

task: The range of technology available to people is increasing the gap between the rich and the poor. Others think it has an opposite effect. Discuss both view and give your opinions.
essay: In today’s world, the impact of technology on income inequality is a topic of intense debate. Some believe it widens the wealth gap, while others argue it can bridge it. This essay explores both viewpoints to assess the complex relationship between technology and socioeconomic disparities.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, technology can amplify the wealth gap as affluent individuals and well-funded corporations can employ automation and artificial intelligence in the workplace. This allows them to reduce labor costs, leading to job displacement and wage stagnation for the working class. For instance, in manufacturing, advanced robotics and automation can replace human workers, leading to job loss and downward pressure on wages, while the companies get the benefits of cost savings and increased profits. This automation-driven wealth accumulation can leave many individuals and communities struggling to keep up economically.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, technology can be a powerful tool in reducing income disparities. The digital revolution has made information and education more accessible. The advent of e-learning platforms and open-source educational resources allows individuals from economically disadvantaged backgrounds to acquire valuable skills, enhancing their employability. Additionally, technology facilitates innovative solutions to societal issues, exemplified by telemedicine, which provides cost-effective healthcare options to underserved communities, effectively bridging the healthcare disparity. The widespread use of smartphones has also created opportunities for micro-entrepreneurship and access to financial services, empowering individuals to improve their economic well-being.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, the impact of technology on the wealth gap is a complex and multifaceted issue. Its potential to either widen or narrow the wealth gap depends on how we approach its development and distribution, emphasizing access, education, and opportunities for all.

task: some people think watching TV is bad for children,while others think that watching TV has more beneficial effect on children. discuss both views and give your opinion
essay: While a group of people claim that the time spent  watching television is detrimental for youngsters, others argue that this trend is advantageous for them. Both approaches have their own shortcomings and merits in association with children and it is my firm belief that streaming TV is not doing any good to the juveniles.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To start with, the TV has long been a reign of traditional information radiators in the world, a source of reliable data to  many. Likewise, TV streaming services are considered  one of the most effective methods to raise kids at home regardless of the difficulties. For instance, they can learn the fundamentals of the world by closely engaging with captivating documentaries and series. On top of that it is an additional booster to the youth to hone their social and learning skills just through sitting in front of television programs. <NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, there are some people who oppose the idea of watching television and its negative impact on children. The first reason why some people evaluate streaming television as  a waste of time for younger generations. Furthermore,  after watching television for a certain amount of time, children become addicted to streaming these shows perpetually. In addition to ,that they also get exposed to  censored views without even a restriction which poses a direct threat to their healthy development to become a successful individual in today's society. <NL><NL><NL><NL>From my perspective, I strongly believe that the members of the younger generation can agree with me in this matter in which young people who are more vulnerable to the changes that are occurring in the surrounding echo system, should stay away from streaming excessive Television though some kids can benefit greatly.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To sum up, although some side effects in either realm, psychological or physical aspects, can be experienced by the young, they would be eradicated if supervising control can be considered by seniors, prohibiting them from violence for example. Thereby, through watching  fruitful programmes children can broaden their horizons about the world.

task: Some people believe that climate has the greatest affect on people's way of life. Others believe that the economy of a region has the greatest effect. This is both the views and give your opinion.
essay: Some argue that climate is the main factor determining people's way of life, while others think the economy of a region is the most important. I agree with both suggestions and I will explain afterwards with my opinion.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, climate is a strong power that changes many parts of our lives. It decides what we can grow, what animals we can grow, and how much water we have. The climate also affects the kind of clothes and houses we need. For example, the public in hot, sunny places lives differently from those in cold areas. Where it rains a lot, society often relies on farming, whereas in dry places, they might depend on things like tourism for money.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, the economy in a place really changes how people live. In areas with lots of money, pupils can get better schooling, healthcare, and jobs. A strong economy creates more progress better buildings, more jobs, and a higher standard of living. For instance, in cities with a strong economy, you'll find new buildings, lots of job options, and a good way of life.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In my opinion, both the climate and the economy have a big role in how people live. Climate can decide what you can grow or raise, but the economy gives us the money and chances to live well. In places with a strong economy, people can bring food from other places or use technology to handle climate challenges.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, both climate and the economy matter a lot. Climate affects what is possible, but the economy gives us what we need to live well. The balance between these two things decides how good life is in a place.

task: Films and computer games containing violence are popular. Some people say they have negative effects on society and should be banned. Others say they are just harmless relaxation. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay: It is a reality that violent movies and video games are becoming prevalent in modern society. While some contend that it has detrimental effects on people and society and ought to be outlawed, others think that these activities are simply good ways to unwind. I concur with these points of view and will talk about them in this post.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, youngsters often mimic violent behavior they see in movies or video games, which is one of the main reasons why they have a negative impact on society. For instance, children are drawn to the dramatic violence and interest in these violent video games, particularly Counterstrike, and desire to practice their actions in real life. The second explanation is that youngsters are more likely to develop a gaming addiction. Children are consequently too lethargic to engage in outside activities and would develop obesity.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, the benefits of movies and video games for society come from the fact that kids can refuel after watching or playing them. For instance, many individuals unwind by watching esport tournaments, which are developed annually with the aim of entertaining people and promoting video games worldwide. Additionally, these violent movies and activities, particularly the games, may aid in the development of new friendships for the children as well as enhance cognitive plasticity.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, even while violent movies and video games are bad for society, they can also be helpful for youngsters in terms of useful relaxation.

task: Some people think that robots are importanat for human’s future development. Others think that robots have negative effects on society. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: It is considered by many that robots play a significant role in the growth of mankind, while others believe that it has an adverse impact on the community. This influenced other restaurant owners too as it attracts customers. As a result, waiters protested against all this strategy. Henceforth, technology serves as a bane to the citizens.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In a nutshell, technology portrays

task: Some people think that robots are important for humankind's future development. Others think that robots have negative effects on society. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: In this age of technocracy, among many wonderous inventions, robots have proven to be the most promising of them all. Many deem it to be a worthy addition to our lives, but contrarians to this notion believe that, it can prove detrimental to our society. In this essay, I will ruminate on both sides, before making my statement.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Those  who consider robotics to be vital for the advancement of civilization, do so by observing several quality-of-life changes brought by it. Such as, the integration of rudimentary assembly line machines used for product manufacturing. Moreover, there exist self-driving cars, waiting to revolutionize methods of transportation. Additionally, there have been major strides in the development of life-like androids. All in all, the future seems bright indeed according to these supporters.<NL><NL><NL><NL>However, trepidatious ones vouching against this technological progress, do so by witnessing drawbacks brought by these gizmos. Like, mass lay-offs caused by the introduction of automatic tools in many factories around the world. Furthermore, these people do not look favourably at the idea of automation in vehicles, as they are wary of hazards associated with it. Also, they hold fast to the belief that, there will come a day when automatons will completely render human talent superficial. As an example, the advent of artificial intelligence art (AI art) has filled artists around the globe with dread, as they think that they will soon be replaced by their man-made counterparts.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To conclude, In my opinion, both views of this argument possess merit. Thus, to ensure a better tomorrow, moderation must be made in terms of the development of bots.

task: Some people think that the range of technology available to people is increasing the gap between the rich and the poor. Others think it has the opposite effect. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: While there is an increasing concern that technological advances increase the gap between the affluent and the poor people, some people argue that technological change narrow this gap. This essay would discuss both perspectives as well as state my opinion for the former one.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, technology exacerbates between the wealthy and the poor. Technological advancements might lead to job replacements in some current areas. The demand for highly-skill workers in some fields such as artificial intelligence or data analysis increase whilst lower-skilled jobs may see reduced demand. As a result, people who do monotonous and repetitive jobs will lose their jobs and result in income inequalities. Furthermore, the limited access to technology among the disadvantaged hinder them from benefiting technological advancements. Many technological products are prohibitively expensive and only the rich can afford to buy them. <NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, proponents of the opposing view contend that technological advancements are reducing income inequality. Technological change enables all individuals, irrespective socioeconomic background, to access education and services with affordable price. Consequently, the poor also have a better chance of landing a high-paid job, leading to increased income and a higher living of standard. In addition, technological advances increase productivity in wide range of fields. This might lead to the demand for job in many industrial zones increase and the poor can improve their income. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, certain innovations in technology might bridge the gap between the rich and the poor, while certain developments help us to narrow down this gap and make our lives better.

task: Some people say that advertising has positive economic effects. Others think it has negative social effects because it will make people feel dissatisfied with who they are and what they have. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay: There are oppsing views on the impact of advertising,some people argue It has benificial with economic.However,other claim that would effect social in the negative way bacause people will feel dissatisfied when other have and they don’t have.In my view,I believe it has positive way in ecnomic,while undoubtedly it also has disadvantages in social.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Advertising is the major way for modern companies to advertise their product to consumers.It can let comsumer have a first impact about their’s product then comsumer would buy it when shopping in supermarket.In fact,research supposed people will prefer to buy product that have seem before rather than not.Futhermore,it provide widely type of products to consumer,so they can buy their favour product.Besides that,advertising is a profesional skill so company should engage employee who can plan a good advertisment.As a result,it provide a lot of job opportunities.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand,advertisment can crete a gap in society.The people who can afford the product which in advertisment will feel superior and look down people who can’t afford it.For instance,the reason of regulate school uniform is demolish the difference between student,and prevent student had been racist by other.As the result,those that cannot obbtain advertist product will try to make money from illegal activities to satisfied their desire.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion,advertising has a lot of advantages in economic such as more consumer to purchase their products and provide more opportunities to employement.While it also has negative way in social bacause it will break people’self esteem and increase rate of crime.In my opinion,undoubtedly advertisment can improve economic but need some law to regulate it to prevent social issue.

task: Some people think that robots are important for human’s future development. Others think that robots have negative effects on society. Discuss both views and give your opinion
essay: In recent times, the development in the field of robotics has increased rapidly and its prevalence can be noticed in many places. Many believe robots are crucial for human development whereas some argue they have a negative effect on society. This essay would discuss both  views with empirical evidence and conclude with my opinion.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with, artificial intelligence is one of the greatest milestones achieved by humans. They can be used to study places which are inaccessible to humans. For instance, the world-renowned rover Curiosity, was sent to Mars for a detailed analysis of the planet's features. Without robotic technology, it would take another decade to achieve this feat. Hence, this technology plays a vital role in the development of mankind.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, robotic machines have replaced men in many jobs. For instance, in many food and packaging industries, programmed machines are used as they are more efficient and fast when compared to a worker. Furthermore, a robot can work for long hours without any breaks, thus increasing in productivity of a company. This scenario can lead to an increase in the unemployment rate causing a detrimental effect on  society.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To sum it up, robots have a pivotal role in  future development and the need for them is inevitable. Although this development has a downside, considering the future technological advancement, robotic science and technology are essential to achieve it.

task: Some people say that playing computer games is bad for children in every aspects. Others say that playing computer games can have positive effects on the way children develop. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: While some people believe that playing computer games is detrimental for children, others claim that it has some benefits in terms of their development. In my opinion, playing computer games should be considered  positive for children’s development as individuals.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, it is obvious that spending a lot of time in front of the screen and playing computer games can bring lots of problems for children’s health, especially their vision. When kids play video games being slumped in front of the screen for hours, it definitely makes their eyes dry and, therefore, destroys the protection layer. Furthermore, in some cases, young people will face other severe issues connected with losing their vision clearness, so at the end of the day, they will have to wear glasses in order to correct their vision and see the objects around them clearly. Another key problem that could be brought about by playing computer games is addiction. Children do not have highly developed brains to protect themselves from the mental issues that they could face by being in virtual reality non-stop. As a result, many parents ought to monitor their children in order to prevent them from being addicted and committing suicide, for example.  <NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, when children spend their time by forming strategies in order to complete the next level of the game, they surely become more responsible for the result and gain important skills such as strategic thinking and tactic vision which might be helpful for them in their study in the university and the future life, and I agree. By being involved in the process of building a strategy and being responsible for the results, children will be aware of the future consequences of their failure. Moreover, playing video games encourages some young people to be interested in coding and software development and, probably, choose it as their future major in university.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To sum up, although lots of people vary in their opinion, I strongly believe that playing games on the computer may provide children with many benefits in their future adult lives.

task: Some people believe that climate change has the greatest effect on people’s way of life. Others believe the economy of the region has the greatest effect. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay: Many topics we can gain from newspapers or social media and climate change is one of them. Nowadays, plenty of people assume climate change can increase the temperature of the earth so it forces people to adapt with that situation. Furthermore, the economy in the place where we live also makes us adjust our lifestyle to be fit with our environment. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Climate change has been a hot topic lately since it gives great impact on humans and the most noticeable problem is an increasing of earth temperature. In Indonesia for instance, people who live in Bandung, which is known as highland, need Air Conditioner (AC) and it's an adaptation done by humans to keep feeling cold. Climate change not only can affect temperature but also it makes messy weather schedule.This random weather creates new habits that are made so people can go their whole lives without being bothered by the weather.  Workers who always bring their umbrella and consume vitamins are behaviors that came from random weather problems.<NL><NL><NL><NL>People who live in Jakarta and people who live in Semarang surely has different lifestyles and it because the rate of economy there. Region where have high rate economy make sellers can sell their products with high price as they know people who live there can afford to buy it. Same way of selling can not applied in low rate economy region. That different makes people need to adjust their lifestyle to place where they live. For example, Semarang people only need Rp 10.000 to get Nasi Padang (Indonesia traditional food) but in Jakarta you need to spend as much money as Rp 15.000 to get the same food. Not only that, the economic rate in a region also give impact to the government about the tax rate. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Either climate change and region economic rate can affect people’s live. In my own opinion climate change give more impact compared region economic rate since climate change could involve to world community but region economic rate only affects that region.

task: Some people are of the view that students should keep a gap of one year without study between school and university. While others think it affects learning.  <NL><NL><NL><NL>Discuss both viewpoints and give your opinion by giving relevant reasons and examples.
essay: University submission is perhaps time-consuming for people, and some think it will be beneficial if a gap year system is applied between the last year in senior high and the university application period.However, there are parts of the community that think the gap year policy will degrade students' ability to learn. This essay will discuss further two perspectives regarding the one-year gap scheme and illustrate each case.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On one hand, gap year regulation gives both parents and students time in preparing the application requirements thoroughly. In fact, kids are enforced to meet the qualification where they have to be  straight-A students in class as well as involved actively in the community. Apparently, being a part of  society consumes  extra time and some children are prioritised to have an extra lesson instead. For instance, some children who are not prepared for an exam tend to take the private lessons outside school time which obviously affects their availability in taking volunteering in their neighbourhood. As a result, their submission process might be affected due to this situation. Therefore, the gap year system will suit high schoolers who want to continue their study.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, some might think this system is reckless where children might be affected and loosen their strategy through university. It is understandable that youngsters are unstable especially if they are not encouraged. Giving them a space of time is a bit risky from some perspectives. To illustrate, after graduation, there will be no formal supervision for the kids which means some can lose their motivation and spirit during the period of preparation. Although they are grownups, their instability dominates in decision-making. Instead of being well-prepared, a gap year might impact their enthusiasm to learn.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To conclude, gap year regulation impact differently amongst children. It might be a positive decision where students focus on one activity at a time resulting high acceptance rate in university. Nevertheless, it might affect negatively youngsters which impacts their learning processes.

task: some people  think that robots are very important to humans future development  while others think they are dangerous and have negative effects on society . discuss both views and give your opinion
essay: Some argue that machines with artificial intelligence are critical to improving people's futures, while others argue that the invention of robots is a risk that can have negative consequences for society.I believe robots are crusial becouse without robots we cannot be achive the production that is required.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In many countries, robots have become crucial to the development of the economy as they engage in not only manufacturing but also service industries. Robots can survive in conditions that humans cannot, for example,roots are working in a mining area where the air contains poisonous gases and they extract valuable resouse to use for human  . In addition, automated machines are used in car manufacturing because they can work long hours continuously and, in most cases, are more effective than humans.Therefore, global productivity has increased significantly, which is good for future human development. I believe this is a great advantage of robots.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, robots can be used in military and anti-social tasks such as causing harm to people and other tasks because the machines only obey their owner's rules and may not consider human feelings or other humans' values. For example, a major Japanese corporation built military robots; after an experiment, they deactivated those robots; however, one of the robots automatically reactivated and connected to the Internet to gather information and become stronger.I believe that this negative impact of rebots can be eliminated by taking strong regulatory measures<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, robots can positively influence human future  development by increasing global productivity; however, they might be dangerous unless controlled by the govenment .

task: Some people think that robots are very important for human’s future development. Others, however, think that robots are a dangerous invention that could have negative effect on society. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: The phenomenon of the effects of robots technologies development has aroused wide concern among various circles. Divergent as people's views on the issue in question may be, I believe that it is more beneficial for humans in the future.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On one hand, some people think robots will take their job away because the expenditure on robots is noticeably less than human salary. For instance, the basic cost between machines and human has dramatically different. Machines only need fuel and time-to-time maintenance, but a human requires much more, ranging from housing, food, and clothes to transportation. It reflects a company's spending on machines and humans respectively. As a result, some people strongly reject the development of robots.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, I believe that automatons can bring us a more wide range of benefits. One of the advantages is that they can work in dangerous environments such as clearing the wall of tall buildings and deforestation. This will in turn prevent the accident occur. Another reason is better shipping efficiency with lower prices, it is beneficial to most businesses these days. For example, automatons shipping can run 24 hours a day which means the period of delivery will be decreased, and the price should be able to cut off half of the original shipping cost because it does not need to pay salary to a machine. Therefore, many people feel that robot development can bring us a better future.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Under this line of thinking, although there is a good reason in favour of the argument that robots are dangerous inventions for our future, I believe automatons development would replace us to finish the most basic work and allow people to live their own life.

task: Human activities have led negative effects on plant and animals all over the world. Some people think it is too late to do something about it. Others think there is still some time to take actions. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: The topic of the effect on plants and animals has been controversial. Some people believe that it is late to take action, whereas I agree with those who think that It is not too late to do something.<NL><NL><NL><NL>One of the most important reasons why people have thought that it is too late to take action is that  capitalism has taken over many places for constructing the building since the government has not taken any responsibility. This example shows that capitalism plays a major role in emission and that it has an effect on those lives<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, it seems to me that It is not too late to do something. To illustrate this, In recent news, in many countries in Europe, governments have been taking project for capitalists, they can obtain incentive if they are willing to reduce emissions. I agree with this point because it is one of the solutions<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, having considered both sides of this issue, although some people think it is too late to take action, I agree with those who think that it is not too late if we take an action as soon as possible.

task: Some people think that children should not watch television because it has negative effects, while others believe that televison helps children. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: Globally, a few humans believe that youngsters should use television but others do not have the same thoughts. In ,addition it serves as a form of entertainment for lads during holiday periods. task: Some people say that public sports facilities improve people health problems. Others argue that this development has insignificant effects on public health.<NL>Discuss both views and give your opinion

task: The range of technology available to people is increasing the gap between the rich and the poor. Others think it has an opposite effect. Discuss both views and give your opinion.<NL><NL><NL>Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
essay: The number of new building devices and tools is expanding, furthermore their prices are rising too.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Firstly, there is a growth of technological inventions and smart tools, gadgets.
