Rich people buy their children the latest models of Iphones, laptops not because of the reason to stand out, however their aim is - time. Time is money, money is time, they say. New devices do not require to spend much time on seeking information, communicating with foreign friends. a lot of children study abroad and wish to see their familys and talk to them, the increase of new technology allow to connect with each other in any country they are.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand the distinction between rich and poor population is growing too. Familys with low income (salary) can not allow themselfes modern technologies. However they can take credits and buy any digital equipment. There is a big variety of credits offerring by banks now. And there are also discounts proposed by trade Marks. The sedantary life-style demands a lot of things in offices and the offices must have hightechnologies to compete with other companies.<NL><NL><NL><NL>The demand of population to the efficient tools and devices is growing too. Development of new hightech is an index of the country growth too. It must not stop, it must be invested and extended.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To sum up, although the increasing of the number of hightech sequences the distinction between the rich and the poor, the modern technologies must be invented according to the requirement of the world. People must take into consideration that there also possibilities to buy appropriate devices and tools.

task: Some believe that people should make efforts to fight climate change while others think it is better to learn to live with it.<NL><NL>Discuss both views and give your own opinion
essay: In the present day, the consequences of climate change are a primary concern in any society. While some people claim that is necessary efforts of everybody to solve this problem, others believe that the ideal should be to learn to live with it. I tend to agree with the former because we live in a society and taking care of the planet is a duty and obligation.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, some individuals believe that citizens should fight climate change in order to address the negative consequences. Solving this problem can ameliorate not only the quality of air but also the quality of water, which are essential resources for surviving. Moreover, improving the quality of both, the number of diseases resulting to them may mitigate. Another important fact about this situation is that by solving this current problem, we can prevent the loss of biodiversity resulting in the maintenance of natural habits. <NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, some people claim this resolution is a process incredibly expensive and demanding. Therefore,  financial resources should be invested in other fields. Furthermore, the necessary time to tackle this hassle is  uncountable since would be a process without resolutions in a short term. In other words, would be better to learn to deal with this situation to save stamina in a problem so complex.<NL><NL><NL><NL>As far as I am concerned, citizens need to combat this situation as we are  responsible for this crucial moment on our planet.  In addition, if the population fights to solve climate change, it will build a better place for the next generations. Another essential fact about this is that schools and organizations, both national and local, can promote educational programs to influence healthy and good habits to the planet. The more society strives to go the extra mile, the better results.   <NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, climate change is a complex and current problem that needs to be solved, otherwise, the negative impacts will endanger not only  human life but also  animal life. The planet is claiming for helping and it is of paramount importance at least trying to diminish the consequences to the next generations.

task: Some people say that playing games can be bad for children. Others say that playing computer games can have positive effects on the way children develop. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: With the boom of technology, video games are gaining in popularity among children and young adults. Some hold the belief that playing computer games is beneficial to their development, while the opponents voice their criticism against it due to the health risks it may pose. However, from my perspective, video games significantly impact the child’s growth if played moderately. <NL><NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, gaming can promote children’s health, whether mental or physical state. These virtual games are capable of easing anxiety and helping tackle some mental health issues due to positive chemicals one’s brain produces when they are playing. Moreover, multiples of games such as Sudoku or online puzzles also foster brain development and enhance thinking capacity. Besides, playing games can be an inventive way of exercising. A case in this point is a game called “Ring Fit Adventure - Nintendo Switch”, which requires players to perform an abundance of physical activities and attacks in-game.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Appealing these health benefits may seem, there are still some potential pitfalls if children play video games too frequently. Even though games are fun and relaxing to some extent, teenagers may still stand a great chance of being addicted. Gaming addiction is detrimental to various aspects of life, ranging from the broken parent-child relationship to poor academic performance. In addition, in 2018, the World Health Organization declared it a serious mental health issue. Furthermore, most children tend to sit in front of the screen for a long time during the game sessions since only an insignificant number of these games are fitness ones. Consequently, they may suffer from eye strain, visual impairments, or other diseases such as obesity.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, it is undeniable that playing video games may positively affect a child’s health since it helps them unwind and encourages exercise. However, they should acknowledge the appropriate amount of gaming; otherwise, this can result in severe health hazards.

task: Many people believe that modern music can have a negative impact on the young. Others believe the effect of modern music is positive.<NL><NL><NL>Discuss both these views and give your opinion.
essay: Nowadays, people believe that modern music could be dangerous, expecially for younger, on the contrary, others argued that modern music could provide beneficial consequences to listeners.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In this essay, I am going to discuss both views as well as why I believe that it can be extremely usefull, in particular for youth.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Firstly, I think that every society has its own genere of music due to the fact that musician instrument developed during the year and also the mind of people changed as a consequence that preferences could be different compared with the past. The fact is provided by the number of variations that every kind of music experienced during their life, in fact, several singer are not related to only one genere of music but we can catalogue in many of them. For this reason I do not think that modern music can be dangerous for young people because I can not find negative effects related to that.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Although I believe that there will not be problem among younger, others argued that modern music can have a negative impact on modern society in light of the fact that it can influence listeners to copy the action of singer which sometimes are lead to negative effects, forr example smoking weed or having a gangster behaviour.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, as I said, I believe that there will not a problem for young who listen modern music due to the fact that all the society have experienced a particular kind of music which often are dangerous whit violent texts and bad words.

task: Some people say advertising has positive economic effects. Others think it has negative social effects because it will make people dissatisfied with who they are and what they have.<NL><NL>Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay: Nowadays, most of the product being advertised by companies. This will be effected positive merits economic as well as negative merits social. Moreover, advertisements are vitally important in the country. I will be explained both views below the paragraphs.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with, all of the companies were shown their positives characterizes of the product, such as good for health, fresh drink, healthy food, etc. For example, a lot of products were advertised by channels (Animal planet, man vs wild, starspots, etc.) in the programs or movies breaks that will cover the children’s and youngers’ aspiration while they do not know the negatives effects. In addition, a lot of new product will be introduced by using advertisement via television or posters that will be updated by the people. Besides, several online products were introduced via a phone app that will be aided the people. For instance, online purchases are very easy and safe.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, some of the products were effected people lifestyles. For example, noodles are not healthy food. But, some people made their foods as noodles for entire days because it will easy to prepare. Also, some of the younger ones adopted the advertisements. For instance, any of the new products were telecasted by the companies that products were liked by younger ones.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To sum up, advertisements were updated people life in order to improve their quality of lifestyles, and to develop positive economic effects. In my opinion, advertisements are essentially important as well as that depicts the side effects of the products.

task: Some people believe that robots will play an important role in future societies, while others argue that robots might have negative effects on society.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: The last two decades have seen enormous changes in the way people's lives are affected by the expert systems, with many advances in this field. However, while these developments have brought many benefits to the world. Personally I believe that the benefits of the robots are likely to outweigh the negative aspects of it.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Some people believe that there are two main reasons why it could be argued that robots might have adverse effects on society in the future. The main issue is that people feel the robots will have a negative impact on the human workforce. The people will be replaced by machines and this will increase the unemployment rate, it leads to more serious problems such as poverty and increased crimes. Furthermore, physical and health issues are a major concern, so people become less active and this may result in some health problems like obesity.<NL><NL><NL><NL>However, others feel that I would agree with those who argue that robots will play important positive roles in future society. The first role is that robots could operate in locations that humans cannot reach such as exploration of the outer space.  Moreover, robots will be used inside the human bodies for monitoring their health and undertake surgery. The second role that will be played by robots is the helping of elderly and retired people with their daily life activities like cooking and cleaning. Finally, robots could do normal jobs quickly unlike human beings. Robots don not complain or get distracted or tired. They readily work twenty-four hours and require minimal maintenance.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, there are convincing arguments both for in and against the role of robots in our future would, but I believe that the robots will add many benefits to the future society.

task: some people think watching TV is bad for children,while others think that watching TV has more beneficial effects on children. Discuss both views and give your own opinion
essay: Television has become an indispensable part of day-to-day life. Although it is thought that spending time watching television is detrimental for children, some people believe this has more advantages in their development. In my opinion, I strongly consider that media has a negative effect in shaping children's behaviour and character and on the long run has damaging side-effects.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, some people voice that screen time is quite harmful for children, and I agree. In other words, spending a considerable amount of time watching programmes reduces the time that is spent on studies, and as a result, they tend to score low grades in academics. Adolescents, for instance, are glued to television spending hours together, thereby lose interest and struggle to concentrate in their studies. Consequently, they end up with poor academic performance and failing to succeed later in life. Moreover, cartoon and animated series target young children, and eventually affects their health as the time spent outdoors is considerably less.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, it is believed by some that watching useful programmes has beneficial effects on children. One reason why it is helpful is that it gives them quality leisure time from the highly demanding various subjects. This gives them the chance to take their mind out and enjoy some fun time, and also cultivate their interests by watching suitable series. Another reason is that they could relax at the comfort of their home by watching their favourite shows or scientific programs, rather than venturing out, thereby managing time efficiently.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, while people may vary in their opinions, I completely believe that spending time before the big screen has harmful effects on children's life.

task: Topic: These days there are a lot of TV channels available to view. Some<NL><NL>people think it is good to have a range of options but others argue that it<NL><NL>affects the quality of programs.<NL><NL>Discuss both sides and give your opinion as well.
essay: The increase in the number of TV channels has provoked a critical controversy over if these variety is valuable and provide a broad spectrum of chances for people to select, or this increase in quantity is accompaned with poor content.From my perspective, many of satalite programs and showes now have very low quality, despite the tremendous which is on the surface nowadays.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, many people aurge that the approach of variety and huge number of programs gives those who watch TV the ability to choose freely bteween movis, talkshows, news, or even crtoon. Not only this, even in the same category there is specificialty, like different types of films' channels, while one is restricted for action, the other is limited to comedy. Also those people stand on the side of variety as the thought that highten people's intellect by huge amount of information about different aspects in life, such as scientific, sports and current world news.<NL><NL><NL><NL>However, I can see that these ideas are flawed owing to superfacial as well as directed thoughts they provide, programs' maneger are usually aiming to enforce their points of view on the viewer, to attract many observers to his side no matter they offer the truth or not. For instance, those who take the side of governement and encourage what they do all the time, while others who judge the behaviours of countries' presidents at any stage even at important and critical events that need all the citizens to be one hand.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, the quality of programs content and to what extent it match the reality is important than how many of them offered to TV watchers.

task: Some people think that increasing business and cultural contacts worldwide have positive influences on development; others think that they have negative effects on national identities. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: Whether engaging with international trade and customs among various countries can be  a controversial argument in the contemporary earth.Moreover, People are divided in their opinion regarding the communications between two or more countries in terms of economical and traditional.I believe  various cultural communities should support each other and encourage harmony and peace globally. This essay will discuss both  aspects of  global interaction and reach  a reasonable conclusion.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To embark on, there are numerous benefits to encourage international corporate and adopt other territories culture in order to grow and support the economy globally. Firstly, masses may land up to better other's nation opportunity as compared to their countries that will help them to grow which in result help the provincial. For instance, Canada welcome immigrants as they are conscientious and diligent which led them to not only earn for themselves but also for the provincial by paying taxes. Apart from that, people from tender age can learn various aspects of cultures all over the country through social media and other networking channels. These advantages can assist an individual in a better life.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the contrary, There is no doubt that global contact comes with a few drawbacks that can have an impact on the people around the world. In other words, folks can have a negative shock on their life if they consecutively follow the culture that does not belong to their provincial. For instance,  Adolescents at a very young age may have an adverse impact by following international movies as well as actress or actor around the world. Furthermore, people can also face racism at their workplace and other parts of the nations which can result in depression and other health issues.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To recapitulate, an aforementioned provides plausible arguments regarding international communications that can have a better impact on the people from a different provincial and can also explore  nature and learn new things.

task: Some people think the increasing business and cultural contact between countries brings many positive effects. Others say it causes the loss of national identities. Discuss both view and give your opinion.
essay: The era of globalisation has made nations around to globe to become interdependent in terms of politics, education, medicine especially international trade and culture exchange. Many regard that the rise in economic and traditional diversity of one nation possess beneficial impacts upon others. However, some object to this idea because of the visible possibility that indigenous values may be perished. <NL><NL><NL><NL>        To begin with, numerous developing countries have been experiencing a rise in employment opportunity and a massive economic gains with regard to globalisation. The modern business has now found its capability to approach customers of oversea countries. To clearly explain this, companies possess a greater chance to have their products increased in sales numbers and to modify their items to become more approachable and more versatile. Furthermore, the cultural relationships among countries allow employees to go abroad and learn more new things about their neighbours. For example, the Americans usually take trips to Vietnam to experience a wide variety of exclusive foods and learn about the history of their past rival. These people exploit this prospect to improve their foreign foods’ quality, especially Pho and to enhance USA’s historical educational quality.<NL><NL><NL><NL>       However wonderful the advantages may be, foreign policies may terminate a country’s exclusiveness. Globalization has provided a more diverse world in terms of culture’s quantity. One culture may become dominating and make others disappear. Once the culture of a region completely vanishes, it will reverse the merits which globalization evokes. For instance, if Vietnam’s indigenous food like Pho disappears, the amount of international tourists will disappear. Therefore, the tourism industry in Vietnam will fall into chaos and thereby downgrading the whole economic system.<NL><NL><NL><NL>     In conclusion, though globalisation may benefit countries in terms of the economy, those countries, neglecting its policies about such progress might one day disappear completely off the world map. From my own experience, it is up to every individual’s awareness to not only keeps their identity but also encourages national growth.

task: Children today have more responsibilities than the past. Some people think it has positive effects than negative ones, while others disagree. Discuss both views, and give your own opinion.
essay: Nowadays, parents tend to give increased responsibilities to their kids. Some people are over the opinion that it is a positive movement, while others do not agree, saying it would negatively affect children’s development. In this essay, I will examine both sides of the argument, as well as give my view.<NL><NL><NL><NL>As for those who believe the benefits to take a handful of responsibilities of children, there are many reasons. Firstly, there is no doubt that youngsters need to be well taught and guided before their growing up and entering their adulthood. Taking more duties would allow them to understand early about the real meaning of it, which will, in turn, prepare them well ahead to be a reliable and responsible person when they turn to adult lives. Moreover, a responsible child in a family also means that they would share some family obligations, hence preparing them to be a great leader or a team player.  <NL><NL><NL><NL>In contrast, other people hold the notion that early responsible child life is harmful to children. For instance, children may appear too young to understand what it takes when comes to responsibility, which may well be added the stress to them, resulting in unnecessarily worrisome and hopeless, which would negatively impact children’s mental development. Besides, they may be able to partially finish the assigned tasks. This might be interpreted as a failure or partial completion, which would cost a shadow in their young minds affecting their later lives. The irony is that they would be less capable of taking responsibilities when they grow up. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, although there are some negative implications, I believe that the positive aspects of children taking responsibility are overweight the negative ones; it would prepare them well to be a responsible person in adulthood.

task: Some people think that range of technology currently available is increasing gap between rich and poor people. Others think that it is causing the opposite effect. Discuss both views and give ur opinion.
essay: According to some, the technological revolution is currently creating a huge disparity between the wealthy and un wealthy group of people. While others believe the opposite idea. However, I support the former statement as I strongly believe that the new technological innovation is the paramount reason for creating such differences among people.<NL><NL><NL><NL> To commence with, technological advancements have drastically changed the world we live in and made our life much more pragmatic than we ever anticipated. Although most of these gadgets are eye catching, most of them are very expensive. Therefore, only affluent population can buy them and those in destitute cannot. For example, in the developing countries, only a few percent of the population can buy iPads, iPhones, mac book, expensive cameras and many more. Not only this, many cannot even afford basic household appliances. They have to perform everything manually. This shows the disparity in the living standard between rich and poor people, which creates imbalances and have detrimental effect. <NL><NL><NL><NL>From the other perspective, with these advancements, internet has become relatively cheaper. Thus, with the help of different social media platform, the general population can virtually connect and interact with each other. With time, they may develop a bond and friendship. This reduces the segregation created in the society. Furthermore, it gives a platform for every indivisuals to express their feelings and talent, regardless of their background. For instance, many people from poor economic background are currently opening channels in youtube and expressing their talent. Through this they are able to generate income for their family. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Thus in conclusion, I support the view that these technological gadgets are the main reason for creating differences among different classes of people.

task: Nowadays families move to different countries for work. Some people think it has a negative effect on children, while others disagree. Discuss both views and give your own opinion?
essay: People have different views when it comes to moving to other countries for a better job opportunity. While some argue that this trend might be harmful to children, others have an opposing idea. Nevertheless, my opinion lies with the latter.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, travelling abroad to find a job can harm children in several ways. Firstly, it  may affect children's languages. These children would not be able to speak their mother tongue fluently after staying in a foreign country for a couple of years. The impact would be more prominent when children try simultaneously to learn their first language. Secondly, children would copy the natives' lifestyles, norms and habits, which might not be acceptable based on their original religion. For example, gender equality and homosexuality are considered a sin from Muslim parents' point of view.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, moving abroad can bring certain advantages to children. To elaborate, they may have this unique opportunity to learn about new cultures, customs and traditions while  broadening their horizons. Nowadays, knowledge is power and people who know more will have a brighter future, thus, these children would be more successful if they decide to return back to their home due to access to outstanding experiences. Moreover, these children can make plenty of friends while living in a foreign nation. In the upcoming years, when these children will apply for a job, their indigenous friends can be helpful by giving them valuable advice.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In summary, the pattern of moving to another country for work can have positive and negative consequences to children, but I think that its merits outweigh the drawbacks.

task: Many people believe that the priority of the government should be to ensure a growing economy. While others believe that the government should focus its efforts on uplifting the less fortunate?<NL><NL>Discuss both views.
essay: A section of the society are ardent believers in government pursuing economic growth as a primary objective. However, the others opine that the government should channelize its efforts on increasing the standards for the under-privileged. Hence, this essay will evaluate both the views of the society. <NL><NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, having an expanding economy is indispensable in uplifting the living standards of the economy. Firstly, a growing country signifies the increasing amount of output produced. To produce more, one needs a lot of human resources(labour). As a result, unemployment drops in the economy as jobs are created and people have a stable income in order to lead a peaceful and prosperous life. For instance, CNBC reported India’s growing economy has improved their quality of life drastically in the last decade. <NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, focusing on elevating the poorer section of the society induces a positive outlook of the economy which stimulates tourism. It is often seen not having a poverty-stricken society boosts the number of travellers to that country. Furthermore, tourists opine that they are disinterested and discontented to perceive an environment which has a low quality of life as the particular nation don’t possess the capability of satisfying their needs and wants. For example, a survey released by the CNA revealed that countries living in poverty demotivates tourists to travel to these nations<NL><NL><NL><NL>All in All, one can conclude that the government should provide equal attention in order to stimulate economic growth. At the same time, it should improve the quality standards of the less fortunate in the society.

task: Some people think that competitive sports are important for a child education, others think that it has negative effects. <NL>Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: At present, competitive sports are playing a considerable role among the age of children. The games are very beneficial for toddlers. Without the competitive sports, they unable to learn something's. While, others say that it has negative effects of competitive sports. In the below paragraphs, I will not only explain both the viewpoints, but also my personal perspective.<NL><NL>To start with, those people say that sports are significant for an adolescent education. Firstly, it helps to the adolescent develop their career. For example, when a kid starts their sports with competition. He or she gets a chance to learn about the rules of games, which he or she does not have to learn in the following decades. Moreover, competition helps to improve their physical fitness level as well as encourage to players always speak truth in life. What is more, they earn lots of name and fame from this. Which is useful for the education.<NL><NL>On the flip side, some reckon that it is a negative effect on an adolescent. First of all, the games need to enough of patients. For instance, if a person wants to become a wealthy man throughout sports. He or she has to take practice. Which wastes more time of players. They unable to earn the money as soon. Therefore, they claim that it has negative impacts. Last not but least, competitive sports have to play under the captain. Because of this, they are not able to play with freedom and not bring out their skills.<NL><NL>To conclude, even though sports are necessary in the age of a teenager in order to study, but competitions are more vital, as it helps to find the ability of offsprings.

task: Some people think Climate Change has negative effects on businesses, others think it creates opportunities. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: Constant viewing of televison has many  impacts either it is advantage or disadvantage. One of many reasons is that by watching documentaries and  feature films enable people to know about western world and its advancement. In other word,  these  devices provide a sufficient amount of information, instantly, from the  all over the world, eventually, people get well  understanding of current affairs. Another point is taken into account is that when  viewers  watch any program  frequently, especially, violent content which gradually desensitise towards  violence in the society. Take a recent research report which has showed that  there is a positive  correlation between watching violent movies and crime activities. Therefore, many believe that children be restricted from watching obscene and violent programs.<NL>  Despite,  the above mentioned arguement, television merely influnce the society, which means content of the stories always unearth from real life experience than fiction. This is jusrt a reflection of current situation in the world.. Our society is changing and transforming  itself, due to this, several  people think that television programs just try to preserve conventionality and status quo. Apart from this,  culture is not monolithic and society is fragmented , so  any tv shows cannot influence the society.

task: Some people think competitive sport is important for a child’s education. Others think it has negative effects on children. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: An increasing number of people are concerned about the purpose of teaching sports at schools. Many people believe that schools should offer competitive sports in a curriculum, while others are against it because it may negatively affect children. In my opinion, I would argue that competitive sports should not be allowed at schools as they may bring many drawbacks to children.<NL><NL>It is a belief that competitive sports bring many advantages for children in the future. First, competition is a natural instinct in humans, and it is likely to strengthen children’s personalities. Therefore, competition is healthy because it pushes people to give their best or even over their limitation. Second, children need to experience these competitions at schools. This is due to the fact that when they graduate from schools, they have to step into the real world where people have to compete with one another to get jobs in daily life.<NL><NL>On the other hand, the negative effects of competitive sports should not be overlooked. The first reason is that sports should provide children with a sense of enjoyment rather than competition. Addionally, playing sports with their peers can build their relationships and teamwork skills. If competitive sports are brought to the curriculum, their relationships will be disjointed and fragmented. Another consideration is that playing sports encourages children to have physical and mental development, meaning that they become healthier and may have fewer diseases, such as diabetes. Whereas competitive sports may make them feel stressed because they have to against one another for higher grades.<NL><NL>In conclusion, sports are great activities for children’s development. Personally, I believe that competition in schools brings more harm than benefits.

task: Many people argu that in order to improve educational quality, high school students are encouraged to make comments or even criticism on their teachers. Other think it will lead to loss of respect and discipline in the classroom.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Discuss both views and give your Opinion.
essay: It is obvious that education is directly connected to countries'development so in order to improve a country the educational system must be improved. But it has always been debatable topic how governments should arrange educational policy. Because almost all people have different thoughts on this topic. Especially people comment on connections between teachers and students, it is because of that these two groups play main roles in education. There are different arguments whether students can criticise their teachers or it can be disrespectful. I strongly believe that students are free to tell their own thoughts.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, it is true that teachers can be more experienced and mature than students. But it doesn't mean that everything they say is true. Sometimes educated people can also have some mistakes or false beliefs. Or their way of thinking may be different than their students. In that case students should absolutely be free to make their own comments and defend their attitudes. It helps them to be more confident when they express their feelings and thoughts.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, those who think it is a reason of losing respect between teachers and their students can be right in some aspects. Generally, students in high schools are not very mature and they can use some rude words in order to express themselves or to criticise someone. Using inappropriate expressions against teacher can cause losing respect to teacher and it would create chaotic classrooms.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To conclude, not only students, but also all people are free to make comments, criticise things that are  not logical for them and to give their ideas. It is possible that students don't like their teachers' ideas, but they must respect them and discuss whatever they want with a polite language.

task: Many people argue that in order to improve educational quality, high school  students are encouraged to make comments or even criticism of their teachers.  Others think it will lead to a loss of respect and discipline in the classroom. <NL>Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay: Many suggest that in the development of learning in classes, pupils shouldn't express any negative comments toward their teachers. Others, however, take a different point of view and emphasise the need for more freedom of expression in classes. In my opinion, it is better for students to have the chance to conceal their thought toward the teachers. <NL><NL><NL><NL>On one side of this argument, there are people who put forward the view that youngsters should be limited their expression in classes. As it shows unrespect behaviour toward the teachers as well as encourages them to break the classrooms' norms. Since, in many institutions, there are clear guidelines on which ways students should behave, thus allowing them to express everything freely  persuades them to ignore those guidelines. Moreover, they might take this opportunity to be their accuses in defending themselves after doing bad things in academies. Therefore, this claim will have drawbacks for both schools and students. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In spite of the above argument, I hold the view that educational places should allow students to make comments toward professors. General speaking, whatever positions we have, we could act the wrong way. This statement could be adapted with the teachers, as not every action they require or acknowledges students to do in schools are make sense. For instance, in some Thai schools, teachers haven't provided a gap for pupils to ask questions, so they just talk until the end of the lesson. As a result, the pupils don't understand anything, and finally they got a low grade on the exams. Furthermore, encouraging students to express things would aid education places finding some inferior points they would miss. For example, they might raise an idea to the professors to open more majors in school. Meanwhile, this idea benefits the students, it also shows the variety of courses of the school to attract new students in the future. Hence, we should support this argument. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, after analyzing the reasons for both of the arguments, it is clear that allowing high school learners to express their opinions bring more benefits rather than limiting their freedom of expression.

task: Many people argue that in order to improve educational quality, high school students should be encouraged to question and offer criticisms on their teachers. Others think this will lead to a loss of respect and discipline in the classroom.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay: Educational institutes are not only important for the theoretical knowledge that is taught in them but also for the overall development of cognitive and social skills of the students. Some believe that high schoolers should be allowed to cross-question and offer criticisms on their educators while others oppose this notion, as it might lead to poor discipline in schools. In this essay, I will discuss the merits of both  sides of the argument and state my opinion about it.<NL><NL><NL><NL>It is argued, that students should be encouraged to question and criticise what they are being taught as it will help them develop the skill of critical thinking . This will be beneficial to them as they will be able to use this skill to analyze various problems in life and also form their individual opinions.  Critical thinking may also save them from misinformation , for example, when they come across some information or propaganda on the internet. Moreover, the habit of questioning will build curiosity in various subjects and may possibly lead to innovation. <NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, encouraging such behaviour may lead to these pupils becoming overconfident , resulting in loss of discipline as they might start disrespecting their teachers. They may criticize every statement and instruction given to them, which will lead to the teachers losing control of their classrooms. Additionally, students may lose their humbleness and become ruder. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, both  sides have their own merits, but on balance, I feel it is important for students to question and offer productive criticisms as it will help them form personal opinions and also lead to innovative discoveries.

task: Some people think in order to continually improve the quality of education, high school students  should be encouraged to evaluate and criticize their teachers. Others feel that this would result in a  loss of respect and discipline in the classroom. Discuss both these views and give your own opinion..
essay: They say that Learning never stops. We learn till our last breath and it is actually responsible to  improve our character, It defines what kind of human being we would be. And now we can see  there’s lot of improvement in learning experience. We have seen evolution from Nature classroom  to Google classrooms. Electronic classes where children sit at their home and learn various things  where teaches plays vital role. It has been revolution at every stage in this process and now students  are encourage to evaluate and criticize their teachers, while others feel that it can disturb the  discipline in the classroom.  Teachers are considered to be another parents who gives valuable lessons to child. There has been a  time when all mistakes of teachers were acceptable and unquestionable where teachers were  considered to be dictator and students were following the instructions given by their mentor.  Nowdays this process has been changed drastically and now students has liberty to judge their  teachers and give them feedback which in my perception should be limited at some extent because  there are number of mischievous children in the classroom who can portray wrong image of the  authority and can disturb the environment of study.  In my opinion there should be transparency in the process where we can validate the on going  process like cameras or recordings. In this way authorities can track their own performance and  make changes rather than giving power to developing minds. Also we can practice gaining feedback  from students with limited resources like google feedback forms.  To conclude would like to say both aspects are beneficial if one is true to himself/herself in order to  judge an experienced person and authorities should limit with boundaries for power they are  providing to students.

task: Some people think the main benefit of international cooperation is in the protection of the environment, while others think that the main benefits are in the world business. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: With the rapid development of globalization in the past decades, many countries get profits due to the increasingly strong bonding through the intensive interaction with others. The environmental protection and economy have equally benefited from such international cooperation under the background in major regions.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, it is commonly known that environmental problems have a heavy toll on the well-being of the whole society. Thus,applying global cooperation can unite more countries and clear the responsibilities of each in preventing detrimental pollution. A great case in point is that the developed countries can support many high-tech devices and professional experts in the developing regions to tackle the environmental problems that can not be solved by limited local technology and lacking of biologists and chemists and so on.What is more, a great number of extinction species can also be rescued by the international organisations when they face detrimentally killing result of the lagging traditions in specific areas.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, the international connection allows entrepreneurs to extend their businesses out of the country, which could make rational use of different resources to help the economic development on both sides.For example, many western companies set up factories in Asia since there are more low-price labour forces and some factories were set in the original source of goods in order to reduce the transportation cost. What is more,one more beneficial fact caused by international cooperation is that the foreign businesses also create many job opportunities for local citizens in some developing countries where the industrial development is primitive and inferior.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion,from my perspective, the expansion of global interaction enhances the relationship among the countries, which can lead to many positive results including earth protection and financial stimulation

task: Most of the urgent problems can only be solved with international cooperation. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: It is generally believed that the majority of urgent issues and disagreements can merely be tackled with global cooperation. I strongly agree with this idea. <NL><NL>International cooperation plays a vital role in solving problems occurred in any country. In the modern era, the mentioned cooperation is promoted by unilateral agreements signed mostly between more than 150 countries. They are ratified by many states to cooperate in critical topics such as crime and punishment and protection of the environment. Take for instance, with the help of the unity between states, criminals transit to another country in order to escape from justice are caught without large operations and efforts. Therefore, it would be beneficial, especially in certain areas to cooperate internationally. <NL><NL>Global cooperation also acts as a deterrent, in other words, some disputable and controversial issues before they become an actual dispute are covered in the agreements as well. An interesting study conducted last year suggests that widespread regulations dissuade people from breaking the law. More, social cooperations help conserve world's cultural heritages.  Furthermore, the deterrence saves our money and time as a country, and so administrers can focus on improving public services. <NL><NL>In conclusion, international cooperation is an efficient means and works as a time and money saver. I believe that is crucial to overcome any problems and especially the urgent ones.

task: In the past, people stored knowledge in books. Nowadays people stored knowledge on the Internet. Do you think the advantages outweigh the disadvantages?
essay: Today's, cutting-edge technologies change human being life significantly. subsequently, This matter affects storing way of books. Although some communities believe that e-book destroys the nature of the book, others think that this technology gives a new and better meaning to the book. In this essay merits and demerits of both points of view will be discussed.<NL><NL><NL><NL>New tools and inventions in the last century, give people improved methods to store data like text. This way of storage is more intelligent because we can transport these very easily. To illustrate, the transportation of 1000 reports in the past was a really huge work to be done but now we can move them on a CD. Moreover, disasters such as war, flood, earthquake, and fire could destroy libraries and consequently millions of reports in a fraction of a second. To clarify, keeping bills on hard disks is safer. In addition, using hard disks for storing statements eliminate neccecety of cutting trees to write  books. <NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, from the readers' point of view, reading bills on paper is more comfortable. for example, they claim that e-book affects human eye health. Additionally, they say electronic books do not have the same good feeling as paper books. Also, researches show that concentrating on a subject is more when you read it on paper.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, like other technologies, keeping reports on hard disks or reading them on the screen has both negative and positive sides. However, I think its advantages are more than its advantages.

task: In the past, people stored knowledge in books. Nowadays people stored knowledge on the Internet. Do you think the advantages outweigh the disadvantages?
essay: Technology has shaped the world in such a way, that nobody can even think to spend a moment of their life without it. Thus, the biggest change we can see in the reading habits. People used to read more books to gain knowledge but these days such material is available on their fingertips with the help of internet. In my view, both statements have their own pros and cons.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with, before the internet era one has to carry the weight of books to get the knowledge but with the internet, everything is readily available on their handheld devices. No one has to go anywhere to get the books to study instead, one just need to type in a few keywords and pretty much everything is cooked up for them. To illustrate, when I was in school I had to buy purchase books or borrow from the library but these days children get the same amount of education even with various methods with help of technology. Thus, the internet clearly has changed the conventional way of learning.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In addition to this, the internet has  huge storage to keep data the whole world, whereas  writing in books may fade away. It is an intelligent way to preserve our heritage or other important data for the upcoming generation. To exemplify, Google known as the biggest tech giant in the world  has zillions of records kept on the cloud<NL><NL><NL><NL>, which are just a few clicks away from us. Therefore, worldwide web storage is a boon for mankind and outplay the use of books.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In a nutshell, the internet is clearly outweighing the advantages of the knowledge stored in books. Although many people may get troubled by misleading information on the internet  it still stands out for its capacity and accessibility.

task: More and more people decide to eat healthy food and exercise regularly. What are the reasons for this trend? What can be done to encourage more people to eat healthier and exercise?
essay: It is true to say that people tend to have nutritious food and do some physical activities more than in the past. In the following paragraphs, a number of factors contribute to this trend, and possible ideas to support these people will be outlined.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with, the trend of a healthy lifestyle is more common in today’s world. Due to technological development, people can easily access some healthy information about nutrition and physical activities. For example, some articles provide information about how to cook healthy food, making people conveniently follow and cook nutritional meals easier than in the past. Moreover, the Internet can provide information about the correct ways to do some physical activities which people can easily follow to do so.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Providing functions for physical activities will increase and encourage people to follow this trend. To illustrate, the governments should invest in public parks and gyms which can help people to do more exercise by providing suitable equipment. Furthermore, the authorities should raise awareness of eating unhealthy food such as fast food as it can make people aware of an unhealthy lifestyle. Additionally, campaigns about being healthy in society can encourage people to spend more time on exercise and eat some healthy food.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, technological development provides information about the health of people which encourages people to do more exercise and cook healthy food conveniently. In addition, the governments should provide public places for people and give knowledge to people of a healthy lifestyle to help them be healthier.

task: Leaders and directors in organizations are normally older people. Some people think having a younger leader would be better.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Commonly speaking, heads of institutions are older members of society. According to some people's opinion younger administrators would influence the management system in a better way. I am inclined to agree with both of the ideas for a number of convincing reasons.<NL><NL><NL><NL>The first idea set out can be true for two solid reasons I am about to explain. Since the beginning of humanity elderly people are always respected and almost every idea, they put forward were always supported without any doubt. The second reason, based on a stereotype, is that older members of public are seen as more experienced and omniscient individuals, hence directors of associations, enterprises often found to be older people.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Regarding the second idea that is claimed, I utterly agree that well-educated younger people would make a better leader as they are full of energy, open to endeavor new management techniques for the best of their workplace. For instance, young ambitious worker would go through sleepless nights to create a project that can benefit to the company and their career and that can be realised thanks to their robust health. In my view, this derives from the urge to prove themselves in society as a prosperous young leader.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To sum up, I am in agreement with the opinion that chiefs of people in organizations are generally older people due to their work experience and reputation they collected over the years. However, I also believe that in times of acute competition where everyone is dealing with the modern technology and methods younger generation can overcome the challenge better.

task: Leaders and directors in organizations are normally older people. Some people think having a younger leader would be better. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: In this present-day world, it has to be said that a younger leader is better than an older one;however, most  organizations have geriatric higher authorities.In this golden digital era, the younger generation has the ability to handle technology rather than dotage people;although, the aged generation have life experience.I agree with the theme and the essay will enunciate this notion in detail with appropriate instances.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To commence with, it is indeed an irrefutable fact that technology has been changing day by day and younger people are updating more advancements than older people.For instance, a study was conducted by scholars of Harvard University about the speed of learning technology in dotage and younger adults.The result shows about 80% of youngsters learn technology fast rather than old age people.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To continue, it is paramount to consider  health instead of experience.Younger people are  healthier than old age because during old age, the chances to get health issues are more and there are chances to get Alzheimers and dementia that horribly affect your ideas.For instance, a survey was conducted by IIT,Mumbai about

task: Leaders and directors in organizations are normally older people. Some people think having a younger leader would be better. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: It is argued by some that giving power to young people to lead organizations can be more beneficial than letting older people be in charge of leadership. I totally agree with this view because of the following reasons.<NL><NL><NL><NL>I hold a firm belief that younger people can bring many benefits to the development of an organization when they become leaders or managers. First of all, compared with senior people who often suffer from health problems, young people have a competitive edge in terms of youth and physical strength. This means that they are willing to sacrifice time, effort and devotion to work longer hours or build a reputation for their business, which old leaders may find  beyond their ability to do. Besides, with  sensitivity and quick adaptation to changes in the market, young leaders seem to be brave enough to take risks and materialize innovative initiatives. With these differences, young people can lead their organization to a higher level of status and competitiveness in the market.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Some people argue that it would be better for an organization when its leaders or managers are older people. The reason for this argument is because those people are very experienced, which means that they can have a wide vision as well as abilities to predict unexpected setbacks. Thanks to accumulated experience, elderly leaders can orientate their businesses to overcome tough times and gain sustainable development. However, I am more convinced that young people are able to do better than these old directors in a constantly-changing world these days. In fact, the more experienced people are, the more conservative they become. In other words, the conservative nature of elderly seniors can be considered as a hurdle for their adaptation to continuous turbulence in the business practice, hindering the breakthroughs of an organization.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, due to the aforementioned reasons in terms of youth and risk-taking nature, young people deserve to be held accountable for leading an organization or a business rather than older ones.

task: Some people think scientific research should focus on solving world health problems. Others think that there are more important issues.  <NL><NL><NL><NL>Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: With the advancement of modern technologies nowadays, people have debated whether scientific studies must aim at finding cures for diseases rather than other areas of concern. This essay will discuss either side and then explain why I prefer for research to give equal importance to all the issues that matter in our society.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To start with, people are suggesting that more thorough research should be spent to deal with the deteriorating health of our society. They are concerned that more and more people are becoming sick thus, focused research must be implemented to have answers to the health problems that our communities are facing nowadays. One good example is the current pandemic. To further elaborate, it has been 2 years since the COVID 19 started and yet, there are still people who die because of the virus. Vaccines may have been invented but it does not necessarily free us from the detrimental effects of this phenomenon.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, some are debating that other issues like economic stability, public safety and the likes are equally vital to the health issues that need to be focused on. They believe that being healthy will not be enough to survive thus giving importance to sustainable living and being safe is a must. In particular, having peace of mind, of not worrying about day to day life will give also a healthy life thus life's function should come as equally important.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, as others may point out that health issues should be focused on research, I believe other society's functions should also be given equal importance.

task: Some people think scientific research should focus on solving world health problems. Others think that there are more important issues.  <NL><NL><NL><NL>Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: Many people believe that scientific research nowadays should concentrate on tackling global health issues. While others and I disagree with the idea and think that there are more vital threats. In the following paragraph, both of these viewpoints will be discussed in detail before the conclusion is reached.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, one of the reasons that folk say that research should focus on handling health problems is that these days, there are numerous new illnesses emerging all the time. To illustrate, Covid-19 that is spreading out currently is a disease that humans have not known before. As a result, we have to do research to invent the vaccine to deal with this disease. Moreover, individuals would like to have a longer life. In other words, at present, the average lifetime of humans is seventy years old. Therefore, If medicines and medical treatments are more enhanced, humans will have a longer life.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, the obvious reason that some people believe that there are more crucial problems is that presently, there are a lot of environmental threats that affect our lives. For example, air pollution is a significant problem that has severe effects on humans because the fumes emitted from cars can cause  lung disease. On top of that, engineering issue also plays an important role in our lives. That is to say, engineering development such as autonomous cars can make individuals more safe and comfortable.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To summarize, although there are tremendous reasons why folk think that research should focus only on health issues, I personally disagree with this notion and believe that there are more crucial problems.

task: Fewer young people choose to work in farming. What are the reasons? Should young people be encouraged to do farming work?
essay: At present, the question of why fewer farms for their livelihoods in the countryside remains a conundrum. I will give my own points about the causes of this trend and whether it is good for youngsters to work in farming.<NL><NL><NL><NL>   Firstly, fewer people do farming jobs in rural areas because those involved are usually underpaid. Consequently, it becomes a real hurdle to lead their family to a happy life while living  a low standard. Everyone desires to have tasty meals, to live in gorgeous houses, to send their kid to well-reputed schools so they would never accept such a low wage . Secondly, extreme working conditions are another burden that people have to take on. For example, when it is in the middle of June, farmers are still in the fields on a daily basis although the weather is rainy which is detrimental to endure. In contrast, even an office worker can get a higher air-conditioned working complex. In other words, this profession is the last choice and people avoid it because making a living seems to be impossible.<NL><NL><NL><NL>    Those above-mentioned pieces of evidence show that there are a lot more well-paid careers for people to choose if they leave the remote area to study in the city. Such as doctors, architecture designers, and other rewarding roles, so I strongly disagree to let  youngsters work in the profession of cultivating. Moreover, if students become farmers, they will waste all the time and money that they spent on academic education because watering and collecting do not need high level of qualification but health, all of their accomplishments at school are unusable then. For instance, unlike farmers, well-educated IT developers can earn much more in a month. In addition, those people also have the  right to experience other perks such as being flexible in working schedules, which farmers could never have .<NL><NL><NL><NL>   In conclusion, there are a few key reasons for the decreasingly attendance to the work that provides agriculture products being little amount of pay and a poor working environment. Due to this, the young should consider having another choice which is more try-worthy with more creature comforts.

task: The expansion of multinational companies and increase in globalization produces positive effects to everyone. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement
essay: globalization and the flourishing of multinational enterprises is a ubiquitous phenomenon and are becoming  the issue of today.such a phenomenon has both positives and negatives impacts on societies ,Nevertheless ,  I am in favour of the idea that showcases  positive development  and I will elucidate on my conviction with relevant examples.<NL><NL><NL><NL>globalization has made the world a small village where it becomes  easier to relocate  from one place to another. many students prefer to pursuing degrees achieving their objectives and passions overseas , in the best world universities.moreover, they may be recruited  in the same country where they studied  or moved to another nation to find  better opportunities ,in addition, many famous corporations  would  bring talented people  for its benefit ,thus, many chances to be considered in the light of globalization, corporates can work globally by working on smooth norms helping other lands to alleviate unemployment rates. For instance, Google is operating in almost every part of the world linking discrete employees. Moving ahead, the social facet is inescapable. When people move  abroad, they meet up and become friends with locals which aids them to know and accept their culture. Therefore, multicultural societies are taking birth welcoming every religion and culture.<NL><NL><NL><NL>furthermore, the more economic advances for a nation the more cons they will get. therefore  having a good strong economy  is the key to better living standards  which uplifted  due to flourished firms in their areas ,consequently, higher wages  and easier life teacher for instance will get double to three-fold salary than what they used to get before . another example, inhabitants will enjoy the new facilities brought to their places  after being isolated ,thus, more shops and recreational centre will be opened .<NL><NL><NL><NL>to sum up, globalization and the advancing of firms are the key points for any community wishing to develop

task: It is argued that the parents of children who break the rules should be punished in some ways as parents are responsible for the children's actions. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: It is widely believed that people should put blame on the parents of those who break the rules. Nevertheless, from my perspective, exerting punishment on parents for their children's wrongdoing is not sensible for a variety of reasons.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with, every individual should be responsible for their own actions. Although fathers and mothers have to take accountability for their children's mistakes in some aspects, the youngsters need to deal with the problems they had caused because each person is a separate individual who has their own thoughts and deeds. Hence, it is morally wrong to blame all the responsibilities on moms and dads. Besides, if parents are in charge of the faults that their children cause, the youngsters will rely on their parents and are not willing to face worthy penalties.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Furthermore, adolescents are influenced by not only their parental behaviours but also other vital factors such as their peers and toxic content on the Internet. In the tech savvy-era, the popularity of social media boosts the anti-social and harmful videos that cause plenty of consequences that fathers and mothers could not control. Those who have curiosities could mimic these criminal activities that they do not have full awareness of. Another reasonable factor that should be concerned is the teenagers' social relationships at school. Friendship plays a crucial role and affects directly children's behaviours and actions. For example, as reported in Times in 2020, there are more than half of teenagers' crimes have the potential root of obeying peers' actions. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, although maternal individuals are the core model and the protectors of their offspring, I am of the opinion that it is unreasonable to accuse them of their children's faulty actions.

task: In recent time economic growth has made some people richer in both developed and developing countries. While studies show that people in developing countries are happier now than before, people in developed countries are no happier than they were before.
essay: Money cannot guarantee people's happiness. It is proved by experts that although economic growth has made people richer, people from developed countries feel less happy than they were before. In contrast, in poor countries, wealth make them happier. I will outline the reason why this phenomenon happened.<NL><NL>In the case of developed countries, they are never starving. In the past, they can found meal everywhere and able to bought it. Before technology advanced, they already went to work such as farming or work in a factory. They had enough money to prevent them from starving. Another reason is the time of working. They worked several hours and have time to take a rest. Meanwhile, in recent year, they work overlap time hours. They have no time to do their interest or go on vacations with their family. It is because of competition among people. Their ambition encourages them to pursue their goal and achievement for enhancing their status.<NL><NL>On the other hand, residents of developing countries feel happier than they were before because they ever lived in a lack of education and food. In the past, it was really hard for them to buy some food and studied in formal education. But today, since they are richer than before, they can get both of those terms. They can buy an important stuff for their life. Another reason is they can manage their time working well, so they still have time to interact with other people.<NL><NL>In conclusion, I must say that what we can learn about two cases above is to love our life. It is true that we need to work and earn money for our life but it cannot be denied that we need to enjoy our life with our lovely people. So, we need to thanks for everything we have and we got.

task: The only way to improve road safety is to give much stricter punishments on driving offenses. <NL><NL><NL><NL>To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: There is currently a debate about whether imposing stricter penalties on inappropriate drivers is the sole solution to promoting road safety. I strongly disagree with this statement because, in my view, road safety depends not only on the severity of punishments but also on effective traffic rule enforcement and heightened public awareness.<NL><NL><NL><NL>One compelling reason why I argue that traffic rules play a pivotal role in addressing this issue is that rules form the fundamental framework that shapes societal behavior. Moreover, stringent traffic laws can deter drivers from engaging in dangerous behaviors on the road, thereby fostering a safer driving environment. To illustrate, individuals contemplating driving home after consuming alcoholic beverages, which could lead to accidents, are more likely to reconsider their actions when faced with the consequences outlined in traffic laws. Consequently, rules are instrumental in preventing potentially hazardous situations.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Another key factor supporting my stance is the importance of individual awareness and responsibility in ensuring road safety. Despite the existence of stringent penalties in traffic laws, some individuals continue to flout them. By educating drivers about these laws and cultivating a mindset of respect for fellow citizens on the road, we can significantly improve driver behavior. For example, a well-informed driver with a positive attitude toward road safety is more likely to become a responsible and law-abiding motorist, thereby contributing to a safer traffic environment. Therefore, encouraging a collective commitment to safe driving is paramount in enhancing road safety.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, I firmly believe that achieving road safety requires more than just imposing harsher penalties on offenders. It necessitates a multifaceted approach that includes effective traffic rule enforcement and the cultivation of public awareness and responsibility. By addressing these aspects comprehensively, we can work towards building a safer and more secure road environment for everyone.

task: Some people think that the only way to improve safety on our roads is to give much stricter punishments on driving offences. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: There is a lot of discussion on how to improve security on our roads. Some people think that in order to decrease  the number of accidents there should be stricter punishments for driving offences. Although this might help, I believe that the impact would be minimal. I firmly believe that to increase safety on our commute there should be better planning on how they construct the roads and also in public transportation availability, in this essay I will point out the reasons and examples for my opinion.<NL><NL><NL><NL>First, hefty fines do not always work, one example is how Brazil increased the punishment for drunk driving, increasing the value of the fine and also making it a crime. But this had the initial effect of decreasing the number of driving under influence related accidents, however, over time drivers grew accustomed to it and rates came back to the same levels as before. Also, most municipalities do not have enough resources to diverge to this kind of inspection, making the punishment not as believable.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Secondly, the construction of  roads has a huge impact on how individuals drive. As an example, large lanes might bring a feeling of security to the driver and they might drive with less awareness and not check their speed as often. Therefore, roads that also are made to share the space with cars and pedestrians might have a huge influence on the number of accidents.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Lastly, there are other mechanisms of traffic control and security, that are more effective and cheaper than fines. One of the main ones is investing in public transportation. Taking people out of the cars and making them use public buses or trains put more professional drivers on the road and remove more aloof from the roads,  thus decreasing the risk of accidents.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, although stricter punishments might look like a good solution, they would have an effect only in the short run. For more lasting effects the design of roads and also how public transportation is available to have a more effective impact.

task: THE ONLY WAY TO IMPROVE ROAD SAFETY IS TO GIVE MUCH STRICTER PUNISHMENTS ON DRIVING OFFENCES. TO WHAT EXTENT DO YOU AGREE OR DİSAGREE?
essay: In the last few years, the debate regarding road safety has been raised. Some people claim that the only way to increase  road security is to have strict rules and punishment systems. However, I believe that such measures will not be enough and we need more actions to tackle this problem. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Firstly, the government should have the responsibility for ensuring that the country has a safe route according to the standards. For example, in the major cities, we should have huge roads then small network routes. In addition, roadway maintenance should occur frequently in order to avoid accidents. Furthermore, we should have a national roads safety committee that will inspect and standardize the traffic safety issues. For instance, the committee will give guidelines to be followed as well as training to the inspectors to monitor the progress. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Secondly, the government also needs to make clear traffic rules and distribute them to the people. In other words,  theoretical knowledge should be included in driving lessons. In addition, such knowledge should be distributed to all roads users. Thirdly, the presence of traffic lights is essential to allow smooth movements of the vehicles. All of that together with a strict punishment system will decrease  accidents and promote roads safety. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, to decrease the accidents and make sure the security of motor traffic, cyclists and pedestrians we should have excellent roads as well as a formal committee that responsible for the guidelines. In addition to a strict fines system. Also,  a theoretical exam should take place for all driving students.

task: Some people think that young people should be required to do unpaid work helping people in the community. Do the advantages outweigh the disadvantages?
essay: There is a widespread belief that voluntary community work should be mandatory for young individuals.  Although charity work does provide some value, I am more convinced that forcing them to take part in these activities is rather unfair.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with the positives, a crucial advantage of unpaid services is that they inculcate a high sense of responsibility towards the community among teenagers. Indeed, without involving in charitable organizations, they miss the chance to experience and gain insight into the underprivileged in real life. As a result, they would not propose adequate solutions to solve these social problems in the future. Furthermore, a volunteer program is a chance for youngsters to develop various skills, which can be seen as a beneficial asset for their resumes. For instance, their communication and teamwork skills can be improved when they collaborate with friends to help the elder or orphans.<NL><NL><NL><NL>However, there are still some disadvantages when forcing young people to take part in unpaid jobs. Firstly, the time devoted to community services can be time-consuming. Undoubtedly, students have to set aside their studying time to join these activities. The second drawback is that if this policy is mandatory, it can pose a stressor for the young generation. Besides studying, most of them already have multiple responsibilities to tend to, like developing their own project, working part-time, or implementing the activities of their club. Adding public service as an obligation will make them feel being stripped of their freedom. Then, the values of voluntary spirit will be lost.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, despite some benefits in terms of a sense of responsibility and skill development, charity services are still overshadowed by the downside.

task: Some people believe that eventually all jobs will be<NL><NL><NL><NL>done by artificially intelligent robots.<NL><NL><NL><NL>What is your opinion?
essay: Artificial intelligence and its impact on employment is increasingly becoming a hot topic of debate. While a number of people believe that artificially intelligent robots will replace humans to do all jobs in the long term, there are many who have opposing views. This essay will argue that eventually, most jobs will indeed be done by robots powered by artificial intelligence although not all jobs as believed by some.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Around the world, giant strides have been made with regards to the capacity of artificial intelligent robots to carry out complex tasks typically done by humans in industries like manufacturing, shipping and information technology. These robots are consistently demonstrating higher efficiency levels with cheaper overhead costs than their human counterparts, causing many industry leaders to cut down on their human workforce in favour of adopting robotic systems. For example, Tesla, the global leader in electric vehicle manufacturing, recently announced plans to lay off 20% of its workforce as well as plans to build two new factories across North America that will be fully operated using robots powered by artificial intelligence. Many more of such announcements are expected in the coming decades, corroborating the belief that human beings will be made redundant as more artificially intelligent robots replace them at their jobs. <NL><NL><NL><NL>However, not all occupations can be efficiently done by these robots. Professions such as prostitution, policing, marketing and customer service require human factors such as empathy and emotions to be delivered efficiently. For instance, studies show that many customers prefer to interact with a human customer service agent over the phone to help resolve their problems, rather than interact with a non-human system.
