To sum it up, artificial intelligence may never be able to replicate the human factors listed and as such cannot perform tasks that require these factors. <NL><NL><NL><NL>This essay has argued that artificial intelligence robots will eventually be able to do most jobs and also touched on the fact that not all jobs can be done by these robots. In my opinion, a lot of jobs will be done by robots in the long-term but not all jobs.

task: Surveys show that many people believe most jobs in the future will be done at home.Do you agree or disagree ?
essay: In recent years, there have been numerous people prefered to spend their work from home. As such, there are agreements and disagreements in comunities, although I opine thats the agreements outweigh the disagreements. I agree that it would be optimized our working performance, if we do it from home. In this essay, I will examine all the relevant arguments based on factual premises.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Nowadays, time is the most important factor in a person's life. A person can save a lot of time from travelling and preparations from their home to workplace. In addition, numerous hassles such as driving and travelling through public transportation will be reduced. It will comfort human life. Due to this, people will have a lot of time to spend with their loved ones. For example. as per data released by the government, numerous people are enjoying to work from their homes which has boost their work performance. <NL><NL><NL><NL>On the companies side, they gain a lot of beneficials from remote workers because they do not have to spend money to manage their employees in the offices. For example, the employer does need to spend money on food and water for their workers. Moreover, they obtain a lot of profits because of excellent performance from their employees. Nowadays, the employer can save money because they do not rent a place.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, there are numerous merits from remote work for employers and employees. This essay suggests companies to adopt this method because of beneficial impacts to all-around society.

task: Some people believe that eventually all jobs will be done by artificially inetligent robots.<NL><NL><NL><NL>What is your opinion?
essay: In these modern days, people think that AI will rapidly increase to replace our jobs. I believe our technology has developed diverse opinions and it will be taking over from what we created, robots.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In the past, skill was a necessary qualification for any occupation, and any type of job had to be done manually by humans such as an accountant or an analyzer. This type of employee has to be very intelligent and concentrated in their job, if there is any error it would cause the accuracy and damage the company's reputation.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Conversely, an intelligent robot can be represented as a computer and a human because of their accuracy and faster response to our needs. For example, auto-clean machines can be used for any type of household, human only need to click an app from their smartphone, and it will automatically start their job. It not only saves time but also saves money to hire someone to tidy the house.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, even though the human is the one who invents robots, we forget this development will change our living society and the innovative machine will also replace our job placement.

task: many universities professional cannot find the jobs in their choosen profession.what factors may have cause this situation and what in your opinion should be done about it.
essay: It has been universally acknowledged that the problem of unemployment among university graduates is escalating at an alarming rate in the current scenario. This issue has been a depressing magnitude. Although a plethora of reasons are there yet some sensible solutions are also available to curb this grave issue.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To commence with  the first and foremost cause,  is a lack of professionalism because colleges  do not teach pupils about the value of being well-behaved at job interviews. Moreover, teachers in educational institutes focus on covering the topics in the syllabus and train students to achieve good grades . Undoubtedly,  a number of learners graduate from top universities  with excellent grades. However, they end up being unemployed due to a lack of knowledge about job opportunities, interview criteria and resumes. To illustrate, in developed nations, multinational companies recruit candidates based on their resumes, interviews and experience in the past and according to a survey majority of people are not called in for hiring events because of the unprofessional format used to make resumes. Hence, being a bookworm is not worth it as communication skills and a number of other personality traits can help to achieve  a reputable position.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Moving toward the ideas that can curb this issue, the best solution to this problem is to make it compulsory for educational institutes to introduce a course in the graduation program in which students will be taught about the proper format of making resumes. In addition, interview practices should be a part of the syllabus and the skills of making connections with people in their field should be taught. For instance, a survey was conducted and it showed that people who took extra courses to learn resume-making and to practice job interviews were able to gain jobs in their fields. Consequently, learners will gain confidence and will gain  an idea of real-world competition in finding jobs.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To recapitulate, without any doubt, this problem has become a burning question of the day. Therefore, educational authorities should come forward to mitigate this complex problem.

task: Many people have jobs that involve working shifts (i.e. working at night). What are some of the problems that shift workers might face? What can be done to solve them?
essay: There is no denying that working shifts might be harder than other regular jobs. This essay is intended to analyze the several drawbacks this category has to face daily, as well as to suggest some solutions to reduce the burden on workers. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Firstly, there are numerous issues when considering working shifts. In fact, if it is not always pleasant to work, it is much less enjoyable when it is due during nights, bank holidays or weekends. While ordinary employees have the chance to spend festive moments with friends and relatives, healthcare workers, to give an example, are going to the hospital. Year after year, these missed precious moments contribute to a potential burn-out. Moreover, it has been demonstrated that working at night alters the circadian rhythm, which has negative consequences on the physical and psychological sphere. To conclude, these are just a few of the innumerable concerns shift workers have to deal with.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, there are different solutions to at least sweeten shift-workers'workers conditions. For instance, an economic incentive should be given to them, especially when considering weekends and bank holidays. In addition, the number of wards should be limited following the guidelines written by the Society of occupational medicine. Finally, extra days off should be guaranteed, in order for workers to spend a proper amount of time with families and friends while they are not sleeping, as well as to profit from daylight to accomplish ordinary tasks. Perhaps, with those suggestions they might cherish their employment a bit more. <NL><NL><NL><NL>To conclude, there are countless cons to working during shifts. However, there are luckily a bunch of options, alternatives and ideas to ameliorate the condition of this essential class of workers.

task: Q:  SOME PEOPLE BELIEVE THAT EVENTUALLY ALL JOBS WILL BE DONE BY ARTIFICIALLY INTELLIGENT ROBOTS.<NL><NL><NL><NL>WHAT IS YOUR OPINION?
essay: These days with the advent of new technologies such as AI, a lot of people have lost their businesses and have been replaced by them. Someone may say that this process will continue, resulting in the loose of all the jobs. While others say that there are professions that only living humans can do. I agree with the latter opinion and process this view in this essay. <NL><NL><NL><NL> Most importantly, professions dealing with feelings are difficult to be managed by AI. It is a privilege for human beings to be moved, shocked or angry and needless to say, those emotions can not be understood by artificially made things. For example, jobs such as mental counsellors can not be replaced. This is because there are no patterns or concrete solutions that can be applied to a mental problem. Problems regarding sentiments are always different and so the solutions are uncountable like stars. It is impossible for AI to deal with it using a pattern programmed previously. <NL><NL><NL><NL> On the other hand, someone may say that if we give all the accumulated information about a job, AI will be able to run the work. I agree to some extent but the more jobs AI steals, the more works people will nurture. AI is special in that it can use effectively all the past information. However, it is unable to make new things because it lacks creativity. Therefore, only humans are able to make innovations and innovative jobs can not be replaced by humans. <NL><NL><NL><NL> In conclusion, AI will never replace all jobs because it can not understand feelings and give birth to innovations.

task: Some people believe that eventually all jobs will be done by artificially intelligent robots. <NL><NL><NL><NL>What is your opinion?
essay: As technology continues to advance, the majority of the jobs in future will be done by machines with artificial intelligence. Robots possibly can take most of the jobs; however, it is highly unlikely that occupations that require human contact can be substituted. This essay will discuss, why most of the jobs will be automated and only a few will be carried out by humans.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Automation is becoming increasingly prevalent and is likely to have a significant impact on the labour jobs market that does not require specific and complex human skills. Many companies will turn to artificial intelligence to automate processes and increase  efficiency as it is far less expensive than hiring, training and employing a human. For example, in many countries car wash stations have been automated that cost far less than employees. In addition, these stations work around the clock and require no vacations or holiday pay. For these reasons, occupations that can be automated will be replaced.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Conversely, there are some occupations that require a human touch and for this ,reason can not be replaced by artificial intelligence. These jobs include education, medicine, psychology and social work to name but a few. Robots will never be able to achieve the social and emotional capabilities that are required to perform these jobs.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To conclude, a significant number of human jobs will be conducted by robots in the future. While robots can take over the labour market jobs , occupations that require human skills will always exist. Ultimately, skilful jobs which are effectively done by people may not be done  by machines.

task: Some believe that eventually all jobs will be done by artificially intelligent robots. What is your opinion?
essay: In all countries around the globe armed police personnel are common. However, the necessity of arming them is debatable. Some people claim that it leads to the unprecedented attack on common people and perhaps to state terrorism and violence, while I concur with the side of those who argue that it is essential to maintain law and order. The reasons are manifold for my support  will be discussed in this essay. <NL><NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, I totally disagree with the notion that state terrorism is raising because of armed police officers. In fact, many people who believe this notion are not ready to understand the fact that the police department is directly controlled by the home department of government. And thus there are myriad public councils are working to strictly monitor the judicial use of these weapons by police officers. Additionally, these people often come with an example of some random police encounters with common people. Although these incidents are true, I believe these are mostly accidental and the police officers who are responsible for these also have been punished severely for their negligence. <NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, the country's entire internal security management is under the control of the police department. In order to maintain these superiorly, they are in the need to develop some sort of fear among people. This fear in my opinion is healthy for the betterment of society. Furthermore, police and state security forces are the first-line workers who need to witness some dangerous situations. Despite their personal well-being, they work towards the welfare and security of the people. For example, recently one of the police inspectors in my neighbourhood was brutally attacked by some petty thieves during a situation when he tried to arrest them for shoplifting. This incident made me  think in favour of armed police officers that if he was allowed to carry his weapon, he would have got prevented  the attack. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, not only do armed police officers use their weapons to maintain law and order, but also for their self-protection. Therefore, I totally agree that arming  police officers will never lead to state terrorism or violence, in fact, it prevents these.

task: Some people believe that eventually all jobs will be done by artificially intelligent robots. Whats your opinion?
essay: The chart below shows the percentage of ordinary in owned and rented in England and Wales between 1918 and 2011.<NL><NL><NL><NL>    The bar chart provides information about the proportion of everyday in owned and rented compromise in England and Wales during the period from 1918 to 2011.<NL><NL><NL><NL>    Overall, it is obvious that the percentage of apartment which were bought increased, whereas the proportion of building  rented decreased over the whole period. Moreover, in 1971, the figures for both items stood at the same number.<NL><NL><NL><NL>    In 1918, more everyday renting reconciliation than everyday owning compromise were chosen, approximately 87% and roughly 23%,respectively.Although renting building was more popular than buying box from 1939 to1961,the statistics for both stayed at 50% in 1971.Furthermore, the proportion of renting building was less than the owning building  in 1981,  40% and 60%, respectively. During the rest of the period, owning building was more universal than renting building.

task: Many university graduates cannot find a job in their chosen profession. <NL>What factors may have caused this situation and what, in your opinion, <NL>should be done about it?
essay: Nowadays we are facing the issue that a great total of graduates are completing their studies and becoming skilled but there are not many opportunities for them to get themselves involved in relevant jobs. This can be addressed by some important factors such as difficult environments and the poor infrastructure of industries. These can be solved by introducing some solutions like making the system more decorated and so on.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with, one of the most deleterious factors is nepotism. We can see in most cases that recruitment has been taken by the control of the people who always try to select those candidates who are known to them, although it is required to choose  skilled  applicants. For instance, the managing director of a company has the power to impact the employee selection process so if he wants to keep that person who is very familiar to him then there should remain nothing to do with him. Another factor regarding this issue is that there could be less total of vacancies in the job market. Sometimes the balance between the total of grads and the required employee gets missing. For example, especially in under-developing countries, the control of the number of alumni versus post vacancies is very fickle. The university produces a greater number of graduates than the industries need. That causes highly skilled alumni to become unemployed.<NL><NL><NL><NL>So, the authorities have to take  responsibility to counter these issues. One solution could be for the appointing system must have to be non-partial and authentic so that only eligible ones could have the chance to get shortlisted. Suppose in the interview, the interviewer should check the actual ability of the candidate, not his family status. On top of that, the industries are needed to expand, which will cause a great number of job fields. The company may collaborate with the research departments of the universities which will help a lot in introducing new products or methods in their working fields. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, there are some pressing factors in the unemployment of  highly qualified graduates for example, partiality in the job opportunity or imperfect management of developing working areas. The government can obtain some solutions like making a fair interviewing panel or spreading out the job field in such a way that the grads get the capability to prove themselves.

task: In many places women are taking jobs, which are traditionally done by men. What do you think make these changes happen? What’s your opinion about it?
essay: Nowadays, more and more women are working in plants, firms and industrial sites where only men  are used to be employed. Women are now more ambiguous and competing with men. This essay will explore reasons  why women are taking places occupied by men and at the end of the essay will underline my opinion.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Firstly, the reason is that there are so many single women pursuing their careers instead of building families. This could create competitive women who are eager for career development instead of building healthy relationships.For instance, compared to married women single one will wish for high-paid jobs and career opportunities because the only passion of not married women is their job opportunities.Thus that is why men are being replaced by females in job places.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Secondly, there are so many lonely mothers who give upbringing to their offspring. Consequently, they need more prospective job positions with high salaries since not everything is affordable nowadays because of high-cost products.For example , in order to afford a good education and food supply for their kids' parents should earn more money. Thus, women are taking any positions even men needed positions because it gives them the opportunity for earning high wages.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To conclude, it is true that women are taking men's traditional workplaces. In our contemporary community , the world it is common that women and men are on the same level. In my opinion, women should know their limitations and never compete with men because men are considered to be the chief of the family. Otherwise, females will stay lonely and not be respected by men.

task: In some countries, people encourage students to find part-time jobs while some people don't. Discuss both sides and give your opinion.
essay: In the contemporary epoch,there is irrefutable debate among folks  about part-time jobs for graduates.In certain countries,individuals inspire learners to find part-time employment while others do not advocate for it. I firmly coincide with and withstand the stated notion that it will expose the student in the line of the employment environment.This discourse will further elucidate my assertion in the forthcoming paragraph.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Firstly,this kind of exposure is very advantagious to the young stars although the society is not really for it.They end up practising what they are taught in lecture rooms as a results the gain experience and get exposure particularly in their area of interest.Moreover,work experience can help them land their dream job because most recruiters prefer to employ individuals with some experience.For example,a research done by kepsa(2020) depicts that 90% of employer prefer to give a job to people who have gone for an internship which help them as they do not take long to adapt to the system.Consequently,it is imperative for school-going people to undertake part-time attachment.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand,this can be detrimental since it can bring some disruption in the study although the student understands and retain more when they practice what they are taught in the classroom.Furthermore ,the scholar is not in a position to prepare for exams or even attend group discussion with others as there are duties allocated to them by the employer.For example,a research done by  the University of Nairobi depicts that part-time jobs for finalists make them drop out of school.Therefore,a certain individual does not advise pupils to work as it affects their performance as well as some end up dropping out of the academy<NL><NL><NL><NL>To sum up,i would like to restate the perspective that i concur that undergraduates must take part-time jobs to gain relevant experience for the sake of future dream jobs despite others advocating that it will affect the graduate end results.

task: Experts believe that over the next decade, robots will be doing many of the jobs currently done by humans.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of this.
essay: From last two decades advancement in techonology grows drastically, that day is not far when its gonna replace humans everywhere. This improvement will introduce its own pros and cons that I will discuss in following paragraphs.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with benefits, robots will be quicker because if same job is assigned to an indvidual and a machine it will be apparent second one will finish the wrok faster. for example,, to build a five stroy bulding genral labour will take atleast two years but when its replaced by robots it will be only the matter of few weeks. Therefore, this replacement will save time. Moreover, quality of work will be improved significantly. As when human beings perform chors its less likely to be error free as compared to technology. According to the study at the Oxford university the automated car tesla avoid 90% of the accidents that human drivers cannot.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Moving towards the drawbacks firstly, will cause unemployement when most taks will be completed by mechanical beings then folks will be jobless. For instance, Kiosk machiens at retaurants replaced the cashiers. Secondloy it will produce unhealthy society because people will always relay on robots to do even basic things like, having a cup of water or swithing off lights from bed these will result to no physical avtivities and will make society lazy.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To conclude, like all other wonders of science robort will be one of them and I believe weight of advanatgeos will be more than disadvantages.

task: In some countries, people encourage students to find part-time jobs while some people don't. Discuss both sides and give your opinion.
essay: It is often suggested that students should indulge in part-time internships while undergoing their studies. Some people, however, may argue and discourage students from doing so. I will discuss both  views in this essay but personally, I believe that youngsters must find part-time jobs which will help them in long term.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with, those who do not favour students in applying for half-time placement states their reason that freshmen should concentrate on their studies and complete their degree with distinction. They think that getting involved in work at this stage will create unnecessary extra pressure that will lead to low grades in college or university. Moreover, they think that this time can be utilized more on exam preparations required for higher studies. For example, undergraduates in their final year usually do not opt for any internships and exploit their time in preparing for MBA and master’s exams. Hence, for these reasons, some individuals do not encourage pupils to work.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, part-time jobs offer lots of advantages to younglings. Firstly, they can apply their theoretical knowledge and gain immense experience through these temporary placements. And secondly, the work experience gained can help them land  their dream jobs as most recruiters prefer people having some experience. For example, many engineering colleges in India have made it compulsory for their students to undergo two months of internship which benefits them in achieving their dream career. Therefore, it is advised to undertake a part-time profession for the above-mentioned motives.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, I agree that students must take on part-time jobs to ensure that they gain relevant experience which will give them an enormous advantage in developing their careers.

task: Some people believe that eventually all jobs will be done by artificially intelligent robots. What is your opinion?
essay: With the advancement of artificial intelligence, there are many people who advocate that humanoid robots can replace completely humans. Indeed, it might a trend in the contemporary day; however, I believe that some jobs are still requested for real people.  This essay will discuss compelling examples to sustain my belief. <NL><NL><NL><NL>There is no doubt that Ai can do numerous works. Because of deep learning and AI algorithms, computer and robots can apply repetitive and simple work, such as manufacturing and accounting. Take factories for example. Through precision computer science, AI might improve effectiveness, accuracy, and productivity compared with what traditional laborers did in the manufactory. Also, AI workers will work for their employers without asking for rest. It is significant to accelerate the productivity and the quality of production. <NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, AI might not take over some intricate jobs which are required for human judgment and experience.  For example, some medical procedures should be operated by skilled surgeons. It is because complex surgeries are crucial and are related to legal issues. Thus, human surgeons should take responsibility for medical decisions instead of AI robots.  Although there are increasing numbers of driverless cars on roads, the autopilot system is reported with an unexpected gap in the reality and causes several fatal car accidents worldwide. Thus, AI-driven vehicles cannot fully substitute for drivers in the short-term time.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, even if it is convenient to utilize AI to enhance the efficiency of the job market, I believe that it cannot fully dominate employment and take the place of humans in all aspects of fields.

task: Experts believe that over the next decade, robots will be doing many of the jobs currently done by humans. Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of this.
essay: Nobody is a stranger to the fact that we live in a digital world. Many experts contend that over the next 10 years, robots will take over the jobs in many industries, which are currently done by people. To my way of thinking, there are both pros and cons to this proposal in equal measure. <NL><NL><NL><NL>There are many advantages, if you ask me, to this situation. In the first place, it increases work productivity at the workplace. Machines can work much longer hours than human employees without taking breaks. Their result is much more efficient and far more accurate than employees. People may make mistakes at work, but machines do not. Added to this, they do not have to be paid. Some occasional repairs are may be required over the long periods.  This saves a great amount of money for businesses. For instance, many supermarkets in many countries use automatic customer check-out points, which avoid hiring many workers. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Be that as it may, the downsides of this phenomenon, if you ask me, are just as big. For one thing, it raises the unemployment rate. People who lose jobs because of this will have no income and therefore no money to spend. This could cause serious consequences for the economy. To name but one example, governments cannot get taxes from individuals. As a result of this, governments do not have enough funds for schools, hospitals, public transport and many other facilities and infrastructure. It follows to stand, therefore, that the quality of all essential services will suffer. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Turning to my own experience, the way things are when it comes to this issue in my country, China, is the same as it was across the world over. My home city of Shanghai is a classic case in point. Here, many factories use robots to make products. Many workers cannot find jobs due to the higher preferences for machines in industrial sectors. <NL><NL><NL><NL>At the end of the day, there are merits and drawbacks to all choices we make in life. It is very important that governments play a role in creating enough employment opportunities for humans. This will develop their societies in a much more sustainable way.

task: Nowadays, more and more jobs and tasks which involve hard physical work are done by machines. Do the positive effects of this trend outweigh the negative effects?
essay: It is increasingly common that smart machines have been applied in some situations in which normal workers can not touch or accomplish. Therefore, I totally tend to agree such a phenomenon is productive for most labourers, corporations, and countries. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Admittedly, utilizing machines may result in some workers losing their jobs, especially those who are semi-literates or illiterates in a short period. While the governments can take various measures –training classes, declining taxes, and so on- to diminish this situation.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In terms of individuals, without hard work conditions, it means that they are under good protection and lower threats from uncontrolled weather or disasters. Compared with the last century, miners need to dig raw materials (such as coal, gold, iron, etc. ) via hammers and shovels  in the underground, which means they are not only in high-intensity work but also at threat of toxic gas; while today, so many robots and artificial machines are utilized in such dangerous field which dramatically reduces the chance that workers be hurt. In addition, as a company leader, what makes he/she most concerned is investments and profits. It is undeniable that machines can promote efficiency and enduring working during the same workload and limited time; when compared to hundreds of labourers. That is why a number of corporate leaders are fonder of taking revolutions in old product lines with new and reliable technologies. More importantly, applying machines in different fields is a symbol of a modern country, which means a good deal of talented people and perfect industry systems are already paying off.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To sum up, artificial machines allow people to get rid of hard work. although utilizing these smart apparatuses may have negative effects on a part group, it can reduce the rate of safety and develop good outcomes in the long term.

task: Some people believe that eventually all jobs will be done by artificial robots. What is your opinion?<NL><NL>Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant example from your knowledge or experience. Write at least 250 words.
essay: Nowadays, some people assume that occupations might be substituted progressively by artificial robots in the future. In my opinion, although a majority of simple jobs will be done by robots ultimately, it is impossible that positions which require human relations can be replaced. This essay will discuss the reasons why only particular jobs will be finally taken over.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Without a doubt, artificial robots will easily overtake the jobs that do not require specific and complex human skills in the workforce. From a cost point of view, many companies will choose to use artificial intelligence because it is far less expensive than training and employing a human. Cashiers in supermarket, for instance, are gradually being replaced by checkout machines that cost far less than employees. Customers can easily pay for their goods by using self-checkout facilities rather than standing in a long queue to wait for services at a counter. For these reasons, using artificial robots can be a significantly effective way for companies. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Conversely, there are some complicated human jobs that will never be overtaken by robotic intelligence because robots do not have the capacities to achieve. In other words, some particular occupations require complex and critical thinking that only human brain can do. For example, science-related jobs, such as doctors, scientists, pharmacists, engineers, can only be carried out by the professionals, even in the future. Robots will not be able to sort out all of the problems which need to be overcome by human. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, with the development of advanced technology, it is no doubt that robots have the abilities to replace a significant number of occupations in the near future. Unskilled labour will eventually be done by machines entirely; however, some sophisticated fields that require specific and complicated human skills will always exist. Consequently, occupations in particular professional areas will be safe in an increasingly artificial intelligent world.

task: Some people believe that eventually all jobs will be done by artificially intelligent robots. What is your opinion?
essay: In the future, artificially intelligent robots will do all jobs, replacing humans in the workforce. While it is possible that robots will eventually do all exactly repetitive jobs, it is unlikely that jobs that require empathy skills by humans will be taken over. This essay will discuss why people, not replaced by robots, will carry out only some specific jobs.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Robots may do jobs with repetitive and straightforward steps that do not require specific and complex human skills. Many companies have applied artificial intelligence robots into programmable tasks to improve processes instead of hiring and training their employees. In many manufacturing factories, for example, many routine production steps have been replaced by automated solutions run by robots that cost far less than employees. In addition, the automated stations work around the clock and require no holiday or sick leave like the workforce. For these reasons, some suitable jobs that can be suitable by robotic process automation will be replaced.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the contrary, some human jobs cannot be replaced by robots because artificial robots will never reach the efficient capacity to do them. The jobs that need psychology, education, medical, and social work require human empathy. In undeveloped countries, for instance, uneducated people need social workers to help them relieve their minds. Additionally, when people face fatal health problems, such as cancer, doctors gradually attempt to empathise, parallel with a situation assessment, to their relatives or even directly to patients. Therefore, it is too complicated that robots will be programmed to well complete those jobs instead of humans being.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, it is increasingly possible that robots will be gradually replaced most human tasks soon. Robots may entirely complete the unskilled jobs; however, not all jobs are replaced by automated solutions, sophisticated jobs that still need empathy from humans will always exist. Ultimately, the complicated jobs that are required a high-skilled workforce are still safe parallel in the automated solution environment increasing.

task: In some countries people encourage teenagers to find part time jobs. Some people agree and others don't. Review both sides and give your opinion.
essay: There is no doubt that working from a young age makes us independent and self displined. While some people believe that this trend should not be followed, others argue that it helps to build strong minded teenagers. In this essay, I will discuss both sides of the argument and explain my support for the latter view.<NL><NL><NL><NL>One of the most important drawback of teenagers involved in part time jobs is time management. The younsters who work in any part time job are mostly undergarduate students or higher secondary students, because of their part time jobs they get very less time for their studies which in turn leads to bad scores in their marksheets.  Additionally, some part time jobs includes morning and late night shifts, which is the most important time for good sleep. As a reult it directly effects the productivity of the teenagers.<NL><NL><NL><NL>However, part time jobs gives the opportunity to experience real time world apart from studies and college life. Working experience gives the chance to learn from your own mistakes from a very young age, that hepls to build the stronger future. For example, there are some students who does not have any financial support for their education, they  can earn their living and fulfill their dreams, and achieve their goals by their own.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, working as a part time can be proven hectic for young generation. In my opinion benefits of part time jobs in young generation are outweighted by the drwabacks, I would prefer top indulge my children in part time jobs.

task: Some people believe that eventually all jobs will be done by artificially intelligent robots. <NL>What is your opinion?
essay: Some may argue that in the future all human workforces will be replaced by robots. While it is possible that most low skill jobs will be taken over by artificial intelligent computers, it is still difficult for some area of work to fully rely on them. This essay will discuss why in the end humans are still needed to do many other jobs.<NL><NL><NL><NL>First, the majority of the non-complex occupation will be handle by robot in the future. It simply because, robot can be easily programmed to do a constant and simple job, moreover, companies will try their best to limit the salary expense by hiring more robots to replace the non-essential workforce. In Indonesia for example, they already started to create an automatic payment gate in every toll-roads. In addition, this automatic gate now being implemented and more common to be found as an exit gate in the parking area. For these reasons, ,eventually many low-level jobs will be replaced by robot in the future.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, there are a lot of specific jobs that utterly cannot be substituted by another thing but human.  This condition applies because that kind of work often needs the intervere of the human brain as decision-makers. Doctors for instance, need to analyse many aspects of patients before taking actions and receipt of proper medicines. That kind of complex decision-making process is very unique and robot will not be able to compete with humans.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, even though in the future robot might take over many kinds of job, there are still numerous jobs that will never be replaced by it, more specifically jobs that involving the decision-making process. Ultimately, the increasing number of robots as work labourers are an inevitability and only a few jobs will incompatible for them.

task: It is generally observed that almost all high level jobs are done by men.Does it mean that the government should encourage a certain percentage of these jobs to be observed for women?<NL>Do you agree or disagree with this proposition?
essay: Nowadays, a great deal of attention has been paid to gender equality. Some people insist that government should quote the percentage of men and women who engage in managing jobs. I strongly agree with the idea because gender inequality is a severe problem in this contemporary world, and it is difficult to solve this without support from the government.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with, the first reason why I support this is that there is a huge gap between males and females at workplaces. In fact, men more likely to be promoted than women in Japan. Japan is ranked 121st out of 150 countries regarding Gender Gap Index in 2020, and there are 10 per cent of female who play important role at office. This is because men have been jacked up the scores for a long time, and this is not because women inferior to man.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Another reason why I believe the government have better observe high-level positions for females is that society needs legal force. In general, managing positions are dominated by men in Japan. As a result, women struggle to be promoted and become executives. Traditionally, seniors do not think women become a member of society, since it had been considered that the greatest success as a woman is to become a housewife and raise children. Hence, it is easier to direct gender equality for companies when the government set a rule.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To conclude, I reiterate my complete agreement with the topic. This is because unfairness among men and women is the critical problem, and it quote is vital to enforce companies to put women at higher positions.

task: Some people believe  that eventually all jobs will be done by artificially intelligent  robots?<NL><NL><NL><NL>What is your opinion?
essay: It's argued that  with today's advanced automation, robots will replace humans in all jobs in the coming days. I strongly disagree that there are many jobs that cannot be substituted by automation despite  the advancement in  technology. This essay will elaborate on few real-time cases.<NL><NL><NL><NL>  Firstly, not all task can be replaced. For instance, Labour delivery in hospitals must and should be done by doctors, because of complications at times, that need to implement on the spot which only comes with experience. However, robots with programme implanted might not be the better option. Secondly, not only this, we have few more cases where mechanisation fail if replaced. Let's take the pilot, Also like the above case, we need to act on real-time circumstances such as weather, turbulence etc., where human pilots have no replacement. Therefore, I strongly oppose the opinion that all jobs will be replaced by artificial intelligence.<NL><NL><NL><NL>  There are few jobs that can be replaced by robots in place of humans. For example, in an Insecurity stream such as bomb dismantles we can save lives if we can use automated gadgets such as drones and robots. In future we can see way more robots in the military, replacing humans. Other than  few tasks, artificial intelligence cannot replace the individual.<NL><NL><NL><NL>  In conclusion, Eventhough, some argue that jobs will be replaced by automation, I strongly believe that a lot of jobs may not be substituted by any technology in the coming future. However, few works can be and should be replaced for human safety as discussed.

task: Only 20% of Tech Jobs are Held by Women.<NL><NL>What problems do women face that prevent them from getting these jobs and what must be done to change this situation?
essay: Men have dominated job sector since the industry revolution, despite progress in gender equality. Men still seem to outnumber the women in terms of employment in tech business. In this essay I shall discuss the issues tossed against women in securing these jobs and changes that need to be put forth to reduce this inequality. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Regardless of having equal or superior skills to their male counterpart, women often feel societal pressure and cultural norms work against them while seeking jobs. Interviewers question the female applicants about their martial and parental status to understand their personal commitments before offering them the job, hence women are pushed to carefully guard their details in an interview, so they don’t lose out on the job. Additionally, not having a collage degree or computer science graduation tend to lower their confidence at workplace or when applying for jobs, because in many cultures’ families encourage men to pursue higher education while women are pushed performed household activities. For instances in Asian countries people believe that men are bread winners of the family as well as invest in their education but on the other hand women are taught to take care of the home and perform domestic work. All these factors make the career path of a woman more challenging.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Many women activist across the globe have brought up this issue to the society and fought gender equality in job market. As result of this, today many corporate companies incorporated polices to ensure their work force have equal number of women and men employee. Other than this IT sector need diligently transform their corporate culture to respect all employees, moreover make discrimination and gender inequality socially unacceptable. These changes will make the womenfolk feel more secure and boost their morality, thus we can perhaps close the gap between gender disparity.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To conclude, cultural norms need to change in employment and educational settings to permanently eliminate the problem of gender discrimination, so every woman can feel confident, supported and safe as they pursue their dreams.

task: Some people believe that eventually all jobs will be done by artificially intelligent robots.<NL>What is your opinion?
essay: Artificially intelligent robots are increasingly going to be replaced by a human in the workforce. Although most jobs can be done by robots, a human-contact is essential in some jobs. This essay will discuss both sides.<NL><NL><NL><NL>As we are in a technological world, many jobs can be done by robots. It is most likely the number one choice, and It is preferable by companies to get for its accuracy, quickness, as well as it is cheaper rather than hiring, training an employee. For example, modern country starts to use an automated station in its shops. In summary, artificially intelligent robots are becoming increasingly popular because of its cheapness, and effectiveness. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Conversely, human-relations are required in some jobs and it cannot be replaced by robots whatsoever. It is impossible that complex jobs could be done by machine when the human interactions are important. For instance, in the education, physiology, medical filed the human-touch is essential. For this reason, there are particular jobs where a present of human is fundamental. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, this essay acknowledges that artificially intelligent robots are preferred in this modern world. Although it cannot be replaced by human in certain jobs.

task: Many jobs used to be done at home by hand, but nowadays an increasing number of them are done using machines instead. Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of <NL>this development.
essay: In this modern world of advanced technology, people were more relying on home appliances for daily household activities as in the past they do all of it by themselves. <NL><NL><NL><NL>The invention of advanced electronic machines is helping people to save time, which they invest in doing regular housekeeping activities.<NL><NL><NL><NL>For instance, washing machines help people to save  their precious time and energy which they spent on washing clothes by hand in the past. Moreover, it helps parents to save time, which they can enjoy with their children.<NL><NL><NL><NL>However, there are few cons associated with use of machines such as health problems.<NL><NL><NL><NL>There was a survey conducted by local newspaper which revealed that people who do not use home appliances were more healthy than people who were in the habit of using them. If we talk about microwaves, it got banned from Japan because use of it was leading to serious health problems like cancer, hypertension. <NL><NL><NL><NL>According to me we should only use these appliances when required so that we can maintain a healthy lifestyle.

task: Some people believe that eventually all jobs will be done by artificially intelligent robots.
essay: Artificially intelligent robots are progressively replacing humans in the workforce. While it is possible that all menial jobs will eventually done by robots, it is unlikely that jobs that require human contact will be taken over. This essay will discuss why eventually only very few jobs will be carried out by people.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Robots may eventually replace all human labour that does not require specific and complex human skills. Many companies will turn to artificial intelligence because it is far less expensive than hiring, training and employing a human. In supermarkets in Australia, for example, many cashiers have been replaced by automated stations that cost far less than employees. In addition, these automated stations work around the clock and require no holidays or holiday pay. For these reasons, jobs that can be replaced by robotic intelligence will be replaced.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Conversely, there are some human jobs that cannot be replaced because robots will never achieve the capacity to do them. Put simply, some jobs require a 'human touch'. These jobs include psychology, education, medicine and social work to name but a few. Robots will never be able to achieve what has taken social evolution hundreds of thousands of years to achieve.<NL><NL><NL><NL>It is increasingly likely that robots will end most human employment. Unskilled labour will eventually be done entirely by robots; however sophisticated jobs that require human specific skills will always exist. Ultimately, few jobs will be safe in an increasingly artificial intelligent workforce.

task: Some people believe that eventually all jobs will be done by artificially intelligent robots, what is your opinion?
essay: At present time, there have been many intelligent robots that can be able to work as same as humans do. Although, some might say that people are into and can be more practical, some argue that a smart invention is totally accurate. I strongly believe that we should intrigate between humankind and robots because both of them have its pros and cons. This essay will explore the benefits and some drawbacks in following paragraphs.<NL><NL><NL><NL>As nowadays there are a number of artificial intelligent robots involve in many industries for a few advantages. One of these is they provide more accurate and precise processing than human. For example, there is a medical robotic machine which helps pharmacist to prepare the tablets for their patients and the medical errors are rarely found  when compared to providing medicine without helping of intelligent machanical inventions.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In contrast, a person can do some task better than a robotic invention, such as cooking in the high class restaurant as the fantastic meals need to be done by a sophisticated chief who can put and test the best ingradient in a hot pot for their customers. Nevertheless, a worker need to get paid for their insurance and other welfares while a robot does not need anythings like humans do.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To conclude, there are advantages and disadvantages both of these of them. A company should wisely make a dicision before choosing and consider which one is more worth or they can apply both of them in order to make more profits. Moreover, the most crucial is they can afford it. I believe that the organizations could earn more income if they opt a smart option.

task: Surveys show that many people believe most jobs in the future will be done at home.Do you agree or disagree ?
essay: Now a days many surveys depicts that “work from home” is the upcoming future trend. This essay completely agrees with the statement because this will save quite an amount of resources for the companies and moreover, it is comfortable for the employees.<NL><NL>To begin with, many companies will allow their employees to work from home. In almost all multinational companies, majority of work is done on the computers online contrary to the work done in the past which was done manually. Work like attending meeting, presentations and conversation with the clients can be easily done with the help of internet and it is not mandatory to go to the office. This saves huge amount of money with regards to paying rents, electricity bill and other running cost. A study performed on America’s largest company has proven that there is no significance difference between the efficacy from working in the office and from home along with positive impact on company’s balance sheet.<NL><NL>Secondly, it is very convenient for the employees to works from home. Going to the office and travelling long distance drains lot of energy and is very tiring and this negatively affect the overall performance. This can be negated by staying home and working in homely and comfortable environment. Several researches have shown that employees who are working from home have fewer health problems and less family issues as compared to the regular employees.<NL><NL>To summarize, in coming years home will be the new office in order to provide much needed relaxation to companies increasing expenditures as well as to the employees

task: Men and women are different in terms of their characteristics and abilities. For this reason, some jobs are better done by men and others by women.<NL>Do you agree or disagree?
essay: These days, it seems that more women are entering “male occupations” than ever before and vice versa. While some still hold to the conservative view that certain jobs are better performed by men and others by women, it is my personal belief that people of their sex are capable of doing any job effectively. The reasons for my position are as follows.<NL><NL>First of all, I believe it is a mistake to base our views on broad generalisations about the characteristics of men and women as such stereotypes are often inaccurate. Although there are certainly traits which are typical of men and others which are typical of women, there are exceptions to every rule. Not all women are physically weak, just as not all men are poor interpersonal communicators; conventional gender roles are not appropriate for everybody. If a man and woman desires to pursue a career which is traditionally reserved for the opposite sex, I believe he/ she should be provided the opportunity to prove him/ herself capable.<NL><NL>Secondly, I would contend that the presence of both males and females in a workplace brings a sense of balance. Men and women frequently, though by no means always, have different methods of doing things. Rather than judging these differences to be weakness, I feel that we should view them as opportunities for innovation and the discovery of more effective and efficient work practices. A person’s weakness can thus be transformed into strengths.<NL><NL>In summary, I once again reaffirm my position that both male and female employees are an asset to any industry and as our stereotypes about men and women are not always appropriate, we must not discourage anyone from choosing an occupation simply because of his/ her gender.

task: Many university graduates cannot find a job in their chosen profession. What factors may have caused this situation and what, in your opinion, should be done about it?
essay: When young people are choosing what subject to study at university, most of them hope they will find a great job upon graduation. In reality many fresh graduates fail to find work in their field and some are even forced to take up a below graduate level job. In my opinion, the root of this problem lies in the outdated higher education system that should be modernized.<NL>Traditional university education does not prepare students for their first job for a number of reasons. One of them is that many programmes are too theoretical. It means that highly educated graduates lack simple skills required for employment, for example, the knowledge of IT software. Employers, therefore, prefer candidates with hands-on experience. Another reason is that universities offer too many courses in popular fields, such as business and law, and do not recruit enough students for engineering and science programmes. As a result, the UK labour market has an oversupply of law graduates and a deficit of engineers. <NL>A reform of higher education could alleviate many of the problems but would require joint efforts from universities and the government. If universities worked closer with employers, they could teach students practical skills that companies look for. Meanwhile, the government could develop guidelines on how many students universities should recruit in each subject in accordance with the market demand.<NL>In conclusion, a likely reason why many graduates cannot find a job in their field is because university education might not have provided them with the right skill set or an in-demand profession. I think that universities and the government could improve the situation by updating the content of the programmes and limiting the number of students in each subject in line with the market demand.

task: Whether or not someone achieves their aims is mostly by a<NL><NL>question of luck. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: One of Mr. Carter's most important jobs is that of public relations director. The purpose of this job is to establish a good attitude toward his country among the public (people) of the origin country. As part of this job, he supervises the writing and distribution of press releases (news stories) for the media. Media refers to all the ways of spreading information, such as newspapers, radio, television, and other means of communication. Media is a plural word, meaning it refers to all these means. Radio is a medium of communication; it is one of the media used for advertising. Public relations people place special news stories in the media to help build interest in the destination country. Advertisements in the media, paid for by the tourism department, also help establish interest.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Employees in public relations and advertising must be fluent in English if they work in English-speaking countries. "To be fluent" means to speak, read, and write a language almost as well as the natives do. Mr. Carter's staff members write advertisements, news releases, and brochures to promote travel to their country. They give lectures (talks) and show films about their country to groups of people. They answer questions about travel to their country.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Mr. Carter holds press conferences whenever something of importance or interest happens in his country. A press conference is a meeting attended by reporters from newspapers, magazines, radio, or television. At a press conference, someone makes announcements that their readers, listeners, or viewers might find interesting. Whenever an important person from his country visits, Mr. Carter holds a press conference to introduce that person to the representatives of the media. Such news items help to build interest in and knowledge about his country.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Information offices also give tourists and immigrants helpful information. The clerks give them any necessary documents or visas that may be required for entrance. The staff can also tell them about different laws and regulations in the destination country.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Mr. Carter and his staff also work with businesses and industries that might be interested in either moving to or doing business with the destination country. Mr. Carter's country wants foreign industries to come and help build industry there. The country is also interested in exporting some of its products. In turn, the country is anxious to get the best prices on products imported from other countries.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Wherever they go and whatever they do, the information staff members represent their country. "We are the face of our country to the rest of the world," Mr. Carter says. "Before they know anything about our country, people form their impressions and attitudes about it from the things we do and say."

task: Whether or not someone achieve their aims is mostly by a question of luck. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Many people claim that luck is the most crucial element contributing to a person's success. While I accept that luck does have an important role in helping people reach their targets, I would argue that hard work and determination are much more crucial factors leading to the achievement of an individual. <NL><NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, I agree that luck can be an important factor. First, some people are fortunate enough to be born in a wealthy family, which allows them to have a better education or to easily start their own business without having to borrow money from someone else. As a result, these people tend to have better opportunities to succeed than those coming from poor families. Furthermore, some individuals are lucky to be given great talents which others do not have. For example, Mozart was able to play music when he was very young, or Lionel Messi already had great football skills when he was born. <NL><NL><NL><NL>However, I would argue that although luck can be necessary, it is not the most crucial factor leading to success. Firstly, people need to work really hard and put much effort into their jobs if they want to be successful. For instance, before becoming one of the best football players in the world, Cristiano Ronaldo had to go through intense training hours every day for many years. Secondly, a person is less likely to reach his targets if he does not have determination. On the way leading to success, there might be many difficulties, and people need to keep moving forward to overcome those challenges. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, while I agree that luck is important to some extent in helping people become successful, I believe that hard work and determination are the most important elements.

task: Some people say in order to prevent illness and disease, governments should focus on reducing environmental pollution and housing problem. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: While a faction of people holds the notion that authorities should invest on controlling pollution and providing houses to protect public health, others argue that more measures are necessary to prevent illness. I totally agree with the latter view as ample reasons are present to substantiate it. This essay wiill explain my view points with relevant illustrations.<NL><NL><NL><NL>First and foremost,  lifestyle diseases such as diabetic mellitus and hypertension are the most prevalant dieseases in the present world. Expert claimed that pollution and infrastructure issues have no relation with lifestyle diseases. For example, poor diet and lack of exercise are the major reasons for lifestyle diseases. Besides,  microorganisms are the primary causes of communicable illness. To illustrate, COVID 19 diesease is spread by virus which is transmitted through air by contacting with infected patients. This is no role for poor housing or pollution to spred this disease

task: Some people say in order to prevent illness and disease, governments should focus on reducing environmental pollution and housing problem. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: It is argued that governments should prioritize addressing environmental pollution and housing issues as a means to prevent health-related problems. From my perspective, I largely agree with this statement.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, there are several methods to deter illness and disease that the government can invest in. Biological research or clinical study could be taken as prominent examples. These studies potentially lead to a better understanding, or better yet, new knowledge about different aspects of health issues, thereby preventing illness and eliminating the roots of it efficiently. However, these research plans may incur substantial costs due to the need for numerous facilities. Consequently, governments might expend on these domains but do not necessarily focus on them.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, an investment in reducing environmental problems and house-related ones are seemingly more effective than the aforementioned. First and foremost, people are exposed to the surrounding environment, including both public areas and houses, on a daily basis. hence, if there are some evironment issues such as air pollution or water pollution, their health is immediately impacted profoundly; and because of this, when such problems are addressed, the benefits will quickly come as a result. For instance, when air pollution in Hanoi is reduced due to municipal initiatives, reports indicate a decrease in the number of respiratory-related patients. Ultimately, it is more urgent to tackle issues related to the environment and housing.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, while there may be other remedies to prevent ailments and diseases such as scientific research, I advocate that emphasis on reducing environmental and housing problems is of paramount significance.

task: Some people think government should focus on reducing environmental pollution and housing problems to help prevent illness and diseas. To what extend do you agree or disagree?
essay: The line graph above illustrates the average number of passengers which use London Underground Station in a day.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Overall, the chart indicates that the station is open from 6 am in the morning to 10 pm in the night. There are two peak times that show a considerable number of passengers, whereas some intervals show a few people.<NL><NL><NL><NL>The most busy time is at 7 am in the morning. There are around 400 passengers which enter the station at this time. Moreover, another peak time is in the evening. Around 380 people visit the station at 6 pm.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, 4 pm is a time which displays the lowest number of passengers. Under 100 people use the station at this time. In addition, in the early morning (6 am), around 100 people use the station which only slighly different compared to the lowest point.

task: Some people think that governments should focus on reducing environmental pollution and housing problems to help people prevent illness and disease. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
essay: A group of individuals believe that country’s officials have to shed light on minimizing the toxicity of the environment and households and cure citizen from getting sick. I strongly believe that government officials must putting their energy on tackling the toxicity on the air and households need because of two reasons which are locally and internationally.<NL><NL><NL><NL>The main reason why I believe that government have to solve the problem of toxicity in the air and their citizen’s housing is because they have a local duties toward citizen which means that themselves are obliged to offers these needs. Furthermore, countries should have go after citizen needs and one of the fundamental needs are to live in area where the air is clean and to have a place to sleep. In fact, most of the rules are talking about what are the human needs such – housing, jutice, safety, and health -; therefore, all countries must offer these needs to their citizen.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, I completely admit that governments must solve any problem related to environment and household; apparently, this is because themselves have local and international obligations. I highly recommend countries to take care of their citizen’s walfare.

task: In some countries, more and more people are becoming interested in finding out about the history of the house or building they live in.<NL><NL><NL><NL>What are the reasons for this?<NL><NL><NL><NL>How can people research this? <NL><NL><NL><NL>Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
essay: There is an increasing number of people who are interested in excavating the history of the house or building where they live. I think people do that because they have the cognitive to protect the historical value of the buildings and the sense of connection that people felt within the exploration. In order to research their history, people can gather the knowledge and memories that elder citizens around them have and go to the libraries in their cities.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Many buildings with great historical value had been destroyed because of the wars and people's ignorance in the past. Therefore, many people appeal for the protection of buildings. After people have the cognitive to appreciate the  beauty of historical buildings, people willing to find out the history of the buildings in their own living places. What's more, the process of exploring the stories about the buildings in their cities enhances the connection between them. Because the forms of architecture are special due to the unique elements a location has, such as weather and culture, these link everyone who lives there and make them feel united.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In order to know the history of the building where they live, one of my suggestions is to ask the elders who also live there. Because they have more experiences since the more time they have lived, they might have experienced the changes of the time of these architectures. Another suggestion is going to local libraries and searching for the information which had been recorded on paper.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, people's increasing interest in excavating the history of  architecture in the place they live is due to their cognitive of protection after the destruction of many buildings and the sense of connection that is given to explorers. My suggestions for explorers to reach this intention are asking the local elders for help and searching for information in local libraries.

task: in some countries, more and more people are becoming intrested in finding out about the history of the house or building they live in.<NL><NL><NL><NL>what are the reason for this ?<NL><NL><NL><NL>how can people research this ?
essay: These days, humans try to give meaning to their lives and they have approached  this point in distinguished ways, one of them is looking forward to the history of their house. In some regions, the people's tendency to figure out the history of their residence shows a significant growth. It may caused by some reasons which I tend to elaborate on.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Initially, they claim that the dichotomy of the good or evil personality of previous owners will be absolutely effective in their current life. For instance, the location where a murder occurred is not a wise choice to reside. On the contrary, a place where a well-known person has lived, can be appropriate for settling down. In my opinion, these sorts of beliefs are conveyed by cinemas and Hollywood by producing films with these kinds of concepts.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Moreover, others see this situation as an opportunity for profitable investment. For example, the person who purchased one of England's royal families' palaces, emphasising the past incidents of that property can assist the investor to raise the value of that place. They have admitted that the history of those particular regions is the best advertisement and promotion to achieve more by selling at a higher price or renting to special tenants in exchange for worthable prices. I would maintain that this issue is mainly rooted in improving the level of knowledge in the community and increasing people’s interest in history, culture, art as well as other essential subjects. Moreover, individuals can easily access favourite information by using either internet or libraries.

task: In some countries, more and more people are becoming interested in finding out about the history of the house or building they live in. <NL><NL>What are the reasons for this?<NL><NL>How can people research this?
essay: Real estate buyers are becoming more interested in past information of the building they are buying, which is a common trend around the world. It seems to me that there are two main reasons, including safety concern and psychological belief and several ways to investigate the history of a house.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Firstly, researching a home`s past allows people to make sure about its architectural history for preservation purposes. For example, it is essential to know when it was built, what it is built of, what changes had been made, or how it was used before. This detailed information can help meet the security requirements of the owners so that they can know exactly what changes and repairs need to be made. Secondly, understanding the history of the house in which you live is one of the reasons to live happily. No one wants to live in a house where some dreadful events had happened, such as murder or violence.  <NL><NL><NL><NL>Tracing the history of old houses could be more challenging than contemporary houses. However there can be several ways to explore the history. First, using internet seems possible to compile initial facts since a wide range of records are becoming more available online today. Official websites can be more reliable and provide information on resources and where to find them. Second, information on the history of houses or buildings can be obtained from local authorities, such as National Archives and Property Registry. In addition, real estate realtors should be able to assist the purchasers with finding the basic information, like previous owners.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, it appears that feeling satisfied and safe in the house we live in is a reason to discover its history, and online resources and local authorities could be the main source of the information.
