task: Human activities have a negative effect on plant and animal species. Some people say that it is too late to do anything. Some people think that we should take effective action to improve the situation. Discuss both sides and give your opinion?
essay: in many recent years, the globe is going to be unhabitable for many life forms due to undesirable activities done by humans. As a result, protecting the environment and keeping plants and animals safe has become one of the most controversial issues among scientists and environmental activists. In this regard, some people claim that the current situation can not be improved, while others take the opposite side and believe that some practical decisions should be made. <NL><NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, some people are of the opinion that the current trend that has been occurring in the world in recent decades is uncontrolled and can not be stopped easily. They believe population explosion and as a result, exploitation of nature and its resources such as water and plants in order to produce foodstuff and necessary products is unavoidable. This is because, in their statements, humans should take priority over all the other creatures. Therefore, it could be noted that, instead of investing huge amounts of either financial or human resources to save some rare species, which can be considered a waste of money because of their insufficiency, we ought to allocate this budget and workforce to enhance the health care and education system in poor countries. For instance, the latest statistics illustrate that the average budget of typical conservation programmes is equal to constructing 50000 schools in Africa where the majority of kids suffer from a lack of education.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, many experts state that the current circumstances send a clear message that the globe is going to be unhabitable in the near future for all beings including mankind. This means that planning and implementing conservation programmes and strict rules in order to save special plants and animals not only help them to escape from the circle of extinction but also could shape our children's future in a far more efficient way. As a result, providing that the governments assist to keep the environment in balance by imposing harsh rules to deter factories and individuals from destroying nature, the position will be improved significantly. For example, in Germany, the government introduced harsh penalties for logging and poaching in 2006, which resulted in a substantial drop in the number of animals death figures after 10 years.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To sum up, although changing the available situation is a tough challenge and requires huge investment and international assessments, I firmly believe that this is possible to tackle this problem only if authorities take practical steps.

task: Human activities have negative effects on plant and animal species. Some people think it is too late to do anything about this problem. Others believe that effective measures can be taken to improve this situation. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: In recent years,  the development of human civilization has led to many adverse impacts on various other living species.It is argued by a few individuals that much little can be done to tackle this problem, while others think advanced measures can be helpful in controlling the circumstances.This essay will discuss both  notions along with my opinion.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, the development of human actions has caused global-level concerns related to animals and plants.First of all,  people have cut huge numbers of trees , which has snatched the habitats of wild creatures , disturbing their normal living, and increasing chances of endangerment and extinction.Taking deforestation as an example, leading to an increased number of problems such as floods , droughts, destruction of habitats and food shortages . However, the solution of more plantations may not become possible due to excessive soil erosion and lack of land.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, people believe that circumstances can be made under control if effective measures are taken right away.To begin with,if the community has already realised the value of planting trees , then the government should make provisions related to logging.Moreover , advanced technology can prove effective in protecting endangered animals.For example, China has been utilising genetic technology, especially to protect panda's life.Additionally , the crowd ought to be encouraged to plant more and more trees.Therefore , the adoption of these solutions can be helpful in tackling global concerns directly from the root level.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, indeed , human activities have resulted in causing numerous problems for living and non-living organisms.Yet , I believe plantations, advanced technology and strict rules and regulations are effective methods for solving this issue.

task: Human activities have a negative effect on plant and animals species. Some people say that it is too late to do anything. Some people think that we should take effective action to improve the situation.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Discuss both sides and give an opinion
essay: In this era, the expanding human population are demanding to have more and more new land for them to build a house and earn money from nature. However, these actions may cause the extinction of biodiversity, therefore, some people said that our care towards the environment from now on can be very life-changing. Meanwhile, others think that whatever we try to improve will be useless. This writing will discuss both views following reasons, examples, and the writer's view at the end. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Nowadays, people are utilizing natural resources exaggeratedly and causing some animal habitats destroyed. For instance, cutting down trees and clearing forest areas can be destructive for some plants and creatures that are living there. In addition, human's greedy and self-centred behaviour will never feel enough of what they have achieved so they will continuously distract their sphere. Moreover, after realising what they have done and how messy it is now, they lose their hope to improve the world and feel like it is too late to start over.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, several communities have started to do many positive works for the environment such as reforestation, processing waste, and making regulations so that people do not destroy the biosphere for their own goods. These actualizations are good because slowly but surely they will bring advantages towards society. For example, knowing that our future life is in danger, we need to make a straightforward solution, one of which is by making a rule, particularly about preserving nature. By that, everyone will notice and diminish their destructive habits.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, what people do now will bring crucial impacts later on. The sooner one realizes what has happened, the more possibility available to change things. As a human, people can start to take care of their surroundings to reduce environmental damage. Thereby, the future world will be better to live.

task: Human activities have negative effects on plant and animals species. Some people think it <NL><NL><NL><NL>is too late to do a anything about this problem. Others believe that effective measures can be taken to improve this situation.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Discuss both views and give our opinion.
essay: Although humans have long acknowledged the impacts of their actions on flora and fauna systems, they still continue destroying them. And it is still a controversial issue whether it is better to find solutions for this urgent problem or let it be as it is already too late. In this essay, I will examine both viewpoints; however, I strongly believe that "late is better than never" and advocate finding ways to fix  mistakes.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Some people have stopped hoping to change the circumstance that many species of vegetation and animals have died out and more will become extinct in the foreseeable future. Humanity has influenced  biodiversity so badly that nature finds it so hard to recover. For example, when ones are in need of land for cultivation or construction, they cut down trees and cement the soil, resulting in  changes in the natural habitat. Consequently, many species of plants and animals can not survive.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Nevertheless, there is still a chance for us to err the mistakes provided that practical methods are put into action immediately. The prerequisite solution is the authorities had better set strict regulations protecting our nature such as ceasing deforestation and overexploitation. Nothing is more obvious than the example of overfishing which prevents fish from reproducing in time; as a consequence, they become extinct. Last but not least, more campaigns to enlighten every citizen's perceptions should be put into practice. Hopefully, when everyone is conscious of the danger of their actions on the common ecosystem, they will find ways to limit them. <NL><NL><NL><NL>To conclude, despite the fact that it is rather late to take action on protecting plants and animals, I suppose effective accounts can help reverse the situation.

task: Human activities have negative effects on plant and animal species. Some people think it is too late to do anything about this problem. Others believe effective measures can be taken to improve this situation. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: As natural resources are under increasing pressure, the list of endangered animals and plants is becoming endless. While some might claim that nothing could be done to reverse the trend, I believe that there are still means to ensure a sustainable future for the planet. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Biodiversity contributes to humanity’s most important life-supporting safety net: nutrition, shelter, clothing, the very water we drink, and the air we breathe. However, our safety net is stretched almost to the breaking point. It is reported that natural forest area continues to decline, marine ecosystems are undermined severely, and countless species are suffering from illegal poaching. Hence, there are increasing voices that question the necessity and viability of making a change. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Nevertheless, to reverse biodiversity decline, I believe, is still feasible, though difficult. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Governments could promote a greater understanding of plants and animals by investing in the research and preservation efforts of universities, zoos, and botanical institutes. This may ensure the survival of individual species and produce tangible benefits in the form of new medicines and products. <NL><NL><NL><NL>An alternative strategy would be to protect natural habitats by expanding nature reserves. This would have immediate positive consequences for those areas by preserving delicate ecosystems. The most effective solution is to limit the damage at the source. Companies that engage in practices that harm the environment should be required to demonstrate that they have taken all reasonable efforts to minimize the damage. Public contracts for roads and buildings should only be awarded to firms that have a good environmental track record. The strategies outlined above could do much to reverse the destruction that threatens the world’s plants and animals. <NL><NL><NL><NL>To conclude, a planet being pushed to the edge will eventually turn on us. <NL><NL><NL><NL>With the accelerating rate of mass extinctions of plant and animal species, I believe, effective measures should be taken immediately to make a difference.
