task: Human activities have negative effects on plant and animal species . Some Human activities have negative effects on plant and animal species. Some people think it is too late to do anything about this problem. Others believe that effective measures can be taken to improve this situation. Discuss both views and give our opinion.
essay: Some actions of mankind have detrimental effects on flora and fauna. It is believed that there is no time for people to redress their mistakes while some people think that this circumstance can be effectively improved by various solutions. From my perspective, I have a strong belief that several measures can be taken to solve this problem.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with, some people have right reasons to claim that it is an unsolvable problem and nothing can be done to deal with it. Deforestation or climate change caused by human activities is so destructive that it is placing many species’lives at risk. As a consequent, many species of plants and animals are dying due to loss of habitat and human’s hunt. Some of them have already become extinct, thus negatively affecting the balance of the ecosystem. For example, in Vietnam where there used to be a large number of tigers, this animal has been hunted for years to satisfy human’s needs and there are only few species left. <NL><NL><NL><NL>However, I strongly argue that there are a lot of things that goverments and individuals can do to deal with this problem. Firstly, the issue of deforestation needs to be addressed. It is the main cause of the disapperance of endangered species around the world. Governments can plant more trees to create places for animals and plants to live and develop their population. Moreover, strict rules should be published to deter people from cutting down trees and hunting for precious animals and plants. Another solution is to raise awareness of residents about the destructive effects of our activities to the Earth and the ecosystem. Public talks and lectures about the possible consequences of mankind need to be hold in order to make the public aware of their activities. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, although some people think that there is nothing to solve this problem, I personally believe that there are many effective solutions to solve it. The protection of forest and the awareness of the public are really important in dealing with this issue.

task: Human activities have a negative effect on plant and animal species. Some people say that it is too late to do anything. Some people think that we should take effective action to improve the situation. Discuss both sides and give your opinion. ??
essay: In our contemporary world, humans have had a destructive impact on the environment and other living creatures. The majority of the population believe that we should take action to preserve our planet, while others have a more critical opinion. Throughout this essay I will discuss both points of view and express my personal opinion on this matter. Firstly, I will discuss the first opinion and ,secondly I will explore the second point of view.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, today's modern society contemplate that people should reconsider their actions in order to maintain our world safe. Our extensively destructive activities have pushed many plants and animal species to the edge of extinction and changing even some simple routines and taking a more eco-friendly approach in our life might offer a great deal of improvement to our natural world. For example, if a person walks or rides a bicycle for a short journey rather than driving a car they will cut in carbon dioxide emission effectively and as a result, fresher air would be available in the local community.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, there are some people who think that it is too late to even think about saving our planet. They believe that simple individual-based changes would not contribute to any improvement and they can not do anything about this matter. They do not consider themselves responsible for what is happening to the natural world and they are more into blaming ruling authorities for everything. In addition, they hold the government responsible to take serious measurements in order to save the environment. For instance, it is the government's responsibility to implement rules on industries to use filters to minimise the emission of toxic materials.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion,  Even though the government is the one who can take some serious measures to maintain our planet safe for citizens and other living organisms, humans can also take part in improving their local climate by following some simple actions. In my opinion, we should always feel responsible for the earth we live in and we must ensure the well-being of our habitat.

task: Human activities have a negative effect on plant and animal species. Some people say that it is too late to do anything. Some people think that we should take effective action to improve the situation. Discuss both sides and give your opinion. ??
essay: There are controversial perspectives heating up a debate over how to solve the negative effect issue caused by human activities on plant and animal species. While some hold a strong view that it is too late to measure the problem, the opposite makes a statement that we should enhance the situation with effective actions. I would contend that take effective actions to revamp the matters, which do more good than harm.<NL><NL><NL><NL> It is obvious to note that there are many reasons to convince that it is too late in order to solve the negative effect of human activities on plant and animal species, one of them is deforestation. Having an ever-growing demand for land to live and wood to consume, humans decide on deforestation to serve their purpose. Therefore, it leads to flora and fauna being indiscriminately destroyed and lost completely instead of being replaced and it pushes many categories of species on the verge of extinction.  For example, Panda is China’s national treasure, but this species is on the brink of extinction because of deforestation. There is a wealth of animals in the world that are dying out because of human activities, which is the reason people doubt that it is too late to tackle the problem. <NL><NL><NL><NL> While the redeeming features of negative effects of human activities on flora and fauna species are widely acknowledged, we will find an address in order to enhance the issue. Plant and animal species play a paramount significant role in human’s life, so we should find a solution as soon as possible. One of the remedies is to build a reserve to create a safe habitat for endangered animals. For instance, Cuc Phuong national park in Vietnam is built and overseen by the authorities, which is home for a wave of precious animals. Hence, the situation will be resolved and revamped if people actively implement it.             <NL><NL><NL><NL> In conclusion, although there are many reasons to prove that it is too late to deal with the negative effect on plant and animal species caused by human activities, people should take effective action to improve the problem.

task: Human activities have negative effects on plants and animal species. Some people think that it is too late to do anything about this problem. Other people believe that effective measures can be taken to improve this situation. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: Human being has always been abusing the mother earth since the industrial revolution. Almost every kind of environmental problem or animal distinction, are the negative result of human activities. Some people believe that we can still save our planet and immediate actions must be taken. Others think that these actions are just grasping at straws. In my opinion, both approaches are equally reasonable, but personal statements vary.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Some people believe that we can take proactive approaches to save plants and animals. For example, panda has once been taken as dangerous distinctive species, but with the effort of many zoologists, pandas are being transfered to a much safer environment, such as the zoo, witch can insure the conservation of them. Now, we can see pandas in zoos all around the world, the number of pandas are surely secured.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, some people say that such actions can never keep up with the damages made by human. Some disruptions are irreversible, like the ozone hole, it takes centuries for it to recover. Before that, animals and plants may suffer from drought and forest fire. Moreover, according to Darwin’s Natural Selection, it is quite natural for animals to die out. Dinosaurs become extinct because of the volcano explosion, and it is unnatural to preserve them or even bring them back to life. We surely don’t want to see such horrible nightmares like the movie Jurassic Park to happen in real life.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, some people nowadays engage in environmental events, and devoted themselves to protect the living creatures on earth. While some only take passive actions. I believe that although there are chances that these protective actions are useless, we should’t give up on doing so. If we don’t give it a try, we will never know what we can accomplish.

task: Human activities have negative effects on plants and animal species. Some people think that it is too late to do anything about this problem. Other people believe that effective measures can be taken to improve this situation. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: Environmental conservation has become a trending topic in recent years. Pessimists claim that there is nothing that can be done to save the Earth, while others argue that human beings still have a chance to modify the situation. In my view, I agree with the latter and I will provide an explanation with examples.<NL><NL><NL><NL>First of all, it is undeniable that human activities have brought a number of serious problems to the Earth due to the increase in human demands based on populations. For instance, the average temperature has increased one Celsius since the 1800s, which mainly caused by deforestation, farming and burning fossil fuels. This leads to a threat to many Arctic species such as polar bears in particular as their habitat is melting and disappearing.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, others including me believe there is still hope because the awareness of environmental protection and sustainable development has raised in recent decades. To be more precise, many countries have started to tackle the negative effects brought by human beings, like reducing overexploitation of natural resources. Instead, professionals are researching and finding other renewable and Eco-friendly resources to limit the demands on fuels. Besides, afforestation is encouraged to offset the damage by deforestation. China is one of the best examples, which the overall forest coverage rate has risen from twelve per cent in the early 1980s to twenty-three per cent currently. As a result, the air quality in China has improved dramatically compared with thirty years ago.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, even if human activities have caused grave consequences and even some permanent damage to our plants and wildlife, it is not completely irretrievable as long as human beings can learn from previous mistakes and insist on sustainable development.

task: Some people think that children should be taught at school to recycle<NL><NL><NL><NL>materials and avoid waste. Other people believe that children should be taught<NL><NL><NL><NL>this at home.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Discuss both opinions and give your own opinion.
essay: It is often argued that schools should own the responsibility to give awareness among youngsters about goods recycling and waste depletion whilst others disagree and thinks that homes are considered as a better learning place for kids for such education. While primary educational institutes are considered to be the initial learning place for growing minds, I believe that parents' and grandparents' contributions can not be neglected. In this essay, I will discuss in favour of school rather than the living place as a suitable land for children to understand the importance of recycling and discourage waste production with relevant examples.<NL><NL><NL><NL> There is no doubt that kids always follow what they see in their daily routines. Kids spend 65% of their time in homes which gives them an opportunity to mingle with family members. As a result, their learning is based on observations. Parents and others should follow the practice of recycling disposals and garbage reduction. Such materials are but not limited to; Card boxes & Plastics. For example, a number of youtube channels are available that convey a plethora of ideas about recycling such as wastage and because of the hectic routine of the elder generation, kids are often provided with a variety of electronic devices that keep them engaged. As a consequence, they learn with fun at home with their best interest.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the hand, Schools are another professional hub for the young generation equipped with modernized facilities that make learning more interesting. I believe that courses can be designed to make recycling and waste prevention a compulsory subject. Setup the special labs that illustrate the types of reusable materials, the process of recycling, and the reduction in litter production could develop a sense of maturity among children at an early age. For instance, The Kenedy School in Brisbane is well known for its achievement in making the world's first prototype of the recycling process together with waste depletion techniques. However, it comes at a massive cost. <NL><NL><NL><NL> <NL><NL><NL><NL>To recapitulate, it is vital for children to learn about reusable products and the reduction in the generation of disposals. However, the part played by early educational institutes in this regard outweighs the knowledge transferred by inhabitants as school facilities significantly impact their learning process.

task: Some people think it would be beneficial for school children to study international news as a school subject, while others argue it would be a waste of time.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: It is commonly known that many species have gone extinct throughout history, including the dinosaurs. Some argue that preventing extinction is not necessary, as it is a natural process. However, I believe that humans have a moral obligation to protect endangered species and prevent their extinction.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Firstly, human activities such as deforestation, overfishing, and pollution have caused a rapid decline in animal populations, leading many species to be at risk of extinction. As a result, humans have a responsibility to conserve the environment and prevent further harm to wildlife. It is unfair for humans to cause the extinction of a species due to their actions, particularly when they have the ability to prevent it.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Another reason is that many species play a crucial role in maintaining the balance of the ecosystem. For example, bees are essential pollinators that are responsible for pollinating 80% of flowering plants, and thus if bees were to become extinct, it would have a devastating impact on our food supply and ecosystem. Similarly, the loss of predators can cause a ripple effect, leading to overpopulation of other species and causing imbalances in the food chain.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Lastly, preventing extinction is not only a matter of responsibility but also a matter of morality. Species have intrinsic value, and it is not our place to determine which species should exist and which should not. Humans must respect the inherent value of all life forms and do what they can to protect them.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, while extinction may be a natural process, it is not a justification for humans to sit idly by and watch as countless species go extinct. By taking action to conserve the environment, humans can ensure that future generations can enjoy the same diversity of life that we have today.

task: Some people think that art is an essential subject for children at school while others think it is a waste of time.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Discuss both sides and five your opinion.
essay: Today, teaching  art in schools is the subject of dispute between people who regard  art as really necessary for children and individuals who find art a waste of time. In my view, art does not play an important role in a child's development.<NL><NL><NL><NL>         Many people consider that art should be taught in schools since children need it to change and make fresh their brain. Because art can be a factor for them to learn how to concentrate their mind on one thing. During art lessons children are required to focus on one particular thing, so art can help to learn to pay attention to also their other necessary works. As a result, they can be productive in their other subjects. Therefore art is vital for everyone, especially child's development. <NL><NL><NL><NL>     On the other hand , there are also people who believe art subject is not required from  children in school. It can take the child's most   time which must be spent on their more crucial subject as realm-related ones. As a result of this, they do not have adequate knowledge of their vital subjects since they spend their precious time on art. <NL><NL><NL><NL>    In conclusion, nowadays, while many people argue that art is not a key factor to a child's education and should not be taught in  schools , others believe art has a big influence on a child's school life, and later also. I am of the opinion that art should be taught in schools as the second statement is that art should be taught in schools as it can help  children's improvement.

task: Some people think that art is an essential subject for children at school while others think it is a waste of time.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Discuss both sides and give your opinion
essay: Nowadays, whether art subject should be taught at school or not has become a matter of concern. Some people think art is essential for students and the country, while others oppose this viewpoint. This essay will discuss both views and give a relevant opinion on them.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with, art is an essential subject for students in terms of positive development. Students learn about their country's history, culture, and traditions. For example, a country like India has diverse cultures and traditions it is important for the citizen to have knowledge of their country when they move to different parts that will help to a certain extent. Moreover, art is good for mental health, as subjects like math and science are very frustrating and stressful, whereas art helps to relax the mind and Borden the thinking process. Hence, art has an essential place in schools<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, some people deny this idea of teaching art subjects in schools. First and foremost, taking subjects like math, science and computer provide a better opportunity in their career. For example, artists like painters and singers can hardly manage daily expenses, whereas doctors, managers, and IT professionals get enough to save for the future. In addition, those who graduate from engineering, business, and medical science make more contributions in terms of the country's economic development like improving infrastructure, increasing life expectancy, and increasing country's revenue with better management. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In Conclusion, although art is very helpful for students to rejuvenate their minds, get off from a hectic schedule, and learn about their country's history and traditions, science and business subjects help the countries grow more. In my opinion, art and science hold special positions. They should be taught; equally; it should be dependent on students and what they like.

task: Some people claim that many things that children are taught at school are a waste of time. Other people argue that everything that children study at school is useful at sometime. Discuss the both views and give your opinion.
essay: Being a parent, our priority is to give our children the best education that they can learn from school in order for them to have a good life. However, some issues are rising these days that children are being stressed out too much at school due to too much studying. Children are being focused on subjects that are not important. It came to arguments too that most of the subjects that being taught in school is just a waste of time. <NL><NL><NL><NL>At a certain point, we would be thinking that those subjects are not beneficial for our children but as they grew up these subjects are needed as a  foundations in order for them to analyzed certain subjects. They will need these subjects to solve problems, issues and come up with a solution. These subjects will be their guides to create solutions for their reasearch.

task: Some people think that secondary school children should study international news as one of the school subjects. Other people think that it is a waste of valuable school time. What do you think? Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
essay: There is a public debate on whether middle schools should have a subject about global news, while some people argue about it. Recently, many big issues have happened all around the world. Especially, the ongoing war between Ukraine and Russia is very sad news for everyone. I personally believe that students need to learn about what is going on outside of their countries during school time. This essay discusses the advantages and disadvantages of creating such a subject at secondary schools and my opinion will be provided. <NL><NL><NL><NL> I opine that international news classes are essential for the following reason. Learning about the topic associated with other countries leads students to expanding their perspectives. To illustrate, an international school in Tokyo where students come from various countries originally have a unique class in which kids take one topic and discuss it from a a cultural and regional point of view. As a result, students can get different ways of thinking and one of the graduates becomes the CEO of the biggest IT company. Exposure to contemporary affairs from a young age makes them become global citizens who are needed to think of things from a variety of perspectives.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, it has a negative aspect as well. A potential disadvantage of this subject is that overseas affairs sometimes contain strong political and religious aspects. Education for kids is supposed to be away from politics and religion because they might affect who they are. For example, children in Iran, where they are taught to be soldiers at school, believe what is taught, therefore they  are fighting as a soldier without any doubt. Hence, global news including such things might affect who they are.<NL><NL><NL><NL> In conclusion, I believe that the advantages of learning about international news as one of the subjects outweigh the drawbacks that it might bring. I suggest that secondary schools should set such a subject in a curriculum in order to make students exposed to various issues in the world, however, educators need to be careful about the negative aspect.

task: Some people believe that children at school should learn art, others says it is a waste of time. What is your opinion?
essay: Today's, music, dancing and painting fields are equally important as any other fields. Some believe that teenagers should learn art at an early age, while others would say that It is waste of time as well as money. This essay strongly agrees with Children should learn the art field because It increases their creativity and develops their minds. <NL><NL><NL><NL>The primary reason students learn arts is that It improves their problem-solving skills. This is because If they learn painting and many more arts improve their mental abilities as well as develop their mind as well. For instance, a study conducted by American Management School found that around 60 per cent of teenagers who learn arts they are well performed in maths subjects because of their problem-solving abilities. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Another reason is that they are more creative than any other children. Arts means creativity and if schools teach artists so, teenagers improve their creativity at an early stage. For example, an article published by BBC news showed that approximately 30 per cent of students learn arts at their starting days more creative than any others students. In addition, people encourage their children to become musicians and dancers.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, mental development and more imagination and I, therefore, believe that students learn arts in their schools.

task: Some people think that children should learn to paint and draw. Others believe that is a waste of time. Discuss both views.
essay: There are conflicting views about whether children should learn arts or not. This essay will discuss both sides of the argument，followed by my own perspective.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Firstly, studying these subjects of children may have more fun after school.<NL><NL><NL><NL>If it is a free choice to choose what they want to learn after class, they will<NL><NL><NL><NL>feel much happier without stress of school. If arts are touched when they<NL><NL><NL><NL>feel relaxed, the different kinds of knowledge will be received that their<NL><NL><NL><NL>brain might relate all skills easier. If the knowledge and skills are learned,<NL><NL><NL><NL>then they will be inspired to use original ways to think, which can<NL><NL><NL><NL>encourage their creative thinking.<NL><NL><NL><NL>However, those who support the idea of learning paint and draw is a waste of time can also justify their opinion. Some parents think the successful education means high ranking of exams that can make their development better in the future. So these children need to focus more on academic subjects, like Math, English......and spending more time to study skills to prepare for exams instead of learning arts.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In my opinion, children should learn paint and draw at an early age. Although some people believe that is important to study main subjects in school. In fact, giving freedom and relaxation to learn arts could help them to study other subjects with related. And receiving creative thinking by knowledge in different fields that can be really an advantage in the future development of the children.

task: Some people think that children should study in school the subject of science of food and how to prepare it properly. Other think it is a waste of time, because there are more important subjects to study. Discuss both views and give your opinion with reasons and relevant examples."
essay: A few people feel that food science should be added to school curriculum whereas others opine that preference should be given to learning other important subjects such as maths and science. In my opinion, it is crucial for children to understand) the benefits of food and learn cooking in school as knowledge about food will help them remain / stay healthy throughout their life and also cooking is a basic skill which everyone should learn from their early days.<NL><NL><NL><NL>As children easily get influenced by their teachers it would be a good idea to make them learn the importance of the right food in school. This is because nowadays social media and television are full of advertisements related to unhealthy food options. So, if a child is aware of food science and how nutritious food would keep their body fit, that would encourage them to choose correct food habits. In addition, cooking is a necessity and should be taught to everyone. The curriculum should have a subject such as home science where students can be taught how to prepare their own food. It would motivate them to indulge themselves in home-cooked food instead of spending money on junk food available in markets.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Others who think school days should be used for learning important subjects such as maths and science would argue that these subjects help students in making successful careers later in life. Moreover, in their view, teaching students to learn cooking would distract them from the main subjects. This might lead to students performing poorly in important career-making subjects. However, in today’s time when childhood obesity is being very common, incorporating food science as a subject in the school curriculum might help in curbing this issue. Also, there should be just one or two hours a week for learning to cook. This way, it will have no impact on children’s focus on core subjects.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To conclude, in my opinion, along with important career-making subjects, students should be taught the science of food as it will encourage them to pursue a healthy lifestyle.

task: Some people believe that holidays are necessary for students, others think that children should not have holidays because it is just a waste of time. Do you agree or disagree?
essay: Nowadays, it  is a moot issue whether children should have holidays or not. It is  believed by a lot of individuals that it shouldn't be, others think that it's just a waste of time,however.From my perspective, it is necessary that children have some free time from their work so, they could relax or learn something new that they haven't yet.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Learning something new that is not related to  academics is the thing that is quite beneficial for them. Since If they would have some time from their main studies that they are having, then they learn something different activities and learn some skills: public speaking cooking time management and so on, which would be beneficial in that they later live especially for take any job and to interact with others.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Have time for recreational activities is another merit of having vacations. It is generally seen that by learning their academics  for a whole year continuously, they get rid of it. So they want some time for them. For instance, many pieces of research proved that if children devote some of their time to activities that help them to be relaxed then it would be better for them as they could perform much better in the exams. <NL><NL><NL><NL>To conclude, as vacation has a lot of advantages such as they come up with an opportunity to have knowledge about different things that they want to do and relaxation, that are the major ones and because of them, I think that Vacations  should be promoted instead of restriction.

task: Some people think that art is an essential subject for children at school while others think it is a waste of time.<NL><NL>Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: Nowadays, there is a highly debate about whether art should remain as a crucial subject at school or not.Some people admit that art should be considerd as one of the compulsory subjects school curriculum because it help to enhance students imagination and release stress.On the other hand, some individuals opine that art is not worth for pupils' time since they should put more afford and concentrate on the main subjects.Personally, I sided with the opinion that art should be taught at school. <NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with, children will have space to develop their ideas and imagination through pieces of art they creted, they are able to express the emotions,thoughts and creativities through their work which cure them from depression and stress.This happened because kids perceived art as a subject with 'no right and wrong' answer, so they are allowed to be themselves as much as they desire. Furthermore,it is another helpfut alternative for them to discover themselves before they stepped in to the real world.For instance, the recent study showed that the average pupils chose Art for their major in universities rose dramatically in the past decades.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the contrary, individauls may claim that kids ought to focus and put an extra afford on other important question such as Math,Science or International launguages.Therefore, they will have more oppotunity to widen their acdemic skills for their further study; which will lead them to several stable and high income occupations.For example, students who are eligible for pursuing a doctor degree need to get high scores on both Science and Math, this mean they. need to study harder to achive the achievement<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclution,despite the perspective of believing that art is a waste of pupils's time,I firmly believe that Art should be a compulsary subject in school's curriculum due to the fact that it broaden children imagination and disminish their depression.

task: Some people think that art is essential subject for children at school while others think it is a waste of time.<NL>Discuss both sides and give your opinion.
essay: In recent years, the question of whether art should be taught at school has been a matter of debate. Some maintain that art should be an integral part of the study; however, there is another school of thought which dismisses this notion as they deem that it is the dissipation of time. In this essay, I will discuss both assertions and conclude that it is of paramount importance.<NL><NL><NL><NL>The most powerful argument in favour of art being on the school curriculum is its profoundly positive impact on the development of children’s cognitive skills. By participating in art activities, children deploy a wide range of accomplishments, like decision-making, thereby enhancing them. Not only can art help children have a fertile imagination, but also promotes lateral thinking in them. It can, therefore, have far-reaching implications, as this expertise are also crucial to learning other subjects; hence it appears logical to suggest that art improve outcomes in all subjects.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Notwithstanding  these substantial benefits, it seems this subject is of no consequence to some. They point out schools should prioritise core subjects, like physics, arguing STEM skills are vital for students’ future lives and art is worthless. Given the fact that not all pupils have the opportunity to pursue their interest in art academies or at home, was art excluded from the school curriculum, they would not be able to understand the value of the arts, nor would those who are artistically inclined hone their skills. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, I subscribe to the theory that art should be a part of the curriculum in view of the fact art education is critical to students’ personal and educational development, and it is inextricably linked to other disciplines as it can foster those skills also needed for them.

task: Some people think that children should be taught at school to recycle materials and avoid waste. Other people believe that children should be taught this at home.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Discuss both opinions and give your own opinion.
essay: In recent times, it is paramount to recycle plastic bags, bottles etc. To reduce the wastage of natural and man-made resources and to improve its usefulness. Many people argue that children should learn this skill of recycling objects at school, while others insist that parents should teach this to their children.  I admit that parents can act as a guide or mentor, but I firmly believe that in academy students can get practical knowledge also. This essay will discuss both the views by demonstrating facts and points.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with, it is very important to protect the environment from getting polluted. For this, schools can introduce a compulsory subject of waste management in the curriculum. Therefore, children will learn more about it as dedicated time slot will be allocated for exploring this issue. Moreover, children will get hands-on experience and practical knowledge too. It is evident that cognition and intellectual skills are developed more by performing group activities. Peers play a vital role in encouraging and inculcating interest in things which aloof individual finds hard to incur. So, school can act as a channel to motivate its students in reducing the misuse.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, kids at home imitate what their parents do. For example, the way parents eat, communicate, etc. Similarly, parents should imbibe the habits of reducing and reusing left over items in themselves, which will be ultimately inherited to the next generation. It has been always stated that home is the first school of the kids. Therefore, parents should indulge their kids in such activities and help then in becoming responsible citizens of the nation. <NL><NL><NL><NL> To conclude, parents are the primary source of the knowledge of the kids and what parents can do nobody can do. But, by performing real-time activities with class fellows  can have a long lasting effect on the minds of growing kids.  Thus, they can contribute in a better way in waste management and make this world a better place to live.

task: Some people think that secondary school children should study international news as one of the school subjects. Other people think that it is a waste of valuable school time. What do you think? Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
essay: The never-ending debate of adding foreign news as one of the subjects of secondary school syllabus is not new. However, the news of overseas current affairs opens the doors for opportunities in indirect ways.   I believe that international news must be a part of the school syllabus for various useful reasons that will be discussed in this essay further. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Since globalization has arrived and the internet has made everything clear, many students entail a lot of knowledge about world affairs. The growth of efficient organizations in developing countries is opening numerous opportunities for everyone. For example, technology innovations in a country like China are mindblowing, many engineers or technical students from developed countries wish to work in companies situated in China. All these news let the students explore what is going on in the world, and where they can be fitted. Moreover, we all are learning from each other; the success or failure of one country's economy is a lesson for others. For instance, a less peaceful country would look into the reforms of the most peaceful countries - i.e. Newzealand or Canada. Therefore, knowledge lets countries learn from each other. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Measuring the other benefits; helps students to know about the areas on which the world is competing. Like sports, Television, E-sports and other activities that give countries get power and fame. For example, there are stories of heroes they share online that helps student boost their confidence and morale. Besides, it might help the students in different fields to explore information about their subjects. We can take an example of medical students who can gain knowledge of different disease testing equipment or methods that are used in developed countries. In short, obtaining overseas news opens the intellectual horizons and thoughts of students. <NL><NL><NL><NL>To summarize, I would suggest that students should know what is happening around the world so that they should adapt to positive change in their life. In my opinion, international news lets students learn practically; whereas, bookish knowledge becomes hard to apply in practical life without examples.

task: Some people think that secondary school children should study international news as one of the school subjects. Other people think that it is a waste of valuable school time. <NL><NL>Discuss both views.
essay: When considering what to be taught in secondary school, people are still divided about whether international news should be one of the official subjects or not. While there are benefits to adding this new channel into the classroom, there are also good reasons why it might be helpful to only focus on current curricula. <NL><NL>The statement that international news should be studied at secondary school is strong for several reasons. In terms of social view, it would help students to gain a wider perspective of the world. In this way, youngsters can be widely acknowledged with current affairs so that they could be aware of how to behave properly. Moreover, in the education view, international news accompanied by different academic subjects such as science, literature, mathematics would complete the integrated learning, which provides students with a full development to lead their life in the future. It is, therefore, clear that global updating plays a vital role in assisting education<NL><NL>On the other hand, it is also understandable that including international news as a subject in secondary school curricula is definitely irrelevant. First, students are now snowed with a hectic schedule, which may result in overloading if any additions. Moreover, in the current education system, especially examination, it places a great emphasis on academic subjects, if students don’t concentrate enough on these qualifications, they might fail. Secondly, the violence represented in many of today's news could affect students' performance. This is because, at the secondary school’ age, students are still inexperienced to understand those negative aspects. So the youngsters tend to misjudge the situations and act inappropriately. Therefore, the study of international news would be a destructive and wasteful use of school resource.<NL><NL>In conclusion, there are convincing arguments for the study of global news into secondary school, but it is also reasonable that it shouldn’t add to be an official subject.

task: Some people think that art is an essential subject for children at school while others think it is a waste of time.<NL>Discuss both views and give your opinion
essay: People have different views about whether art should become one of important subjects for the youth or not. While many arguments assume that learning about art at school is time consuming, others are on the contradicting view. Personally, I would contend that art should be taught in optional courses.<NL>On the one hand, there are some reasons for the idea of removing art classes from school’s schedule. One realistically cogent reason is that art is not an essential skill for life survival. People still can find a job and earn for living without an art talent. In fact, there are not many job opportunities for artists compared with other common sectors, hence, some parents would incline to equip their children with academic knowledge rather than art techniques so that kids’ future would be guaranteed with an easier and brighter career path. Therefore, it is not unreasonable for those who consider that spending time for these subjects is such a waste resulting in their intention of the cancellation.<NL>On the other hand, there are some points of view that support the necessary of art courses in school. It can be seen that practicing art activities could develop the young generation’s creativities. Besides, initial art classes could help children explore their passion and ability, thereby gradually germinate and evolve their talent. Moreover, a few hours of learning art could be able to help children relax after other academic subjects.<NL>However, to my mind, although there are both merits and drawbacks of art courses, they should not be completely removed or become an essential subject. I believe some kids enjoy doing art, others might feel uncomfortable. Hence, I would like to suggest that school can make these courses optional. It should depend on the youth to decide to participate in or not.<NL>In conclusion, there are pros and cons for spending time for art in school, nevertheless, everyone deserve to freely make their own decision for how they spend in education stage.

task: Some people say that economic growth is the only way to end hunger and poverty, while others say that economic growth is damaging environment so it must be stopped. Disscuss both view and give your opinion?
essay: Is developing economy harmful to the environment or saving our land from being destroyed constantly by human ignorance and greed?  The answer is positive.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In recent years, extreme environmentalists acclaimed that their activities, including protesting and advocating for conservation and improvement are the best way to avoid our planet being damaged inevitably. Other people argued that the growing economy would resolve the problems of scarcity and starvation, which are the real causes of environmental destructing somehow nowadays.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Firstly, starvation and scarcity of resource are important issues in our world, but resolving these problems are not standing on the opposite side of environmental protection. They are not topics in the same category. The efforts striving to improve the prosperity of society aren't meant it's damaging our nature,  but for which, is now being protected by lots of advanced technics attributed to economic growth. For example, in Ning Xia, a province of northwest China, local peasants have benefited from the increasing economy and technologies and can have better measures to protect grasslands. <NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, ending hunger and poverty, along with protecting the environment, which one is the prior issue? For some perspective of environmentalists, the best earth is a world without any human species. There would be no hunger and poverty issues if human beings never existed before. That is ridiculous. The environment is not a stationary object that never changed since the birth of our mother planet. It doesn't need to worry about our world excessively, because it has experienced so many extinctions and rebirths after numerous catastrophes and keeping vibrant now.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, promoting economic development is not only the method to end starvation and poverty problems, but also the best way to protect our environment. Furthermore, the whole of nature would be benefited from our new technologies generated by economic growth.

task: some people think that the best way to solve global environmental problems is to increase the cost of fuel. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: The global environmental problems are coming in the first  earth problem`s list, therefore all offers should  come hand in hand to end these troubles and have a clean planet.<NL><NL><NL><NL>First, of ,course one of the ways to reduce  global environmental problems is to increase the cost of fuel, which makes people think twice before using their car or turning on the heating, They will use it at the needed time, not every time. For instance, I remember when I was in Syria and petrol was very expensive, we had not used it a lot, and we heated one room instead of three.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Second, there were a lot of methods to make people reduce using  fuel, like decreasing the price of electronic cars, encouraging them to ride the popular buses or trains and making workshops to be aware of the environment and their problems. For example, I have my own car, and I look forward to having an electronic car but it is so expensive compared to mine or normal cars.<NL><NL><NL><NL>As a result, in my ,opinion the world must be a part of saving the environment, and do anything logical to solve the global environment, without being so hard on people, We just need to aware and hand in hand with our environment.

task: Some people think the government should increase the cost of fuel for cars and other vehicles in order to solve environment problems. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Many people argue that environmental issues are needed to be solved strictly by the government's policy of increasing the cost of private vehicles. Personally, it is a useful measure, but other measures might be more effective.<NL><NL><NL><NL>There are some underlying reasons why authorities should make an effort to raise petrol prices. Firstly,  it would limit the number of car journeys and the money raised could be used to improve public transport. Because of the sharp rise in appearance and convenience of cars, humans forget the harmfulness of using their vehicles related to the environment. Therefore, the government should upgrade and expand public transport provided by the cost of private vehicle users. Moreover, more goods would travel by rail. It is clear that freight services and the useful solution former would reduce vehicle emissions and the greenhouse effect.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Apart from the practical measures mentioned above, I believe that other solutions are more effective. There are more and more traffic jams happening on the road daily, especially during rush hours. In this situation, congestion charges should be the best idea to improve transport infrastructure.For instance, London's government used this method to avoid traffic congestion influenced directly by transport facilities. Additionally, free bus and train passes are other measures that helped to reduce the use of cars and improve air quality. Local authorities should subsidize the cost of fares to encourage people in using public transport. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, it seems to me that it's useful to raise taxes on petrol, but other transport measures would be more effective to help the environment.

task: You should spend about 40 minutes on this task.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Write about the following topic.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Some people believe that one of the best ways to solve environmental problem is to increase the cost of fuel for cars and other vehicles. To what extent do you agree or disagree?<NL><NL><NL><NL>Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.<NL><NL><NL><NL>You should write at least 250 words.
essay: With the rising number of environmental issues , many suggest that increasing the prices of vehicles and car fuels will help save the escalating situation , I totally agree that this solution will contribute positively as it will force people to replace their fuel-working vehicles with electric ones or rely on public transportation and also it's known that around the world nations that provide cheap fuel prices suffer with environmental hardships the most.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with , a surge in the prices of fuel can lead to pleasant outcomes , if it were to occur in a particular nation people will start to think about alternatives that could be more environmentally safe , for instance , the government of Norway , is known for its harsh taxation policies against fuel products , therefore , the number of electric cars sold in the country is one of the most worldwide .<NL><NL><NL><NL>In addition , countries that have low gas prices are said to be the most polluted , moreover , people in these states heavily depend on fuel-based cars , for example , Saudi Arabia has one of the cheapest gasoline prices in the world , given that fact , almost everyone ones a car ran by it , furthermore , it's one of the most polluted places according to the Air Quality Index , however ,in recent years the Saudi government has been funding public transportation and making it cheap and accessible for everyone , and this based on other countries experiences , will surely be a positive development for the surroundings .<NL><NL><NL><NL>To sum up , increasing the prices of fuel products is an effective way to reduce pollution, as it will make individuals seek  other means of transport , on the contrary , it's evident that doing the opposite and declining the prices can be very harmful and have a lot of serious consequences.

task: Some people think that one of the best ways to solve environmental problems is to increase the cost of fuel. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: The world is now surrounded by many urgent environmental problems, and many people feel that raising the cost of fuel is one of the most effective ways of combatting them. Although I tend to agree with this viewpoint, I believe there are other environmental measures that need to be taken. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Increasing petrol prices would help save the environment in many ways. As the number of vehicles on the roads is increasing dramatically, so is the amount of vehicular emissions released into the atmosphere. However, if governments increase fuel costs, this solution would serve as a deterrent for people who drive their private cars, reducing air pollution and ozone layer depletion. Besides discouraging people from driving their private cars, this would also generate income to make further investments in environmental initiatives. Given these potential benefits of raising fuel prices, is it hardly surprising to see so many countries applying it to practice.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Apart from increasing the cost of fuel, we can also implement other solutions to environmental issues. For instance, on an individual level, people who want to help the environment should become more environmentally responsible by buying eco-friendly products, and reusing and recycling plastic bags. They can also take public transport as opposed to their personal cars, which produce toxic fumes. From a government’s perspective, it is essential to switch to green energy sources, such as solar and wind, rather than continuing to rely on gas and petrol. Thus, environmental protection goes beyond just raising fuel prices. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, though I attach great importance to the practice of increasing fuel costs, I think that both individuals and governing bodies should become environment-oriented in their mindset to tackle environmental problems.

task: Some people believe that one of the best ways to solve environmental problem is to increase the cost of fuel for cars and other vehicles. To what extent do you agree or disagree? Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
essay: Raising the price of petrol for vehicles and other transportation is one of the best ways for some people who believe that can solve <NL><NL><NL><NL>environmental problems. I would like to share some of my opinions about it.<NL><NL><NL><NL>First of all, I agree that increasing the cost of fuel for cars and other vehicles is one of the best ways to solve environmental problems because nowadays there are too many cars running on the streets. Almost everyone has a car and does not like to use public transport because it is difficult to go to work by bus or metro ,especially from a suburb. However, if the government can raise the price of petrol and make their transportation systems more friendly, it will make citizens and tourists use it generally due to the financial concerns.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Secondly, the government can make some packages for the public transportation to inspire people to take them instance of driving their own cars. For example, if people can get discount from taking public transportation, they will be willing to do it from time to time. Besides, between different places, the governments can build systems for people to bike, if it is convenient for everyone to rent bikes from one place and return to another, it will be more and more popular for people to use it and make the environment friendly.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, it is not only because  the cars produce too much carbonatite but also many other facts. Due to many studies, climate-changing <NL><NL><NL><NL> is cost by many different issues which include making products related to meat, factories, agriculture...etc. Therefore, all of the facts cost different levels of environmental problems and it <NL><NL><NL><NL>all results in climate-change.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, though there are many issues cost the environmental problem, I believe it will have a good result if the fuel price increase and everyone will definitely be concerned about the cost and make new methods to itface.

task: Some people believe that one of the best ways to solve environmental problem is to increase the cost of fuel for cars and other vehicles. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Increasing the price of fuel for cars and other vehicles is proposed to be one of the best ways to mitigate the issues in our environment. However, in my opinion, I am absolutely in disagreement with this statement. The reasons for this will be tackled in this essay.<NL><NL><NL><NL>First of all, increasing the price of fuel will only have a minimal impact on protecting our environment from pollution or climate change and will have a significant rebound negative impact on an individual level and on microenterprises. This will cause financial strain for the less fortunate, while the wealthy and large-scale business owners will most likely be unaffected. For these reasons, there will be a clash of temperaments and an increasing poverty level for those affected and could possibly lead to other issues like a rise in looting and crime rates.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Furthermore, there are other effective ways to address environmental issues, such as increasing the use of renewable energy and encouraging the use of recyclable materials.By doing such things, society can benefit more as recyclables are a more practical way of saving money. Furthermore, making use of our renewable energy sources such as solar, wind, and water energy will help reduce the amount of fossil fuel circulating in the atmosphere. Thus, this will help aid in protecting our nature.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To summarize, repricing crude is not a practical or optimal solution to the environmental issues we face today. It will only hurt the poor and benefit the rich, which could create tension and, worse, lead to other societal issues such as a rise in crime rates. It is then imperative to consider the use of renewable sources of energy to conserve and aid the earth from pollution and climate change by reducing the amount of fossil fuel accumulation.

task: People think that goverments should increase the cost of fuel for cars and other vehicles to solve envinronmental problems. Give your opinion
essay: It is certainly true that one solution to address environmental issues would be for the governments to raise the prices of petrol . Although i consider that this might be an effective measure, i believe that other measures have even more profound impacts. <NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, there are a variety of reasons why increasing the fuel prices is beneficial in addressing some of the environmental problems . Firstly, in terms of private cars, when the national authorities raise the taxes on petrol, motorists will have to limit the time and length of their journey. Therefore, governments will have more money to reinforce and update the public transport provision, as people still need to go the office, school or other medical health services like hospital, for example. Secondly, from the perspective of the freight services, more goods are transported by rail instead of truck. Thus, Both these measures will cut down on emissions and reduce the greenhouse effects. <NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, while this rise in fuel prices might be a stopgap measure, governments can adopt other policies which may be more effective in the long term. For instance, the local authorities in London have introduced a congestion charge on all vehicles visiting the city central. As a result, they have subsidized their money on some health awareness campaigns and spending on the transport infrastructure. In turn, there is a general decline in exhaust fumes from vehicles around the city centre and the air quality in the city has improved by this action.  Another policy could be to establish some free bus and train routes, as the increased use of public transport will alleviate pollution from private cars and help in the effort to combat global warming.<NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, a sharp rise in petrol prices can be a useful environmentally friendly transport measure, although in the long term other steps will be more valuable

task: Some people think that one of the best ways to solve environmental problems is to  increase the cost of fuels for cars and other vehicles. To what extent do you agree or disagree  with this statement?
essay: Over the past decades, environmental problems have never failed to draw public attention  and provoke debates. Although the severity and urgency of addressing environmental  problems properly are hardly arguable, the issue as to whether governments should deal with  these issues with higher price of fuels or not remains controversial. From my own perspective,  I consider this approach is ineffective.  Firstly, it is important to recognize that although the occurrence of positive outcome towards environment is almost inevitable, the final result may not be as expected for long. Some may  hold optimistic attitude that this particular approach would be the effect on limiting the  number of cars and thereby reducing the amount of environment-damaging gas emission. This  argument could be true to some extent. However, they should take into account the fact that  since the cost of public transport would also be affected, resistance in people with the need of  travel seems to be inevitable, hence the impossibility of achieving the desired goal. Therefore,  increasing fuel prices will not make any significant changes.  Secondly, it is equally important to recognize that there is evidence that waste gas from cars is  not the leading cause of air pollution. The opponents may argue that the combustion of fossil  fuels by cars is the main producer of carbon dioxide. Nevertheless, they are ignorant of the fact  that the chef culprit is the discharge of pollutants into the atmosphere due to the rapidly growing  manufacturing industry. Governments could better handle this problem if they could increase  control over industrial waste-discharge and adopt more environmental friendly materials and  production equipment. For example, wind and tidal power in the Netherlands, nuclear power in  Japan and solar power in the United States have all proven their efficiency  in energy  production. This example indicates that other solutions could be employed in other parts of the  world to minimize the global dependence on fossil fuel.  In conclusion, under no circumstances should increasing the price of fuels be taken as the best  solution to environmental issues, as it has neglected both the reaction of consumers and the  root cause of the problem as mentioned above.

task: People think that government should increase the cost of fuel for cars and other vehicles to solve environmental problems. Give your opinion.
essay: It is widely believed that one solution to environmental problems would be for governments to hike up the price of petrol. While I consider that this might be an effective measure, I would argue that other measures might have an even greater impact.<NL>On the one hand, raising the cost of fuel for cars and other modes is one of the efficient way because of some reasons. Firstly, higher fuel prices can help to limit the number of car journeys. A large number of low and middle income earners are not able to afford the incease in the cost of petrol, therefore they are forced to adapt to other means of transport such as: bicycle, walking, train, bus, etc. Traveling by public transportation instead private cars is the necessary way to cut down on car emission and reduce greenhouse effect. Secondly, the extra money, which collected from increasing fuel prices can be used in order to compensate for the extra expense. Government can raise expenditure on upgrading and expand public facilities and transportation to suffice residents. <NL>On the other hand, while this rise in petrol costs might be a useful stopgap measure, national authorities could apply some other solutions to tackle this problem. The first measure is to invest money in developing eco-friendly means of transport. People should be encouraged to use electric cars and motorbikes to prevent air pollution. Moreover, introducing free bus and train passes, as the increased use of public transport would help in the effort to combat global warming. Another measure is to raise people awareness of the need to cut down on emissions from their cars. Environmental campaigns shoud be carried out more, especially on social media to popularize residents efficient ways to protect the environment. <NL>In conclusion, a sharp rise in petrol prices would be a useful environmental friendly transport measure, although in the longer term other steps would be more effective.

task: Some people think that the best way to solve global environmental problems is to increase the cost of fuel.<NL><NL>To what extent do you agree or disagree.
essay: It is believed by some people that increasing the prices of the fuel is the key to solving environmental problems. In my opinion, I completely agree with this statement.  Firstly, this essay will discuss on how this decision can reduce the emissions of dangerous gases releasing into the air and secondly, explain how it can decrease the overall consumption of this resource utilized by human beings for industrial purposes.<NL>Increasing the price of fuel can reduce the number of vehicles travelling on the streets. This can prevent in emission of greenhouse gases, particularly from vehicles into the air and as a result, it reduces overall pollution, which is also one of the primary  contributing factors in environmental issues. For example, the United Kingdom has recently surged the prices of the fuel and it resulted in lesser traffic and even showed significant difference in the air quality due to lesser hazardous gases released. Therefore, it is clear that increasing the cost can actually make a difference to tackle this problem.<NL>Another reason to consider inclining the prices of the fuel would directly reflect in the reduction of all other industries using fuel as a primary energy source. In other words, several industries use diesel and gas as a primary source of energy to provide electricity to their machines and now people will double check on spending hefty amounts which will eventually reduce the excess consumption of this resource and therefore look for renewable ways to run their machines. It is therefore playing a prominent role in tackling the contributing factors of environmental problems. Hence, it is patently evident that hiking the costs of the fuel is beneficial to the society.<NL>In conclusion, surging the prices of the fuel can tackle environmental problems as it reduces the vehicles that emit gasses into the atmosphere and overall reduction of its consumption which are powering up machines. It is recommended that more and more countries should take this initiative for a better healthy air in the world.

task: Some people think the best way to solve environmental problems is to increase the cost of fuel for cars and other vehicles.<NL>To what extent, do you agree or disagree?<NL>
essay: It is commonly believed by many that inflating the cost of fuel is the most efficient way to solve environmental issues. I partially agree with them because I believe that although it is an important way but there are many other more effective ways of doing so.<NL><NL>On one hand, increase in the rate of fuel would definitely reduce the level of pollution to some extent. As increased rate will discourage people to use their vehicles unnecessarily, as it is a common trend to drive a car even though the distance is walkable. This will encourage people to use pooling of vehicle while going to same site. For instance, if five people from one community work in same office or location, it is the efficient to go by one car alternatively. This will also motivate them to use bicycles and public transport system. Thus, this will solve the problem to some extent.<NL><NL>On the other hand, I believe this is not the key method and there are many other effective ways to solve environmental issues such as growing more trees and avoid use of plastic bags. Plastic containers should be replaced by bio-degradable glass dishes. Also I believe that this change would provide some level of discomfort to the public as the public transport system in most of the countries are not very convenient. In short, only increasing the rate of fuel would not protect the environment, people have to become conscious about the surrounding and put their contribution by many other ways such as aforementioned.<NL><NL>In conclusion, I agree that inflated rates of fuel would decrease the environmental problems but it is not the most efficient way, as it will benefit the environment but may provide inconvenience to public. Only increasing the rate of fuel would not improve the adverse condition of our environment, many other measures need to be taken such as planting trees, choosing glass over plastic and using renewable resources instead of fossil fuels.

task: Some people think that one of the best ways to solve environmental problems is to increase the cost of fuel for cars and other vehicles.<NL>To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: The earth's average surface temperatures are increasing every year by the pollutions which are emitted by vehicles. However, some people believe that the rise in fuel prices is the best way to solve environmental problems. Although it is a controversial statement, I completely disagree with this statement.<NL><NL>Firstly, it is important to solve the environmental problems due to the global warming effect on the earth's surface. Many harmful gases are released into the atmosphere by fuel vehicles, while electric vehicles can be the best way to this problem. For instance, electric vehicles do not emit any harmful gases into the atmosphere as it runs through electricity. Although it saves fuel, but it takes more time to charge. Whereas growing more trees is also a solution for that cause.<NL><NL>In contrast, many people cannot afford those electric cars, so they use normal fuel  vehicles.<NL>Raise in petrol or diesel price can affect the people in various ways. For example, when the petrol price is raised, many people usually prefer to use public transport. Excess use public transport leads to more traffic jam on roads for hours. This makes people feel uncomfortable as well as late to their works. So, it causes many disadvantages to normal middle class people who tends to use normal vehicles for their daily uses.<NL><NL>In conclusion, by the above aforementioned  points, the rise in fuel rates has various effects on normal people and it is not the best way to solve the environmental pollutions. However, the electric vehicles and growing more trees can solve the majority of the problem. The government should implement new awareness of pollution in schools can also results to decrease environmental problems

task: Some people believe that the government should not spend money on international aid when they have their own disadvantaged people like homeless and unemployed. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Some individuals suppose that the government should allocate financial resources to other impoverished countries while others believe that it is of paramount importance to focus on solving their domestic issues. From my point of view, I strongly agree with the proposal of determining national priority on internal problems.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, it is undeniable that cross-border support is a symbol of humanity. Geographically, people are divided into different ethnicities but by nature, it will be the core of connecting features among individuals. Thus, aiding the poor stems from the consciousness and heart of each resident and is not solely contingent on monetary contributions. Not to mention that helping other nations to encounter  financial crises would eliminate the chances of illegal migration which is detrimental to surrounding developed regions. For example, back to the COVID-19 pandemic, with  assistance from the whole world related to foods, vaccines,... etc, leading to a sustainable society as well as expressing humanity among several nations.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Nevertheless, I am of the opinion that concentrating on addressing domestic issues such as homelessness or unemployment should be of the utmost urgency in any country. To begin with, the financial fund from the government is regarded as a crucial means to reserve and maintain welfare schemes as well as social security. The smooth flow of how society works would generate a favourable environment for employment opportunities which accordingly increases the economic growth rate. Furthermore, employment prospects, consequently, generate more personal budgets which people can use to afford decent accommodation decreasing the homelessness rate.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, although transnational support should be executed as a gesture of humanity, I still believe that the government should put the goal of tackling internal issues in a country to be the top priority.

task: Some people believe that the government should not spend money on international aid when they have their own disadvantaged people like homeless and unemployed. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Over the last 100 years, population has grown at an exponential rate across many countries in the world. This brings along with it its own problems such as poverty, illiteracy, unemployment and so on. Many governments allocate huge resources to tackle these problems. Since all governments have problems to solve in their own countries, I agree with the argument that their first priority should be their own people.<NL><NL>There are ample reasons why I believe that the government should put the welfare of its own people ahead of others. To begin with, financial resources are becoming scarce and many countries are already in debt. These funds must be reserved for the development and maintenance of its own institutions and social security measures such as free health care and shelters for homeless people. Secondly, such welfare schemes not only elevate people out of poverty; they also help the government indirectly by creating jobs. This, in turn, facilitates the economic growth of the country.<NL><NL>On the other hand, it is understandable and reasonable to donate money to the poorer nations as a gesture of basic human decency and humanity. No nation, after all, can live in prosperity when its neighbours are struggling with poverty. By offering financial assistance to their poor neighbours, countries can also put a curb on illegal immigration. Even so, in my opinion, solving problems in one’s own country is more important than venturing to help others. Others should be helped only when the donating country has a surplus of money and resources.<NL><NL>In conclusion, there are obvious benefits for the government in the long run from donating money as relief aids to many foreign countries. However, I strongly iterate that the government must first improve the economic, financial and employment prospects of its own people before embarking on humanitarian work abroad.

task: Some people believe that it is the government’s responsibility to provide care and finance to support people after they retire. Others, however, think that individuals themselves should save money in their own when they are old. Discuss both views and give your opinion. > DISCUSS AND OPINION
essay: Some people believe that the government should take care of old people and provide financial support after they retire. Others say individuals should save during their working years to fund their own retirement. What is your opinion? Give reasons for your answer and include examples from your own experience.<NL><NL><NL><NL>It is true that when people advance into their golden years, they require more help and attention. For that reason, a significant number of people hold the opinion that the government should provide financial assistance to the elderly. However, I tend to agree with those who argue that workers should be saving a portion of their income to have a nest egg in their retirement.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with, a culture of saving rather than depending on the government may foster the overall economic development of a country. In other words, if people were to accumulate their own savings for their pension age, it would lessen the financial burden on the government. As a result, the government would be able to release more funds to more productive purposes, such as development of infrastructure, industries, hospitals, and so on, which may expedite the overall progression of a country.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In addition to economic factors, putting money aside has some personal benefits. Since savings-oriented people are not dependent on the state for their living expenses, this may instill a sense of self-respect and pride in them. On the other hand, those who are reliant on financial assistance very often face the negative societal stigma, as many people consider them to be inferior and unworthy members of society. Hence, to live a life with dignity and pride, taking responsibility for funding one’s own retirement is evidently a better option from individual perspective.

Firstly, schools are made for human, where people can taken good things. To be precise, Education gives the real meaning of life what exactly children needs to do in their upcoming times, either they take it or waste their time on wasted area.For example, by taking good morality from schools are able to know what are goods and bads, so they can make difference on that. Secondly, children are going to do hard working to get success. This is because, if children wants to live a better life then have to do as much hard work they didn't.
