Unlike in the past, children are now getting access all of the facilities they want, so they can use their didactic knowledge with that resourses are going to build something that can produce best outcome for them and world as well.In addtion, children who are gifted they can be a businessman, show some creativity in their little life to become more polpular or be a sucessfull person.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, schools are built to magnify the light of every single children brain, so they can not only focus on perticular field but also understand how many things they can do within their small lives.

task: Some people think that the main purpose of schools is to turn children into good citizens and workers, rather than to benefit them as individuals. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Some people are of the opinion that the primary role of schools is to create good citizens, instead of merely working towards individual betterment. During the course of this essay, this statement would be subjected to objective discussion before drawing a rational conclusion. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Obviously, there are a plethora of reasons to support the given perspective; nevertheless, the value of a well-functioning society seems to be the most widely accepted. As contemporary society moves into a phase of rapid developments in medicine, technology, welfare and so on, the luxury of conformity requires people to sacrifice their individualism for common prosperity.  To be specific, individuals are expected to function harmoniously to both stimulate the economy and preserve the peaceful existence amongst communities. As much as these prerequisites require education, school is where this education can initiate. In many educational institutions, teachers have the power to both openly and subconsciously influence students’ socially responsible actions and provide them with a solid foundation for future employment.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, this perspective should not be considered an ideal one. As a result of following their own ostensibly selfish goals, students who are taught to share, work effectively in teams, and enhance their talents can benefit society. In addition, it’s possible that occasionally the emphasis on society may come at the expense of people’s mental health. For instance, pupils who are instructed to keep their personal opinions to themselves in class, as is typical in many authoritarian countries, could harbour anger and feel unable to properly express themselves in a democratic setting. According to cognitive science, the ability to express oneself without worrying about negative consequences or repercussions is essential for well-rounded development.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, while there is a case to be made for societal stability, schools should work to develop strong, motivated students. Naturally, these objectives do not conflict with one another, and it is important to highlight the overlap.

task: Some people think the main purpose of school is to turn children into good citizens and workers, rather than to benefit them as individuals.<NL><NL>To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: The young generation of each country is its main part contributing to the future of that country. Schools as the second home of children have a significant role in their lives; as a result, there is a widely accepted belief which says they are only responsible to provide the future law-abiding citizens and productive workers. On the contrary, there is another hypothesis against that which points out that schools should concentrate on students' happiness and personal growth regardless of the society and professional market requirements. I believe to some extent both ideas are correct and the right way is to utilize both ideas at the same time.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, a proportion of people agree schools have to provide both educational and vocational curricula for students to provide the nation with citizens who will behave based on the predefined rules and act proactively in the industry as employees. For example, these days, elementary school pupils are encouraged to join different extra-time classes including sports, dance, science or vocational.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, there is an idea against the aforementioned belief which says if kids require to know their mental and physical characteristics first, then they will figure out their talents easily. This idea points  out that playtime is a must-have for children at school and they need to play with other counterparts in school to learn the concept of teamwork naturally. Therefore, they will learn to obey the law and be productive by doing social activities.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In general, there are two hypotheses about the responsibility of schools to nurture students. The first one knows schools are responsible for preparing useful employees and citizens, but the second one mentions children only need to take benefits from schools individually. Although schools have to focus on the personal growth of each child, they need to prepare them for their future professional life as children are the most valuable asset of each nation.

task: 2) Some people believe that teenagers should be required to do unpaid community work in their free time. This can benefit teenagers and the community as well.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Teenager is a very active phase of life when they have so much curiosity to explore about the world.  In order to utilize that energy in a positive way, I do believe that they need to be involved in a social work as a volunteered. This will help for a community as well as teenagers themselves as it will give them a kind of sense of being worthwhile in a society. Moreover, it is obvious that community will get benefit from it as it will help to build harmonious society.  <NL><NL><NL><NL>There are three reasons why I recommend to include teenagers in unpaid social work. Firstly, when teenagers start working in the community from the early age of their life, they will learn different life skills which will be useful for them in the future. Furthermore, it will help them to gain work experience which will make their life easy to find the job in their adulthood. Moreover, teenagers will feel the sense of being included and being part of the society which help them to grow mentally and physically. Thus, I strongly support to involve teenager in social activities. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Secondly, encouraging teenagers in social work will help to lower the risk of them getting involved in illegal activities. As teenagers are very curious by the nature to see the world and they can easily influences by other as their articulative ability to distinguise right and wrong is not fully develop, they might choose the wrong way during this stage of life. Therefore, keeping them busy in community work in their free time will help to distract them from making the bad decision in their life. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Thirdly, involving teenagers in a community volunteer work will set an example for others to be selfless and help each other. Moreover, it will help to build a peaceful, harmonious and cooperative environment in the community. In addition, observeing teenager doing the social work will encourage others to do the volunteer work in future. Furhtermore, teenagers will feel empower, proud and confident being part of the society and being able to bring the change in the community. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Thus, it is beneficial for both community and teenagers themselves, I would highly recommend them to participate in social activities.

task: Some people believe that teenagers should be required to do unpaid community work in their free time. This can benefit teenagers and the community as well. To what extent do you agree or disagree.

task: Some people believe that teenagers should be required to do unpaid community work in their free time. This can benefit teenagers and the community as well. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Some people argue that wages should not be paid for teenage workers who spend their free time on work in the community so that can lead to some beneficial skills to teenagers and also good to the community. In my opinion, This can not be acceptable for youngsters who attempt to live on their own. This essay partially agree with this topic and will discuss both views<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, It can reduce an expenditure of community organization who works for public without paid as well as it also can contribute youngsters to gain essential skill and social skill which could help them to grow up effectively and can face to a real world. For example, some community group who works for a charity and give all money they earn to a donation for stray dogs. This can be seen as a positive affect to the community, teenagers as well as dogs.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, while it can be a positive aspect to teenagers, it also can exhaust them in case it is hard work or some work that requires them to use their force. Besides, youngsters can be distracted from their classes by this work and they would think that it is not worth participating in public work.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To conclude, It could depend on how hard they have to work and these both views could have beneficial positive effects to young people and even community organization.

task: Some people believe that teenagers should be required to do unpaid community work in their free time. This can benefit teenagers and the community as well. Agree? disagree?
essay: Many people argue that younger generation should volunteer for free in their spare time, which would be beneficial for them and society as a whole. I strongly agree with this view as described as the following paragraphs.On the other hand, people who participate in the community activities have more opportunities to meet a lot of people from different regions and backgrounds.They can see all aspects of life through which they will learn how to communicate with folks who have a different characteristics, have a compassion for each other and how to work in a group. Besides that, participatingin volunteer activities is the perfect time for children to develop skills such as time management, communication, and problem-solving, which are strong points for them to compete with other candidates when lokking for future work. <NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, it also brings a lot of benefits to the community. Firstly, the local environment does not need to spend the budget to hire people and work.They may spend that funds on health or education. Secondly, working as a volunteer for free, it could reduce crime and robbery in the country. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Taking everything into one consideration, parents should allow their children work for free as volunteer in their free time, because it has a great adventage both society and adolscent.

task: Some people believe that teenager should be required to do unpaid community work in their free time . This can be benefit teenagers and the community as well . To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: There are a lot of young people who go to do unpaid community work after school. Some people think that it is good for both young people and the community. My view is that unpaid community jobs can provide teenagers and the community with a lot of advantages. <NL><NL><NL><NL> <NL><NL><NL><NL>First, it is obvious that young people can have a good experience for doing community work. This is because they need to learn how to communicate with different kinds of people who are living in this community and how to work together. task: Some people think that all teenagers should be required to do unpaid<NL>work in their free time to help the local community. They believe this<NL>would benefit both the individual teenager and society as a whole.<NL>Do you agree or disagree?
essay: Many youngsters work on a volunteer basis, and this can truly be conducive for both the community and themself; however, from my perspective, I disagree with the viewpoint that all teenagers should be forced to do unpaid work in their leisure time.<NL><NL><NL><NL>One evident reason that supports my idea is that students are already stressed and tired enough during their school hours; therefore , they should be allowed to rest and enjoy their leisure time in lieu of being asked to do unpaid work. Forcing students to do such work might further enhance their burden and even lead to a reduction in their academic performance. Another problem is that inefficient work can be anticipated. To exemplify, It can be easily envisaged that people who are compelled to do work  against their will are liable to end up inefficiently; moreover, this action can even exacerbate the relationship between the adolescents and the local community, eventually reaching the outcome which is against the initial expectation.<NL><NL><NL><NL>People who stand on the opposite side might contend that youngsters can cultivate a sense of responsibility through work on a volunteer basis. This can be sensible in some aspects; however, except for being forced to do unpaid work, there are still other gateways for the young to attain the same effect. For example, it is also an act of responsibility for some teenagers who manage their own time to do part-time jobs to support their tuition or personal expenses and ameliorate their families' economical condition. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, I disagree with the view that young people should be required to do unpaid work as many drawbacks can be anticipated. The meaning of volunteer work would be conducive for both sides only if it is not against any individual’s will.

Professionals don't leave their jobs so that they can get more and more work experience and be awarded promotions and certain desired positions in long run. Even women are also in this race and not ready to compromise their careers on the family because they also have the motives of getting  managerial positions. Besides this, the masses work to get job benefits, for instance, insurance and free vacations with family to Europe and other fascinating destinations. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In addition to this, on 2017 Hilti company hired an external agent to make a survey for their employees about major issues that affect performance as well as how much they believe in long service in the company, the results were surprising  90% of the employees are searching for another opportunity outside due to money, hence, this made the management to take serious actions, for example, salary review and set the salary benchmark against market standards. moreover, many researchers have done about employee satisfaction through recruiter agencies and institutes found out that 70% of employees can be productive at work when they are well paid and their income is enough to cover their daily expenses.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, money is a very important factor for employees to be productive and stay in the company, hence companies should take serious actions for this reason, such as yearly review of the salary and ensure employees are well paid by adding a bonus system for a productive employee or achieving the targets or else the company will face serious issues on employee retention as well as, company performance.

task: Some people think that museums should be enjoyable places to entertain people, while others believe that the purpose of museums is to educate. Discuss both views and give you own opinion
essay: Every person has different beliefs about a purpose of museums. The majority of people believe that museums should be visited as an entertainment while others think that this place is to educate. In my opinion, I see museums as a place where people can do both fun and get knowledge.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, not everyone in this world enjoy visiting a monument because most of the people are not really interested in history or geography. Furthermore, they will be bored if there is no something funny to see. For instance, research reveals that more than 30% of teenagers that went to museums felt no enjoyable. Some of them even wanted to go home earlier. As a result, a function of museums should be added more to be entertain.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, generally, museums are related to history, and some of them contain many ancient artefacts and weapons. This purpose is to give public new knowledge about our past conditions or how our heroes sacrificed themselves. For example, in Yogyakarta, there is a house that constructed into a museum that show Indonesian history. Because of this, tourists and visitors can see real-life example of a country history, and they can get education that they can not get in schools.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, although a function of museums is to educate people, it is not wrong to turn museums into entertainment places.

task: Some people think that museums should be enjoyable places to entertain people,<NL><NL>while others believe that the purpose of museums is to educate.<NL><NL>Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay: These days, public debate has been going on over whether museums should amuse or enlighten humans. Both viewpoints can be grounded with compelling arguments, which are key for understanding the reasons behind conflict and can broaden one’s horizons, therefore, will be analyzed.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To embark on, a pleasurable experiences in museums would have a range of benefits for the society. To start with, a higher attendance of the institutions would be provoked. For this reason, more tickets would be bought and higher sums of money collected. The financial savings could be used for virtuous purposes when, for example, state museums would give them to the government. The latter undeniably has a dozen of opportunities for investment, including social projects that increase the welfare of the country. Moreover, some museums might become a cheap option for entertainment. If more people can afford the latter, they will have more opportunities for unwinding themselves. Undoubtedly, relaxing and resting after a workday is indispensable for being productive the next day. Eventually, workers could produce more value for their land or environment with their work. <NL><NL><NL><NL> But the assertion that museums should serve the purpose of teaching people, has convincing justifications too. One of them is that the facilities could evoke curiosity about the culture along with traditions of a land. This may catalyze the development of national pride and patriotism. Consequently, individuals pursuing such values would get motivated and have an incentive to collaborate, work hard for the nations well-being and promote peace in their surroundings for achieving that. Furthermore, expositions might spark curiosity about some subjects. As a result, there would be more young personas inspired about science, hence, interested in studying. If they learned more, they would acquire more skills for possibly inventing something in the future. If it would turn out to be so, the inventions could help the society like electricity does.<NL><NL><NL><NL> This leads to the conclusion that making museums a place, which is fun to come to, and utilizing them for enlightening members of the society has a multitude of merits. On the basis of the above discussion it might not be clear for what one should opt for, however, it may be manageable somehow for museums to fulfill both needs and solutions for that should be sought after.

task: Some people think that museums should be enjoyable places to entertain people, while others  believe that the purpose of museums is to educate. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay: People tend to have different views about the function of museums. Some think that they should be  a place for enjoyment, while the others are certain, that it is important for them to be educational.  In this essay I will discuss both views and state my opinion.  On one hand, it can be said that the main role of museums is to be a place of entertainment. If there  is going to be too much educational content, some visitors might become bored and that way less  people will be interested in visiting places like that. Nevertheless, museums are tourist attractions  and attract many visitors in general, so big part of society thinks, that they should emphasize the  enjoyment, create more interactive activities or some sort of games, so that the exhibitions could be  more entertaining for people of all ages and that way more people would take interest in visiting  places like that.  On the other hand, a big part of the society believes that not everything in this world should be all  about fun and games. They are sure that the main point of any exhibition is to help people learn  about something they did not know previously. This means that the story behind every exhibit  should be explained, and this can be done in various ways. Some museums have professional guides,  and the others offer audio guides, so that the visitors can listen to a commentary about every single  object and explore them by themselves. That way people do not have to read long and boring  descriptions and then museums can play a big part in helping people broaden their knowledge in  many different aspects of life.  To conclude, I believe that museums should be a place, where you can do both – broaden your  knowledge and have some fun at the same time. Especially when there are various

task: Some people think that museums should be an enjoyable place to entertain people. While others believe the purpose of the museum is to educate. <NL><NL>Discus both views & give your own opinion
essay: It is often argued by individuals that the museum’s motive is to entertain the masses. However, Others ponder that museums ought to offer education & knowledge.  This essay will articulate both views as far as I am concerned, I  am in the favour of Former notion. <NL><NL><NL><NL>To commence with the initial view that why art galleries should be a place of entertainment the people act as a stress buster. However, It can also give birth to mental disorders which are not fruitful for them. To elaborate it, By, visiting museums individuals can enhance their knowledge about their culture and part of their elders which can assist them in their future as when they read about their ancestors they can get experience which can reduce the chance of errors which their elders did in the past because of this they can do the work effectively.  To exemplify, A headline of BBC in 2009 revealed that having information about ancestors plummets 60% chances of mistakes which leads to profit at work. As a result, Art galleries ought to provide education as it aid to enhance knowledge and experience. <NL><NL><NL><NL>To conclude, Although museums should be a place to have fun due to stressful lives and these also should be educational, Yet I believe that art galleries must be enjoyable instead of educational because nowadays people have the burden of work or study which create many health issues.

task: Some people think that museums should be enjoyable places to entertain people, while others believe that the purpose of museums is to educate. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay: Some people argue that museums ought to be a place for recreational purposes, while others argue that museums ought to be used solely for educating people. Museums can be used to attract tourists which will benefit the country in the end as it can flourish the economy. In contrast, museums are imperative to educate the public about their art, history and culture. In my opinion, museums should be used for both educational and entertainment purposes.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with, museums attract numerous tourists from all around the globe. From an economic perspective, museums generate job opportunities in the market and contribute to the growth of the local economy because of tourists, which will benefit the nation in the end. A museum where people could enjoy and entertain attracts more people than other museums. There are museums where it is not only about history or art, such as the kimchi museum in South Korea and the chocolate museum in Belgium. Hence, since these museums are quite popular among international tourists, museums should be a place to entertain people. <NL><NL><NL><NL>On the contrary, museums play a crucial role in educating the public about art, history, science, culture among others. Moreover, it is imperative for educating future generations about their history, culture and roots. Thus, museums are undoubtedly a huge source of knowledge, so it ought to be solely used for educational purposes.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, museums and entertainment purpose both for educational and entertainment purposes. From an economic point of view, enjoyable museums attract a significant number of tourists which will eventually benefit the country, while it is also a huge source of knowledge and plays an important role in educating people about art, history and culture.

task: Some people think that museums should be enjoyable places to entertain people, while others believe that the purpose of museums is to educate.Discuss both views and give you own opinion.

task: Some people think that museums should be enjoyable places to entertain people, while others believe that the purpose of museums is to educate.  Discuss both views and give you own opinion.
essay: The role of museums in our lives has been widely debated. Opinions differ as to whether the role of museums is solely limited to entertain us or as a means of education. In this essay, I will not only discuss both sides, but also provide my viewpoint while concluding this.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with, these galleries serve people in getting rid of their boredom. To elaborate, nowadays, people tend to get tired very easily, owing to their monotonous lifestyles. In order to mitigate this weariness, these archaeological places can serve as a one of the many options for them to explore and rejuvenate.<NL><NL><NL><NL> Red Fort, for instance, is frequently visited by tourists and local people as a leisure activity.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Conversely, these museums are the symbol of our cultural history, identity, and traditions. Visiting these places helps people to broaden their horizon and enhance their knowledge about their ancestral roots. According to an article published in "THE TIMES", the students who explored these sites as their history assignment, achieved more success than other students in their exams. Besides this, feeling proud about their identity is an another possible reason. Because of the globalisation the world has become a smaller place, these places serves as a medium to connect people to their traditional roots,and also develop a social bond between them. As a result, they are proud of their national identities and its values.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To conclude, while there are valid arguments on both sides, I believe museums have an equally important role to serve as a leisure activity as well as for education, and people have sole right to decide upon what they want to do.

task: Some people think that museums should be enjoyable places to entertain people, while others believe that the purpose of museums is to educate. Discuss both views and give you own opinion.
essay: It is argued that museums are better to become entertainment sites whilst others think that education should be the main aim of museums. For my perspective, both of distraction and education sides shoud be encouraged in museums.<NL>On the one hand, museums should be play in the entertainment role for some reasons. Firstly, lots of people are likely to go somewhere in weekends to let their hair down after hard working days. They want to look for a transquil place to contemplate the beauty of life or artworks and museums are such appropriate sites. Secondly, museums are destinations for tourist attractions, where a country may advertise its regional or national culture or history. Therefore, it is necessary to incorporate the interacted activities or funny games into museum trips so that visitors do not feel boring and find it easy to remember the knowledge provided by the guides. <NL>On the other hand, museums should teach people about many aspect of life, such as history, science, art, culture and so on. Almost every city in one country possess at least one museum to serve local people and tourists. Hence, professional guides of museums have to either explain visitors whatever about the historical stories or origin of relics attached to locality or distribute to visitors pictures or audio documentary so that they understand well about details of one exhibition. Schools and colleges also usually organise museum trips where pupils or students are more eager to learn or verify the reality through visual sightseeings. <NL>In conclusion, it seems to me that learning from the practical observation and combined games is more interesting than tough theorical lessons. For that reason, museums should offer to visitors interesting recreation activities besides the education features.

task: As society changes, more and more people do not want to stay in one career or job. Many people change their careers and jobs. What is the cause of this phenomenon? Can you give some suggestions to solve this problem?
essay: With the development of our society, there is a noteworthy phenomenon that more and more people do not stay in one job position in all their careers, which means people now change their job frequently. This essay will give several factors that why this happened and will give some suggestions to solve this problem.<NL><NL><NL><NL>The first reason why people changed their job frequently is due to the job market nowadays is much better than it was in the past. Now, there are more jobs for people to choose from in the job market than in the old times. So people will have more chances to join  a new position in the same field or switch to a completely new field due to  society's development.<NL><NL><NL><NL>The second reason is that the cost for people to live  a decent life costs much more than it  used to. So people always want their salary incremented each year. The best way to achieve this is to switch their job to a different company. That's the second reason why employee changed their jobs <NL><NL><NL><NL>frequently.<NL><NL><NL><NL>The third factor is that the employee are easier to get bored with what they have done in the company, and thanks to the development of the internet. People have a way to find what they are interested in and the internet helps people  learn new knowledge or technology easily. It provides a convenient way for people to switch their jobs. It also causes people  not to stay in one position for a long time.<NL><NL><NL><NL>But this phenomenon may do a little harm to the company because it may lose some expertise employees and if they want to hire  new employees with the same quality, it requires them to pay more salaries to them, which may influence the company's development and profits. So there should have some measures to alleviate this phenomenon happened. The company could provide a clear path for employees to get promoted and give some employees who perform well a good bonus. It will  make employees feel safe and satisfied. What's more, a good work-life balance is also a key factor to reduce the leaving rate for employees.

task: as transport and accommodation problems are increasing in many cities, some governments are encouraging business to move to rural areas. do you think the advantages outweigh disadvantages?
essay: It is true that the world's largest companies are located in large cities. In the city many people expect to find better employment opportunities, often with bigger, secure companies. as cities become overcrowded, problems relating to housing and transport arise, because of which some people suggest that the larger companies should relocate to the countryside. while this may have some advantages, i firmly believe that the disadvantages would be far more than the advantages. <NL><NL><NL><NL>It is reasonable to think that moving thousands of employees from large companies out to remote areas would have a positive impact on the overcrowding of some cities. there would be less traffic because of less strain on the services offered by the city-bank, public transportation, restaurants and the like. This would mean a reduction in queues and faster customer service. To add to it, housing would also become affordable. It is generally seen that because of too many people wanting to live in the city, land prices and event rents of houses start touching the sky.<NL><NL><NL><NL>the problem however would be that a dramatic reduction in numbers of people in the cities would mean that many businesses would go broke. Restaurants, cafes and other service areas would suffer tremendously. What would happen is that overcrowding would occur where the new, large organizations relocate. More and more people offering services would spring up- restaurants, shopping centers and other businesses would be needed to serve the increasingly larger numbers of people who moved to the area. in addition, the rural area may not be able to provide the enormous quantities of housing, electricity and raw materials required to run a huge company. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Furthermore, relocating businesses to rural areas may upset many households. Children also may have to change schools. so It would not be practical to do so. Transport and accommodation problems in cities need to be sorted out by connecting the villages and cities by very efficient public transport, so that people come to work in cities and live in rural areas. Newer businesses should be encouraged to open in the suburbs; the already existing ones should continue to be where they already are. <NL><NL><NL><NL>To sum up, relocating the companies would assist with the overcrowding problem in some cities. However, a new set of problems would surface, which would be far more than the benefits. Therefore, I reiterate my point that the idea of moving larger corporations out to rural areas would not be beneficial.

task: Detailed description of crimes on newspaper and TV can have bad consequences on society, so this kind of information should be restricted on media. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?
essay: Many people have expressed that a number of reports detailing crime news should be controlled, as they have many negative effects on society. I partly agree with this view.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, I believe the bad influences that stem from two main reasons. Firstly, the direct result of crime news with extremely details are to bring victims psychological injury. To pique readers’ interest, the media may use the bloody images and exaggerated language. This reminds me of a school murder that occurred in China.The local media had numerous reports on the atrocious detail of crimes. Repeated reports led the surviving children to recall the exceptionally painful experience. They had to live under an intense psychological pressure. Secondly, too many details in crime news allow people attempting to commit crime to learn the criminal methods and consequently increasing the crime rate. It not only to victim's mental health caused some damage, but also to the whole community to bring about a great potential threat. So the media should not report too many details of crimes to the public. <NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, the crime news can serve as a public warning. People can enhance their guarding consciousness in order to avoid becoming a victim, and also  assist the police in remaining alert. For example, the media report criminal news in a public place to arouse our social concern. The police can use this information to strengthen the force of supervision in this areas.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, I argue that detail of crimes in the media are likely to invite various problems, and we should limit them to protect people from harm.

Likewise, send kids in unisex school could be risky which young boy may have a physical relationship with a classmate and get pregnant. Furthermore, A significant is the way parents explain to their kids what is right and what is wrong no matter if they will be in single-gender school or co-school and watch their behaves.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, parents can send thier kids to any school they wants as long as it is helpful for children which it give them good knowledge and educate them who to behavior with both genders.

task: In many countries today, parents are able to choose to send their children to single-sex schools or co-educational schools. Some people think that children to single-sex schools have disadvantages later in life.<NL><NL>Do you agree or disagree?
essay: Today's both single-sex <NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, <NL><NL><NL><NL>institutions and co-educational institutions are available to provide education in many nations. Parents, accordingly, can opt for any of these academies for their offsprings to study. While some individuals advocate children who have schooling from single-sex schools face difficulties in later life, I disagree with this notion as students who study in single-sex schools have the same education as co-educational institutions provide to their scholars ,and they have interaction with other sexes after school hours, so it does not have any effect on their later life. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In terms of education, both single-sex and co-educational academies provide a similar level of education to their students, which means opting for single-sex institutions does not have any effect on students' studies. In other words, the same school subjects are taught in both institutions, so whether to study in a single-sex or co-educational institute does not make any difference in academic studies. Single-sex school students, for example, study the same subjects, such as science, English and maths. Students, therefore, who study in single-sex have the same level of opportunities as co-educational scholars have.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Another point to consider is that interacting with other genders after school times creates no difference between a co-educational and single-sex student. This means that single-sex school students still have interaction with other genders after getting free from  school.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, obtaining education from a co-educational or single-sex school does not make in difference in a individual's life.

task: In many countries today, parents are able to choose to send their children to single-sex schools or co-educational schools. Some people think that children going to single-sex schools have disadvantages later in life. To what extent do you agree?

the prejudice against the opposite sex because boys will find that a girl can be as brave as any boy and that gossiping is also common among boys.<NL> Secondly, co-educational school is beneficial for children as they expose them to different viewpoints.Since male and female have varied perspectives on issues and it results in the difference of handling scenarios.Co-education allows children to task: In many countries today, parents are able to choose to send their children to single-sex schools or co-educational schools. Some people think that children going to single-sex schools have disadvantages later in life. To what extent do you agree?

task: Some people think that the best way to become successful in life is to get a university education, whereas others say this is no longer true. Discuss both these views and give your own opinion.
essay: Colleges and Universities are a crucial part of ancient history. Education is the right of every citizen of a developed and developing countries. Whereas few people contract this fact and say this is no longer needed at all. In My Opinion, Universities develops  discipline, technical skillset , human behaviour and other important aspects of life in the student which make them  survive financially dependent on society.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Getting seats in supreme colleges is always a nutcracker for every student.The preparation to get admission usually starts at a very early stage. task: Some people think that the best way to become successful in life is to get a university education, whereas others say this is no longer true. Discuss both these views and give your own opinion.
essay: It is considered that having academic degrees from institutions is the best way to achieve goals and obtain more success, while others argue that university degrees are not important things to become successful. In my view, effective educations in universities prepare you for a better future and getting professional qualifications.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with, applying for prestigious establishments can assist citizens to achieve their ambitions and give them the best chances to improve their knowledge. Because  the universities have well-known professors that they have professional experience and can help people to become successful. For example, when people have gone to universities, they have developed their practical skills such as  communication skills, time management and leadership skills and these skills can influence  their future lives. In my opinion, going to top universities provide students with comprehensive educations that we cannot find  in any place. Consequently, becoming more successful in life can result in effective education in universities.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, getting experience or doing something you like can help you become professional rather than having academic degrees. Sometimes people pursue their ambitions or learn some skills that they want, and these goals can persuade them to become successful. For instance, C. Ronaldo is  one of the best soccer players in the world that does not have any academic degrees, and just he has endless effort. In my view, however, this statement can be accurate, the best way to become a successful person in your life is high-level education in universities.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, getting prestigious establishments is the best way that can assist people to become the professional people in their lives, whereas some others believe that  not more important as experiences and goals. In my opinion, academic educations can cultivate practical skills that obtain more success in our lives.

task: Studies have shown that many criminals have a low level of education. For this reason, some people believe that the best way to reduce crime is to educate people in prison, so that they can get a job when they leave. Do you agree or disagree ?
essay: Most of the criminals are uneducated so some people advise to train and provide them education. They state that this will help them to find a job after they leave prison. I strongly agree with this because this is will help to reduce crimes and help for a better society.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Firstly, the number of crimes will reduce in the near future if criminals are taught during their time in imprisonment. Criminals commit crimes because they are not capable of earning money. To satisfy the basic needs of life, they loot other people. Food and shelter are the basis needs to gratify these needs people commit crimes because they are not able to buy these. If they are capable of buying these, they will not trouble others. For instance, most of the thieves in India are uneducated and  for food they loot other citizens.

task: The best way to solve the world's environmental problem is to increase the cost of fuel for cars and other vehicles. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: In the modern day, numerous people believe that it is more beneficial to increase the price of fuel for all means of transportation to cope with environment-related issues. I argue that although this solution can bring about several benefits, there are various effective methods to resolve this pressing matter.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the one hand, the increase in electricity prices can contribute to preventing environmental problems on a global scale. One reason for this is that when governments apply higher prices for materials, commuters will consider whether they should drive or not to save their money. If people do not drive regularly, it means that less exhausted fumes are released into the atmosphere. Another thing is that instead of using their cars, people will travel by public transportation, which is environmentally - friendly to the surroundings. This has a great contribution to reducing air pollution, especially the large metropolises.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, I firmly believe that there is still a plethora of solutions that help to solve environmental problems more effectively. The first method is that the national authorities all over the world should launch community campaigns to educate citizens about the importance of protecting the surrounding environment. Secondly, it is essential to encourage manufacturers to produce various types of vehicles that release less greenhouse gas into the atmosphere. For example, in Vietnam, some technology companies have come up with electric cars which are no fumes. This product is not only suitable for customer needs but also friendly with surroundings.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, for the reasons I have mentioned above, I assume that with the increase in the cost of fuel, the government can apply several measures which are better for both the environment and the benefits of residents.

task: The best way to solve world's environmental problem is to increase the cost of fuel for cars and other vehicles. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: nowadays,The production of transport vehicles are increasing very fast in all over the world.In this case if the production value increases then the environmental problems also increases equally.we can see the air pollution due to the function of fuel based vehicles like car,bus,truck.they are producing too much of carbonated air from their engines.it would be spoiling our environment continuously.transportation is the biggest need for humans routine life.one side factories are manufacturing lots of vehicles daily on the other side humans are destroying forests which makes pure oxygenated air for living things of earth.Incase If we increase the cost of fuel for cars and other vehicles there is no use.because today peoples are earning lots of money in this running modern world.so In my point of view we need to get a alternative way of transportation vehicles.let we think about electric vehicles which is not producing air pollution.  <NL><NL><NL><NL>electric vehicles are functioning from batteries.we can charge it through electricity.today we can getting electricity easily from windmills,nuclear power plants.so we all need change into electric vehicles.

task: The best way to solve the world’s environmental problems is to increase the<NL>cost of fuel for cars and other vehicles.To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: n recent years, some people believe that the government increasing the cost of fuel for vehicles is the primary way to solve the environmental problems, whilst others hold the reverse viewpoint. I disagree with this statement. In this essay, I will explain my viewpoints in detail in the ensuing paragraphs.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with, the front and centre in this favour are that cars are necessary means of tools for commuters due to inconvenient public transport in a rural area.Moreover, it is undeniable that the exhaust gas emitted by the usage of automobiles causes environmental pollution. However, raising money for fuel does not solve the root of the phenomenon. For instance, people need to pay more for fuel in order to get to a specific location, which does not change the probability of use. This indicate that this policy would not improve much environmental issues.<NL><NL><NL><NL>At the other end of the spectrum, transportation indeed plays a vital role in our daily life. Considering  carbon dioxide emission, it is the leading cause of air pollution. Therefore, the government may divert some budget to build more facilities for public transport. On the other hand, if they provide some discounted ride plans for taking ones, it would be a better way to decrease the chance of the use of private vehicles. The monthly pass is a salient example. Based on such compelling evidence, it appears that government incentives may improve air pollution. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In summary, the growing use of automobiles is an issue that needs to be addressed. It is widely believed that the promotion of public transportation can solve environmental problems nowadays.

task: The best way to solve world’s environmental problem is to increase the cost of fuel for cars and other vehicles. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: In the twenty-first century, there are many factors that lead to the environmental problem. Thus, some people suppose that the best way to solve this problem is to increase the cost of fuel for cars and other transportations. As far as I am concerned, I partly disagree with that idea. <NL><NL><NL><NL>Indeed, the increase of the cost of fuel for cars and other vehicles can lead to the reduction of the expenditure. When the cost is more expensive than people’s finances , they have a tendency to find other fuels that are affordable. As a result, this restricts the pollution of fuel for transportations such as petrol. Compared to other solutions, it is the most practical way to directly improve the environment. However, some people argue that this way is not optimal to reduce the spending of fuel.<NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, it is necessary that the government should come up with stricter laws about the fuel of transportation. In particular, they need to promulgate more administrative laws for the polluted fuel which eliminate numerous CO2 or harmful substances for the environment. In some developed countries such as Europe, they forbid transportations that negatively affects the ecosystem , especially trucks. In addition, the government should cooperate with the media to organize more campaigns to advance the awareness of citizens. Currently, they are exploring a number of new fuels that would instead be detrimental fuel for vehicles and it is more environmentally friendly.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, the growth of the price of fuel for cars or other vehicles has some limitations. Thus, there must be a more acceptable solution to improve the environment.

task: As well as making money, businesses also have social responsibilities. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Many individuals believe that businesses have social responsibilities, alongside earning money. However, I partly agree with this statement. <NL><NL><NL><NL>  Some people think that companies should only concentrate on making money rather than their social responsibilities for two main factors. Firstly, if a factory considers the social effects of their products excessively, they will suffer from the hard-tight rules and standards, which prevent the business from progressing. In other words, these corporations will be asked to be more cautious and not to take risks in order to gain more money. For example, if companies that work on AI were worried about people's personal security too much, they would not make such progress that they have made by now, as they have access to every detail of a person's life. Secondly, caring about the social impacts of a business sometimes affects the income of a factory as well. After producing a product, it can bring about some side effects for consumers, and if the producer is responsible for paying compensation, their income will become lower, because they have to cover the damages made to the consumers. <NL><NL><NL><NL>  On the other hand, businesses should be socially responsible for two major reasons. These traders are doing business in a country, and they are more powerful than ordinary people, due to the fact that they have more money. Thus, they must be responsible to the public. It is a global rule that those who earn more money in a business must take responsibility as well. Moreover, in some cases, safety is more important than making progress. To exemplify, biotechnological goods are really dangerous and should be used and produced in a safe manner. These products can easily create health issues like those related to one's digestion. As a result, their producers have to take care of this situation. <NL><NL><NL><NL>  In conclusion, even though companies are trading and making money by that, they should also consider social responsibilities for numerous reasons.

task: As well as making money , businesses also have social responsibilities. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Businesses have sets of principles. Earning profits has the same importance as social responsibilities for businesses. I largely agree with this point and I will outline my reasons in this essay.<NL><NL><NL><NL>There are other factors which accompany the purpose of making money that promotes companies in long term.Social responsibilities have played a crucial role to hold businesses in their paths.To name an exquisite example , there were companies which produced plastics. Although they reached the niche of becoming prosperous , it was only for a short time Because as people figured out the disadvantage of plastics that harms the environment due to incapability to recycle , most people refused to buy them and those businesses have become faded in long term.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In most developed countries , government determine obligation for businesses in terms of social responsibility such as environmental responsibility by establishing taxes and allocating budget for campaigns to observe the function of businesses. Hence , companies should respect and follow the rules to stay in the market. For instance , in the USA , green taxes are enacted and the founders who refuse to respect their devastating product should pay taxes.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To conclude , I’m on the same page with this approach of having social responsibility besides  making money because of government function and also repercussions in long term.

task: As well as making money, businesses also have social responsibilities. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: It is true that businesses need to make a profit in order to not declare bankruptcy. Some people have opinions about whether businesses should have public responsibilities. From my perspective, I totally agree with the statement.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To begin with, it seems logical that businesses must make a profit in order to cover their overhead cost. Without profiting from their business, companies might not be able to cover their running costs, such as employees’ salaries, facilities, and payments for the building. As a result, companies might declare bankruptcy, and end up closing down their businesses. Another argument is that without making profits, businesses might not be able to fulfil their social responsibilities. This is because when businesses can not cover their running cost or fulfil customers’ demands, any social concerns might be neglected. In other words, less attention might be paid to public concern, simply because this is not businesses’ main purpose. This means if a business is not in good financial health, it might not be able to fulfil public concerns. <NL><NL><NL><NL>On the other hand, businesses should also fulfil their public responsibilities, instead of focusing on the sole purpose of maximising their profits. Firstly, one social concern that is associated with managers and businesses is to treat their employees well. Treating employees right might provide them with the comfortability needed to improve their work efficiency, boosting the country’s economy. Lastly, I believe that companies should stop abusing accounting loopholes to minimise their taxes. Paying taxes is an essential part of businesses’ social responsibility. Instead of using accounting loopholes to avoid taxes, companies should happily pay taxes to contribute to society. <NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, it is logical that companies must make a profit to not go bankrupt, however, they should still fulfil public responsibilities instead of focusing on maximising profit.

task: As well as making money, businesses also have social responsibilities. <NL>To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: The role of companies is to produce all the goods we need to satisfy the request of society. However, many people support the idea that they have also social commitments.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In this essay, I will agree with the afore-mentioned statement which every company is also responsible for their employees and the environmental problem.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Firstly, commercial activities should give the right weight to human resources. In order to work and sell goods or services, companies foremost need people who are relevant to the role that they have in the process. On the other hand, employees need more than the salary at the end of the month, it is essential to value their work through rights and respect. <NL><NL><NL><NL>It is vitally important that people could work in a safe place where their well-being is guaranteed, For example, for fabric employees, is extremely significant that the companies provide to everyone the tools to work in a safe way, such as glove’s pair, adapt shoes, and a helmet.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Furthermore, businesses have also an environmental engagement. Due to the increment of the purchases, the consumption of resources is rose.  <NL><NL><NL><NL>In the consumer era, it became drastic the respect for the planet. In the current situation, companies have the responsibility to adopt measurements to decrease consumer levels.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Solutions, such as solar panel use or preferring renewable resources enterprises could do a difference, and that could be the first approach to the problem.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, companies have also social responsibilities. From the employees to the environment the companies engagement should be constant and respectful

task: As well as making money, businesses also have social responsibilities. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Although earning money is one of the most important factors when people conduct business, those who run companies should take social responsibility. In my opinion, while generating profit is the top priority for each company, I agree that firms should have the responsibility to society.<NL><NL><NL><NL>There are many reasons why firms should allocate resources to help the community. Firstly, this may help companies promote their public image and increase their sales figures. For example, big corporations such as Vinamilk and FPT should have philanthropic activities such as providing scholarships and giving charitable donations to help those who are less fortunate. Secondly, production processes may lead to serious environmental degradation such as pollution and global warming stemming from factory emissions and the irresponsible disposal of chemical waste. Thus, firms should spend their income installing waste treatment systems and solving these environmental issues along with the governments.<NL><NL><NL><NL>However, The efforts of businesses to earn their profits may bring some tangible benefits to society. The first reason is that they have the opportunity to expand their businesses thanks to their income. So, this creates new job opportunities for workers and reduces crime in many countries. Another reason is that the more money companies earn, the more taxes they pay to the government. As a result, authorities can have more revenue to spend in key fields such as education, health care, and transportation. So, this contributes to improving the quality of life of local communities.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, although I recognize that increasing profits is the fundamental principle of business, I would argue that all companies should be responsible for society.

task: As well as making money, businesses also have social responsibilities. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: IIt is argued by many people that companies have necessary communal duties in addition to making a profit, while others claims that making profit  is the fundamental aspect for them so they can  focus only their gains.<NL><NL><NL>To begin with, companies budget is restricted so they cannot allocate funds to social investments. To demonstrate, many firms prefer to invest their limited funds to infrastructures for their companies such as new production systems, education for their workers. In 2012,  I worked in a company and this firm has a chance to construct a fitness centre for workers, these place probable increased labor’s  motivations, while firm owner preferred to buy a new machine for production.  Without doubt, this company  was eager to  allacote funds for public awareness due to this machine was capable for gain more income than personal’s motivation.<NL><NL>In addition, many companies are prone to social developments. To illustrates, if citizens adjusted better life conditions, they would want to new social opportunities. Without doubt, no firm does not jeopardize their system. According to Hans Brigel, a history professor at Cambridge University, Ottoman Empire’s economy system was collapsed due to globalization. As can be predicted, many labour heard new gadgets, high-quality fabric, especially coffee. Price of the coffee was excess to an Ottoman worker’s monthly salary so citizens wanted an improvement at their income. This improvements affected the budget of the government. Finally, Ottoman’s treasure went to the debt due to personal’s wages.<NL><NL>Finally, some business is eager to allocate a budget for the public duty due to their marketing strategy. To demonstrate, these companies gain customers with their social investments. Kellogs, one of the biggest cereal producers in the world, they invest %20 of their income to UNICEF and Red Cross so they  gained customer’s sympathies. As stated by an observation company that they observed 100.000 people who ate one cup of Kellogs cornflakes in their breakfast. Surprisingly, %70 of them preferred to Kellogs due to their social supports.<NL><NL>In conclusion,  social awareness is not compulsory for firms, because paying their labour’s wage and making profits are  their crucial duties so they cannot jeopardize their budget for the communities benefits.

task: As well as making money, businesses also have social responsibilities. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: In this modern era , everyone needs money for the their survival and plays an indispensable role . After making money , organization have some social duty . I personally believe that a business should pay attention towards social responsibility.<NL><NL>To begin with , enterprises have many responsibility regarding society and they need to fulfil it because a business operates in a society. Besides this ,  a business  gets resources from society , thus it's duty of a organization to pay back to society.  For instance , if a enterprise gets its raw material <NL>from community than a company will provide good quality product in return. Secondly, if a business perform it's duty very well then it will somehow benefits the entire community as well as enterprise, because it will increase the sale , additionally reputation of company will become good.<NL><NL>On the other hand , sometime social responsibility  creates loss for a company as  when they organise a  free health check up or give charity etc because all this money is withdrawn from company's profit . However , company by doing it's social responsibility generates employment , so whenever a new enterprise  starts it give job to numerous people.<NL><NL>To conclude, it's a duty of company to fulfil it's social responsibility as somehow it will benefit the organization as well as community. Moreover ,it's better to perform their responsibility because it will create ample opportunities not only for community but for enterprise.

task: Nations should spend more money on skills and vocational training for practical work, rather than on university education.<NL><NL><NL><NL>To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Many today feel that countries should prioritise vocational training over higher education due to changes in the labour market. In my opinion, though there are strong economic reasons to support this idea, university education holds greater value.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Those in favour of more practical skills training point out the financial benefits. Most university graduates are burdened with student debt and face uncertain job prospects. In contrast, training schools are cheap, fast, and ease students into steady employment immediately. The jobs they train for are also most likely recession-proof and durable, including positions as cooks, hotel managers, and skilled technicians. Someone who is firmly established in such a job in their early 20s does not have to deal with the pressure associated with university life and its incumbent debts. Instead, they can begin to set aside money for a house or start a family.<NL><NL><NL><NL>Nonetheless, lacking a university degree limit one's options. The jobs available will pay well initially and be secure, but offer narrow scope for advancement and virtually no opportunity to switch the career paths. An individual with a university degree, on the other hand, might begin from a lower position, but has a higher ceiling on future earnings. It is also possible for them to explore a variety of fields. Most good jobs require at least a bachelor’s degree even for simple internship vacancies. Lacking such a degree, means restricting oneself to manual labour or service industry jobs. The actual learning that takes place at university, particularly for those with multi skills majors or studying at liberal art schools, also encourages students to consider a wide range of possible career options.<NL><NL><NL><NL>In conclusion, increasing funding for vocational training is an attractive yet short sighted approach that curbs possibilities. Governments ought to continue to support higher education even in dark economic times in order to reap future rewards.
